Sauvages, François Boissier de la Croix de (1706-1767), French naturalist and
physician; Dr. med. Montpellier 1726; professor of medicine (1734), later of botany
(1740) at the University of Montpellier; royal professor of botany ib. 1755; staunch
supporter of Linnaeus and the Linnaean ideas in France. (<em>Sauvages</em>).

PAGE: 78
HEADING: SAUVAGES

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material at LINN and MPU.

<sm>NAME</sm>: Often cited as Sauvages de la Croix, F.B. de la or as Boissier de Sauvages de la
Croix, François. – Not to be confused with his brother Pierre Augustin Boissier de
Sauvages de la Croix (1710-1795), French clergyman, also active as botanist, see e.g.
L.A. d'Hombres-Firmas, Notice biographique sur l'abbé de Sauvages, Alais, 1820, 8 p.-
See e.g. Stafleu (1964).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 216 (b. 12 Mai, d. 19 Feb 1767); BM 8:
1142; Bossert p. 350; Herder p. 175; Plesch p. 397; Quenstedt p. 377.; SO 635c, 2480
corr.; Sotheby p. 673.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Cat. gén. livr. Bibl. natl. 15: 143-155. 1924; Index sem. Hortus
	monspeliensis 1982, cover (portr.) and p. [i] (dedic).
Berg, F., Lychnos 1956: 31-54 (comp. Linnaeus-Sauvages, nosolog. systems).
Blunt, W., The compleat naturalist 131. 1971.

	by <em>Projet d'une méthode sur les feuilles des plantes</em>, Montpellier 1743 (n.v.). – PR (950)
	cites this under P.A. Boissier de la Croix de Sauvages.

Sauvaigo, Émile (1856-1927), French botanist and physician; worker on the sponta-
neous and cultivated mediterranean plants; curator of the library and archives of the
town of Nice until 1897; director of the Museum of natural history, Nice 1897-1924.
(<em>Sauvaigo</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: NICE.

Cavillier, F., Boissiera 5: 85-86. 1941.

Sauvalle, Francisco Adolfo (1807-1879), United States-born botanist and malacolo-
gist of French descent who settled in Cuba 1824 as merchant and industrialist. (<em>Sauvalle</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HAB; some further material at NY.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 216 (b. 1 Jul 1807, d. 30 Jun 1879); BL 1:
225, 317; BM 4: 1814; Bossert p. 350; CSP 8: 838, 18: 463; IH 2: (files); Jackson p. 370;
Kew 4: 604; Langman p. 675; Morren ed. 10, p. 136; PH 98, 567; Rehder 5: 761;
Tucker 1: 625.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Conde, J.A., Hist. bot. Cuba 94, 279-281, 284, 286. 1958.
Ramos, J.E., Anal. r. Acad. ci. med. Habana Rev. ci. 16: 38-52. 1879 (éloge).
Urban, I., Symb. ant. 1: 148-150. 1898 (publ.), 3: 119. 1902 (biogr.).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Sauvallea</em> C. Wright (1871); <em>Sauvallela</em> Rydberg (1924).

10.371. <em>Flora cubana</em>. Enumeratio nova plantarum cubensium vel revisio catalogi griseba-
chiani, exhibens descriptiones generum specierumque novarum Caroli Wright, (Cantab-
rigiae) et Francisci Sauvalle, synonymis nominibusque vulgaribus cubensis adjectis.
Auctore Francisco A. Sauvalle ... Havanae [Habana] (Imp. "La Antilla", de Cacho-
Negrete, ...) [1868-] 1873. Qu. (<em>Fl. cub.</em>).

<sm>AUTHORSHIP</sm>: Urban (1898) gives details on the history of publication of the <em>Flora cubana</em>
	explaining that the 1873 book is a reprint, published in parts, from a series of articles
	in <em>Anal. Acad. Ci. Habana, Rev. ci.</em> vols. 5, 1868 -9(app.), 1873. The title of the articles
	in the original journal publication makes it clear that Sauvalle is actually mainly
	editor and that the new taxa are to be attributed to Charles Wright (1811-1885), an
	opinion already held by Asa Gray (Sci. Pap. 2: 473). The new taxa are to be cited as
	C. Wright <em>in</em> F.A. Sauvalle.
<em>Publ</em>. (book): 1868-1873 (in parts; see below under journal publication), p. [i], [1]-324,
	[i*]-90* (indice nombr. vulg.). <em>Copies</em>: G, HH, M, MO, US, USDA (incompl.); IDC
1581 (journal publ.).
<em>Journal publication</em>: in <em>Anal. Acad. Ci. Habana</em> with the title <em>Flora cubana</em>. Revisio catalogi
	grisebachiani vel index plantarum cubensium ad catalogum cl. Grisebachii anno 1866
	editum attemperata, pluribus Wrightianis novis speciebus aucta, valde quoque
	emendata, à cl. C. Wright; omnia pro Annalibus Regiae Academiae Scientiarum
	Havanensis digesta, nominibusque adjectis cubensis vulgo receptis à Francisco A.
	Sauvalle.

For C. Wright's work in Cuba see e.g. L.M. Underwood, Bull. Torrey bot. Club 32:
291-2300. 1905 and the last volume of TL-2.

Savatier, Paul Amadée Ludovic (1830-1891), French botanist and marine medical
officer; educated at the Naval medical school, Rochefort; on a mission to Japan 1866-
1876; from 1877-1879 head physician on the circumnavigation by the Magicienne; re-
tired as "médecin en chef de la marine". (<em>Sav</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: K (personal herb., 730 specimens from Japan; 775 specimens
from Tahiti, Peru, Magellan from the <sm>MAGICIENNE</sm> circumnavigation), P, PC (orig. set
Magicienne; also Japanese material), other material at BR, LE and US.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart: 216 (b. 19 Oct 1870, d. 25 Aug 1891); BM 2:
610, 4: 1814; Bret. p. 826; CSP 8: 839, 11: 291, 12: 652, 18: 464; Herder p. 208; Hortus
3: 1203; Kew 4: 605 MW p. 430; Plesch p. 397; TL-1/376, see Drake, E.; TL-2/1844, see
Drake, E.; Tucker 1: 626; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 752, 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bull. Soc. bot. France 13 (bibl.): 47. 1866 (in charge of setting up an
	arsenal in Japan); J. Bot. Morot 1: 80. 1887 (hepatics Magicienne at PC).
Candolle, Alph. de, Phytographie 412, 446. 1880.
Fuchs-Eckert, H.P., Proc. Kon. Ned. Akad. Wet. C 85(2): 212-213. 1982.

Moore, D.M., Fl. Tierra del Fuego 6, 10. 1983.
Reiche, K., Grundz. Pfl.-Verbr. Chile 21-22. 1907 (Veg. Erde 8).
Sayre, G., Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 19(3): 391-392. 1975 (coll.).
Souché, B., Fl. Haut Poitau 2: xviii. 1901.

PAGE: 84
HEADING: SAVI, G.

Savi, Gaetano (1769-1844), Italian botanist and physician; studied in Pisa; curator of
the Pisa botanical garden and museum 1791 ; professor of botany 1810; director the
botanical garden 1814-1843. (<em>Savi</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PI; some other collections at FI (in part also in herb. Micheli),
MOD, MW, P, PAD, UPS (Thunberg herb.), W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(1): 275; Backer p. 513; Barnhart 3: 216 (b. 13 Jun
1769, d. 28 Apr 1844); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7868; BL 2: 401-402, 714; Bossert p. 350; CSP
5: 421, 8: 839, 12: 652; Dryander 5: 65; DU 271; Frank 3 (Anh.): 88-89; GF p. 75; GR
p. 521, cat. p. 71; Herder p. 475 [index]; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 315; Kew 4: 605-
606; Lasègue p. 314, 342; LS 23763-23763a; MD 213-214; NI 1732-1733; Plesch p. 397;
PR 8057-8082, ed. 1: 9012-9042; Rehder 5: 762; RS p. 140; Saccardo 1: 147, 2: 97, cron.
xxxii; SO 831a; Sotheby 674; SY p. 58-59; TL-1/249; TL-2/1172, 4630, see G. Raddi;
Tucker 1: 626; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1844: 176 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 2: 592. 1844 (d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat.
	print. books 213: 746. 1964; Encicl. ital. 30: 921. 1936; Flora 27: 536. 1844 (d.);
	Grande Diz. encicl. Utet. 16: 735. 1971.

Savi, Paolo (1798-1871), Italian zoologist and geologist; son of Gaetano Savi; professor
of zoology and mineralogy at the University of Pisa; from 1823 professor of natural
history at Pisa University, from 1840 professor of zoology and comparative anatomy.
(<em>Pa. Savi</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at M.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 326; Barnhart 3: 216 (b. 11 Jul 1798, d. 5
Apr 1871); BM 4: 1815, 8: 1143; Bossert p. 350; CSP 5: 421-422, 8: 839; De Toni 1: cx;
Jackson p. 149; Kew 4: 606; PR 8083, ed. 1: 9040; Quenstedt p. 377; Saccardo 1: 147, 2:
97-98.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bol. r. Com. geol. ital. 2(3-4): 90-91. 1871 (obit.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat.
	print. books 213: 747. 1962; Encicl. ital. 30: 921-922. 1936; Encycl. brit ed. 11: 24:
	242. 1911; Grande diz. encicl. Utet 16: 7350. 1971.
Carrucio, A., J. Zool., Paris 1: 96-97. 1872 (abstract).
Caruel, T., Nuovo Giorn. bot. ital. 4: 178. 1897 (in biogr. of Pietro Savi).

Meneghini, G., Mem. mat. fis. Soc. ital. Sci. ser. 3. 4: lxxiii-lxxxv. 1882 (obit.).

Savi, Pietro (1811-1871), Italian botanist; son of Gaetano Savi; professor of botany and
director of the botanical garden of the University of Pisa 1842-1871. (<em>Pi. Savi</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PI; other material at A, AWH, BR, C, CGE, DBN, F, FI,
GOET, MANCH, MW, US, W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 438; Barnhart 3: 216 (b. 20 Mai 1811, d. 9
Aug 1871); BM 4: 1815; Bossert p. 350; CSP 5: 422-423, 8: 839, 12: 652; Herder p. 120,
272, 274; IH 1 (ed. 7): 342; LS 23764-23765; PR 8084-8085, ed. 1: 9041-9042; Rehder
1: 427; Saccardo 1: 147-148, 2: 98; Tucker 1: 626.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bull. Soc. bot. France 18 (bibl.): 41. 1872, 18: 208, 285. 1871 (d.); Flora
	54: 320. 1871.

	Agosto 1871. Macerata 1871 (typ. Mancini).

Institution of Harvard University 1916; M.S. ib. 1917, in military service 1917-1919; at
the Agricultural Experiment Station, University of Maine, Orono, Maine 1920-1928;
D.Sc. Bussey Inst. 1922; associate professor of plant cytology Arnold Arboretum and
Bussey Institution 1928-1936; full professor 1936-1959, acting director (1946) and direc-
tor of the Arnold Arboretum 1947-1954; worked mainly on cytology, genetics and hort-
iculture; Dr. Sci. h.c. Univ. Maine 1971 (<em>Sax</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 218 (b. 2 Nov 1892); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7870;
BJI 2: 152; Bossert p. 350; IH 1 (ed. 4): 85; Langman p. 676; NCAB 58: 511; Tucker 3:
269.

Say, Thomas (1787-1834), American naturalist, entomologist, zoologist and Quaker;
energetic collector; with the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia 1822-1825;
with the settlement at New Harmony, Indiana 1825-1834. (<em>Say</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PH.

Quenstedt p. 378; SIA 7103, 7112, 7177, 7298; TL-2/3275, 3569, see W.H. Keating.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Most of Thomas Say's publications were on conchology and entomology; for
collected writings see:
1. W.G. Binney, ed., Complete writings of T.S. On the conchology of the United States,
New York 1858, vi, 252 p., 75 pl.
2. J.L. Le Conte, ed., The complete writings of T.S. on the entomology of North
America, with a memoir of the author by Geord Ord, New York, 1859, 2 vols., 55 pl.
(other eds. 1869, 1891).
For botanical contributions, mostly in works by others, see e.g. the references in Ewan
eds. 1 &amp; 2, and those in the TL-2 indexes.

Sayre, Geneva (1911-x), American bryologist, botanical historian and bibliographer;
Dr. phil. Univ. Colorado 1938; instructor in biology, Univ. of Colorado 1938-1940; id.
at Russell Sage College 1940-1941; assistant professor of botany at Russell Sage College
1941-1945, associate professor 1945-1947, professor 1947; in retirement associated with
Farlow Herbarium of Harvard University. (<em>Sayre</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FH, other types and material at NY.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 218 (b. 12 Jun 1911); Roon p. p. 99-100;
SBC p. 131.

	33: 162. 1984 (Hedwig medal); Who's who Amer. women ed. 3. 891. 1965, ed. 5.
	1063. 1969.
Hesterberg, C.S., Bryol. Times 11: 4-5. 1981 (Festschrift).
Kaye, G.C., Occ. Pap. Farlow Herb. 16: 9-12. 1981 (bibl.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: The authors of TL-2 are indebted to Geneva Sayre for her continuous help and
assistance through published and unpublished information. For information on <em>Crypto-
gamae exsiccatae</em> we have leaned heavily on her annotated bibliography, in the Memoirs
of the New York Botanical Garden vol. 19(1-3): 1969-1975 (see e.g. Taxon 19: 129-130.
1970); other important sources are <em>Dates of publications describing Musci 1801-1802</em>, Troy
1959 (SY) and <em>Authors of names of Bryophytes and the present location of their herbaria</em>, Bryolo-
gist 80: 502-521. 1977.

Scamman, Edith Henry (1882-1967), American botanist; B.A. Wellesley College
1907, M.A. comparative literature Radcliffe College 1909; engaged in church-work
until 1935; studied botany with M.L. Fernald at Radcliffe 1935; on nine collecting trips
to Alaska between 1936 and 1954; associated with the Gray Herbarium through M.L.
Fernald and C.A. Weatherby, especially interested in Pteridophytes; collected in Costa
Rica between 1951 and 1956 and in Puerto Rico and Guadeloupe 1960; on the Gray
Herbarium visiting committee 1942-1946; research associate 1949-1962; honorary re-
search associate 1962-1967. (<em>Scamman</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GH (incl. slides, indexes and other manuscript material). Other
material in MIN and US.

Scannagatta, Josue (1773-1823), Italian botanist, student of G. Marsili at Padova;
curator of the botanical garden of the University of Pavia 1774-1802; founder and
director of the botanical garden and professor of botany at the University of Bologna
1802-1815. (<em>Scannagatta</em>).

Schaarschmidt, Julius after 1886 Gyula [von] Istvánffi de Csík Madéfalva (1860-
1930), Hungarian botanist; professor of botany at the Technical University of Budapest.
(<em>Schaarschmidt</em>; <em>Istv</em>.).

Schacht, Hermann (1814-1864), German (Hamburg) botanist; studied pharmacy at
Altona (Holstein); practiced at Braunschweig, Hamburg, Emmerich, Aachen and at
Altona until 1847; studied at Jena 1841-1842; assistant with M. Schleiden 1847; Dr.
phil. Jena 1850; in Berlin 1850, as private lecturer from 1853-1860; on Madeira for
health reasons 1855-1857; professor of botany and director of the botanical garden at
Bonn 1860-1864; worked mainly on plant anatomy and embryology. (<em>Schacht</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (mainly destr.); some herbarium material from Madeira at C.
For a list of anatomical preparations left by Schacht upon his death see Groenland
(1864); this collection was bought by the Russian government for the University of

PAGE: 99
HEADING: SCHACHT

Warsaw. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL, to F.A.W. Miquel at U. –
<em>Manuscripts</em> and 884 original drawings at B (rd 1973). – For the sales catalogue of
Schacht's botanical collections (microscopical preparations; models; posters) see Prings-
heim 1864.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 30: 482-486 (C. Wunschmann); Ainsworth 74, 316,
347; Barnhart 3: 219; Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7881; BM 4: 1820-1821; CSP 5: 433-434, 8: 843,
11: 296, 12: 652; Frank 3 (Anh.): 89; GR p. 129 (b. 15 Jul 1814, d. 20 Aug 1864);
Herder p. 38, 121, 132, 218; Jackson p. 70, 89, 92, 147, 172, 219, 353; Kew 4: 612;
Kleppa p. 29; KR p. 620; LS 23787a-23801; Moebius p. 170, 456 [index]; NI 1197,
1739-1743, 1755; PR 8098-8107; Ratzeburg p. 454-456; Rehder 1: 521, 5: 762-763; TL-

Schack, Hans (1878-1946), German (Bavarian) lawyer and botanist; judge ("Landes-
gerichtsdirector") at Coburg, later (from 1930) idem (Reichsgerichtsrat) at Leipzig;
interested in Hieracium and Rubus. (<em>Schack</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (p.p. <em>Hieracium</em>; destr. 1943), M (other part, extant); further
material (mainly <em>Hieracium</em>) at B (extant), HAL, JE, K.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 12(2): 418 (b. 3 Jul 1878); Barnhart 3: 219; BFM
657; Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7883; BL 2: 153; CSP 18: 477; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, 2: (files); TL-
2/see G. Kükenthal.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Schwimmer, J., Ber. bayer. bot. Ges. 28: 301-302. 1950 (obit., portr., b. 3 Jul
	1878, d. 15 Feb 1946).

10.460. <em>Zwischen Main und Werra</em>. Flora der Gefässpflanzen von Coburg und Umgegend
einschliesslich des oberen Werragebietes, des Grabfeldgaues, der Hassberge und des
Nördlichen Frankenjura ... Coburg (Druck und Verlag von A. Rossteutscher) 1925.
Oct. (<em>Zw. Main &amp; Werra</em>).

<em>Collaborators</em>: A. Brückner, F. Ruppert, G. Kükenthal, A. Siegel.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1925 (Nat. Nov. Aug 1926; AbZ 20 Dec 1925), p. [i, iii, v], [1]-197, i-viii, map.
	<em>Copies</em>: G, M. – Coburger Heimatkunde und Heimatgeschichte ... Erster Teil:
	Heimatkunde. Erstes Heft: Pflanzenwelt.
<em>Erster Nachtrag</em>: 1926, p. [1]-31. <em>Copies</em>: B, M. – Coburger Heimatblätter, Heft 7, Beilage.
<em>Ref</em>.: Kneucker, A., Allg. Bot. Z. 28/29: 48. 20 Dec 1925 (rev.).

Schade, [Friedrich] Alwin (1881-1976), German (Lausitz) botanist (lichenologist);
Dr. phil. Jena 1911; high school teacher ("Studienrat") at the Kreuzschule at Dresden
1906-1945; on war duty and p.o.w. in France 1914-1919; schoolsupervisor at Putzkau
1946-1947; Dr. h.c. Dresden Techn.Univ. 1966. (<em>Schade</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Private herbarium and field notes destroyed by fire in Dresden
Feb 1945; post-war herbarium (containing e.g. H. Schindler's lichen herbarium) at
GLM; a further set of Saxonian lichens (1916-1964) at M.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: (1) <em>Hepaticae saxonicae exsiccatae</em>, with E. Stolle, dec. 1-27, nos. 1-270, 1923-
1934. Sets at FH. See Sayre (1971).
(2) <em>Lichenes saxonici exsiccati</em>, with E. Stolle and Ernst Riehmer, dec. 1-55, nos. 1-550. Sets
at BM, DR (destr.), FH, HAL, L, M, S. – See Sayre (1969).
(3) <em>Sphagna saxonica</em>, dec. 1, nos. 1-10, Leipzig 1923 (Herbarium 64: 161. 1923; ÖbZ Sep-
Oct 1923). No copy known to Sayre (1971).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 220; Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7883, 7884; BL 2:
153; Christiansen p. 133, 319; Futak-Domin p. 522; GR p. 43, <em>pl</em>. [<em>16</em>], cat. p. 71; IH 1
(ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342, 2: (files); Kleppa p. 140; LS suppl. 24398-24400; SBC p. 131.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Rev. bryol. lichénol. 43: 117. 1977 (d.).

	portr., notes on collections, bibl.).

	Apr 1881, d. 23 Feb 1976).

Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 138. 1935, 2: 169. 1936, 3: 128, 149. 1937, 6: 304.
	1941.

<sm>NOTE</sm> (1) Letter to H. Schindler (1979) of 2 Mar 1946: "Beim 3. Angriff am 14.2.45
Mittags war unser Haus nicht mehr zu retten, es brannte aus bis in die Keller hinab. Bis
auf einen Handwagen, 2 Luftschutzkoffer und Rücksäcke, ein Gedeck Betten und einige
Kleidungsstücke ist alles restlos verbrannt: Bücherei, Separate, Herbarien ... Mikros-
kop, sonstige Apparate usw. usw.". – German lichenology was excessively hit by World-
War II: the lichen collection at Berlin-Dahlem (B) was destroyed; the private collections
of Hillmann, Klement, Sandstede and Schade were all lost or abducted [sic]. See e.g.
Mattick (1975).

<sm>NOTE</sm> (2): Main publication on lichens outside our period: <em>Zur sächsischen Flechtenflora</em>

HEADING: SCHAEFER, M.

insbesondere aus der Familie der Umbilicariaceen. Zwei Beiträge ... Nova Acta Leop.
ser. 2. 17: [191]-280. 30 Nov 1955 (also as reprint; <em>copy</em>: Almborn).

Schaefer, Michael (1790-1846), German botanist and clergyman; ord. 1815 Trier;
chaplain at the St. Laurentius church and high school teacher at Trier. (<em>M. Schaefer</em>).

10.467. <em>Trierische Flora</em>, oder kurze Beschreibung der im Regierungsbezirke Trier wild-

PAGE: 104
HEADING: SCHAEFER, M.

wachsenden Pflanzen ... Trier (bei J.J. Lintz) 1826-1829, 3 vols. (<em>Trier. Fl.</em>).

<em>1</em>: 1826 (p. iv: 18 Mar 1826; Linnaea 1: 469-470. Aug-Oct 1826; Flora 14 Nov 1827), p.
	[i]-lvii, [1]-252, [1-8, index].
<em>2</em>: 1826, p. [i], [1]-254, [1-8, index], [1, err.].
<em>3</em>: 1829 (p. [iiij: 14 Apr 1829), p. [i]-xlviii, [1]-389, [390-395, ind.; 396, err.], <em>Anhang</em> [1]-
	37.
<em>Copies</em>: G, MO.

Schaeffer, Cäsar (1867-1944), German botanist and entomologist; Dr. phil. Freiburg
i. Br. 1889; teacher's examination Göttingen 1890; teacher at various schools in
Hamburg from 1890; ultimately at the grammar school "auf der Uhlenhorst"; scientific
assistant (part time) at the Hamburg Natural History Museum 1891-1900. (<em>Cä. Schaeff.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7902; BM 4: 1821; Christiansen p. 61;
Rehder 2: 120; TL-2/3905.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 295. 1940.
Oberschelp, R., ed., Gesamtverz. deut. Schriftt. 112: 346. 1980.
Weidner, H., Abh. Verh. naturw. Ver. Hamburg ser. 2. 9. suppl. 220-221. 1967 (biogr.
	sketch, portr., b. 30 Jun 1869, d. 13 Mai 1944).

10.468. <em>Über die Verwendbarkeit des Laubblattes</em> der heute lebenden Pflanzen zu phylogene-
tischen Untersuchungen [Abh. naturw. Ver. Hamburg 13(7). 1895]. Qu. 

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan-Feb 1895 (Bot. Zeit. 1 Apr 1895; journal for 1894, probably publ. early 1895;
	Nat. Nov. Mar(2) 1895), p. [1]-40, <em>1 pl. Copy</em>: G.

Schaeffer, Gottlieb August Herrich [Herrich-Schaeffer] (1799-1874), German
(Bavarian) botanist, entomologist and physician; Dr. med. Landshut 1821; practicing
physician at Regensburg 1823 and 1828-1864; " Physikus" at Vohenstrauss 1824-1828;
"Landesgerichtsarzt" for Stadtamhof, residing in Regensburg 1828-1833; regional and
town physician ib. 1833-1856; from 1861-1874 director of the Regensburg bot.
Gesellschaft and editor of Flora. (<em>Herr.-Schaeff.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NAME</sm>: Correctly to be listed as Herrich-Schaeffer, G.A.; father Johann August Herrich;
mother Maria Margaretha von Schaeffer, grand daughter of Johann Gottlieb Schäffer
(1720-1795), brother of Jacob Christian Schäffer (see below); G.A. Herrich adopted the
name Schäffer on 23 Mar 1821.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 220 (b. 18 Dec 1799, d. 14 Apr 1874); BM 2:
833.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Accent. list Brit. Lepid. xxv-xxvi. 1858; Amer. Natural. 8: 447. 1874;
	Berl. Entom. Zeit. 18: 7. 1874; Bot. Not. 75: 30. 1875; Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books
102: 750-751. 1961 ; Entom. mon. Mag. 11: 20. 1874; Korr.-Bl. zool.-min. Ver.
	Regensburg 28, 65-73. 1874; Leopoldina 10(1-2): 2-5. 1874 (obit., bibl.).
Fürnrohr, O., Ber. naturw. Ver. Regensburg 9: 129. 1903, 11: 133-135. 1908 (biogr.
	sketch, bibl., portr.); Denkschr. k. bot. Ges. Regensburg 8: [1 p.]. 1903.
Hofman, O., Stettin. entom. Zeit. 35: 277-284. 1874.
Krantz, G., Deut. entom. Z. 19: 437-438. 1875.
Leussink, J.A., Taxon 30(2): 383-384. 1981 (biogr. sketch, relation with Flora), 32: 351,
	355. 1983.
Pongratz, L., Act. Albert. ratisb. 25: 54, 60, 87-89. 1963.
Saunders, S.S., Proc. entom. Soc. London 1874: xxxv.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: Editor of <em>Flora</em> vols. 44-54. 1861-1874.

PAGE: 105
HEADING: SCHAFFER, J. C.

Schaeffer, Jacob Christian (1718-1790), German (Saxony-born Bavarian) botanist,
zoologist and theologist and clergyman; studied theology at Halle; private teacher at
Regensburg 1738-1740; pastor and teacher at the protestant seminary at Regensburg
1741; Dr. phil. Wittenberg 1760; Dr. theol. Tübingen 1763; pastor and superintendent
of the Regensburg protestant community 1779-1790. (<em>Schaeff</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NAME</sm>: The name is correctly J.C. Schäffer; however, most of the botanical works have a
latin title and on them "Schaeffer" is used.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 30: 531-532 (E. Wunschmann); Ainsworth p. 56,
68, 115, 226, 254, 273, 311; Barnhart 3: 220 (b. 30 Mai 1818, d. 5 Jan 1790); BM 4:
1822, 8: 1145-1146; Bossert p. 351; Dryander 3: 20, 32, 226, 351, 557; Frank 3 (Anh.):
89; Hawksworth p. 197; Herder p. 95, 142, 245, 393, 411; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p.
162; Kelly p. 207; Kew 4: 613; Lasègue p. 545; LS 23806-23810; NI 1744-1746, 1743n;
Plesch p. 378; PR 7059, 8109-8116, ed. 1: 9058-9065; Quenstedt p. 380; Rehder 1: 78,
257, 5: 763; RS p. 140; SO 638, 639, 640; Stevenson p. 1257; TL-1/1153-1156; TL-
2/345, 4215; Tucker 1: 627; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 214: 112-115. 1964; Cat. gén. livr.
	impr. Bibl. natl. 164: 673-683. 1943; Index biogr. Acad. Sci., Paris 460. 1954.

	Jahrhunderts 1(2): 191-196. 1824 (biogr., bibl. 68 nos.; further sec. refs.).

	Abbildungen).

Fries, Th.M., Bref Skrifv. Linné 1(3): 154. 1909, 1(4): 228, 245. 1910, 1(5): 15, 136, 351.
	1911, 1(6): 76, 121. 1912.
Fürnrohr, O., Ber. naturw. Ver. Regensburg 11: 120-139. 1905/6 (1908) (biogr. details
	on the Regensburg Schäffer family, biogr. sketch, bibl., portr.; main modern source).
Gilbert, P., Comp. biogr. lit. deceased entom. 336. 1977 (further refs. to older notes on
	his entomology).

Hulth, J.M., Bref Skrifv. Linné 2(1): 267, 308, 309. 1916, &amp; A.H. Uggia 2(2): 232, 233,
	234. 1943.

Jourdan, A.J.L., Dict. Sci. méd., Biogr. méd. 7: 119-121. 1825 (bibl.).
Laplanche, M.C. de, Dict. iconogr. champ. sup. 1894 (tableaux de concordance).
Mayer, C., Rep. spec. nov. regn. veg., Beih. 131: 121-125. 1942 (reproduces part of the
	key in the Erleichterte Arzneikräuterwissenschaft of 1759).
Meusel, J.G., Lex. teut. Schriftsteller 12: 71-79. 1812.

	1980 (on S. and Linnaeus).
Nissen, G, Zool. Buchill. 362-364. 1969.
Percheron, A., Bibl. entomologique 2: 31-37. 1837.
Raab, H., Z. Pilzk. 46: 106-107, 109. 1968 (brief evaluation of mycol. work).
Rothmaler, W., Repert. spec. nov. 53(1): 31, 32, 33. 1944.
Sachs, J., Gesch. Bot. 226. 1875.
Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. nos. 4296-4299. 1940.
Stafleu, F.A., Linnaeus and the Linnaeans 253, 254. 1971.

Weiss, H.B., J. New York Entom. Soc. 46(3): 244. 1938 (S. made paper of wasp's nests,
	different kinds of wood, moss, and vines), 60: 241-244. 1952 (biogr. sketch).

sexualium et universalium in hunc finem elaboratarum aerique incisarum [Ratisbonae,
Regensburg] (Litteris fratr. Zunkel) [1758]. Qu. (<em>Epist. stud. bot.</em>).

Regensburg (verlegts Johann Leopold Montag) 1760. Qu. (<em>Gichtschwamm</em>).

HEADING: SCHAFFER

editioni jam paratae propediem evulgandae denunciantur ... Ratisbonae [Regensburg]

10.476. <em>Fungorum qui in Bavaria et Palatinatu</em> circa Ratisbonam <em>nascuntur icones</em> nativis
coloribus expressae ... Ratisbonae [Regensburg] (typis Zunkelianis) 1762-1771, 4 vols.
Qu. (<em>Fung. Bavar. Palat. nasc.</em>).

<em>1</em>: Sep-Oct 1762 (p. [xxi]: 1 Sep 1762; GGA 28 Oct 1762), p. [i-xxi, preface mat., no
	sign.], "genus primum" text sign. A1-N3, [i, t.p plates], engraved t.p., <em>pl. 1-100</em> (two-

<em>2</em>: Apr-Dec 1763 (t.p. date of copies seen by us 1767; p. xxiv: 19 Mar 1763; Comment.
	Sci. nat. Gleditsch 12: 98-101. 1764: issued 1763), p. [i-xxiv, preface material, no
	sign.], genus secundum text sign. O2-DD4, index x1-xx4, [i, t.p. plates], <em>pl. 101-200</em>

	1767 (<em>copy</em>: G).
<em>3</em>: Sep-Oct 1771 (t.p. 1770; GGA 21 Dec 1771; distr. at Michaelmismesse 1771 ; announ-
	ced Jena Zeit. 4 Jan 1771), p. [i-vi, preface material, no sign.], genus tertium text

	plates are coloured copper engr. by Sophie Bez [Beez], I. St. Loibel and (smaller
	numbers) by Joh. Jos. Rothermund (vol. 4) and Schauer.
<em>Copies</em>: BR, G, HH, MICH, NY, Stevenson; IDC 5304. – <em>German t.p.</em>: Jacob Christian
	Schäffers, ... natürlich ausgemahlte <em>Abbildungen Bayrischer und Pfälzischer Schwämme</em>,
welche um Regensburg wachsen ..."
<em>Editio secunda</em>: volumes 1-3 were reissued in 1772 with a title page Ratisbonae (impensis
	auctoris) 1772, "editio secunda". We have seen only a copy with this t.p. in the Stev-
	enson library; it is accompanied by vol. 4 of the regular issue. Another copy is at H-
	UB.
<em>Editio tertia</em>: volumes 1-3 were also reissued in 1780 with a title page Ratisbonae (im-
	pensis auctoris) 1780, "editio tertia". We saw copies at HH and USDA, accompanied
	by a vol. 4 of the regular issue.
<em>Editio nova</em>: 1800, ... <em>Fungorum qui in Bavaria et Palatinatu circa Ratisbonam nascuntur</em> Icones
	nativis coloribus expressae. <em>Editio nova</em> commentario aucta a Dr C.H. Persoon ..."
	Erlangae [Erlangen] (apud Joannem Jacobum Palmium) 1800. Qu.
	<em>1</em>: frontisp. portr., engr. t.p., [i-iv], text A-N3, <em>pl. 1-100</em> (as in orig. edition).
	<em>2</em>: [i-iv], text A-O3, <em>pl. 101-200.</em>
	<em>3</em>: engr. t.p., [i, printed t.p.], sign. A-O3, <em>pl. 201-300.</em>
	<em>4</em>: [i*], [i]-viii, 1-136, [1-8, index], <em>pl. 301-330.</em>
	<em>Commentarius</em> by C.H. Persoon (see TL-2/7729) 1800, p. [i-xxii], [1]-130, [1-8].
	<em>Copies</em>: G, MICH, NY, USDA.

	Laplanche, M.C. de, Dict. iconogr. champ. sup. 1894 (Friesian equivalents).
	Killermann, S., Z. Pilzk. 3: 25-35, 49-53, <em>pl. 4.</em> 1924 (identif. pl.).

10.477. Jacob Christian Schäffers ... <em>Neue Versuche und Muster das Pflanzenreich zum Papier-
machen</em> und andern Sachen wirthschaftsnützlich <em>zu gebrauchen</em> ... Regensburg 1765-1767,

Schäffer, Julius (1882-1944), German mycologist; studied at the evangelical-

PAGE: 108
HEADING: SCHAFFER

theological seminary at Tübingen 1900-1904; teacher at the "Landerziehungsheim"
Ilsenburg am Hartz; studied natural sciences at Dresden, teacher's examination 1910;
high school teacher at Potsdam 1912-1939; from 1939-1944 in Diessen am Ammersee.
(<em>Jul. Schäff.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: W. Other material at C. – Left many watercolour drawings of
fungi, especially Russulae which were published in part in 1952 (<em>Russula-Monographie</em>).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 220; Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7903; LS suppl.
24409-24426; NI 3: 73; no. 2375n; Stevenson p. 1257.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Flury, A., Schweiz. Z. Pilzk. 40(5): 68-69. 1962 (100th anniv. birth, portr.).
Grenier, G., Z. Pilzk. 33(3-4): 82-87. 1967 (list of illustr. and descr. in S.'s estate).
Haas, H., Z. Pilzk. 1949(2): 4-10 (reminiscenses).
Hennig, B., Michael/Hennig Handb. Pilzfr. 5: 119-124. 1970 (biogr., portr.).
John, A., Z. Pilzk. 33(3-4): 74-77. 1967 (reminiscenses).
Moser, M., Z. Pilzk. 1952(11): 30-31 (70th birthday).
Müllerott, M., Hoppea 34: 316. 1976 (publ. at REG).
Neuhoff, W., Z. Pilzk. 33(3-4): 79-82. 1967 (on his work on Swedish Russula).
Oberschelp, R., ed., Gesamtverz. deut. Schriftt. 112: 350-351. 1980 (bibl.).
Schäffer, L., Z. Pilzk. 33(3-4): 49-74. 1967 (biogr., bibl.).
Schärer, W., Z. Pilzk. 1949(2): 1-4 (obit. not.).
Seehuber, G., Z. Pilzk. 33(3-4): 78-79. 1967 (reminiscenses, portr.).

10.478. <em>Russula-Monographie</em> ... Annales mycologici vol. xxxii. No. 3/4. 1934. Oct.
<em>Orig. ed.</em>: in Ann. mycol. 32(3-4): 141-243. <em>pl. 1-4</em> (col.). 1934 (USDA rd 28 Jul 1934).
<em>Completed ed</em>.: 1952 (p. 7: Jul 1951 ; BR rd 20 Dec 1952), p. [1]-295, [296], <em>pl. 1-20</em>, [<em>21-
	22</em>] by author. <em>Copies</em>: BR, NY. – Die Pilze Mitteleuropas. Band iii.
<em>Facsimile ed</em>.: 1970, Verlag von J. Cramer, D-3301 Lehre. <em>Copy</em>: FAS. – See Taxon 20:
	173. 28 Feb 1971. – ISBN 3-7682-0689-0.
<em>Ref</em>.: Hesler, L.R., Lloydia 24(4): 182-198. 1961 (a study on Julius Schaeffer's Russulas).

10.479. <em>Revision der Russula-Sammlung Romells</em> nebst Anmerkungen über die Russula-
Sammlung Bresadolas im Naturhistorischen Reichsmuseum, Stockholm ... Arkiv för
Botanik 29 A. N:o 15. [1939]. Oct. (<em>Revis. Russula Romells</em>).

<em>Collectors</em>: Lars Romell (1854-1927), Don Giacopo Bresadola (1847-1929).
Publ.: shortly after 27 Jul 1939 (date of printing on p. 80), p. [1]-80. <em>Copy</em>: U. – Distri-
	buted in journal volume 17 Jan 1940.

Schaerer, Ludwig Emanuel [Louis-Emmanuel] (1785-1853), Swiss (Bern) clergyman
and lichenologist; studied theology; teacher at a Bern primary school 1806-1808; or-
dained 1808; high school teacher 1813, conrector gymnasii 1814; director of the
municipal orphanage 1819; pastor at Lauperswil (canton Bern) 1826, later in Belp
(idem) until 1852. (<em>Schaer</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: G (lich.; Rev. bryol. 24: 64), BERN (phan.); important collect-
ions also at G, GL, H, M, MPU, WRSL. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Lichenes helvetici exsiccati</em>, fasc. 1-26,
nos. 1-650. Bern 1823-1852. <em>Editio altera immutata</em>, fasc. 1-10, nos. 1-250. Bern 1842-1852.
For details on publication see Sayre (1969). The labels on the exsiccata refer, from fasc.
4 onward, to the <em>Spicilegium</em> (see below); later numbers cite the <em>Enumeratio</em> (see below).
Sets of exsiccatae at BERN (both eds.), BM (both eds.), BP, BR, C, DUKE, FH, G,
GJO, GL, GOET, H, HAL, IBF, K(1-26), KIEL, L, LE, LZ (destr.), M, MANCH,
MASS, MICH, MPU, MSTR, NEU, NY, O, PC, REG, S, STU, TCD, TO, UPS,
VER, W, WRSL, Z, ZVS. For a continuation of this series see J.A.P. Hepp, <em>Die Flechten
Europas</em>.

Schaffner, John Henry (1866-1939), American botanist; A.B. Baker Univ. 1893; M.S.
ib. 1896; at Univ. Michigan 1894-1895, at South Dakota 1895-1896; at Chicago 1896-
1897; assistant botanist Ohio State Univ. 1897-1899; asst. prof. bot. ib. 1899-1902; assoc.
prof. bot. 1902-1911; prof. bot. 1911-1939; head of Botany Dept. 1908-1918. (<em>J.H.
Schaffn.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: OS (Equisetum); other material at C, CAS, NY. – Archival
material in GH and SIA.

261; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 6): 384, (ed. 7): 342, 2: (files); Kelly p. 207; Kew 4: 614-
615; LS 23836-23838a; MW p. 433; NW p. 57; Rehder 5: 763; SIA 223; TL-2/3572;
Tucker 1: 627, 2: xxxiv, 3: 270.

Schaffner, Wilhelm (later: J. Guillermo Schaffner) (x-1882), German (Hessen) plant
collector and pharmacist; settled in Mexico 1856; collected extensively around Mexico,
Orizaba and San Louis Potosi.
(<em>W. Schaffn.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material at A, BM, C, CAS, COLU, CORD, E, F, GH, GOET,
K, KIEL, L, M, MEXU (impt. set), MICH, MW, NY, P, PH, S, SLPM, US, W,
WRSL. – Sometimes labelled J.G. Schaffner; exsiccatae distributed by R.F. Hohenacker
and C.H. Schultz-Bip. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 221; Bossert p. 351 (d. 8 Apr 1882); Hortus
3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 7): 342 ("J.G. Schaffner"), 2: (files); Urban-Berl. p. 391.

	1882 (obit. not.).

Schallert, Paul Otto (1879-1970), American physician, amateur botanist and plant
collector; Dr. med. Univ. Illinois 1904; practicing physician; collected all over the
United States from 1904-1958; ultimately at Altamonte Springs, Florida. (<em>Schallert</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: SMU (100.000); further material in B, BPI, BR, BUT, C, CAS,
DAO, DBN, DPU, DS, DUKE (impt. set), E, F (20.000 crypt.), GAES, GB, GH,
GOET, HUJ, ILL, KY, LE, M (lich.), MICH, MIN, MONTU, MPU (lich.), NY,
OKLA, PH, RM, SD, TAES, TEX, UAC, UT, VT, WAG, WS, WVA, W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 221; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7):
342, 2: (files); Lenley p. 360; Roon p. 100.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Harrison, S.G., Index of collectors in the Welsh National Herbarium 262. 1982
	(d. 1970).
Louis-Marie, Père, Revue d'Oka 33: 46-47. 1959 (in 1959 in Altamonte, Florida, has
	100.000 specimens for exchange; still active while 80 yrs old).
Moldenke, H.N., List coll. Verben, suppl. 22. 1947.
Schallert, P.O., private comm. to senior author 1957 (b. 5 Mar 1879; details on coll.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: "For over 50 years I have sent herbarium specimens all over the world. Most of
these are at Duke University, Durham, N.C. I have collected herbarium specimens in
nearly every state of the U.S.A. I am now a retired M.D. and doing more collecting
then ever before in my life. Although 78 years old I am in good health and will collect
everything that grows and belongs to the vegetable kingdom. I started to collect in 1904
in Wisconsin; then from 1910-1942 I lived and collected in North Carolina. I was in the
M.C. Army out in the Western U.S.A. from 1943-1945 and did a lot of collecting in
California, Oregon, Washington, Colorado, Arizona and New Mexico. Many of my
specimens have been sent to Chicago Museum of Natural History, to Universities of
Wisconsin, Illinois, California, New Mexico, Arizona, Colorado, North Carolina, New
York, New Hampshire, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Florida and many other places", (in
litt. to FAS, 1957). Schallert's main herbarium is now at SMU.

Scharfetter, Rudolf (1880-1956), Austrian botanist; studied at the University of
Vienna as a student of R. Wettstein and Grobben; Dr. phil. ib. 1902; supplementary
teacher at the Staatsgymnasium of Klagenfurt 1902-1904; teacher at the Staatsgym-
nasium of Villach 1904-1911 ; professor at the second Staatsrealschule Graz 1911-1919;
director ib. 1919-1937; school inspector 1937-1945; habil. Univ. Graz 1913, "Privatdo-
zent" ib. 1913-1923; extraordinary professor (title) 1924; active extraordinary professor
1935; regular titular professor 1937-1950; honorary professor 1950-1956. (<em>Scharf</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Private herbarium destroyed shortly after 1945 (fide H. Scharfet-
ter through D. Ernet); a small set of specimens is at GZU.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 222 (b. 20 Feb 1880); BFM 883, 884, 885,
2017, 2103, 2127, 2196; Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7926; BJI 2: 153; BM 4: 1825; Bossert p. 351;
LS 38883.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Österr. bot. Z. 61: 359. 1911 (moves to Graz), 87: 159. 1938 (ord. prof.
	Graz).
Bamberger, R. &amp; F. Maier-Bruck, Österreich Lexikon 2: 1006. 1966.
Biebl, R., Mitt. naturw. Ver. Steiermark 87: 5-11. 1957 (obit., bibl.).
Janchen, E., Richard Wettstein 186. 1933 (Österr. bot. Z. vol. 82); Cat. Fl. austriac. 1:
	4, 6, 31, 36. 1956 (bibl.).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 2: 29. 1936 (director Bundesrealschule Graz), 5: 114, 425,
	526. 1939, 6: 304. 1941 (Landesschulinspektor).
Wendelberger, G., Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 96: 7-9. 1956 (obit.).

Scharlok, [Carl] Julius [Adolf] (1809-1899), German (Prussian/Pommeranian) bota-
nist and pharmacist; trained as a pharmacist in the Treptow pharmacy "Zum Schwar-
zen Adler" 1824-1830; in Frankfurt a.O. 1830-1831; at Vietz near Landsberg a.W.
1831-1832; at Berlin University 1833-1834; state examination in pharmacy 1834; assist-
ant pharmacist with A.F.T. Lucae in Berlin 1834-1836; owner of the Löwen-Apotheke
at Graudenz from 1837-1865; active also as a voluntary teacher and journalist in ad-
dition to his dedication to the flora of Western Prussia. (<em>Scharlok</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: KBG (rd 1891; destroyed) and Danzig (destroyed) some extant
material at MANCH.

Schauer, Johannes Conrad (1813-1848), German (Frankfurt a.M.) botanist; studied
at the gymnasium of Mainz 1825-1827; in the "Hofgarten" of Würzburg 1828-1831
with Ant. Heller; assistant at the botanical garden of Bonn, 1831-1832; with C.G. Nees
to Breslau in charge of the botanical garden 1832-1848; Dr. phil. Erlangen 1835; habil.
Breslau 1841 ; professor of botany at the University of Greifswald and the Agricultural
College of neighbouring Eldena 1843-1848. (<em>Schauer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material at BR, K, REG. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal
at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 30: 623-624 (E. Wunschman); Backer p. 515;
Barnhart 3: 222 (b. 16 Feb 1813, d. 24 Oct 1848); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7937; BM 4: 1826;
CSP 5: 442-443; Futak-Domin p. 523; Herder p. 136, 181, 224, 312, 339; Hortus 3:
1203; HR; IH 2: (files); Kew 4: 616; Klásterský p. 164; Langman p. 677; Lasègue p. 337
(pl. in Martius herb. BR); LS 23846-23847; Maiwald p. 235; MW p. 434; PR 837, 1214,
1485, 5902, 6412, 8130-8135, ed. 1: 948, 1384, 2256, 7133, 9080-9085; Ratzeburg p. 456;

HEADING: SCHAUER

<em>Sebschauera</em> O. Kuntze (1891) honor Sebastian Schauer. The etymology <em>of Schauern</em>

determined.

10.505. <em>Chamaelaucieae</em>. Commentatio botanica quam consensu et auctoritate amplissimi

	cognita</em>, ib. 17: 235-244. Aug-Oct 1843.

Schawo, Michael (1850-1909), German (Bavarian) algologist; telegraph operator at
München ca. 1879-1891; later "Telegraphen-Verwalter" and "Postverwalter" at
Lindau. (<em>Schawo</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: CSP 18: 496; De Toni 4: 1.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Haesler, I., in litt. 17 Feb 1982 (member Bot. Ver. Landshut 1879-1882; at that
	time "Kön. Telegraphen-Amtsgehilfe" München; mentioned as "Kön. Telegraphen-
	Expeditor" in membership list Bay. bot. Ges. 1891; in idem 1899 "Kon. Telegraphen-
	Expeditor" in Lindau; id. 1904 "Kgl. Telegraphen-Verwalter" Lindau); id. 23 Apr
	1982 (d. 20 Oct 1909, aged 59 yrs, 3 months).
VanLandingham, S.L., Cat. Diat. 6: 3587. 1978, 7: 4224. 1978.

Scheele, [Georg Heinrich] Adolf (1808-1864), German (Hannover) botanist and
clergyman; from 1826 at Göttingen studying theology and botany; private teacher 1831-
1834; from 1834-1842 in Hannover in the seminary, vicar at the church of St.-Egidius,
and assistant pastor at Gross-Munzel; from 1842-1864 pastor at Heersum nr. Hildes-
heim. (<em>Scheele</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Present location unknown; further material at BREM, GOET,
REG, and Hermann Roemer Mus., Hildesheim. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at
HAL. – Scheele types are reported from CAS.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 660; Barnhart 3: 223 (b. 4 Jul 1808, d. 6 Sep
1864); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7946; BM 4: 1826; CSP 5: 447; DTS 1: 262; Herder p. 305, 336;
Hortus 3: 1203; Kanitz 190; Langman p. 677; ME 3: 451; Moebius p. 203, 269; Rehder
5: 764; RS p. 140; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Amer. J. Sci. ser. 2. 41: 264. 1866 (death notice; "a botanist of con-
	siderable merit; which, however, was not greatly shown in his contributions to the
	Flora of Texas, ..."); Bot. Zeit. 22: 328. 1864 (d.); Flora 47: 541. 1864 (d.); J. Bot. 2:
	324 ("326") 1864 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 14: 360. 1864 (d.).
Hitchcock, A.S. &amp; A. Chase, Man. grasses US. 989. 1951 (epon.).

Seeland, H., Mitt. Herrn. Roemer-Mus. Hildesheim 40: 19, 20-22, 28, 44. 1936.
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 144. 1982.

Scheer, Friedrich (Frederick) (1792-1868), German (Swedish-Pommeranian born,
from the island of Rügen) merchant and botanist; settled in England as city merchant in
London, living for many years on Kew Green, ultimately at Northfleet, Kent; active
supporter of the continuation of Kew Gardens in 1839/1840. (<em>Scheer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown; the material described by Scheer in B.C. Seemann,
Bot. Voy. Herald 1852-1857, is at BM (see TL-1/p. 441).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 223 (d. Dec 1868); BB p. 270; BM 4: 1826;
Bossert p. 351; CSP 5: 447; Desmond p. 545; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 412; Kew 4:
617; PR 8136; Rehder 5: 764; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Allibone, S.A., Crit. dict. Engl. lit. 2: 1947. 1878.
Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 214: 316. 1964 (used also pseud. Diogenes).

Scheffer, Rudolph Herman Christiaan Carel (1844-1880), Dutch botanist; student
of F.A.W. Miquel; Dr. phil. Utrecht 1867; director of the Botanic Gardens Buitenzorg
(Bogor) 1868-1880; founder of the Economic Garden and the Agricultural School at
Buitenzorg; id. of the mountain garden at Tjibodas. (<em>Scheff</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BO; other material especially at L; further material at C, K. NA,
P and 276 wood samples at BM. – <em>Letters</em> to F.A.W. Miquel at U.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 515; Barnhart 3: 223 (b. 12 Sep 1844, d. 9
Mar 1880); BJI 1: 50; BL 1: 121, 317; BM 4: 1827; Bossert p. 351; CSP 8: 847, 11: 300-
301, 12: 653-654; Frank 3 (Anh.): 89; Herder p. 148, 164, 212, 291, 314, 317, 434;
Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 fed. 6): 364; Jackson p. 118, 452; JW 2: 300, 3: 368, 4: 405; KR 4:
617; LS 23851-23852; Moebius p. 421; Morren ed. 2, p. 39; MW suppl. p. 308; NNBW
4: 1206-1207 Sirks ; PR 8137-8138; Rehder 5: 765; SK 1: 466-467, 4: cvi, cxiv-cxv,
cxxix, cxlix, 5: cccxviii; Tucker 1: 627-628; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 1/2: 256. 1880 (d.); Bot. Not. 1881: 39 d. ; Bot. Zeit. 38:
	408. 1880 (d.); Bull. Soc. bot. France 27 (bibl.): 45. 1880 (d.); De Economist 1880(1):
	624-625; Flora 63: 290. 1880 d. ; J. Bot. 1880: 160 (d.); Nat. Nov. 2: 62. 1880 (d.);

Weesp Hollandiae (apud G.G. Brugman) 1867. Oct. (<em>Myrsin. arch. ind.</em>).

10.515. <em>Observations phytographicae</em> ... [Nat. Tijdschr. Ned. Indië 31, 32. 1869-1872].

Scheidweiler, Michel Joseph François (1799-1861), German-born (Rheinland)
Belgium botanist and horticulturist; at first active as pharmacist and industrial chemist
at Siegsburg, Köln and Aachen; settled in Belgium 1830, at first in Liège, later in
Brussels; teacher at the Bruxelles École de médecine vétérinaire et d'agriculture de la
Belgique 1836, teacher at the horticultural college at Gentbrugge 1851. (<em>Scheidw</em>.).

PAGE: 125
HEADING: SCHELLE

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BR; further material at AWH, B (mainly destr.), L.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 660; Barnhart 3: 223 (b. 1 Aug 1799, d. 24 Sep
1861); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7961; BM 4: 1827; Bossert p. 352; CSP 5: 452; Herder p. 365,
393; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 2: (files); Langman p. 677; MW p. 434; PR (alph.), 5203, 8232,
ed. 1: 5745, 9088; Rehder 5: 765; RS p. 140; Urban-Berl. p. 272; Zander ed. 10, p. 711,
ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Biogr. natl., Dict, écriv. belg. 3: 377. 1897; Bonplandia 9: 376. 1861

Schellenberg, Gustav [August Ludwig David], (1882-1963), German (Wiesbaden)
botanist; Dr. phil. Univ. Zürich 1910 (student of H. Schinz); assistant botanist at Berlin-
Dahlem 1911-1912; 1913-1915 editor Wiesbadener Tageblatt; on active service 1915-
1919; lecturer ("Privatdozent") Kiel 1919-1925; assistant and lecturer Göttingen 1925;
extra-ordinary professor ib. 1926-1934, later publisher of a newspaper in Wiesbaden; in
1954 still editor-in-chief of the Wiesbadener Tageblatt. (<em>G. Schellenb.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GOET.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7968; BJI 2: 153; BM 8: 1148; Christ-

Tucker 3: 270; Zep-Tim. p. 98.

Schellenberg, Hans Conrad (1872-1923), Swiss botanist; studied agronomy at the
ETH, Zürich; with S. Schwendener in Berlin; Dr. phil. Univ. Zürich 1896; assistant at
the national Swiss seed-control station; teacher at the agricultural college "im
Strickhof'; habil. ETH Zürich 1901; lecturer ib. in plant pathology and viticulture
1903; extraordinary professor 1907; professor of agriculture ib. 1908. (<em>Schellenb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schelver, Friedrich (called Franz) Joseph (1778-1832), German (Westphalen) physi-
cian, philosopher and botanist; Dr. med.; lecturer at the University of Halle 1802-1803;
extra-ordinary professor of medicine and director of the botanical garden at Jena 1803-
1806; professor of botany and medicine at Heidelberg 1806-1832; fierce opponent of the
acknowledgement of sexuality in plants. (<em>Schelver</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 182 7-1828; Herder p. 68, 121; Moebius p. 343,
344; PR 3972, 8148-8149, ed. 1: 4368, 9095-9096; Rehder 1: 33, 199.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 214: 455-456. 1964; Flora 16(1): 28.
	1833. (d.,).
Chemnitius, F., Botaniker Univ. Jena 15, 21. 1930.
Heinsius, W., Allg. Büch.-Lex. 3: 545. 1812, 5: 487. 1817, 6: 733. 1822, 7(2): 264. 1829,
	8(82): 213. 1838.
Mägdefrau, K., Gesch. Bot. 111, 125, 269. 1973.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 786. 1863 (b. 23 Jul 1778, d. 30 Nov
	1832).
Renner, O., Jena Z. Med. Naturw. 78(2): 138-139. 1947 (opposition to sexuality of
	plants; left Jena 1806 after the battle of Jena; according to Renner his leaving re-
	mained unlamented).
Sachs, J., Gesch. Bot. 175-182. 1875; Hist. botanique 439. 1892.
Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 147, 248, 570, 616. 1940.

HEADING: SCHENCK, A.

Schemmann, Wilhelm (1845-ca. 1920), German (Prussian) botanist and school-
teacher at Annen nr Witten; conducted a bryological exchange club. (<em>Schemmann</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: MSTR; other material at E, GB, GOET and M.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Deutsche Glumaceen</em>, 3 Lief., 1920-1921, 177 nos.; <em>Deutschlands Gramineen</em> 1892-
1896, 266 nos. and various irregular sets of flowering plants and cryptogams.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Morren ed. 10, p. 8; Tucker 1: 628.

Schenck, A. (Adolf?) (<em>fl</em>. 1845), German botanist; high school teacher at the teacher's
college of Nassau-Dillenburg. (<em>A. Schenck</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Possibly identical with the entomologist Adolf Schenck who also lived at Nassau
around 1845-1850. – Adolf Schenck (1857-1936, hence not identical with this author),
was a geographer and geologist who explored and collected plants in German S.W.
Africa.

Schenck, Carl Alwin (1868-1955), German (Hessen) forester and dendrologist; Dr.
phil. Giessen 1894; to the United States 1895 as forester at the "Biltmore estate";
founder and first director of the Biltmore Forest School and head of the Vanderbilt
Forestry reserves in North Carolina 1898-1913; from 1913 active in Germany (from
Darmstadt); one of the organisers of the Hoover-plan for post-1918 hungry German; in
close contact with the development of forestry in the United States until 1938 and again
after 1945. (<em>C.A. Schenck</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Biol.-Dokum. 15: 7974; Rehder 5: 766; Tucker 1: 628, 3:
270.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Amer. Forests 61: 42. 1955 (obit. not., portr.); Amer. men Sci. ed. 2:
	411-412. 1910; Forestry 53: 461. 1955 (obit. not.); New Yorker 27: 11-12. 1951;
	Who's who Amer. 4: 1567. 1906-1907, 5: 1663. 1908-1909, 6: 1684. 1910-1911, 7:
	1841. 1912-1913, 8: 2063. 1914-1915, 9: 2166-2167. 1916-1917, 10: 2391. 1918-1919;
	Wood preserving News 34: 27-38. 1956.
Butler, O., The Biltmore story, St. Paul 1955, viii, 224 p.

Heske, F., Z. Weltforstwirtschaft 18: 231. 1955 (obit.).

	Story. 1955 (autobiographical).

Schenck, [Johann] Heinrich [Rudolf] (1860-1927), German (Westfalen) botanist;
studied at Bonn 1879-1880, 1882-1883, and Berlin 1881-1882; Dr. phil. Bonn 1884,
student of E. Strasburger; travelled in Brazil 1886-1887 and Mexico 1908; habil. Bonn
1889; "Privatdozent" and assistant at the Botanical Institute, Bonn 1890-1896; extra-
ordinary professor ib. 1896; professor of botany at the Technical University and director
of the botanical garden Darmstadt 1896-1927. (<em>Schenck</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (mainly destroyed), C, H, KIEL, L, M, MB, UPS, WRSL, Z.

HEADING: SCHENCK, J. H. R.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Eduard Strasburger, Fritz Noll, Heinrich Schenck, A.F.W.
Schimper, <em>Lehrbuch der Botanik für Hochschulen</em> eds. 1-16, 1894-1923 (Schenck contributed
the chapters on cryptogams). This is the famous "Bonner Lehrbuch" or "Viermänner-
buch" which has served numerous continental European botanists since 1894; Schenck
was one of the original foursome; see under E. Strasburger.
(2) <em>Vegetationsbilder</em>. Herausgegeben von Dr. G. Karsten and Dr. H. Schenck. Jena
(Gustav Fischer) Ser. 1-16, 1903-1924; Schenck himself provided: Ser. 1, Heft 1, 1903 (
S. Brazil), Heft 3, no. 1 (Trop. Nutzpfl.), Heft 7 (Strandveg. Bras.); Ser. 3, Heft 4
(Mittelmeerbäume); Ser. 6, Heft 5/6 (Alpine Vegetation); Ser. 8, Heft 8, no. 1 (Trop.
Nutzpfl.); Ser. 12, Heft 5, 1914/15 (Flechtenbestände); Ser. 14, Heft 5/6, 1921/22 (Veg.
Sierra Mixteca, Mexico).
(3) <em>Lianen</em>, in <em>Handw.-Buch Naturw.</em> 6: 176-185. 1913.
(4) <em>Wasserpflanzen</em>, in <em>Handw.-Buch Naturw.</em> 10: 511-528. 1913.

Schenk, [Joseph] August [von] (1815-1891), Austrian (Tirol) born German botanist
and palaeontologist; studied medicine at München University; Dr. med. 1837; Dr. phil.
Erlangen 1840; habil. München 1841; extraordinary professor of botany at Würzburg
1844; from 1850 regular professor and director of the Würzburg botanical garden; idem
at Leipzig 1868-1887. (<em>Schenk</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: WB and LZ (both destroyed). – Further material in BR, C,
GOET, MW, REG, W, WAG. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 53: 749-751 (E. Wunschmann); AG 12(2): 14;
Andrews p. 327; Barnhart 3: 226 (b. 17 Apr 1815, d. 30 Mar 1891); Biol.-Dokum. 15:
7982; BJI 1: 50-51; BM 4: 1828-1829; Bossert p. 352; CSP 5: 455-456, 8: 849-850, 11:
302, 12: 654, 18: 504; De Toni 1: cxi; DTS 1: 262; Frank (Anh.): 89; Hegi 6(2): 1245;
Herder p. 95, 121, 158, 213, 218, 224, 286, 352; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 62, 185, 187,
431, 478, 488; Kew 4: 620; Kleppa p. 232; KR p. 622; LS 23871-23874; Moebius p. 171,
381, 382; Morren ed. 2, p. 10, ed. 11, p. 22; MW p. 434; NI 1747; PR 5902, 8153-8161,
8315, ed. 1: 9107; Quenstedt p. 381; Rehder 5: 766; Saccardo 1: 149; TL-2/see G.K.M.
Kraus, H.L.H. Müller; Tucker 1: 628, 3: 271; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 811.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Andrews, H.N., The fossil hunters 163, 305-306. 1980.
Anon., Bonplandia 6: 51. 1850; Bot. Centralbl. 30: 256. 1887 (retirement), 46: 62. 1891
	(d.); Bot. Gaz. 16: 242. 1891 (library for sale); Bot. Not. 1892: 47 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 2:
	320. 1844 (extra-ord. prof. Würzburg, provisional), 7: 910. 1849 (ord. prof. Würzb.),
	9: 799. 1851 (ord. prof. Würzb.), 26: 96. 1868 (to Leipzig), 45: 276. (retirement), 439

Schenk, Ernst (1796-1859), German (Thüringian) botanist and botanical artist,
"akademischer Zeichnenlehrer" in Jena. (<em>E. Schenk</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(1): 678; Barnhart 3: 226; BM 4: 1828; Herder p.
386, 411; Kew 4: 620; NI 1748-1750, 3: 45; PR 3422, 4863, 5049, 5902, 8214, 10466-
10470, ed. 1: 3731, 5393, 5539, 11424, 11428; TL-1627; TL-2/2064, 3922, 4039-4041,

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 260, 333, 927. 1940.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: Schenk provided illustrations to many works, see e.g. the references
under PR and TL-2; some of the most noted are:
(1) K.C.T. Goebel, <em>Pharm. Waarenk.</em> 1827-1834, 2 vols., see TL-2/2064.
(2) J.C. Zenker, <em>Maturgeschichte der vorzüglichsten Handelspflanzen</em> 1832, 2 vols., <em>48 pl</em>. by
Schenk.
(3) J.W. Krause, <em>Abbild. Getreideart.</em> 1834-1837, TL-2/3922.
(4) J.C. Zenker et al., <em>Fl. Thüringen</em> 1836-1855, 12 vols., 144 Hefte; see under J.C.
Zenker.
(5) G. Kunze, <em>Analecta pteridogr</em>. 1837, see TL-2/4039; <em>Farrnkräuter</em> 1840-1851, 2 vols., see
TL-2/4040; <em>Suppl. Riedgräs.</em> 1840-1850, see TL-2/4041.
(6) D.F.L. von Schlechtendal et al., <em>Fl. Deutschland</em> 1841-1869, 22 vols., (ed. 5: 1880-
1888), see under D.F.L. von Schlechtendal.

PAGE: 139
HEADING: SCHERER

(7) C.E. Langethal, <em>Termin. beschr. Bot.</em> 1845, see TL-2/4195.
(8) Johann Guenther &amp; Friedrich Bertuch, <em>Pinakothek der deutschen Giftgewächse</em> ... Jena
(Druck und Verlag von Friedrich Mauke) 1840, 16 p. text, <em>36 pl</em>. by Schenk; ed. 2
"herausgegeben von Dr. E. Schenk und Dr. Günther", Jena (id.) s.d., 16 p., <em>36 pl. Copy</em>:
B.
(9) <em>Atlas</em> zu [Ludwig] Herfort's <em>Waarenlexikon</em>, Leipzig 1857, <em>80 pl</em>. (n.v.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: For Ernst Schenk (b. 1 Mar 1880, d. 3 Feb 1965), German (Berlin) high school
teacher and botanist (rhodologist), see M. Rosenthal, Willdenowia 4(3): 419-421. 1968
(obit., portr., bibl.). Schenk's herbarium was acquired by B in 1961 with that of Carl
Risch.

10.568. <em>Atlas der vorzüglichsten Handelspflanzen</em> zu Schwarzkopf's Lehrbuch der Colonial-
und Spezerei-Waarenkunde. Mit erläuterndem Texte und treu nach der Natur gezeich-
neten Abbildungen ... Jena (Druk und Verlag von Friedrich Mauke) [1853-1854]. Qu. (<em>Atlas Handelspfl</em>.).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1853-1854 (possibly in parts; p. [i-xxii], <em>pl. 1-4.8</em> (uncol. copp.). – Reissue of the
	plates belonging to J.C. Zenker, <em>Merkantilische Waarenkunde</em>, Naturgeschichte der vor-
	züglichsten Handelsartikel, 2 vols., 1831-1832, see under Zenker.

Scherbius, Johannes (1769-1813), German (Frankfurt a.M.) botanist and physician;
Dr. med. Jena 1790, later practicing physician at Frankfurt a.M. and associated with
the Senckenberg Institute. (<em>Scherb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FR; also HBG, JE, W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 226 (d. 8 Nov 1813); BM 4: 1830; Dryander
3: 501; GR p. 44; GR, cat. p. 71; Hawksworth p. 185; Herder p. 183, 411; Hortus 3:
1203; Kew 4: 620; LS 9458; NI p. 245; PR 3167, 8167, ed. 1: 3468, 9110; SBC p. 131;
TL-2/1926, 8593; Tucker 1: 628; Zander ed. 11, p. 754.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Blum, J., Ber. Senckenb. naturf. Ges. Wiss., Abh. 1901: 10.
Conert, H.J., Senckenbergiana Biol. 48(C): 10. 1967.
McNeill, J. &amp; H.C. Prentice, Taxon 30(1): 29. 1981 (date Oekon. Fl. Wetterau vol. 2).
Sayre, G., Bryologist 80: 517. 1977 (bryoph.).
Voigt, A., Bot. Inst. Hamburg 18. 1897.
Zingel, J., Gesch. Wetterau. Ges. ges. Naturk. 9, 14, 16, 20, 210. 1908.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: With P.G. Gaertner and B. Meyer, <em>Oekon. Fl. Wetterau</em> 1799-1802, 3
vols., see TL-2/1926. <em>Additional information</em>: vol. 2 published 4 Mai 1800 (J. McNeill &amp;
H.C. Prentice 1981), thus antedating e.g. Rafn, Danm. Holst. Fl. vol. 2, which was
published Jun 1800. Corrected pagination formula and date 3(2): [1]-388, [1, err.], [1,
Nachricht dated 1 Jun 1802], [1]-32. Vol. 3(2) therefore came out Jun-Dec 1802. – <em>Copies</em>: FI, HH, L, USDA.

10.569. Dissertatio inauguralis medica <em>de Lysimachia purpureae</em> sive Lythri salicariae Linn.
virtute medicinali non dubia. Quam rectore academiae magnificentissimo serenissimo
duce ac domino domino Carolo Augusto ... consensu gratiosi medicorum ordinis pro
gradu doctoris summisque in medicina et chirurgia honoribus ac privilegiis rite con-
sequendis a.d. v junii [1790] publice defendet auctor Joannes Scherbius moeno-

<em>Publ</em>.: 5 Jun 1790, p. [i-vii], [1]-34, <em>1 pl</em>. (I.C. Berndt, uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: FI, G.

Scherer, Johann [Baptist] Andreas (1755-1844), Bohemian botanist; studied at
Praha and Wien under J.G. Mikan and N.J. v. Jacquin; practicing physician at Wien;
professor of chemistry at the "Theresianische Ritterakademie", Wien 1797-1803; id. at
the Technical Institute Praha, later professor of "special natural history" in Wien 1803-
1833. (<em>Scherer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 787-788. 1863 (b. 24 Jun 1755, bibl.,
	biogr. notes).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: The Swiss clergyman (O.S.B.) and botanist Emmanuel Scherer (b. 16 Jun 1876)
defended 1903 at the University of Freiburg (Fribourg), Switzerland: <em>Studien über Gefäss-
bündeltypen und Gefässformen</em>, Jena (Verlag von Gustav Fischer) 1903. Oct., p. [i, iii], [1]-
44, [45, vita], <em>pl. 1-3</em> (uncol.) (<em>copy</em>: B); subsequently teacher in Sarney, d. 1929 (Ber.
Schweiz. bot. Ges. 39: v-xi. 1930).

Scherfel, Aurei Wilhelm (Vilmos Auréi) (1835-1895), Austro-Hungarian botanist
and pharmacist; practicing pharmacist at Felka; founder and first director of the Tatra
Museum in Poprad-Felka (Slovakia), explorer of the western Carpathic Mts. (<em>Scherfel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at W. – The original collections of the Poprad-
Felka Museum (POP) are now incorporated in TNP.

ed. 10, p. 41.

Scherffel, Aladár, (1865-1938), Hungarian mycologist and algologist; studied at
Budapest University 1883-1884, at Graz 1886-1887, again at Budapest 1887-1888; from
then on private scientist at Iglo, Gödölló, later at the Hungarian biological institute at
Tihany; Dr. phil. h.c. Szeged 1922; titular professor at the University of Szeged 1933.
(<em>Scherff</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Library at Tihany.

(err. Scherfell).

Scheuchzer, Johannes (1684-1738), Swiss botanist at Zürich; brother of J.J. Scheuch-

Scheuchzer, Johann Jakob (1672-1733), Swiss naturalist, physician and historian;
studied at Altdorf 1692; Dr. med. Univ. Utrecht 1694; second town physician at Zürich
1704; professor of mathematics at the Zürich Carolinum 1710 (? 1716), first town physi-
cian 1733; explorer of the Alps and founder of palaeobotany and palaeontology. (<em>J.J.
Scheuchzer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ZT; grasses and other plants in herb. Sloane (BM), see Dandy
1958; some further material in E (via herb., Giseke) and OXF. – Lists of plants are
given by S. in his travelogues, e.g. the <em>Itinera alpina</em> (Itinera helvetiae alpinas regiones ...
Leiden 1723. 4 vols). – Letters to Sherard at Roy. Soc, London.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: For a detailed bibliography of J.J. Scheuchzer see e.g. Brit. Mus. gen. cat. 214:
575-579. 1964 (70 nos.); for biographical and bibliographical references as well as sec-
ondary studies see Poggendorff 1971. We list here only a selection of writings on
Scheuchzer which may be of importance for an understanding of his palaeontology or
botany.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 34: 710-715; AG 1: 374, 5: 384, 6(2): 935; Backer
p. 515-516; Barnhart 3: 227 (b. 2 Aug 1672-23 Jun 1733); BM 4: 1830-1831; Bossert p.
352; Clokie p. 238; DSB 12: 159, 1975; GR p. 645; Herder p. 58, 75, 352, 425; HU 456;
IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342; Jackson 1, 19, 176, 341; Kew 4: 621; Lasègue p. 347; LS
23888; Moebius p. 126, 376, 377; NI 1752, see also indexes; Oudemans p. 234; Plesch p.
398; PR 8173-8174, ed. 1: 9117-9120; Quenstedt p. 381; Rehder 5: 766; Saccardo 2: 99;
Sotheby 678; TL-2/see A. Buddie, P.A. Micheli; Tucker 1: 629.

Scheuchzer, Johannes fil. (1738-1815), Swiss botanist at Zürich; son of Joh. Scheuch-
zer (1684-1738); Dr. med. Leiden 1760; private scientist at Zürich from 1760; for some
time assistant librarian at the municipal library, head-librarian 1789-1795. (<em>J. Scheuch-
zer, fil.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: See J.J. Scheuchzer.

Scheutz, Nils Johan Wilhelm (1836-1889), Swedish botanist; Dr. phil. Uppsala 1857;
high school teacher at Västervik (1859) and Växjö (1862); lecturer in natural history
and Latin Växjö 1872; especially interested in rhodology and bryology. (<em>Scheutz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LD (bryol. herb.; some phan.), Växsjö Highschool (phan.); other
material at B (mainly destroyed), C, GB, H, LD, MW, UPS, WRSL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 74; Barnhart 3: 224; BL 1: 542, 544, 714; BM
4: 1831; Bossert p. 352; CSP 5: 460, 8: 852, 11: 304, 12: 655, 18: 509; Herder p. 195, 266,
342; IH 2: (files); Kew 4: 621; Kleppa p. 217; KR p. 622-624 (b. 8 Apr 1836, d. 26 Feb
1889); Morren ed. 10, p. 108); MW p. 434; PR 8175-8176; Rehder 5: 5: 766-767; SO
863, 2727; TL-2/3552; Tucker 1: 629; Urban-Berl. p. 313.

	Bot. Not. 1871: 15 (to Gotland), 197 (in Blekinge), 1872: 96 (to Bohuslän), 1889: 79
	(obit. not.); Generalreg. Bot. not. 1839-1938, p. 70 (16 papers in Bot. Not.), 116.

Schiede, Christian Julius Wilhelm (1798-1836), German (Hessen) botanist, travel-
ler and plant collector; originally gardener; studied medicine at Göttingen and Berlin; to
Mexico 1828 (with F. Deppe); staying there until his death in 1836 exploring Orizaba,
Jalapa, Cuautla and Cuernavaca. (<em>Schiede</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (original set destr.; set ex herb. Baschant extant), HAL (sent to
Schlechtendal); further material BM, BR, C, CGE, F, FI, G, GH, GOET, K, KIEL,
LE, LZ (destr.) M, MO, NY, OXF, P, S, U, US, W, XAL (photos). – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L
von Schlechtendal at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 516; Barnhart 3: 224 (b. 3 Feb 1798, d. Dec
1836); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 8007; BM 4: 1831; Clokie p. 239; CSP 5: 461, 6: 753, 8: 854;
Hegi 6(1): 18; Herder p. 132; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, 2: (files); Kew 4: 621;
Langman p. 678; Lasègue p. 332, 468, 505; PR 8177, ed. 1: 9121; Rehder 1: 271, 331;
TL-2/1082; Urban-Berl. p. 290, 313, 392; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 812.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Flora 9(1): 234. 1826 (will travel "overseas"), 12(1): 94, 175-176. 1829
	(with Deppe to Mexico, from Bordeaux Mai 1828; arrived at Veracruz Jul 1828,
	collected in Jalapa and Orizaba, ..." sind entzückt über die Herrlichkeit der dortigen
	... Natur"), 12(2): 494. 1829 (news from Veracruz), 13(1): 45-46. 1830 (trip Jalapa
	to Orizaba), 14(1): 398. 1831, 15(2): 407. 1832 (coll. rd.), 20(2): 432. 1837 (died of
	typhus Dec 1936).

Schiedermayr, Karl [Carl] B. (1818-1895), Austrian physician and botanist; Dr. med.
Wien 1843; Chir. Dr. ib. 1844; practicing physician at Linz, 1845 and Kirchdorf 1849-
1871; regional physician for Kirchdorf and Steyr 1871; id. Linz 1874; "Statthal-
tereirath" (medical adviser to the government of Upper Austria) 1875; ultimately again
at Kirchdorf (<em>Schiederm</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LI (cryptogamic herb.); further material at M (lich.), W,
WRSL. Contributed to C. Roumeguère et al., <em>Fungi selecti exsiccati</em>.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 224 (b. 3 Nov 1818, d. 29 Oct 1895); BM 4:
1831; Bossert p. 352; CSP 5: 461, 8:854, 11: 306, 12: 656, 18: 511; De Toni 1: cxii ("D.C.
Schiedermayr"), 4: xlv; DTS 1: 262-263; GR p. 439; Herder p. 192; Kew 4: 621; LS
23892-23897; Morren ed. 10, p. 32; Nordstedt p.26, 28; PR 8178; Rehder 2: 273; Stev-
enson 1257; TL-2/see I.S. Poetsch; WU 29: 274-276.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 64: 319. 1895 (d.); Bot. Not. 1896: 44 (d.); Hedwigia 35:
	(35). 1896 (d.); Jahresber. Ver. Naturk. Österreich ob der Ems, Linz 25: 3-5. 1896
	(obit.); Nat. Nov. 17:704. 1895; Österr. bot. Z. 32: 213-217. 1882 (biogr. sketch,
	portr., bibl., epon.), 45: 446. 1895 (d.).

Sayre, G., Bryologist 80: 517. 1977 (coll. bryoph.).
Wittrock, V.B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(2): 85. 1903.

author of <em>Syst. Aufz. Krypt. Nachtr.</em> 1894; see also under Poetsch.

Schiemann, Carl Christianus (1763-1835), German (Kurland) physician; studied
medicine at Göttingen 1782-1786; Dr. med. ib. 1786; travelled in Holland and England
1786-1787; practicing physician in Mitau (Kurland) from 1787. (<em>C. Schiem</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

HEADING: SCHIEMANN, E.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Dryander 3: 510.; PR ed. 1: 9123.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Welding, O. et al., eds., Deutschbalt. biogr. Lex. 675. 1970 (b. 6 Sep 1763, d.

10.594. Dissertatio inauguralis medica <em>de Digitali purpurea</em>. Quam illustris medicorum
ordinis consensu in Academia Georgia Augusta pro summis in medicina honoribus rite

<em>Publ</em>.: 15 Aug 1786, p. [1]-63, [64, theses]. <em>Copies</em>: Edinburgh Univ. Libr., NSUB(2).

Schiemann, Elisabeth (1881-1972), German (Baltic-German) botanist; Dr. phil.
Berlin 1912; worked with E. Baur in the Genetics Institute, Friedrichshagen 1914-1931;
habil. Agricultural University Berlin 1924; unofficially associated with the Botanical
Museum Berlin-Dahlem from 1928-1972; extra-ordinary professor at the Agricultural-
Veterinary faculty of the University of Berlin 1931-1940; from 1936 lecturing on biology
and reproduction; discharged for political reasons 1940; re-instated 1945; professor of
genetics at the Wilh. von Humboldt Univ. 1946, with the Deutsche Forschungshoch-
schule, Berlin-Dahlem 1949-1952, with Max Planckgesellschaft 1952-1956; leading
authority on the history of cultivated plants. (<em>E. Schiern.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Museum material in B.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 224 (15 Aug 1881); BFM 2978, 2979; Biol.
Dokum. 15: 8010-8012; BJI 2: 154; Bossert p. 352; Hirsch p. 263; Kew 4: 621-622; MW
p. 434.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Österr. bot. Z. 74: 248. 1925 (habil. Berlin), 85: 160. 1936 (lecturing
	assignment); Der Tagesspiegel 31 Jan 1962 (Dr. h.c. T.U. Berlin), 15 Aug 1971 (90th
	birthday), 9 Jan 1972 (d.).
Asen, J. Gesamtverz. Lehrkörp. Univ. Berlin 1: 170. 1955 (professorship suspended 6
	Apr 1940).

	ever, had been kept elsewhere and remained intact.

Schiffner, Victor Félix (1862-1944), Bohemian-born Austrian botanist; Dr. phil.
Praha 1886; assistant with M. Willkomm and R. v. Wettstein at the Botanical Institute
of the German University Prag (Praha) 1884-1896, and lecturer in systematic botany ib.
1888-1896; extra-ordinary professor of botany ib. 1896-1902; at Buitenzorg (Bogor,
Java) 1893-1894; extra-ord. prof. of systematic botany ib. 1896-1902; in Brazil (with R.
v. Wettstein) 1901; extra-ord. prof. of systematic botany at the university of Wien 1902-
1904; regular professor 1904-1932; outstanding hepaticologist. (<em>Schiffn</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: FH (rd 1931; hepatic coll., 19.200 specimens, see C. Neuhauser
1973 for index); B (extant; hepatics and algae acquired after 1931, see Pilger 1947). – Other material at A, AAU, BM, BP, BR, C, CERN, CU, DBN, DPU, E, GH, GOET,
H (large coll.), IB, IBF, JE, KIEL, L, LD, M, MANCH, MICH, MO, NMW, NY, PR,
PRC (early), S, STU, W (2000, through Baumgartner, many types), WRSL, WU
(Brazil).
<em>Hepaticae europeae exsiccatae</em>: ser. 1-29, nos. 1-1465, Wien 1901-1943 (details see Sayre
	1971), sets at AAU, BM, BR, C, CERN, CU, E, FH, FR, G, GJO, H (compl.), IBF,
	KIEL, LD, M, MANCH, NY, PC, PL, S, STU, W, WRSL, WU.
<em>Other exsiccatae</em>: Schiffner issued various other sets of exsiccatae, e.g.:
	<em>Iter indicum</em> 1893/1894, plantae exsiccatae indicae, ser. 1-2, 1897 (see E. Bauer, Bot.
	Centralbl. 72: 421-422. 1897, 78: 268-269. 1899 and Sayre (1975). Set at FH.
	<em>Musci brasilienses</em>, nos. 1-174. 1932.
	<em>Algae marinae</em>, ser. 1 (nos. 1-244) 1927, 2(245-500). Jan 1929, 3(501-750). 1930, 4(750-
	1000). Nov 1932, 5(1000-1250) 1931, 6(1251-1500). 1931. Sets at BM, FH, NY, SI.
<em>Contributed to E. Bauer, Bryotheca bohemica</em> and to A. Kerner, <em>Flora exsiccata austro-
	hungarica</em>.

Schilberszky, Károly (1863-1935), Hungarian botanist; Dr. phil. Budapest, 1893; as-
sistant at the Seed Control Station Budapest 1887; subsequently assistant at the Botan-
ical Institute of the University of Budapest; until 1894 professor of botany and phytopa-
thology at the Budapest Horticultural School (later: college) 1894; habil. Univ. Budap-
est 1904; asst. professor at the Faculty of Philosophy, Univ. Sci. Budapest 1904, id. at
the Technical University 1911 and at the Agronomical Faculty 1923, full professor 1926.
(<em>Schilberszky</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BP.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 225; Biol.-Dokum. 15: 8017-8018; BM 4:
1832; Bossert p. 352 (b. 26 Nov 1863, d. 10 Nov 1934); CSP 18: 517-518 (bibl.); De
Toni 4: 1; Futak-Domin p. 525; GR p. 660; LS 23906-23913, 38905-38913, 41711,
suppl.24629-24653; Rehder 5: 767; Stevenson p. 1257.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 60: 288. 1894 (prof. bot.), 96: 80. 1904 (habil. Univ.
	Budapest); Hedwigia 43: (126). 1904 (habil. Univ. Budapest), 52: (155). 1912 (habil.
	Budapest Polytechnic); Österr. bot. Z. 37: 410. 1887 (Seed Control Station), 44: 479.
	1894 (prof. bot.).
Husz, B., Bot. Közlem. 35: 11-21. 1938 (obit., bibl., portr.).
Sayre, G., Bryologist 80: 517. 1977.
Ubriszy, G., Acta phytopath. Acad. Sci. Hung. 1: 5-10. 1966 (biogr., portr.).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 2: 200, 201. 1936 (d. obit., portr., d. 10 Sep 1934).
Verseghy, K., Feddes Repert. 68(1): 125. 1963.

jegyzéke ... Budapest (Kiadja a K.M. Temészeffudoményi Társulat) 1892. Oct. (<em>Hazsl.
Magyarorsz. mohfl.</em>).

Schiller, Eduard (<em>fl</em>. 1886), German physician and botanist at Breslau. (<em>E. Schiller</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<em>Publ</em>.: 1886 (ÖbZ 1 Oct 1886; Bot. Zeit. 17 Sep 1886; Nat. Nov. Sep(2) 1886), p. [i]-iv,

<em>Ref</em>.: Freyn, J.F., Bot. Centralbl. 30: 49-50. 1887 (rev.).

Schiller, Josef (1877-1960), Bohemian-born Austrian hydrobiologist and algologist;
Dr. phil. Wien 1905; botanical assistant at the Triest zoological station 1905-1910; high
school teacher ib. 1909; high school teacher in Wien from 1911, continuing his partici-
pation in the Austrian research of the Adriatic with the "Najade"; habil. Wien 1917;
lecturer in botanical hydrobiology at the University of Wien from 1918, from 1927 with
the title of extraordinary professor; gave practical hydrobiological courses also at
Helgoland (1925-1930), Ragusa (Dubrovnik) 1926, Spolato (Split) 1928, and Rovigno
d'Istria 1937. Retired officially ca. 1938, continuing his algological research. (<em>J.
Schiller</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material at BM, NY, PC.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Algae adriaticae exsiccatae</em> herausgegeben von der k.k. zoologischen Station in
Triest, cent. 1, fasc. 1-30, 1910.
<em>Hydrobiologische Präparate</em>: Mitteleuropäisches Winter-Heloplankton, ser. i, Leipzig 1925-
1926; see e.g. Herbarium 69: 201-202. 1924.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 225 (b. 16 Jun 1877); BJI 2: 154; Christ-
iansen p. 177; Roon p. 100; Tucker 1: 629(?).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Österr. bot. Z. 59: 327. 1909 (high school teacher at the k.k. Staats-
	Oberrealschule, Triest, 60: 407. 1910 (resigns assistantship zool.-sta. Trieste), 61: 407.
	1911 (appointed at Staatsgymnasium Wien-Meidling), 67: 42. 1918 (habil. Wien);
	Richard Wettstein zum sechzigsten Geburtstag 1923, p. 5 and 7 (signature; teacher
	with R. Wettstein).
Janchen, E., Richard Wettstein 186. 1933 (brief biogr. details).

PAGE: 159
HEADING: SCHILLING

Kamptner, E., Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 100: 11-13. 1960 (obit., d. 10 Jul 1960).
Kneucker, A., Allg. bot. bot. Z., 15: 14.8. 1909 (app. high school Triest), 33: 64. 1928
	(extra-ordinary prof.).
Schiller, J., Naturwissenschaften 4: 277-283. 1916. "Der derzeitige Stand unserer Kennt-
	niss der Coccolithophoriden".
VanLandingham, S.L., Cat. Diat. 4: 2368. 1971.
Wawrik, F., Rev. algol. ser. 2. 5(4): 227-235. 1961 (obit., portr., bibl.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Contributed to Rabenhorst, <em>Krypt.-Fl.</em> ed. 2 (q.v.):
	(a) <em>Coccolithineae, in</em> 10(2): 89-268. 1931; rev. O.C. Schmidt, Hedwigia 71: (8)-(9).
Aug 1931.
	(b) <em>Dinoflagellatae</em> (<em>Peridineae</em>), <em>in</em> 10(3)(1): [ii-iv], [1]-617. 1931-1933, 10(3)(2): [ii]-vii,
[1]-589, [590], 1933-1937; see O.C. Schmidt, Hedwigia 72: (13). Apr 1932 (rev. Lief. 1),
73: (10)-(11). 30 Mar 1933 (rev. Lief. 2-3), 75: (87). 1936 (part 2, Lief. 1-2), 77: (13). 15
Oct 1937 (i. Lief. 3-4).
(2) <em>Rhodophyta, in</em> A. Pascher, <em>Süssw.-Fl. Deutschl.</em> 11: 157-206. Jun-Jul 1925.
(3) <em>Über Kultur und Methodik beim Studium der Meerespflanzen</em> in E. Abderhalden, ed.,
Handb. biol. Arbeitsmeth. 9(5): 181-309. 1928.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schilleriella</em> A. Pascher (1932); <em>Schillerochloris</em> Ruinen (1938); <em>Schilleriomonas</em>
T.V. Desikachary (1976); <em>Note</em>: <em>Schilleria</em> Kunth (1840) commemorates the German poet
Schiller; the etymology of <em>Schillera</em> H.G.L. Reichenbach (1828) was not given.

Schiller, Sigismund (1847-1920), Austro-Hungarian botanist and journalist; from
1881-1884 at Presburg (Bratislava, now Czecho-Slovakia); later editor of the "Pester
Lloyd" at Budapest. (<em>S. Schiller</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 225 (d. 14 Sep 1920); CSP 5: 465 (? paper
by "Sigismund Schiller"), 8: 857; Futak-Domin p. 525.

Schimper, Andreas Franz Wilhelm (1856-1901), German (Alsatian) botanist; son of
Wilhelm Philipp Schimper (1808-1880); studied with A. de Bary at the University of
Strassburg; Dr. phil. ib. 1878; at the botanical garden of Lyon 1878; with J. Sachs in
Würzburg 1879-1880; fellow of John Hopkins University, Baltimore 1880-1882; assistant
to E. Strasburger at Bonn 1882; lecturer in physiological botany ib. 1883, extraordinary
professor 1886; travelled in the E. United States 1880-1881, the West Indies 1882-1883,
Brazil 1886, Ceylon and Java 1889-1890; with the German <em>Valdivia</em> expedition ("Deu-
tsche Tiefsee-Expedition") 1898-1899; professor of botany at Basel 1898 (effective 1899)-
1901; outstanding physiological plant geographer. (<em>A. Schimp.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GRA, STU; some bryophytes from the West Indies in E. – Alcohol material was at BAS and BONN (see e.g. Urban 1898). – 16 <em>letters</em> to W.G.
Farlow at FH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 516; Barnhart 3: 225 (b. 12 Mai 1856, d. 9 Sep
1901); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 8042; BJI 1: 51; BM 4: 1833, 8: 1151; Bossert p. 352; CSP 111:
310-311, 12: 656, 18: 521; DSB 12: 165-167 (A.P.M. Sanders); Hegi 4(3): 1253; Herder
p. 434; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364; Jackson p. 107, 493; Kew 4: 623; Langman p. 679; LS 23922,
26018; Moebius p. 198, 456 (index); Morren ed. 10, p. 8; NI 1754; Plesch p. 399;
Rehder 5: 768; SK 1: 468-469 (coll. Indonesia), 4: cxxviii; TL-2/5434, 6151-6153, 6155;
see I.B. Balfour, F. Noll, H. Schenck; Tucker 1: 629, 3: 271; Urban-Berl. 392.
