	Hafner Publishing Co., New York. – ISBN 3-7682-0901-6.

Schimper, Georg [Heinrich] Wilhelm (1804-1878), German (Baden) botanist and
plant collector; brother of Karl Friedrich Schimper; collected for the Esslinger Reise-
verein in S. France and Algeria 1831; in Egypt and Arabia 1834-1836; in Abyssinia from
1837; became Abyssinian, married a daughter of Ras Ubies and became governor of the
district of Antitscho 1840-1855; living on his collecting from 1855. (<em>G.W. Schimp.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (partly extant), and P, PC (later coll., after dissolution of Unio
itineraria, went directly to P/PC). – Further material at AWH, BAS, BERN, BHU, BM,
BR, BUF, CAL, CAS, CGE, CN, DBN, DPU, E, FI, FT, G, GE, GH, GOET, GRA,
GRO, H, HAL, JE, K, KIEL, L, LE, LG, LY, LZ (destr.), M, MICH, MO, MPU,
MW, NA, NCY, NY, OXF, P, PC, S, SAM, STU, TCD, TO, TUB, U, UPS, US, VT,
W, WAG, WB, WRSL, WU. – Schimper's collections, from Abyssinia, Egypt, Algeria,
"Arabia petraea" (NW Arabia), "Arabia felix" (SE and S Arabia) were distributed by
the "Esslingen" or "Würtemberger Reiseverein", also called "Unio itineraria". This
society was administered by R.F. Hohenacker and E.G. von Steudel. For further details
see Baur (1970). Schimper was by far the most important collector for this society. See
also Sayre (1969).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 279-281; AG 2(1): 694, 2(2): 152; Backer p.
516; Barnhart 3: 226 (b. 19 Aug 1804); BM 4: 1833; Clokie p. 239; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364,
(ed. 7): (in press), 2: (files); Jackson p. 347; Lasègue p. 583 [index]; PR ed. 1: 9131;
Rehder 1: 484; Urban-Berl. p. 268, 290, 313, 392.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Belg. hort. 29: 346-348. 1879 (obit.); Bot. Not. 1844: 32, 1880: 29 (d.
	Oct 1878); Bull. Soc. bot. France 2 (bibl.): 813. 1856 (on mishaps in Abyssinia), 26
	(bibl.): 91. 1879 (obit. not.); J. Bot. 17: 160. 1879 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 18: 233. 1868
	(released from captivity in Abyssinia; collections in part to B), 21: 62. 1871 (erro-
	neously reported to have died).
Bary, A. de, 37: 239-240. 1879 (obit., extensive details).
Baur, , Jahrb. Gesch. Oberdeut. Reichsst. 16: 257-262. 1970 (details on collections and
	work for the Unio itineraria).
Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. res. Brit. Isl. 224.212, 269.318. 1980.

PAGE: 164
HEADING: SCHIMPER, G. H. W.

Cufodontis, G., Phyton 3: 84-89. 1951 (localities coll. N. Abyssinia), see also Gillett
	(1958).
Dolezal, H., Friedrich Welwitsch 38, 128, 214. 1974.
Embacher, F., Lexikon Reisen 258-259. 1882.
Garcke, A., Linnaea 43: 49-58. Jul 1880 (Abyss. Malvaceae rd 1869 from S.).
Gillett, J.B., Kew Bull. 1957: 460 (addition to Cufodontis 1951), 27: 115-128. 1972
	(G.W. Schimper's botanical collecting localities in Ethiopia).
Götz, H., Georg Wilhelm Schimper, der Abessinier, Schrifte des Stadtarchivs Schwet-
	zingen, Band 14, Schwetzingen 1980, 85 p. (biogr., reproduction of original docu-
ments and letters, main treatment, further secondary references); Kindheit u. Jugend
der Brüder Karl und Wilhelm Schimper, Schr. Stadtarchiv Schwetzingen 13, 1980,
71 p.
Hochstetter, C.F., Flora 1844: 18-19. 14 Jan 1844 (on <em>Aspidostigma</em>) said to have been
	published in 1842 in Sched. Itin. Abyss. 1293, sent to Paris in 1842, subsequently
	described by Delile in 1843 as <em>Teclea nobilis</em>).
Hochstetter, C.F. &amp; Steudel, E.G. von, Aufruf und Bitte ... Schimpers Abyssinische
	Reise betreffend, Esslingen, Jan 1838, 7 p. (<em>copy</em>: G; coll.), also in Linnaea 12(1): 112-
	128. Mar 1838; <em>in</em> W.J. Hooker, London J. Bot. 5: 7-9. 1846 (information on his
	"Abyssinian plants" and his position in Abyssinia; is now ruler of Antitscho county),
	8: 284. 1856.
Jessen, K.F.W., Bot. Gegenw. Vorz. 471. 1884.
Leeuwenberg, A.J.M., Webbia 19: 862. 1965 (lists herbaria having Schimper colls.).

-r, Flora 51: 428. 1868 (released from captivity by an English expedition).

Schimper, G.H.W., Wilhelm Schimper, Reise nach Algier in den Jahren 1831 and 1832,
	Stuttgart (Metzler) 1834 (n.v.); Mitt. Geogr. A. Petermann 1868: 294-298 ("Meine
	Gefangenschaft in Abessinien").

<sm>NOTES ON TRAVELS AND COLLECTIONS</sm>: in <em>Flora</em> 8(1) Beil. 2: 96. 1825, 14(2) Int. Bl. 1: 6.

Felix), 81-83. 14 Feb 1836, 188-192. 28 Mar 1836, Int. Bl. 2: 21-25 ("21"). 21 Jun 1836;

ssinia), 14: 47-48 (has to live from manual work; lives under dire circumstances), 597-

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Oreoschimperella</em> Rauschert (1982); <em>Schimpera</em> Steudel et Hochstetter ex Endli-

10.671. Wilhelm Schimper's <em>Reise nach Algier</em> in den Jahren 1831 und 1832, oder Be-
schreibung der Stadt Algier und ihren nächsten Umgebungen, vorzüglich der daselbst
wohnenden Völkerschaften, ihrer Lebensart, Sitten und Gebräuche und des gegenwärti-
gen Zustandes dieser französischen Colonie ... Stuttgart (Verlag der J.B. Metzler'schen
Buchhandlung) 1834. Oct. (<em>Reise Algier</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1834 (p. vi: 8 Sep 1834), p. [11]-x, [1]-215, [216, err.]. <em>Copy</em>: HH. – Isued as Sehr.
	Würtemb. naturh. Reisever. 1, 1834 (eds. C.F. Hochstetter, E. Steudel).

Schimper, Karl ["Carl"] Friedrich (1803-1867), German naturalist, philosopher,
poet, botanist and morphologist; originator of the theory of the ice-ages; brother of
G.H.W. Schimper; cousin of W.P. Schimper; Dr. phil. München 1829; in München
until 1841, later in Zweibrücken and Mannheim; from 1849 in Schwetzingen except for
a stay in Jena 1854-1855. (<em>K.F. Schimp.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some lichens at M and WRSL; further material at REG. –
Manuscripts and other material left by Schimper in the Landessammlungen für Natur-
kunde, Karlsruhe. On Schimper's herbarium see e.g. Lentz (1890). – A 304 p. manu-
script notes by an attendant of Schimper's lectures on botany 1831-1832 at München is
at M.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 274-277; Backer p. 660; Barnhart 3: 226 (b. 15
Feb 1803, d. 21 Dec 1867); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 8042; BM 4: 1833; CSP 5: 467, 6: 754, 8:
857, 12: 656, 18: 521; DSB 12: 167-168 (bibl., sec. refs. by H. Tobien); Frank 3 (Anh.):
90; GR p. 130; Herder p. 148, 312; Kew 4: 623; Moebius p. 155, 156, 158, 298; PR
1112, 8188, ed. 1: 1241-1242, 9130; Quenstedt p. 382; Rehder 1: 102; TL-1/1157; see
W.P. Schimper; Urban-Berl. p. 272, 290, 313.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 3: 34. 1855, 6: 51. 1858 (cognomen Leopoldina: Galilei);
	Bot. Zeit. 26: 32. 1868 (d.); Gartenflora 17(2): 63. 1868 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 18: 102
	(d.), 408 (on posthumous publ.). 1868.

	bibl.).

10.672. <em>Beschreibung des Symphytum Zeyheri</em> und seiner zwei deutschen Verwandten der S.
bulbosum Schimper und S. tuberosum Jacq. ... Heidelberg (Universitätsbuchhandlung
von C.F. Winter) 1835. Oct. (<em>Beschr. Symphytum Zeyheri</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: somewhat before 7 Jun 1835 (Hinrichs 7-13 Jun 1835), p. [1]-119. <em>pl. 1-6</em> (uncol.
	liths. auct.). <em>Copies</em>: G, HH, NY. – An unauthorized reprint of the 1829/1830 original
	publication in Mag. Pharmacie, Geiger, 28: 3-49. Oct. 1829, 29: 1-71. 1830 (French
	abstract Bull. Sci. nat. 21: 442-445. 1830; see also Flora 13: 272. 1830). Contains a
	fundamental treatise on phyllotaxis; whether or not the spiritual property of this
	theory belongs to Schimper or to Alexander Braun has been debated (see A. Braun,
	1835 and Mettenius 1882; Mägdefrau 1968). Full title of article in Mag. Pharmacie,
	Geiger: "<em>Beschreibung</em> ... S. tuberosum Jacq. nebst Erläuterungen über die Asperi-
	folien überhaupt, namentlich über deren Blattstellung und Inflorescenz und das
	Pflanzen-Ei".

10.673. Auszug, Stücke aus dem noch ungedruckten: <em>Mooslob</em>, oder die schönsten Ge-
schichte der Moose, alte und neue, in Versen für eine junge Dame zu einer eleganten
Moossammlung von Dr. Karl Friedrich Schimper. [p. 16: Mainz, Sep 1857]. Oct. (<em>Mooslob</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Sep 1857 (p. 16), p. [1]-16. <em>Copy</em>: NY. – Explanations on p. 16.

Schimper, Wilhelm Philipp (1808-1880), Alsatian bryologist and palaeontologist;

PAGE: 167
HEADING: SCHIMPER, W. P.

cousin of Karl Friedrich (1803-1867) and Georg Heinrich Wilhelm (1804-1878) Schim-
per; father of A.F.W. Schimper; studied philosophy, philology, mathematics and the-
ology at Strasbourg 1826-1832; studied mosses in association with Philipp Bruch 1834-
1834; assistant geological section Strasbourg natural history museum 1835; with this
institution until 1880, from 1866 as director; Dr. sci. Strasbourg 1848; professor of geo-
logy and paleontology at Strasbourg from 1872-1879. (<em>W. Schimp.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Original moss herbarium at BM (originally K). – A very large
collection, including many types, was at B (Urban). – Other material at BUF, C, CGE,
DBN, DPU, E, FH, G, GOET, H, HAL, KIEL, L, LIV, M, MANCH (impt. set),
BERN, BR, MASS, MPU, MW, NY, OXF, PC, QK, S, STR (Alsatian pl., mosses),
TL, W, WRSL. – See Sayre (1975) for various sets of bryophytes issued by Schimper.
See J.B. Mougeot (TL-2: 606-607) for <em>Stirpes cryptogamae vogeso-rhenanae</em> (Schimper co-
editor fasc. 12-15; see also MD p. 185-186, K. Müller (1900) and TL-2/6373). <em>Letters</em> to
D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; to W.G. Nylander and to S.O. Lindberg in H-UB.

<sm>NAME</sm>: Schimper was born 8 Jan 1808 in Dossenheim nr. Saverne, Alsace, Alsatia, then
Dépt. du Bas-Rhin, France, the son of the local protestant minister. It is not known to us
how Schimper was baptized: "Guillaume Philippe" or as "Wilhelm Philipp". However,
Schimper signs himself W.P. Schimper on the t.p. of his 1848 French thesis defended in
(then French) Strasbourg (1848).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 277-279 (v. Gümbel); Andrews p. 327;
Barnhart 3: 227 (b. 8 Jan 1808, d. 20 Mar 1880); Biol.-Dokum. 15: 8042; BM 4: 1833-
1834; Bossert p. 353; Clokie p. 239; CSP 5: 467-468, 8: 857, 11: 311, 12: 656; De Toni 1:
cxii; DSB 12: 168-169 (P.W. Richards); DTS 1: 263-264; Frank 3 (Anh.): 90; GR p.
130-131; Hegi 4(1): 154; Herder p. 266, 352; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 153, 154, 178,
184, 228; Kew 4: 623-624; Kleppa p. 143; KR p. 624; Lasègue p. 583 [index]; Lenley p.
361; LS 23923-23925; MD p. 185; Moebius p. 117, 120; Morren ed. 2, p. 13; NI 1755-
1760, see also 2: 313; PR 8189-8197, ed. 1: 1394, 7248, 9132-9150; Quenstedt p. 382;
SBC p. 31; SO 3476; TL-1/167, 1158-1161; see C.G. Nestler; TL-2/451, 844, 2828, 6373
and see indexes for cross refs.; Tucker 1: 629; Urban-Berl. p. 313.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) J.B. Mougeot, C. Nestler et W.P. Schimper, <em>Index alphabeticus</em> ...
1843, see TL-2/6373.
(2) <em>Mousses, in</em> L. Leresche et E. Levier, Deux excurs. bot. 1881; TL-2/4407, reprinted
s.l.n.d. p. [i], [1]-14. <em>Copy</em>: G.
(3) Editor and for a major part author of P. Bruch, W.P. Schimper et W.T. von
Gümbel, <em>Bryol. eur.</em> 1836-1855, 6 vols. TL-2/844 (q.v. for full details). Other <em>copies</em> seen
by us: BR, NY, USDA. – For a reply by W.P. Schimper to Karl Müller's criticism of the
first 20 fascicles see Bot. Zeit. 2: 121-125, 134-139. 1844. – For details on preliminary
fascicles as reported by Sayre (1982) see below.
(4) <em>Palaeophytologie, in</em> K.A. Zittel, Handbuch der Palaeontologie vol. 2, Lief. 1, p. 1-152.
1879 (first use of term Bryophyta in the modern sense, fide R.M. Schuster, Hep. Anthoc.
N. Amer. 1: 95. 1966.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: G. Sayre (1982) provides the following details of four preliminary versions of parts
of P. Bruch, W.P. Schimper &amp; W.T. von Gümbel, <em>Bryol. eur.</em> 1836-1855, 6 vols. TL-
2/844 (for full details see Sayre).:

PAGE: 169
HEADING: SCHIMPER, W. P.

(1) <em>Fragmens de la bryologie d'Europe</em> ... Buxbaumiacées. AA. p. [1]-7, <em>pl. 1-2.</em> Phascacées.

Schindler, Anton Karl (1879-1964), German (Bremen) botanist; studied in Göttingen,
Strassburg, Halle; Dr. phil. Erlangen 1904; professor of natural sciences at the Univers-
ity of Peking 1905-1907, idem Shanghai 1907-1910; high school teacher at Magdeburg
and Posen 1910-1916; on active service 1916-1918; teacher in Jüterbog 1918-1925;
studied dentistry 1925-1929; practiced in Grossalmerode nr. Kassel 1929-1932; in
Döberitz nr. Berlin 1932-1956; fled to Düsseldorf 1956. (<em>Schiudl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: material at BM, E, GRO, K, MANCH, NY, W. – Manuscripts,
notes, sketches and photographs concerning <em>Desmodium</em> at HH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 660; Barnhart 3: 227 (b. 15 Aug 1879); Biol.-
Dokum. 15: 8044; BJI 2: 154; BM 4: 1834, 8: 1151; Bossert p. 353; Hortus 3: 1203; Kew
4: 624; Langman p. 679; MW p. 434-435; Rehder 5: 768; SO 914; TL-2/1713; Tucker 1:
629, 3: 271; Urban-Berl. p. 392; Zander ed. 10, p. 711, ed. 11, p. 812 (d. 18 Mar 1964).

PAGE: 173
HEADING: SCHINDLER

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 96: 495. 1904 (app. Peking); Hedwigia 44: (92). 1905
	(app. Peking).
Chung, Lingnan Sci. J. 7: 125. 1929 (information on his collecting in China; the data
	given by Schindler himself in his mss. Lebenslauf show that we he was empoyed in
	Peking and Shanghai and made occasional trips, e.g. to S. Fukien).
Cordier, H., Bibl. sinic. 5: 3430.
Kneucker, A., Allg. bot. Z. 10: 204. 1904 (app. Peking).
Merrill, E.D., B. P. Bishop Mus. Bull. 144: 163. 1937 (bibl. Polyn.); Contr. natl. Herb.
	U.S. 30(1): 266. 1947 (bibl. Pacific).
Schindler, A.K., Bot. Jahrb. 46, Beibl. 106: 51-64. 1912 ("Botanische Streifzüge in den
	Bergen von Ost-China"); Lebenslauf, mss. 2 p. at B (incl. bibl.).
Schubert, B.G., Taxon 13: 7-10. 1964 (biogr. sketch, portr., bibl.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) <em>Halorrhagaceae, in</em> Engler, <em>Pflanzenreich</em> 4(225) (Heft 23): 1-133. 12
Dec 1905. For preliminary publications see Bot. Jahrb. 34 (Beibl. 77, Heft 3): 1-77. 1904
and 34 (Beibl. 79, Hefte 5): 42-52. 1905; for new species see Repert. Sp. nov., Fedde 9:
123-125. 1911; Facsim. repr. Lehre 1958, ISBN 3-7682-2023-0.
(2) Collaborator, J. Mildbraed, <em>Wiss. Erg. deut. Zentr.-Afr. Exped. Bot.</em> 1910-1914, see
TL-2/6008.
(3) <em>Lespedezia, in</em> C.S. Sargent, <em>Pl. Wilson.</em> 2: 105-112. 1914; <em>Campylotropis, in</em> id. 2: 113-
115. 1914.

10.693. <em>Die Abtrennung der Hippuridaceen von den Halorrhagaceen</em> ... Beiblatt zu den Botanis-
chen Jahrbüchern Nr. 77.. 1904. Oct. (<em>Abtrenn. Hippur. Halorrhag.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 16 Aug 1904, p. [1]-77. <em>Copy</em>: B. – Bot. Jahrb. vol. 34(3). 1904, Beibl. 77. – See
	also Halorrhagaceae novae i, Repert. sp. nov. 9: 123-125. 1911.

10.694. <em>Einige Bemerkungen über Lespedeza</em> Michx. und ihre nächsten Verwandten ...

Schinz, Christoph Salomon (1764-1847), Swiss physician and botanist at Zürich; Dr.
med. Göttingen 1787; practicing physician at Zürich 1787, from 1812-1834 professor of
medicine at the Zürich "Carolinum"; later at the university; librarian of the "Naturfor-
schende Gesellschaft, Zürich 1792-1837. (<em>C.S. Schinz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schinz, Hans (1858-1941), Swiss botanist; Dr. phil. Zürich 1883; travelled in southwest
Africa 1884-1887; habil. Zürich 1889; in charge of the University botanical garden
1893-1929; extraordinary professor 1895-1929. (<em>Schinz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Z. – Further material (mostly S.W. Africa, also Fl. Zambesiaca)
at B, BM, BREM, C, COI, CORD, E, FR, GB, GE, GRA, K, L, W.

page [17], undated [1895], at G. "Le conspectus aura 6 volumes et formera un ouvrage
de plus de 3000 pages", it was to contain information on 20.000 species and 80.000
synonyms. Volume 5, Monocots, to be published first in view of the lack of a recent
treatment. Number of copies to be printed to be fixed in accordance with the number of
subcriptions.
(4) Editor, Mitt. Bot. Mus. Univ. Zürich 1-128. 1893-1928.

	1928) is now the main co-author. – <em>Name changes</em> by Schinz &amp; Thellung, published

Schinz, Salomon (1734-1784), Swiss physician and botanist at Zürich; student of
Johannes Gessner; Dr. med. Leiden 1756; professor of natural sciences at the Zürich
Carolinum; practicing physician and physician to the orphanage; secretary of the Na-
turforschende Gesellschaft, Zürich 1759-1778. (<em>S. Schinz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 227 (b. 26 Jan 1734, d. 26 Mai 1784); BM 4:
1835; CSP 3: 22, 367; DU 275; HU 640; NI 1761-1762; Plesch p. 399; PR 8200-8201,
ed. 1: 9135-9136; Rehder 5: 768; SO 664, 675; Sotheby 679.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 214: 835. 1964.
Attinger, V. et al., eds., Dict. hist. biogr. Suisse 6: 22. 1932.
Bartlett, H.H., 55 rare books no. 49, 1949.
Rudio, F., Vierteljahrsschr. naturf. Ges. Zürich 41: 105-106. 1896 (biogr. sketch).
Schinz, H.R., Atlantis 3(9): 395-397. 1946 (portr., brief biogr. sketch).

10.722. <em>Anleitung zu der Pflanzenkenntniss</em> und derselben nützlichsten Anwendung. Mit

PAGE: 182
HEADING: SCHINZ, S.

hundert illuminierten Tafeln. Zürich (In Verlag des Waysenhauses) 1774. Fol. (<em>Anteil.
Pfl.-Kenntn.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1774 (p. 6: 25 Apr 1774)), p. [1]-129, chart, <em>pl. 1-46, 47a, 47b</em> (on verso of <em>47a</em>), <em>48-
	100</em>; handcol. wood cuts. <em>Copy</em>: G (p. 17-68 missing). NI (1761) notes that the wood
	cuts were originally prepared for L. Fuchs, <em>De historia stirpium</em> (Basel 1542). The old
	names were removed; new names are printed at the bottom of the plates. The book
	was printed at the Zürich orphanage and the colouring of the plates was done by the
	inmates. See also HU 640, and Sotheby 679.

10.723. Salomon Schinz, Med. Dr. <em>Primae lineae botanicae</em> ex tabulis phytographicis cl. D.
Joannis Gesneri ductae. Turici [Zürich], (apud J. Casparum Fueslinum, filium) 1775.
Fol. (<em>Prim. lin. bot.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1775, p. [i-iv], [1]-19, [20, err.], <em>pl. A-B</em> (handcol. copp.), chart (expl. pl.). <em>Copies</em>:
	BR, G, M, USDA. – German title on lower part of t.p.: Salomon Schinz, Med. Dr.
	<em>Erster Grundriss der Kräuterwissenschaft</em> aus den characteristischen Pflanzentabellen des
	Herrn D. Johannes Gessners gezeichnet. Zürich (by Johann Caspar Fuessli, Sohn)
	1775. The text and plates are based on the "tabulae phytographicae" which his son
	Christian Salomon Schinz (1764-1847) published in 1795 and 1804, see TL-2/2003.

Schiønning, Holger Ludvig (1868-1942), Danish mycologist; cand. chem. 1893; assist-
ant at the Carlsberg Laboratory; specialist in the physiology of yeasts. (<em>Schiønning</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 132, 133, 322, 347; Barnhart 3: 227 (b. 20
Aug 1868); LS 23933-23937, 38923-38925.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Christensen, C., Danske bot. Litt. 1880-1911: 193-194. 1913 (bibl.), id. 1912-
	1939: 62. 1940.
Hansen, A., Dansk bot. Ark. 21(1): 70. 1963 (d. 17 Mai 1942).

Schiøtz, Ludvig Theodor (1821-1900), Danish pharmacist and amateur botanist;
cand. pharm. 1844; high school teacher at Rödding 1851-1859; brewer at Odense 1859-
1900. (<em>Schiötz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: C (ca. 900 nos.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 227 (b. 4 Sep 1821, d. 31 Aug 1900); Chris-
tensen p. 28, 42; Christiansen p. 319; CSP 5: 471; Kleppa p. 282; Rehder 4: 344.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. 1901: 114 (d.).
Christensen, C., Danske Bot. Litt. 1880-1911: 8. 1913, Danske Bot. Hist. 1: 441, 442
	(portr.), 2: 303-304 (bibl.). 1925; Dansk biogr. Leksik. 21: 173. 1941.
E.R., Bot. Tidsskr. 23: xxxvii-xxxviii. 1900 (obit.).
Fischer-Benzon, R.J.D. <em>in</em> P. Prahl, Krit. Fl. Schlesw.-Holst. 2: 53. 1890.
Lind, J., Danish fungi herb. Rostrup 38. 1913.
Warming, E., Bot. Tidsskr. 12: 190. 1881 (bibl.).

10.724. <em>Beretning om en botanisk Reise</em>, foretaget i Sommeren 1858 i Landskabet mellem
Slesvig, Rendsborg og Ekernförde, samt paa Vesterhavs-Öerne Amrom, För og Sild. (Af
naturhist. Foren. Vidensk. Meddelelser 1860). Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1860, p. [1]-52. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted and to be cited from Meddel. naturh. For.,
	Kiöbenhavn 1860: 117-168.

Schipp, William August (1891-1967), Australian-born explorer and plant collector;
collected in N. Australia, New Guinea and Java; via San Francisco to British Honduras
1929; collected in British Honduras 1929-1935; returned to Australia because of failing
health, living ultimately in New South Wales. (<em>Schipp</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Collections from British Honduras in many herbaria, for full

PAGE: 183
HEADING: SCHISCHKIN

details see R.M. Lowden (1970). The most complete set (1934 specimens) is at F, other
large sets at BM (1498), BRH (1462), K (1166), UC (1066); other sets at A, AMES, B,
BKL, BM, E, G, GH, K, L, LCU, MICH, MO, NY, PH, S, UC, US, Z.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 227; Hortus 3: 1203; HR; Kew 4: 626; SK 8:
lxxxvi.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Lowden, R.M., Taxon 19: 831-861. 1970 (major treatment of S.'s botanical
	exploration in the Stan Creek and Toledo Districts, British Honduras; many second-
	ary references, based in part on letters at GH, F, K, MICH and UC).
Schipp, J.M., letter to R.M. Lowden Sep 1969 (returned to Australia from Honduras).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 287, 347, 384. 1935, 3: 241, 310. 1937.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schippia</em> Burret (1933).

10.725. <em>Flora of British Honduras</em>. Price list of seeds and herbarium material from William
A. Schipp. Stann Creek British Honduras Anno 1933-34. (<em>Fl. Brit. Hond.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1934 (copy at E rd 12 Nov 1934), p. [i], 1-69 (mimeogr.). <em>Copies</em>: E, G, HH, NY,
	USDA. – Some copies have various plant specimens on separate pages.

Schischkin, Boris Konstantinovich (1886-1963), Russian botanist; studied at the
medical faculty of the University of Tomsk 1906-1911, on botanical trips in East Kazak-
hstan 1912-1914; served on the Turkish front in World War I, studying the flora of
Armenia; from 1918-1924 botanist at the Herbarium of Georgia, Tiflis; from 1925-1931
professor of botany at Tomsk University; from 1931-1963 at the Botanical Museum
(later incorporated in the Komarov Botanical institute), Leningrad; from 1938-1949 as
director; professor of botany at Leningrad University 1945-1958; head of the Depart-
ment of Systematics and Plant Geography of the Komarov Botanical Institute 1945-
1963. (<em>Schischkin</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE, TK and VLA; other material BM, C, DAO, E, G, GH, M
	(lich.), NY. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Plantae orientalis exsiccatae</em> 1924-1928, 16 fasc., with A.A.
Grossheim. Set e.g. at Z.

Schkuhr, Christian (1741-1811), German (Saxonian) botanist and "Universitätsme-
chaniker" at Wittemberg. (<em>Schkuhr</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HAL, originally bequeathed to the University of Wittemberg

Heft 1-5 (contents unknown) were sent to a Leipzig bookseller by Schkuhr on 13 Dec
1789 (letter at G). The total number of copper-engravings (all by Schkuhr) is 446;
according to J. Collins (Sotheby 680) plate 287 was not published.
<em>Copies</em>: G, HH, NY, USDA. – Published in 30 parts the contents and precise dates of
	which are not known to us. The 445 plates are handcol. copp. engr. by Schkuhr.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: in 4 vols., all dated 1808, actually published 1806-1814, in 40 parts with a total of
	483 col. copper engr. by Schkuhr (1300 figures). <em>Copies</em>: G, M, MICH, PH, US; IDC
	5715. – A fifth volume, containing the cryptogams, was issued separately in two parts.
	–"Zweyte mit dem Nachtrag der Riedgräser vermehrte Auflage". Leipzig (bey
	Gerhard Fleischer dem Jüngern) 1808. Oct.

10.730. <em>Vier und zwanzigste Klasse des Linnéischen Pflanzensystems oder kryptogamische Gewächse</em>.
Erster Band mit zweyhundert und neunzehn ausgemalten Kupfertafeln enthält ausser

Welttheilen, welche noch nicht, oder zum Theil unvollkommen, auch nur in seltnen

Schläpfer, Georg (1797-1835), Swiss botanist at Trogen. (<em>Schläpfer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

1836; CSP 5: 476, 6: 754; PR 8207; Rehder 1: 433.

Schlagdenhauffen, Charles Frédéric (1830-1907), French botanist and phytoche-
mist at Strasbourg; Dr. sci. Strasbourg 1857; with the École supérieure de Strasbourg
from 1855 as assistant, associate professor of toxicology and physics, and, from 1873-
1900, regular professor of toxicology. (<em>Schlagdenhauffen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

HEADING: SCHLAGINTWEIT, A.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 228 (b. 7 Jan 1830); BM 4: 1836; TL-

10.733. <em>Contribution à l'étude du genre Coronilla</em> au point de vue botanique, chimique, physi-
ologique et thérapeutique ... Strasbourg (Imprimerie alsacienne anc. G. Fischbach)
1897. Oct. (<em>Contr. Coronilla</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: E. Reeb.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1897 (Nat. Nov. Jun(1) 1897), p. [1]-159, <em>pl. 1-37, 3bis. Copy</em>: BR.

Schlagintweit, Adolf von (1829-1857), German (Bavarian) traveller, geologist and
plant collector; brother of Robert and Hermann Alfred Rudolph von Schlagintweit-
Sakünlünski; studied at München; habil. ib. 1853 for geognostics; explorer of the
Himalaya, Karakoram, Tibet, N. India and other parts of Central Asia; killed by religi-
ous fanatics at Kashgar, Turkestan. (<em>A. Schlagintweit</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The herbarium of the brothers Schlagintweit came to B (now
mainly destroyed) (see Urban 1891). Most material collected by A. Schlagintweit is
mentioned in connection with the collections of his brothers Robert and Hermann.
Herbaria listing Adolph v. S. specifically: CAS, GOET, PH (major set), WRSL. – For
further details see under Hermann v. S.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: For biographical and bibliographical references see also under H. von Schlag-
intweit; many publications deal with the three brothers rather than with only one of
them.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADN 31: 336-347; AG 12(2): 271; Barnhart 3: 228 (b. 9
Jan 1829, d. 26 Aug 1857); Biol. Dokum. 16: 8057; BM 4: 1837; Bossert p. 353; Bret. p.
795; CSP 5: 475; DTS 1: 265; GR p. 131; Hegi 6(2): 1319; Herder p. 36; Quenstedt p.
382; Rehder 5: 769; Tucker 1: 630; Urban-Berl. p. 392.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Allibone, S.A., Crit. dict. Engl. lit. 2: 1948. 1878.
Anon., Bonplandia 6: 192. (probably killed), 298 (spent winter in Aktak), 359-360 (no
	doubt about death. 1858), 7: 51. (report from Mussoore), 115 (details about death)
	1859, 8: 249. 1860 (body and holdings found); Bot. Zeit. 11: 318-319. 1853 (habil.
	München); Bull. Soc. bot. France 6: 176. 1859 (d.); Encycl. brit. ed. 11. 24: 328.
	1911; Flora 36(1): 190. 1853 (habil. München), 42: 255. 1859 (d.); Grand Larousse
	encycl. 9: 666. 1964; Österr. bot. Z. 9: 201-202. 1859 (on his death going from
	Pundjab to Turkestan, killed (beheaded) at Kargash by fanatic "Muselmänner" i.e.
	islamics.
Bridson, G.D.R. et al., Nat. hist. mss. res. Brit. Isl. 240.92, 274.38. 1980.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 801-802. 1863.
Schlagintweit, H., S.B. k. bayer. Akad. Wiss., München 1869(1): 181-190. 1869
	(Adolph died 26 Aug 1857; details on death).
Schmidt, T.A., J. Bot. 8: 225-250. 1868 (Enum. Labiat., Scroph. coll. 1855-1857 by S.).
Urban, I., Bot. Jahrb. 14 (Beibl. 32): 29. 1891 (Schlagintweit herbarium at B, bought
	directly and through Hennings).
Wittrock, V.B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(2): 142. 1903, 3(3): 151. 1905.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schlagintweitia</em> Grisebach (1853) and <em>Schlagintweitiella</em> Ulbrich (1929) both
honor A. Schlagintweit and his brother H.A.R. von Schlagintweit-Sakünlünski (<em>q.v.</em>).

10.734. <em>Ueber die Ernährung der Pflanzen</em> mit besonderer Rücksicht auf die Bedingungen

PAGE: 188
HEADING: SCHLAGINTWEIT, A.

ihres Gedeihens in verschiedenen Höhen der Alpen ... aus den "Untersuchungen ...
Alpen ..." Leipzig (J.A. Barth) 1850. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1850, p. [1]-25. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted from H.A.R. &amp; A. Schlagintweit, Unters.
	physic. Geogr. Alpen, 1850.

Schlagintweit-Sakünlünski, Hermann Alfred Rudolph von (1826-1882), German
(Bavarian) traveller, geographer, plant collector and explorer of Northern India, the
Himalaya, Karakorum and Tibet 1854-1857. (<em>H. Schlagintweit</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The herbarum of the three Schlagintweit brothers, Adolph
(1829-1857), Hermann (see above) and Robert (1833-1885) was for the greater part
acquired by B, partly by direct acquisition, partly through P. Hennings who acquired
the remaining part of the herbarium, sold several sets to others but who also presented a
further set of 1155 nos. from India and the Himalayas to B (Urban 1891); the greater
part of these collections was destroyed in 1943. Other herbaria usually cite collections
simply as "Schlagintweit"; material is reported from BM (2050), BR, E, G, GH,
GOET, HBG, JE, L, LE, M, MO, PR, S, US, WRSL, W, WU.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 336-347; AG 12(3): 271; Biol.-Dokum. 16:
8057; BM 4: 1837; CSP 5: 475-476, 8: 861, 11: 313-314, 12: 657; DTS 1: 265; GR p. 132;
Hegi 6(2): 1319; Herder p. 36, 59, 167, 342; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, 2: (files); Jackson p. 218,
292; LS 23942-23942a; MW p. 436; PH 567; Quenstedt p. 382; Rehder 5: 769; TL-
2/3710; Tucker 1: 630; Urban-Berl. p. 392.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Allibone, S.A., Crit. dict. Engl. lit. 2: 1948. 1878.

Schlatter, Theodor (1847-1918), Swiss botanist and merchant at St. Gallen; trained as
a pharmacist at Würzburg, Basel and and Bern; head of the family firm of paints, dyes
and colonial produce. (<em>Schlatter</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Vogler, P., Verh. Schweiz. naturf. Ges. 1918: 133-135. 1919 (obit.).

HEADING: SCHLAUTER

Schlauter, [E.] August (1803-1849), German (Hannover) gardener and botanist at
Hildesheim nr. Celle; in the Hannoverian army 1824-1828; Dr. h.c. Bonn 1835; active as
gardener in the family firm at Hildesheim 1828-1836; curator of the botanical garden at
Erfurt 1836-1837, subsequently again at Hildesheim. (<em>Schlauter</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GOET.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BFM 399; Biol-Dokum. 16: 8058; BM 4: 1837; CSP 5:
476; Herder p. 316; PR 8208, ed. 1: 9143.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Koppe, F., Hercynia 3: 588-607. 1944 (Die Moosflora von Hildesheim; used
	Schlauter's coll.).
Seeland, H., Mitt. Herrn. Roemer-Mus. Hildesheim 40: 1-49. 1936 (biogr., esp. p. 4-14,
	26, 43, 44).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 148. 1982.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 210. 1982.

Schlayer, Philipp (<em>fl</em>. 1837), German (Württemberg) botanist; Dr. med. Tübingen
1837. (<em>Schlayer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

unter dem Präsidium von Hugo Mohl, ... im Juli 1837 der öffentlichen Prüfung vorlegt
(Philipp Schlayer von Nürtingen. Tübingen (gedruckt bei Gustav Bähr) 1837. Oct. (<em>Anat. porös. Zell. Sphagnum</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jul 1837, p. [1]-43. <em>Copy</em>: NY.

Schlechtendal, Diederich Franz Leonhard von (1794-1866), German (Cleve-born,
Prussian) botanist; studied medicine and natural sciences at the Friedrich-Wilhelm-
University of Berlin 1813-1819; Dr. med. ib. 1819; curator at the Royal Herbarium,
Berlin 1819-1833, from 1822 in close association with A. von Chamisso; Dr. phil. h.c.
Univ. Bonn 1823; habil. Berlin 1826, extraord. prof. of. botany 1827; successor to Kurt
Sprengel as professor of botany and director of the botanical garden of Halle university
1833-1866; editor of Linnaea 1826-1866 and co-editor with H. Mohl of the Botanische
Zeitung 1843-1866. (<em>Schlechtend</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HAL. – Several of the types of his Berlin period were at B
(mainly destroyed). – Plants from the botanical gardens of Berlin and Halle, and
material from his herbarium (but collected by others) are e.g. at CAS, E, FI, G, L, M,
MW, S, W, WAG. – Plants mentioned (erroneously) as having been collected by
Schlechtendal in Mexico, the Cape and other extra-European areas stem from his her-
barium. S. himself never travelled outside W. Europe. Schlechtendal's extensive corre-
spondence is also at HAL (see Schubert 1964 for a list of correspondents; Stafleu (1970)
for the Miquel-Schlechtendal correspondence; Bessler (1954) for the correspondence
with Chamisso). <em>Letters</em> from Schlechtendal to Miquel at U; to Irmisch (copies only) at
Sondershausen (Müllerot 1980); other letters at GH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 351-353; AG 6(1): 523-524; Ainsworth p. 247,
347; Backer p. 517, 518; Barnhart 3: 228 (b. 27 Nov 1794, d. 12 Oct 1866); BFM 15; BL
1: 137, 317; BM 4: 1837; Bossert p. 353; CSP 5: 476-481, 8: 862 (232 nos.); DTS 1: 266;

HEADING: SCHLECHTENDAL, D. F. L.

(files); Jackson p. 295, 350; Kelly p. 207; Kew 4: 628; Langman p. 679-681; Lenley p.

but especially in the Botanische Zeitung are not listed (but are often referred to in TL-

ciculus I. (c. tab. vi. aeneis, 4to). (<em>Notit. Adumbr. pl.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Mai 1825, (dated Idibus Maji a. mdcccxxv), 1 sheet (1 p.). <em>Copies</em>: HH, PH. –
	Announcement of the publication of the <em>Adumbr. pl.</em>, see below. Part 1 already pub-
	lished. – See also Schmid (1942) 3c.

10.743. <em>Adumbrationes plantarum</em> edidit D.F.L. de Schlechtendal ... Fasciculus i [-iv,
vi(= v)] 1824-1832, 5 fasc. Qu. (<em>Adumbr. pl.</em>).

<em>1</em>: Mai 1825 (p. 1: Mai 1825; Notitia Id. Mai 1825 says: already published; publ. Easter
	1825, Schl. Flora 8 (Beil. 1): 2-3. 1825, but preface Mai 1825), cover-t.p. (with above
	title), [1, h.t.], [1]-16, <em>pl. 1-6</em> (uncol. copp. C. Röthig). – h.t.: "Sectio prima. Adum-
	bratio filicum in Promontorio Bonae Spei provenientium auctore D.F.L. de Schlech-
	tendal". Often used as t.p. in copies bound without the original covers.
<em>2</em>: Jun-Dec 1825 (Linnaea Jan 1826), cover-t.p., p. 17-24, <em>pl. 7-12</em> (id.).
<em>3</em>: 1826 (Linnaea Oct-Dec 1826), cover-t.p., p. 25-32, <em>pl. 13-18</em> (id.).
<em>4</em>: 1827 (Linnaea Oct-Dec 1827), cover-t.p., p. 33-40, <em>pl. 19-24</em> (id.).
<em>5</em>: numbered "vi" on cover]: 1832, cover-t.p., p. 41-56, <em>pl. 25-30</em> (<em>id</em>.)<em>Copies</em>: FI, G, HH,
	MO, NY, PH, USDA. – See also Schmid (1942) 3c.
<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Flora 8(2), Beil. 1: 2-3. Jul-Oct 1825 (announcement;
	name artist spelled "Rötnig"); Linnaea 1(1): 118. Jan 1826 (contents 1, 2), 1(4):
	614. Oct-Dec 1826 (cont. fasc. 3), 2(4): 677. Oct-Dec 1827 (cont. fasc. 4).

10.744. <em>Linnaea</em>. Ein Journal für die Botanik in ihrem ganzen Umfange. Herausgegeben
von D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, ... Berlin ([1-2:] Bei Ferdinand Dümmler) 1826-1882,43
vols. Oct. (<em>Linnaea</em>).

<em>Editors</em>: D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, vols. 1-34, 1826-1866; Christian August Friedrich
	Garcke (1819-1904), vols. 35-43, 1867-1881.
<em>Title development</em>: 1-16 as above; 17-34 <em>Linnaea</em>. Ein Journal für die Botanik in ihrem
	ganzen Umfange ... Oder Beiträge zur Pflanzenkunde ..."; 35-43, <em>Linnaea</em>, ...
	Pflanzenkunde, Neue Folge Erster Band [-Band ix].
<em>Imprints</em>: 1-2: Berlin bei Ferdinand Dümmler.
	3-4: Berlin ... Bei Ludwig Oehmigke.
	5-8: Berlin ... Gedruckt auf Kosten des Herausgebers. In Commission bei [L.]
	Oehmigke.
	9-24: Halle ... Gedruckt auf Kosten des Herausgebers. In Commission bei C.A.
	Schwetschke und Sohn.
	25-34: Halle ... C.A. Schwetschke und Sohn (M. Bruhn in Braunschweig).
	35-36: Berlin ... Gedruckt auf Kosten des Herausgebers. In Commission bei
	Wiegandt u. Hempel in Berlin.
	37-39: Berlin ... Wiegandt, Hempel &amp; Parey in Berlin.

40-41: Berlin ... Gedruckt auf Kosten des Herausgebers.
42: Berlin ... Herausgebers. In Commission bei Wiegandt, Hempel &amp; Parey in Berlin.
43: Berlin ... Herausgebers. In Commission bei Paul Parey in Berlin.

HEADING: SCHLECHTENDAL, D. F. L.

<em>Continuation</em>: Jahrbuch des Königlichen Botanischen Gartens und des Botanischen
	Museums zu Berlin 1-5, 1881-1889. For the successors of this <em>Jahrbuch</em> see e.g. Englera
	1: 183-184 (Notizblatt, Mitteilungen, Willdenowia). <em>Linnaea</em> was never an official
	publication of the Berlin Botanical Museum, but the second series, under Garcke, had
	virtually become a Berlin journal.
<em>Ref</em>.: Foster, R., J. Arnold Arb. 43: 400-409. 1962.
	Kuntze, O., Rev. gen. pl. 3(2): 158-159. 1898.
	McVaugh, R., Taxon 5: 134-135. 1956.
	Moore, H. &amp; C. Wood, J. Arnold Arb. 46: 68-73. 1965.
	Stafleu, F.A., Wentia 16: 90-91.1966, TL-1: 419-424. 1967.
	Steenis-Krusemann, M.G. v., Fl. males, ser. I. 4(5): cxcviii-cxcix. 1954, Fl. males.
	Bull. 17: 607. 1962, 19: 1143. 1964, 20: 1275. 1965.
	Svenson, H.K., Rhodora 41: 313. 1939.
	Urban, I., Bot. Jahrb. 19: 562. 1894.

10.745. <em>Florae insulae Sti. Thomae Indiae occidentalis</em> concinnata a D.F.L. de Schlechtendal.
[Linnaea 3(3)-6(5), 1828-1831]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: in <em>Linnaea</em> as follows:
	[1] <em>in</em> 3(3): 251-276. Mai-Sep 1828.
	[2] <em>in</em> 4(1): 78-93. Jan 1829.
	[3] <em>in</em> 5(2): 177-200. Apr 1830.
	[4] <em>in</em> 5(4): 682-688. Oct 1830.
	[5] <em>in</em> 6(4): 722-736. Jul-Dec 1831.
	[6] <em>in</em> 6(5): 737-773. Jul-Dec 1831.

10.746. <em>Flora von Deutschland</em> herausgegeben von D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, ... und Dr.
Ernst Schenk, ... Jena (Druck und Verlag von Friedrich Mauke) [1840-] 1841-1873. 24
vols. (<em>Fl. Deutschl.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: 1-19 (-24?) Ernst Schenk (1796-1859), 6-19 (-24?) Christian Eduard
Langethal (1806-1878).
<em>Ed</em>. [<em>1</em>]: 24 vols., 1840-1873 in volumes published in 12 Hefte each, <em>10 pl</em>. with text per
	Heft, in all <em>2880 pl. Copies</em>: HH (1-20), M (1-18). – No complete volume seen. Our
	data are incomplete. The analysis of the HH copy is as follows:
<em>1</em>: [1840]-1841, p. [i]-xii, [xiii-xvi, prospectus], [1]-14, <em>120 pl</em>. with text (col. copp.).
<em>2</em>: [1841]-1842, p. [i]-xii, <em>120 pl</em>. id.
<em>3</em>: 1842]-1843, p. i-xii, <em>120 pl</em>. id.
<em>4</em>: 1844 (t.p.), p. [i]-xii, <em>120 pl</em>. id.
<em>5</em>: 1845 (t.p.), p. [i]-xii, <em>120 pl</em>. id.
<em>6</em>: 1846 (t.p.), p. [i]-xii, <em>120 pl</em>. id.
<em>7</em>: 1846-1847, p [i]-xii, <em>120 pl</em>. id.

	continued in other vols.

<em>20</em>: [no t.p. seen], <em>120 pl</em>. id.
<em>21-24</em>: n.v. [21(11-12) 1869; 22(2-4) 1869; 24(1-2) 1872, 24(3-4) 1873].
<em>Publication dates</em>: We refrain from listing the scanty data so far obtained. Heft 1 of vol. 1
	came out 4-10 Oct 1840 (Hinrichs).
<em>Ed. 2</em>: n.v., fide Nissen identical with <em>ed. 3.</em>
<em>Ed. 3</em>: 1845-1872, 22 vols., <em>2816 pl</em>., see separate treatment below.
<em>Ed. 4</em>: 1849-1872, 17 vols., each of 16 Lief. with 8 pl. each, <em>2176 pl</em>., n.v.

PAGE: 201
HEADING: SCHLECHTENDAL, D. F. L.

<em>Ed. 5</em>: edited by Ernst Hallier, 1880-1888, 30 vols., 236 Lief., <em>3470 pl</em>. (1-3283 + extra
	plates), see separate treatment below.
<em>Note</em>: editions 1, 2/3 and 4 came out separately but more or less parallel. Notes in <em>Bot.
	Zeitung</em> and <em>Hinrichs</em> (incomplete) give an indication of this parallelism. Our data are
	incomplete for all editions.

10.747. <em>Index seminum in horto academico halensi</em> 1838 <em>collectorum</em> [Halle 1838]. Qu. (<em>Ind. sem.
hort. hal.</em> 1838).

<em>1838</em>: publ. Dec 1838 (p. 8), p. [1]-8. <em>Copy</em>: HH.
<em>1840</em>: publ. Jan 1841 (p. 7), p. [1]-7. <em>Copy</em>: HAL.
<em>1844</em>: publ. Jan 1845 (p. [8]), p. [1]-7, [8]. <em>Copy</em>: G. – <em>Adnotationes</em> on p. [8].
<em>1845</em>: publ. Feb 1846 (p. [8]), p. [1]-7, [8]. <em>Copy</em>: G. – <em>Adnotationes</em> on p. 7-8.
<em>1846</em>: publ. Jan 1847 (p. 8), p. [1]-8. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH. – <em>Adnotationes</em> on p. 7-8.
<em>1848</em>: publ. Jan 1849 (p. 8), p. [1]-8. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH. – <em>Adnotationes</em> p. 8.
<em>1849</em>: publ. Jan 1850 (p. 8), p. [1]-8. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH. – <em>Adnotationes</em> p. 7-8.
<em>1854</em>: publ. Jan 1855 (p. 8), p. [1]-8. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH.

We have only seen a few of the seed lists of the Halle botanical garden published by von
Schlechtendal. Several of these indexes contained descriptions of new taxa. These de-
scriptions were sometimes reproduced in Linnaea or the Annales des Sciences naturelles.
So far we have seen:
<em>1839</em>: Linnaea 14 (Litt.): 126-130. 1840 [or 18411.
<em>1840</em>: Linnaea 15 (Litt.): 94-96. 1841 [or 1842].
<em>1841</em>: Linnaea 16 (Litt.): 103-105. 1842 [or 1843].
<em>1843</em>: Linnaea 18(2): 158-161. Jan 1845.
<em>1844</em>: Linnaea 18(4): 506-508. Jun 1845.
<em>1845</em>: Linnaea 19(4): 400-402. Dec 1846.
<em>1846</em>: Ann. Sci. nat. ser. 3. 7: 191-192. 1847.
<em>1848</em>: Ann. Sci. nat. ser. 3. 11: 248-251. 1849.
<em>1849</em>: Ann. Sci. nat. ser. 3. 12: 360-363. 1849.
<em>1850</em>: Ann. Sci. nat. ser. 3. 14: 342-344. Dec 1850.

10.748. <em>Hortus halensis</em> tam vivis quam siccus iconibus et descriptionibus illustratus à
D.F.L. de Schlechtendal ... Halis Saxonum [Halle] (apud C.A. Schwetschke et filium.
Impensis auctoris editum). [1841-1853]. Qu. (<em>Hort. hal.</em>).

<em>1</em>: 20-26 Jun 1841 (cover p. 2: Mai 1841; Hinrichs 20-26 Jun 1841; PAW 11 Aug 1842),
	p. [i, iii], [1]-8, <em>pl. 1-4</em> (col. copp. Schumann).
<em>2</em>: 19-25 Sep 1841 (cover p. 2: Mai 1841, same text as on cover fasc. 1; Hinrichs 19-25
	Sep 1841), p. 9-16, <em>pl. 5-8</em> (id.).
<em>3</em>: possibly 1853 (Bot. Zeit. 25 Nov 1853 rev.), p. 17-24, <em>pl. 9-12</em> (id.).
<em>4</em>: possibly never regularly issued, <em>pl. 13-16</em> are present (without text) at JE, M, PH.
<em>5</em>: 1853 (fide NI, PR), <em>pl. 17-20</em>, not seen by us.
<em>Copies</em>: B-S (1-3), FI (1-3), G (1-3), HAL (1-3), HH (1-3), LC (1-3), M (1-4), MO (1-
	3), NY (1-3), PH (fasc. 1-3 with text, fasc. 4 plates only).
We have seen no text of fasc. 4, 5 and no plates of fasc. 5. Copies may have some plates
uncoloured.
<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Bot. Zeit. 11: 836-838. 25 Nov 1853 (rev. fasc. 3).

10.749. <em>Flora von Deutschland</em> herausgegeben von D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, ... und Dr.
Ernst Schenk, ... <em>Dritte Auflage</em>. Erster Band. Mit 128 colorirten Kupfertafeln. Jena
(Druck und Verlag von Friedrich Mauke) [1843]-1845. Oct. (<em>Fl. Deutschl. ed. 3</em>).

<em>Authors, editors, artist</em>: Ernst Schenk (1796-1859) provided the plates (col. copper engr.);
	D.F.L. von Schlechtendal is listed as the senior author (in addition to Schenk) for
	vols. 1 and 2. From vol. 3, 1846 onward C.E. Langethal is listed as the second author.
	it is generally assumed (but we have no proof of this) that Schlechtendal actually
	wrote the texts for vols. 1 and 2, and little, if any, of the other volumes. Even so his
	name appears on the title pages of all volumes as senior author. The question of the
	real authorship remains unsolved.
<em>Publ</em>.: 22 volumes, each with 128 plates with text, published in Lieferungen of 8 plates
	(16 per volume, 2816 in all). According to Pritzel ed. 1 was published between 1840

PAGE: 202
HEADING: SCHLECHTENDAL, D. F. L.

	and 1873 in 24 volumes, each volume in 12 Lief. of 10 plates. It seems possible that
	the book was issued in parallel editions(e.g. ed. 3, 1(2-5) came out 7-9 Sep 1843, fide
	Hinrichs); further information lacking. <em>Copies</em>: M, NY (some volumes have less than
	128 plates; the t.p.'s, however, all call for 128 pl. We cite the composition of the NY
	copy with t.p.-dates. All plates are accompanied by text).

issued in 60 half-volumes, see below. Most of the <em>Lieferungen</em> are announced by Bot.

HEADING: SCHLECHTENDAL, D. F. L.

<em>Re-issue</em>: 1892-1898 "Jubiläums-Ausgabe" in 60 half-volumes. <em>Copy</em>: NY. – Volumes not
	dated; vol. 1 publ. Sep 1892; Register publ. Sep 1898.
<em>Re-issue</em>: Cyperaceae et Gramineae: 1899-? (30 parts), (n.v.).

Schlechtendal, Diederich Friedrich Carl von (1767-1842), German
(Kleve/Prussian) botanist; father of D.F.L. von Schlechtendal; judicial magistrate at
Kleve until 1798; "Stadtgerichtsdirector" (municipal judiciary) in Berlin 1798-1814;
subsequently in charge of the law courts at Minden, and, ultimately,
Oberlandesgerichts-Präsident at Paderborn; Dr. phil. h.c. Berlin 1838. (<em>D.F.C.
Schlechtend.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown; possibly in the herbarium of his son D.F.L. von
Schlechtendal, q.v.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 523; Barnhart 3: 228 (b. 24 Sep 1767, d. 22
Feb 1842); PR alph., 10285, ed. 1: 11264.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Flora 21: 143. 1838 (jubilee), 25: 256. 1842 (d.).
Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Linnaea 16(6): 513-522. 1842 (obit.).
Schmid, G., Chamisso als Naturforscher 18, 172. 1942.
Schubert, G., Leben Werk Schlechtendal 6-7. 1964.
Stafleu, F.A., Miquel-Schlechtendal corr., Regn. veg. 71: 297, 303. 1970.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schlechtendalia</em> Willdenow (1803, <em>nom. rej.</em>); <em>Schlechtendalia</em> K.P.J. Sprengel.
(1827).

Schlechtendal, Diederich [Dietrich] Hermann Reinhard von (1834-1916),
German (Sachsen-born) entomologist, palaeontologist and plant pathologist; son of
D.F.L. von Schlechtendal; state examiniation ordnance survey and geodesy 1868;
"Markschneider" (surveyor of mines) at Zwickau 1869-1881; from 1881 in Halle as
private scientist; assistant at the Halle mineralogical institute 1885-1913, also active as
librarian. (<em>D.H.R. Schlechtend.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown; the cecidiological herbarium was acquired by the
Royal Zoological Museum, Berlin.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 228 (d. Jul 1916); BM 4: 1837-1838; Boss-
erte p. 353; CSP 8: 862, 11: 314, 12: 657, 18: 526-527; DTS 1: 266; LS 23957; PH 364,
923; Quenstedt p.382; Rehder 5: 769-770.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Deut. biogr. Jahrb. 1: 368. 1925 (d.); Deut. entom. Zeit. 1916: 364. (d.);
	Entom. Bl. Biol. Syst. Käfer 12: 290. 1916 (d.).
Taschenberg, O., Leopoldina 52: 55-60, 62-68. 1916, 53: 62-64. 1917 (detailed obit.,
	bibl.) (also in Mitt. naturf. Ges. Halle 4: 44); Z. Naturw. 86: 321-336. 1917 (obit.,
	bibl.).
Trotter, A., Marcellia 17: viii. 1919 (d.).

10.755. <em>Beiträge zur näheren Kenntniss der Braunkohlenflora Deutschlands</em> ... Halle a.S. (Max
Niemeyer) 1897. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1897, p. [1]-28, <em>pl. 3-6</em> (uncol.). <em>Copy</em>: NY. – Reprinted and to be cited from Abh.
	naturf. Ges. Halle 21: 85-110, <em>pl. 3-6.</em> 1897.

10.756. <em>Die Gallbildungen</em> (Zoocecidien) der deutschen Gefässpflanzen. Eine Anleitung
zur Bestimmung derselben ... Zwickau (Druck und Verlag von R. Zückler) 1891. Oct.

PAGE: 205
HEADING: SCHLECHTER

10.757. <em>Thuja occidentalis thuringiaca</em> ... Stuttgart (E. Schweizerbart'sche Verlag-
shandlung (E. Naegele) 1902. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1902, cover-t.p., p. [33]-42, <em>pl. 1-3</em> (uncol., with text). – <em>Copy</em>: HH. – Reprinted
	and to be cited from Z. Naturw. 75: [33]-42. <em>pl. 1-3.</em> 1902.

Schlechter, [Friedrich Richard] Rudolf (1872-1925), German (Berlin/Prussian)
botanist, botanical explorer and orchidologist; gardener at Berlin Botanical Garden
until 1891; collected in S. Africa and Moçambique 1891-1895, 1896-1898; leader West-
African Caoutchouk exp. 1899-1900, id. New Guinea, Indonesia, New Caledonia 1900-
1903; Dr. phil. Berlin 1904 as student of Engler; to Cameroons 1904, Borneo and
Sumatra 1906; Kaiser Wilhelmsland 1907-1909, until 1910 in Indonesia; from 1913
assistant (active service in World War I 1914-1918), from 1921-1925 curator at Berlin-
Dahlem. (<em>Schlechter</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (many types and some other (e.g. alcohol) material extant); a
major set of his African collections is at K; other duplicates, p.p. including New Guinea
collections, at A, AMD, AMES (impt. set), BAF, BAJ, BG, BM, BO, BOL, BPI, BR, G,
CAL, CGE, COI, CR, DPU, E, EA, F, G, GB, GH, GRA, GRO, H, HAL, HBG, JE, K,
KMG, L, LAU, LE, LY, M, MEL, MICH, MIN, MO, NH, NY, P (4500 nos.), PH,
PR, PRE, S, SAM, SI, SRGH, STE, STU, U, UC, UPS, US, VT, W, WAG, WRSL,
Z. – Early collections made with his younger brother Max Schlechter. For itineraries
and titles of sets of duplicates distributed, see Loesener (1926). For Schlechter Orchid
types at Berlin see Butzin (1978), for those at NSW and Genève (G) see Blaxell (1973,
1978), id. at PH (Ericaceae) see Mears (1976); for other Schlechter material extant at B
see P. Hiepko (1978). – "He is said to have collected up to 100 duplicates on occasions"
(Sunn &amp; Codd, 1981). – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 502, 518; Barnhart 3: 228; Biol.-Dokum. 16:
8060-8064, BJI 1: 51, 2: 155-156; BL 1: 119, 317; BM 4: 1838, 8: 1152; Bossert p. 353;
CSP 18: 527; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 2): 130, (ed. 3): 167, (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342;
Kew 4: 628-629; KR p. 625; Langman p. 681; MW p. 437, suppl. p. 308; NI 1772-1774,
3: 60; NW p. 57; PH 241; Plesch p. 399-400; Rehder 5: 770; RS p. 140; SK 1: clii, 470-
472, 4: cxxviii, cxxxix, cxlvii, cli, 5: cccxviii, 8: lxxxvi, 86; TL-2/3565, 4239-4240, 7684,
8726, see R. Mansfeld; Tucker 1: 630-631; Zander ed. 10, p. 712, ed. 11, p. 812; Zep-
Tim p. 99-100 (b. 16 Oct 1872, d. 15 Nov 1925).

	1944 (note on destr. of his herb. at B; much original material at AMES).

Schleicher, Johann Christoph (1768-1834), German-born (Hessen-Nassau) botanist;
settled ca. 1790 in Bex, Vaud, Switzerland as owner of a firm selling living plants as well
as herbarium specimens. (<em>Schleich</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: G and LAU (major part), other material in BR, C, CGE, DBN,
E-GL, FI, G, GJO, H, H-Ach., HAL, LE, LIV, M, NEU, OXF, PH, PR, TUR.
(1) Genève (G) received in 1821 a collection <em>Plantae in Helvetia cis</em>- <em>et transalpina sponte
nascentes</em>; the Boissier herbarium distributed in 1898 Schleicher plants with labels "Reli-
quiae Herb. Schleicher à Bex, Vaud, Suisse ... communicavit Herb. Boissier 1898".
(2) Schleicher himself distributed <em>Plantae</em> [<em>Cryptogamae</em>] <em>helveticae</em>, cent. 1-5, 500 nos.,
1805-1807. Sets at BM, BPI, CAN, E, G, GOET, H, KIEL, L, LD, LIV, M, PC, S, W,
WRSL (see Sayre, 1969, for further details.
(3) Sets of <em>Salix</em> distributed by Schleicher are listed by GJO, LE and UPS (Thunberg),
but are also included in the above-mentioned holdings of various herbaria.

PAGE: 214
HEADING: SCHLEICHER

<em>Note</em>: For more detailed information on Schleicher's sets of exsiccatae and associated
	publications see Burdet &amp; Greuter (1982). The references to Haller on the labels are
	to A. von Haller, <em>Hist. stirp. Helvet.</em> 1768. These references may have nomenclatural
	importance.
<em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG(1): 143, 12(2): 96; Backer p. 518; Barnhart 3: 229
(d. 27 Aug 1834); BM 4: 1839; Clokie p. 239; Dryander 5: 70; Frank 3 (Anh.): 90; GR,
cat. p. 71; Hawksworth p. 185; Hegi 4(1): 50, 4(2): 798, 6(1): 442; Herder p. 181;
Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 2): 69, (ed. 3): 87, (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342; Jackson p. 344;
Kew 4: 129; LS 23962; NI 3: 245; PR 8221, ed. 1: 9153; Rehder 1: 433, 2: 102; Saccardo
1: 149, 2: 99; SBC p. 131; Stevenson p. 1257; TL-1/1170; Tucker 1: 631, 3: 272; Urban-
Berl. p. 272, 281, 290, 313, 393, 415; Zander ed. 10, p. 712, ed. 11, p. 812.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Beer, G. de, The sciences were never at war 73. 1960.
Burdet, H.M. &amp; W. Greuter, Candollea 37: 590-595. 1982 (distribution of exsiccatae
	and publications).
Candolle, A.P. de, Mém. souvenirs 139. 1862.
Candolle, Alph. de, Phytographie 447. 1880 (coll.).
Sayre, G., Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 19(1): 43. 1969 (on exsiccatae); Bryologist 80:
	517. 1977 (coll.).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 148. 1982.
Wilczek, E., Bull. Soc. vaud. Sci. nat. 60: 6-8, 11. 1937 (on Schleicher coll. at LAU,
	major part of orig. herb. and library acquired 1832; lichens 1837).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schleichera</em> Willdenow (1806, <em>nom. cons.</em>).

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Webbia 32(1): 37. 1977; Candollea 33: 171-172. 1978, 37: 593. 1982.

10.795. <em>Catalogus plantarum in Helvetia</em> cis- et transalpina sponte nascentium quas in cont-
inuis fere itineribus in usum botanophilorum collegit et summo studio collatione cum
celeberrimorum auctorum descriptionibus et iconibus facta, rite redegit, J.C. Schleicher.
Bex (in pago Lemano in Helvetia) [1800]. Oct. (in fours). (<em>Cat. pl. Helv.</em>).

<em>Ed</em>. [<em>1</em>]: 1800, p. [1]-76. <em>Copies</em>: G, H, HH, NY; IDC 5716. – See Burdet &amp; Greuter
	(1982) sub f.
<em>Ed</em>. [<em>2</em>]: 1807 (SY p. 31: Jan-Jun 1808), p. [i], [1]-39. <em>Copies</em>: G(2), H, HH, NY. –
	"Catalogus hucusque absolutus omnium plantarum in Helvetia cis et transalpina
	sponte nascentium. Quas continuis itineribus in usum botanophilorum collegit,
	nomine genuino destinxit ac collatione cum celebriorum auctorum descriptionibus et
	iconibus rite facta summo studio novissime redegit J.C. Schleicher. Bex, in pago
	helveto-vaudensi 1807. Oct. (in fours). – Bound with most copies: <em>Catalogus Salicum
	helvetiae</em> quas in usum botanophilorum collegit J.C. Schleicher, s.l.n.d., p. [i-ii], [1]-2.
	A simple list of names of Salix species with references to e.g. W (Willdenow), L
	(Linnaeus) and S (Schleicher).
<em>Ed. 3</em>: 1815, p. [1]-48. <em>Copies</em>: FH, FI, G(2), H, HH; IDC 5718. – "Catalogus ... [as ed.
	2] ... Bex, in pago Helveto-Vaudenst [sic]. Editio tertia emendata et auctior. 1815".
	Oct. (in fours).
<em>Ed. 4</em>: 29 Dec 1821 (see Fuchs 1965), p. [1]-64. <em>Copies</em>: BR, FH, FI, G(3), MO, NY(2),
	PH, USDA; IDC 5201. – "Catalogus ... [as ed. 2] ... Bex, in pago Helveto-Valdensi.
	Editio quarta emendata et auctior. Camberii [Chambéry], ex typis Corrin ex Routin.
	1821". Oct. (in fours). – Review: Anon., Flora 5: 464. 7 Aug 1832.
<em>Note</em>: The catalogues provide names without descriptions but with (very) abbreviated
references to earlier authors. For this reason the names in these catalogues and especi-
ally in ed. 4, may be of nomenclatural importance. For details see Fuchs 1965.
<em>Ref</em>.: Fuchs, H.P., Taxon 14: 245-246. 1965 (on ed. 4).

Schleiden, Matthias Jacob (1804-1881), German (Hamburg) botanist; Dr. jur.
Heidelberg 1827; lawyer at Hamburg; Dr. phil. Jena 1839; Dr. med. h.c. Tübingen
1843; studied botany in Göttingen and Berlin, student of Johann Horkel, collaborating
with Johannes Müller and Theodor Schwann; from 1839 in Jena, from 1840 as professor

PAGE: 215
HEADING: SCHLEIDEN

of botany, from 1851-1862 also as director of the Jena Botanical Garden; professor of
anthropology in Dorpat 1863-1864, in St. Petersburg 1864-1865; in retirement as "Priv-
atgelehrter" at Dresden, Wiesbaden and, ultimately, in Frankfurt am Main; founder of
the German school of developmental morphology; forceful proponent of inductive and
experimental research; promoted T. Schwann's "cell theory". (<em>Schleid</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: JE. – 9 vols. original drawings of plants with manuscript de-
scriptions at BM. Other drawings by Schleiden are at JE. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von
Schlechtendal at HAL; further letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 417-421; Ainsworth p. 117, 121, 315; Backer p.
518; Barnhart 3: 229 (b. 25 Apr 1804, d. 23 Jun 1881); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8069; BM 4:
1839-1840, 8: 1153; Bossert p. 353; CSP 5: 484-485; De Toni 1: cxii, 2: civ; DSB 12: 173-
176 (by M. Klein); Frank 3 (Anh.): 90-91; GR p. 132; Herder p. 476 [index]; Hortus 3:
1203; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342; Jackson p. 52, 68, 69, 70, 216, 480; KR p. 625;
Langman p. 681; LS 23964-23967a; Moebius p. 456; MW p. 437; NI 1775, 1: 204, 207;
Plesch p. 400; PR 3793, 8222-8236, 8252, 8253, 10324, 10325, ed. 1: 4160, 9154-9166,
9179, 11294-11295; Quenstedt p. 382-383; Ratzeburg p. 461-462; Rehder 5: 770; SO
2745a; TL-2/598, 3517, 3976, 6605, 6679, see E. Hallier, K.L.T. Liebe, L. Radlkofer;
Tucker 1: 631, 3: 272.

Schlich, Wilhelm [Philipp Daniel], [later: Sir William Schlich], (1840-1925),
German-born (Hessen) British forester; Dr. phil. Giessen 1867 (thesis submitted 1866;
degree awarded 1867); in the Indian Forest Service, Burma 1867-1870; id. Sind 1870-
1872; conservator of forests Bengal 1872-1878; on furlough 1878-1880; conservator of
forests Punjab 1880-1881; Inspector-general of forests 1881-1883 (deputy), 1883-1885; at
Royal Indian Engineering College, Coopers Hill, head of Forestry Dept. 1885-1906; id.
at Oxford 1906-1911; professor of forestry Oxford 1911-1919. (<em>Schlich</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: OXF; other material at E.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 229; BB p. 270; BM 4: 1840; Clokie p. 239;
CSP 18: 529; Desmond p. 545 (b. 25 Feb 1840, d. 28 Sep 1925; Dr. phil. 1867); DNB
1922-1930: 751-752; Jackson p. 380, 389, 390; Morren ed. 10, p. 144; Rehder 5: 770;
Tucker 1: 533, 631.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Ann., Gard. Chron. 1925(2): 298 (obit.), 1929(2): 396 (memorials).
Anon., Indian Forester 15(2): 45-51. 1889, 51(12): 625-632. 1925 (obit., portr.); J. Bot.
	67: 192. 1929 (bronze portrait plaque); Who's who [Gr. Britain] 1899-1926; Who was
	Who [Gr. Britain] 1916-1928: 937. 1929.
Buckland, C.E., Dict. Indian biogr. 377. 1906.
Burkill, I.H., Chapt. hist. bot. India 243 [index]. 1965.
Druce, G.G., Bot. Soc. Exch. Club Brit. Isl., Rep. 7(5): 857. 1926 (obit.).
D.P., Proc. R. Soc. London 101: vi-xi. 1927 (obit.); thesis submitted 1866; degree awar-
	ded 1867).
Hosmer, R.S., Empire For. J. 4(2): 161-167. 1925 (an American appreciation).
Mammen, E. et al., Indian For. 91: 77-82, <em>pl. 1-4.</em> 1965 (pioneer of Indian scientific
	forestry).
Robinson, R.L., Empire For. J. 4(2): 162-165. 1925 (work in England).

Schlickum, Julius (1804-1884), German (Prussian) pharmacist and botanist at Win-
ningen a.d. Mösel. (<em>J. Schlickum</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material at AMD, BR, MW and OXF.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: August Schlickum (b. 7 Aug 1867), son of Julius Schlickum and also pharmacist
from Winningen, obtained a degree Dr. phil. Marburg 1895, on a dissertation <em>Mor-
phologischer und anatomischer Vergleich der Kotyledonen und ersten Laubblätter der Keimpflanzen der
Monokotylen</em>, p. [i-ii], [1]-80, [1]. Marburg 1895, subsequently published as Bibl. bot. 35,
1896. Herbarium material attributed to A. Schlickum was at B. (AG 12(1): 198).

Schlickum, Oscar (1838-1889), German (Prussian) pharmacist and botanist; son of
Julius Schlickum; studied pharmacy with his father in Winningen, pharm. assistant in
Neuwied 1861-1863; State examination pharm. Bonn 1865; from 1866 in charge of the
Winningen pharmacy. (<em>O. Schlickum</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schlieben, Hans-Joachim Eberhardt (1902-1975), German (Saxonian) botanist and
plant collector; studied horticulture at Geisenheim a. Rhein; collected for Berlin-Dahlem
in Tanganyika Territory (Tanzania) 1930-1935; in Germany until 1955 (part of the
time at the Forestry Institute, Hamburg/Reinbek); emigrated to South Africa 1955;
technical officer at the National Herbarium of South Africa 1956-1973; died in
Germany. (<em>Schlieben</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (pteridophytes and many duplicates of the Tanzanian coll.
1930-1935 still extant), duplicates Tanzania at A, BM, BR, EA, F, G, HBG, K (large
set), LISC, M, MA, MAD, MO, NY, P (4000), PRE, S, SRGH, US, Z. – Main set of
South African and Madagascar collections in PRE; duplicates in B.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 229; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8078; IH 1 (ed. 6):
364, (ed. 7): 342, 2: (files).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Forum bot. 13: 72. 1975 (d).
Gunn, M. &amp; L.E. Codd, Bot. Expl. S. Afr. 316. 1981 (Itin. S. Afr., coll., portr.).
Hiepko, P., Willdenowia 8(2): 393. 1978 (much material extant at B).
Leeuwenberg, A.J.M., Webbia 19: 862. 1965 (dupl. coll. in many herbaria; 4000 in P).
Leistner, O.A., Bothalia 12(1): 133-135. 1970 (biogr., itin., coll., portr., b. 26 Mai 1902,
	d. 14 Jul 1975).; S. Afr. Orchid J. 11(4): 107-109. 1980.
Mendes, E.J. &amp; J. Balsas, Bol. Soc. Brot. 53(2): 1223-1231. 1981 (type specim. LISC).
Mildbraed, J., ed., Notizbl. Berlin-Dahlem 11-15, 1931-1942 (14 papers "Neue und
	seltene Arten aus dem südlichen Ostafrika ... leg. HJ. Schlieben"; various authors).
Pilger, R., Mitt. Bot. Gart. Mus. Berlin-Dahlem 1(1): 19. 1953 (duplicates Tanzania
	extant).
Schoser, G., Palmengarten 39(3): 85. 1975.

Schüz, E., Jahresh. Ges. Naturk. Württemberg 131: 199-203. 1976 (obit., portr.).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 89, 171, 264. 1935, 2: 83, 142, 288, 276. 1936, 3: 112,
	118, 119, 121, 241, 4: 87, 186, 565. 1938, 5: 301, 516. 1939.

10.819. <em>Deutsch Ost-Afrika</em> einmal ganz anders. Eine fünfjährige Forschungsreise.

<em>Publ</em>.: 1941, p. [i-ii], frontisp., [iii-iv], [1]-436, 2 maps, <em>48 pl. Copy</em>: LC.

Schliephacke, Karl (1834-1913), German (Saxonian) botanist (bryologist); studied
pharmacy in the Löwenapotheke in Halle, associated with K. Müller hal.; founded
various factories in the brown coal and mineral oil industry in Saxony; from 1873-1898
industrialist at Waldau nr Osterfeld (Thüringen); in retirement at Naumburg a.d. Saale
and Blasewitz nr Dresden. (<em>Schlieph</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: JE; further material at BP, BR, E, F, GOET, H, L, MANCH,
MW, NY, S, W, WRSL. – 49 letters to V. Brotherus in Helsinki Univ. Libr.; other
letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 229 (b. 2 Aug 1834, d. 3 Jun 1913); Biol.-
Dokum. 16: 8080; CSP 5: 487, 8: 863, 18: 530; DTS 1: 267; GR p. 132; Herder p. 266;
IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342; LS 23973; Morren ed. 10, p. 17; SBC p. 131; Urban-Berl.
p. 313.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Meyer, F.K. &amp; H. Manitz, Reichtümer u. Raritäten, Jenaer Reden und Schrif-
	ten 1974: 92 (orig. herb. at JE; contains much material from K. Müll. hal.).
Röll, J., Mitt. thür. bot. Ver. ser. 2. 31: 1-5. 1914 (Meine Erinnerungen an ...).
Sayre, G., Bryologist 80: 517. 1977 (coll.).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 148. 1982.

HEADING: SCHLIEPHACKE

10.820. <em>Beiträge zur Kenntniss der Sphagna</em> ... (Aus den Verhandlungen d. k.k. zoologisch-
botanischen Gesellschaft in Wien [Jahrgang 1865] besonders abgedruckt) [1865]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1865 (submitted 7 Jun 1865; journal volume preface Dec 1865), p. [1]-32. <em>Copy</em>: B.
	– Reprinted and to be cited from Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 15 (Abh.): 383-414.
	1865. – The copy at B may be a preprint; the journal issue was first mentioned by
	Hedwigia in Apr 1866; all other references seen by us mention the volume after Apr
	1866. – "Ce travail abonde tellement en subtiles observations et en remarques crit-
	iques, qu'il mérite d'être étudié par tout bryologue (A. Geheeb, Rev. bryol. 5: 15.
	1878), see also J. Röll, Irmischia 3: 17-32. s.d.

10.821. <em>Ueber das Genus Andreaea</em> Ehrh. ... (Aus den Verhandlungen d. k.k. zoologisch-
botanischen Gesellschaft in Wien ... besonders abgedruckt). [1865]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1865 (mss. submitted 7 Jun 1865) p. [1]-6. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted and to be cited
	from Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 15(Abh.): 423-428. 1865.

10.822. <em>Die Torfmoose der Thüringischen Flora</em> ... Separatabdruck aus "Irmischia,"
botanische Monatschrift [1882].

Schlim, Louis Joseph (<em>fl</em>. 1845), Belgian plant collector; half brother of J.J. Linden;
collected in South and Central America 1841-1852. (<em>Schlim</em>).

Schlosser, Ritter von Klekovski, Joseph Calasenz (1808-1882) Moravian-born
Austrian physician and botanist; Dr. med. Torino 1836; external practicing physician
with the Vienna general hospital 1836; private physician in Slavonia and Croatia 1836-
1838; "Badearzt" in the Kurort Teplitz 1838-1844; regional physician of the Kreutzer
Komitat 1844-1854; governmental physician of the Agram [Zagreb] Komitat 1854-
1861; from 1861-1864 again at Kreutz; regional medical supervisor (Landes-
Protomedikus) for Croatia and Slavonia 1864; ennobled 1867. (<em>Schloss</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (extant); further material at BP, CGE, E, GOET, MW, ZA. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 127, 5(2): 189; Barnhart 3: 230 (b. 25 Jan
1808, d. 27 Apr 1882); BM 4: 1841; Bossert p. 353; CSP 5: 494, 12: 658; Futak-Domin p.
526; Hegi 4(1): 263, 5(2): 1364; Herder p. 193; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 265; Kanitz
p. 129, 130 (no. 185); Klásterský p. 165; PR 8239-8242, 10635, ed. 1: 9170; Rehder 1:
447; TL-2/6306; WU 30: 142-143.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 11: 34. 1882 (d.); Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 215:

	to his co-author.
<em>Ref</em>.: Kanitz, A., Flora 52: 317-318. 10 Jul 1869 (rev.).

Schlotheim, Ernst Friedrich [Freiherr, baron] von (1764-1832), German (Thürin-
gian) magistrate, palaeontologist and geologist; educated at the Gotha gymnasium
1779-1781; studied public administration and natural sciences at Göttingen and geology
at the Freiberg (Saxony) mining academy; entered the Gotha civil service 1793 as
"Beisitzer" (assessor), "dirigierender Rat" (1805), Präsident des Kammercollegiums
(1817) and Oberhofmarschall (1828); pioneer palaeobotanist. (<em>Schloth</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Palaeobotanical collections in the Museum für Naturkunde,
Bereich Paläontologisches Museum, Humboldt Universität, Berlin, D.D.R. (Storch
1981). Dr. Storch informed us that by October 1981, 60% of the Schlotheim collection
had been retrieved. – See also Syst. Verz. Petref.-Samml., Gotha 1832, below.

PAGE: 227
HEADING: SCHLOTHEIM

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 550-551 (C.W. v. Gümbel); Andrews op. 327-
328; Barnhart 3: 230 (b. 2 Apr 1764, d. 28 Mar 1832); BM 4: 1841, 8: 1154; Bossert p.
353; CSP 5: 495; DSB 12: 182-183 (B. von Freyberg); Frank 3 (Anh.): 91; Herder p.

10.828. <em>Beschreibung merkwürdiger Kräuter-Abdrücke</em> und Pflanzen-Versteinerungen. Ein

10.829. <em>Die Petrefactenkunde</em> auf ihrem jetzigem Standpunkte durch die Beschreibung
seiner Sammlung versteinerter und fossiler Überreste des Thier- und Pflanzenreichs der
Vorwelt erläutert ... Gotha (in der Becker'schen Buchhandlung) 1820. Oct. (<em>Petrefactenkunde</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1820, p. [i]-lxii, [lxiii], [1]-437, <em>pl. 15-29</em> (uncol. copp. Theod. Goetz). <em>Copies</em>: BR,

PAGE: 228
HEADING: SCHLOTHEIM

	NY, Teyler, U. – Article 13.1 (1) (ICBN 1978): starting point date for the nom-
	enclature of fossil plants, "all groups, 31 Dec 1820 (Sternberg, <em>Flora der Vorwelt,
	Versuch</em> 1: 1-24, <em>t. 1-13</em>). Schlotheim, <em>Petrefactenkunde</em>, 1820, is regarded as published
	before 31 Dec 1820." The Sydney Botanical Congress (1981) postponed, for further
	consideration, a proposal by Storch (1981) to change this to 1 Jan 1820 thus including
	the <em>Petrefactenkunde</em> among the literature to be taken into account for the nom-
	enclature of fossil plants. The <em>Petrefactenkunde</em> provides no generic descriptions. The
	numbering of the <em>plates</em> (<em>15-29</em>) continues that of the <em>Beschr. Kräuter-Abdr.</em> (1804). –
	The BR and Teyler copies have a page [438], instructions to binder which accom-
	panied a cancel leaf for p. 43/44.
<em>Separate issue of plates</em>: 1820, cover-t.p., <em>pl. 15-29</em> (id.). <em>Copy</em>: PH. – <em>xv Kupfertafeln z. B. von
	Schlotheims Petrefaktenkunde</em> ... Gotha (id.) 1820.
<em>Nachträge</em>: 1822, p. [i]-xi, [xii, cont.], [1]-100, <em>pl. 1-21</em> (id.). <em>Copies</em>: BR, NY, PH, Teyler,
	USGS. – Counts for nomenclatural purposes. – "<em>Nachträge zur Petrefactenkunde</em> ..."
	Gotha (in der Becker'schen Buchhandlung) 1822. Oct.
<em>Nachträge 2</em>: 1823, p. [i-iii], [1]-114, <em>pl. 22-37</em> (id.). <em>Copies</em>: BR, NY, PH, Teyler, USGS. –
	Counts for nomenclatural purposes. – "<em>Nachträge</em> ... Zweyte Abtheilung ..." Gotha
	(id.) 1823. Oct.
<em>Separate issue of the plates</em>: 1822-1823, cover-t.p., <em>pl. 1-21</em>, cover-t.p., <em>pl. 22-37. Copy</em>: PH. –
"... <em>Kupfertafeln zu ... Schlotheim's Nachträgen zur Petrefaktenkunde</em>". Gotha (id.).
<em>Re-issue of the plates</em>: see below, <em>Merkw. Versteinerung.</em> (1832).

10.830. <em>Merkwürdige Versteinerungen</em> aus der Petrefactenksammlung des verstorben wirkli-
chen Geh. Raths Freiherrn v. Schlotheim ... Gotha (Becker'sche Buchhandlung) 1832.

<em>Publ</em>.: 1832, p. [i*-ii*], [i]-viii, [1]-80. <em>Copy</em>: NY.

Schlotterbeck, Julius Otto (1865-1917), American botanist and pharmacist; Dr. phil.
Bern 1896; lecturer at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich. 1888-1897; asst.
professor of pharmacognosy 1897-1904; prof. of pharmacognosy and botany 1904-1917
and dean of the College of Pharmacy ib. 1905-1917. (<em>Schlotterbeck</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 230 (b. 1 Sep 1865, d. 1 Jun 1917); BM 4:
1841; Rehder 1: 121, 2: 440.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., First cent. Philad. Coll. Pharmacy 214, 220. 1922 (portr.); Science ser.
	2. 46: 34. 1917 (d.); Who's who in America 1903-1905: 1305-1306, 7: 1845-1846.
	1912-1913, 8: 2067. 1914-1915, 9: 2171. 1916-1917, 10: 2396. 1918-1919; Who was
	who Amer. 1: 1088. 1968.
Stearns, F. &amp; Company, Amer. J. Pharm. 89: 336-338. 1917 (obit.).

10.832. <em>Beiträge zur Entwicklungsgeschichte pharmakognostisch wichtiger Samen</em>. Inaugural-
Dissertation zur Erlangung der Doktorwürde vorgelegt der hohen philosophischen
Fakultät der Universität Bern ... Bern (Buchdruckerei Neukomm &amp; Zimmermann)
1896. Oct. (<em>Beitr. Entw.</em>-<em>Gesch. pharmakogn. Samen</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1896 (imprimatur Univ. 28 Jul 1896; Nat. Nov. Aug(2) 1897), p. [1]-56, <em>pl. 1-5</em>
	(uncol. liths. auct.). <em>Copies</em>: G, NY.

PAGE: 229
HEADING: SCHLUMBACH

Schlotthauber, August Friedrich (x-1872), German botanist, zoologist and high
school teacher in Hamburg, later in Göttingen; Dr. phil. h.c. Jena 1860. (<em>Schlotthauber</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Offered a herbarium of 15.000 nos. for sale in 1860
(Bonplandia 8: 188. 1860). – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal in HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 230; PR 5: 771.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Göttingen Zeit. 12 Nov 1872 (d. 10 Nov 1872); Österr. bot. Z. 10: 335.
	1860 (Dr. phil. h.c. Jena).
Meinhardt, G., Göttinger Originale, ed. 4, 1982, p. 111-113 (with portr. drawing).
Schlotthauber, A.F., Bonplandia 8: 188. 1860 (offers his herbarium of 15.000 specimens
	and other collections for sale).
Wagenitz, G., <em>in</em> Litt. 29. Sep 1981 (ca. 1844 in Hamburg; at least from 1857 in
	Göttingen).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Published e.g. (see CSP 5: 495) <em>Enumeratio diagnostica et descriptiva Utricularinarum et
Droseracearum</em>, quas Ludovicus Preiss, ... in Novae Hollandiae ... "Terra Leaenae" ...
reportavit ..." Bonplandia 4: 102-117. 1 Apr 1856.

&amp;c. enthaltener, naturwissenschaftlichen Thesen und Hypothesen zur Rechtfertigung
des, in meinem 11. Excurse ausgesprochenen, Vorwurfs der Trüglichkeit menschlicher

Schlümbach, Friedrich Alexander von (<em>fl</em>. 1809-1811), German (Bavarian) forestry
botanist at Nürnberg. (<em>Schlümbach</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: A "xylotheka" consisting of 158 boxes with wood and bark
samples as well as dried specimens of branches, leaves and fruits, is at the Museum 't
Coopmanshûs, Franeker, the Netherlands; this wood collection was assembled by von
Schlümbach and bought by Louis Napoleon [with Dutch funds] for the then Frisian
University at Franeker.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 1841; Herder p. 294; NI 1778; PR 8246; Rehder
3: 289; Tucker 1: 631.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Het botanisch kabinet, prospectus exhibit 7 Jul-4 Oct 1980, Museum 't
	Coopmanshûs, Franeker, 1981 (brief description with sample illustration of
xylotheca).

10.835. Friedrich Alexander von Schlümbach, ... <em>Abbildung der hauptsächlichsten in</em>- <em>und
ausländischen Nadelbäume</em> welche besonders in dem Königreich Baiern wild gefunden wer-
den; nebst den sich am häufigsten dabey aufhaltenden schädlichsten Insekten; mit
Anzeige der Zweckmässigsten Vorbauungs- und Ausrottungs-Mittel der Insekten; dann
mit einigen Fragen und mit einer Anleitung zu amtlichen Berichten nach dem baieris-
chen Geschäftsgang; ingleichen mit einer Holzsaamen-Preisstabelle. Erster [Zweyter]
Theil, ... Nürnberg (zu finden bey dem Verfasser) 1810-1811, 2 parts. Qu. (<em>Abbild.
ausländ. Nadelbäume</em>).

Schmalhausen, Johannes Theodor [Ivan Fedorovich Schmal'hausen,
Shmargauzen] (1849-1894), Russian aktuo- and palaeobotanist; studied at the Univers-
ity of St.-Petersburg ("Magister" 1874); studied with Heer and A. de Bary; Dr. phil.
and habil. St. Petersburg 1877; from 1876-1879 curator at the botanical garden ib.;
professor of botany at the University and director of the Botanical Garden of Kiew
1879-1894; member of the International Commission of botanical Nomenclature 1892-
1894. (<em>Schmalh</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: KW; further material at LE. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 867-868; Andrews p. 328; Barnhart 3: 230 (b.
3/15 Apr 1849, d. 7/9 Apr 1894); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8097; BJI 1: 51-52; BM 4: 1842;
Bossert p. 353; CSP 18: 534-535; Herder p. 121, 162, 352; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 6):
364, (ed. 7): 342; Jackson p. 87, 190; Morren ed. 10, p. 98; Quenstedt p. 384; Rehder 5:
771; TL-2/see E. Regel; TR 1243-1248*; Tucker 1: 631; Zander ed. 10, p. 712, ed. 11,
p. 812.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Andrews, H.N., The fossil hunters 364-365. 1980.
