Schmalz, Eduard (1801-1871), German (Saxonian) botanist and surgeon, practicing
in Königsbrück 1824-1827; Dr. med. Leipzig 1827; practicing at Leipzig from 1827;
ultimately physician for the poor in Dresden. (<em>Schmalz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Bought by G.L. Rabenhorst, q.v. Contains e.g. lichens from
Leipzig and Königsbrück, mostly checked by E. Fries (see GR p. 132). – A mss volume
with 140 drawings by Schmalz (mostly watercolours of higher fungi) is [was?] at the
Sächsiche Landesbibliothek, Dresden (<em>Tabulae fungos praesertirn carnosos Saxoniae</em>, ...)
(<em>Pieschel 1929</em>).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8098; BM 4: 1842; CSP 5: 496; GR p.
132; Herder p. 188; Krempelh. 1: 484; LS 23997-23999; PR 8247-8248, ed. 1: 9174-
9175; Rehder 1: 377.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Flora 6(2) Beil. 2: 53-64. 1823 (dupl. coll.).
Pieschel, E., S.B. Isis, Dresden 1927-1928: 56-64. 1929 (mss. ills.).
Schade, A., Nat. lusat. 5: 29. 1961.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Not to be confused with the Saxonian agriculturist Friedrich Schmalz (b. 25 Jan
1781, d. 15 Mai 1847) author of a <em>Theorie des Pflanzenbaus</em> (1840, publ. 7-13 Jun 1840,
Hinrichs) and an <em>Anleitung zur Kenntniss und Anwendung eines neuen Ackerbausystems</em> (1842).

10.842. <em>Dispositio synoptica generum plantarum</em> circa Dresdam et sponte crescentium et in
agris frequentius cultarum, adjectis familiis naturalibus, ... Tabellarische Uebersicht
der Gattungen von den um Dresden wildwachsenden und auf Aeckern gebauten
Pflanzen, nebst den natürlichen Familien, ... Als Anhang zu Dr. H.D.A. Ficinus Flora

PAGE: 232
HEADING: SCHMALZ

von Dresden. Dresden (In der Arnoldischen Buchhandlung) 1822. Fol. (<em>Disp. syn. gen.
pl.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1822 (p. 3: 18 Mai 1821, date of preface by H.D.A. Ficinus), p. [1]-37. <em>Copies</em>: B-S,
	FI, G. – For H.D.A. Ficinus, <em>Fl. Dresden</em> see TL-2/1768. Schmalz in his "Vorrede" to
	the <em>Dispositio</em> on p. 3 refers to Ficinus as residing in Königsbrück (nr. Dresden); he
	was born in Lommatzsch (Saxony) on 18 Mai 1801 (PR). – See also his <em>Kryptogamische
	Beiträge zur Flora der Gegend um Dresden</em>, Flora 6: 566-573. 1823.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Flora 5(2), Beil. 2: 24-30. Jul-Dec 1822.

10.843. <em>Prospectus. Fungorum species</em> novis iconibus novisque descriptionibus illustratae.
Pars i. Fungi carnosi. Cum pluribus mycologis editurus est Eduardus Schmalz ... ac-
cedunt tabulae ii coloratae s.l.n.d. [1827]. Qu. (<em>Prosp., Fung. sp.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1827 (see German version below), p. [1]-7, <em>2 pl</em>. (col. copp. auct.). <em>Copies</em>: G(2).
<em>German translation</em>: Flora 10(2), Beil. 1: 1-15. Jul-Sep 1827, dated 1 Mai 1827 on p. 15;
	accompanied by one of the two plates, that of <em>Fistulina hepatica</em>. Subscription reques-
	ted; general plan; Hefte of 25 plates each, with text, foreseen [but not published].
<em>Reissue</em>: 1829, p. [i], [1]-7, <em>2 pl</em>. (as above). <em>Copy</em>: FH. – "<em>Commentalo botanica</em> sistens
	descriptionem Fistulinae hepaticae Bull, et Agarici volemi Fr. auctore Eduardo
Schmalz ... Lipsiae 1829". Qu.
<em>Note</em>: other mycological papers by Schmalz: "<em>Cryptogamische Beiträge</em> zur Flora der
	Gegend um Dresden", Flora 6: 566-576. 1823, and "<em>Nachricht wegen Abbildungen fleisch-
	iger Pilze</em>", Bot. Zeit. 13: 22. 1855.

Schmeil, [Franz] Otto (1860-1943), German (Saxonian) botanist; high school teacher
at Zörbig, Halle, Magdeburg, Marburg, Wiesbaden and, from 1893, in Heidelberg;
reformer of the German high school biology curricula. (<em>Schmeil</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 230 (b. 3 Feb 1860); BFM no. 16, 17; Biol.-
Dokum. 16: 8101; BM 4: 1843; Collander p. 481; CSP 12: 535-536; KR p. 625; LS
38943.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: K.R., Frankfurter Allg. Zeit. 3 Feb 1960 (O.S. – Reformer des
	Biologieunterrichts).
Oberschelp, R., Gesamtverz. deut. Schriftt. 114: 511-519. 1980.
Schmeil, O., Leben und Werk eines Biologen, Heidelberg 1954, 253 p. (autobiogr.,
	edited, with "Lebenswerk", by A. Seybold).
Schmid, B. &amp; C. Thesing, Biol.-Kalend. 1: 305-306. 1914.
Seybold, A., <em>in</em> O. Schmeil, Leben und Werk eines Biologen 230-253. 1954 (evaluation).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 1: 10. 1935.
Zischka, G.A., Allg. Gelehrt.-Lex. 579. 1961.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: In addition to the <em>Fl. Deutschl.</em> Schmeil published a highly successful <em>Lehrbuch der
Botanik</em> (ed. 1, 1903; ed. 56, by A. Seybold, 1958 (translated e.g. into Dutch and
Italian); (with J. Fitschen) <em>Pflanzen der Heimat</em> (ed. 1, 1896; ed. 2, 1913, ed. 6, 1937); a
<em>Leitfaden der Botanik</em> (ed. 1, 1903; ed. 81, 1918; ed. 173 (sic) by Wilhelm J. Fischer, 1951);
(with J. Fitschen) <em>Die verbreitesten Pflanzen Deutschlands</em> (ed. 1, 1911; ed. 36, 1938) and
several botany books for high schools and a series of <em>Botanische Wandtafeln</em>.

10.844. <em>Flora von Deutschland</em>. Ein Hilfsbuch zum Bestimmen der zwischen den deutschen
Meeren und den Alpen wildwachsenden und angebauten Pflanzen ... Stuttgart (Verlag
von E. Nägele) 1904. Oct. (<em>Fl. Deutschl.</em>).

Schmid, [Ludwig] Bernhard [Ehregott] (1788-1857), German (Thüringian) mis-
sionary and botanical explorer; nephew of J.K. Zenker (Jena); studied theology at Jena
1807-1810; private teacher at Aachen, Hamburg and Paris 1810-1817; to Madras 1817-
1819; in the Nilgiri Hills 1819-1837. (<em>B. Schmid</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: JE; other material at B (partially extant), GOET, K, L, MW
(700), W ("Plantae nilagiricae"). – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(1): 8; Backer p. 518; Barnhart 3: 231 (b. 20 Mar
1788); BM 4: 1843; Desmond p. 545; PR 10468, ed. 1: 11426; TL-1/1445; Urban-Berl.
p. 313, 322.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot, Zeit. 5: 264. 1847 (plants sent to Zenker at Jena; used by him for
	<em>Pl. indic.</em>, material still at Jena).
Burkill, I.H., Chapt. hist. bot. India 18, 42, 53, 54, 55, 71, 89, 109. 1965.
Chemnitius, F., Die Botaniker an der Universität Jena 16-17. 1930 (donated herbarium
	to JE).
Jackson, B.D., Bull. misc. Inf. Kew 1901: 58 (942 specimens "Herb." at K).
Lindemann, E. v., Bull. Soc. Imp. Natural. Moscou 61: 67. 1886 (biogr. details; 600 sp.
	at MW).
Stewart, R.R., Taxon 31(1): 58. 1982.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: <em>A list of plants gathered on the Neilgherries</em>, particularly in the environs of
Ootacamund, <em>in</em> R. Baikie, <em>Observations on the Neilgherries</em>, Calcutta 1834, p. 129-136.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schmidia</em> R. Wight (1852).

Schmid, [Schmid-Gams] Emil (1891-x), German (Württemberg) botanist; Dr. phil.
Zürich 1923; curator at the Botanical Museum, Univ. Zürich; professor of botany at the
University of Zürich 1936-1961. (<em>Em. Schmid</em>).

Schmid, Ernst Ehrhard Friedrich Wilhelm (1815-1885), German (Thüringian),
meteorologist, mineralogist and naturalist, Dr. phil. Jena 1839; from 1840-1843 lecturer

PAGE: 236
HEADING: SCHMID, E. E.

("Privatdocent") at the University of Jena; from 1843 extraordinary professor of natural
history; from 1854 titular professor, from 1856 regular professor id.; also, from 1856
director of the Mineralogical Museum, Jena. (<em>E.E. Schmid</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schmid, Günther (1888-1949), German (Braunschweig) botanist and historian of biol-
ogy; Dr. phil. Jena 1912; assistant at the botanical Institute, Univ. Jena 1909-1913; on
active service 1913-1919; first assistant at the Botanical Institute of the University of
Halle a.S. 1920-1935; habil. Halle 1921; Privatdozent ib. 1921-1928; extraord. professor
1928-1935; from 1935-1946 active as historian of science; ordinary professor for the
history of sciences, Halle 1946-1949. (<em>G. Schmid</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown; Schmid's library, and manuscripts are at HAL. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Hirsch p. 264.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Bohacek, K.A. &amp; F. Schirmer, Bibliographie der Veröffentlichungen von Prof.
	Dr. Günther Schmid. Halle, 12 Aug 1948, unpaginated (almost complete biblio-
	graphy: Schmid died 17 Jul 1949; introduction by R. Zaunick).
Chlond, A., Unidentified reprint at B, "Umschau aus und über Bibliotheken", p. 284-
	285 (note on acquisition of Schmid's library and manuscripts in HAL).
Gittner, H., Pharm. Zeit. 85: 439-440. 1949 (obit., portr.).
M., Liberal-demokratische Zeitung, Halle, 30 Jul 1949 (a visit with G. Schmid).

Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 616 [index]. 1940.
Zaunick, R., Pharmaz. Zentralh. Deutschl. 88: 369-370. 1949 (obit.).

<sm>THESIS</sm>: <em>Beiträge zur Ökologie der insektivoren Pflanzen</em>, Flora ser. 2. 4(3): 335-383. <em>pl. 12-13.</em>
1912.

Schmidel, [Schmiedel] Casimir Christoph (1718-1792), German (Bavarian) physi-
cian and naturalist; Dr. med. Jena 1742; professor of medicine and pharmacology at the
University of Bayreuth/Erlangen 1743-1763; physician to Margrave Carl Alexander in
Ansbach 1763; Dr. med. h.c. Erlangen 1783. (<em>Schmidel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M (in herb. Schreber), further material in G and LINN.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: The correct orthography is probably Schmiedel (latinized Schmidelius); we have
retained Schmidel because it seems to be generally current in botanical nomenclature.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 700 (W. Hess); Ainsworth p. 115, 311, 347;
Backer p. 518; Barnhart 3: 231 (b. 21 Nov 1718, d. 18 Dec 1792); Blunt p. 167; BM 4:
1844, 8: 1154; Dawson p. 736; De Toni 1: cxii; Dryander 3: 69, 81, 91, 255, 340, 341,
342, 386; DSB 12: 185 (by A. Geus; bibl.); DU 276; GF p. 75; GR p. 133; Herder p. 22,
59, 121, 148, 261, 266, 319; Hortus 3: 1203; HU 576; Jackson p. 113; Lasègue p. 66,
335, 528; LS 24003-24004; Moebius p. 116; NI 1780; see also index p. 314 and 3: 60;
Plesch p. 400; PR 3296, 8255-8261, ed. 1: 3607, 9183-9196; Quenstedt p. 384; Rehder 1:
291, 5: 771; Saccardo 2: 99; SBC p. 131; Sotheby 682, 683; TL-1/1171a; TL-2/934,

The names in the capitalized headings are generic.
The dates given by Fuchs (in Nissen) and by Casper differ in details. – 75 hand coloured
engravings after drawings by N. Gabler, J.C. Keller, and V. Bischoff.

For full details see the treatment by Casper (1967) and Fuchs (in Nissen 3, 1966 and
1973). The 1973 treatment by Fuchs is very detailed and should always be consulted for
bibliographical purposes.

Booknumber 10.855 has not been used.

10.856. Dissertatio inauguralis botanica de <em>Buxbaumia</em>. Quam rectore magnificentissimo
serenissimo ac principe domino Friderico marggravio Brandenburgico borussiae ac
Silaesiae ... ex decreto illustris et gratiosi ordinis medici praeside D. Casimiro Christo-
phoro Schmidelio .. in Alma fridericiana Erlangensi pro doctoris gradu honoribus privi-
legiis ac immunitatibus rite obtinendis ad diem. [] Jun mdcclviii. Placidae eruditorum
disquisitioni subjicit Johannes Georgius Hoelzel wonsideliensis. Erlangae [Erlangen] (lit-
teris Tetscherianis) [1758]. Qu. (<em>Buxbaumia</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 12 Jun 1758 (p. 44), p. [i], [1]-46, <em>pl. 1</em> uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: FH, H, MO, NY,
	USDA.
<em>Republication</em>: in D.C.C. Schmidelii ... Dissertationes botanici argumenti revisae et re-
	cusae ... 1783, see below.
<em>Note</em>: the respondens J.G. Hoelzel defended the dissertation; the text must be assumed to
	have been written by the "promotor" Schmidel, in accordance with current practice.

10.857. Dissertatio inauguralis botanica de <em>Blasia</em>. Quam rectore magnificentissimo
serenissimo principe ac domino domino Friderico marggravio Brandeburgi, Borusiae,
Silesiaeque duce ... ex decreto illustris et gratiosae facultatis medicae praeside D. Cas-
imiro Christophoro Schmidelio ... in Alma fridericiana Erlangensi pro doctoris gradu,
honoribus, privilegiis ac immunitatibus rite obtinendis die [] Nov. mdclix benevolae
eruditorum disquisitioni offert Johannes Christophorus Zimmermann eurtho-noricus.
Erlangae [Erlangen] (Litteris Tezschnerianis) [1759]. Qu. (<em>Blasia</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 2 Nov 1759 (p. 32), p. [i-iv], [1]-32. <em>Copies</em>: FH, H, MO, NY.
<em>Republication</em>: in D.C.C. Schmidelii ... dissertationes botanici argumenti revisae et re-
	cusae ... 1783, see below.
<em>Note</em>: see Note <em>Buxbaumia</em>.

10.858. Dissertatio inauguralis botanica de <em>Jungermanniae charactere</em>. Quam rectore mag-
nificentissimo serenissimo principe ac domino domino Friderico marggravio
Brandenburgico Borussiae Silesiaeque ... ex decreto illustris et gratiosi ordinis medici

HEADING: SCHMIDEL

MO, NY. – Contents:

Schmidely, Auguste Isaac Samuel (1838-1918), Swiss bank employee at Genève,
active amateur floristic botanist. (<em>Schmidely</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: G (rd 1913, 22527 nos.); other material in A, BR, C. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>:

numbered labels.
<em>Letters</em> at G.

Schmidle, Wilhelm (1860-1951), German (Baden) algologist and geologist; studied at
Freiburg i. Br. and Berlin 1879-1883; high school teacher at Mannheim; from 1902-1907

PAGE: 241
HEADING: SCHMIDLIN

director of the Baden teachers college at Meersburg on the Bodensee; at Karlsruhe 1907-
1908; director of the Zeppelin-Oberrealschule, Konstanz 1909-1924; at the Schloss-
Schule, Salem 1924-1930; from 1931 in retirement at Freiburg i. Br.; Dr. h.c. Univ.
Freiburg i.Br. 1920 (<em>Schmidle</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ZT. – Contributed to V. Wittrock &amp; O. Nordstedt, <em>Algae aquae
dulcis exsiccatae</em>. – Letters at W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 231 (b. 16 Feb 1860); Biol.-Dokum. 16:
8110; BJI 1: 52, 2: 11; BM 4: 1844; De Toni 4: 1-li; DTS 1: 267; KR p. 625-626;
Moebius p. 93; MW p. 437; Nordstedt p. 28-29, suppl. 13-14.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Hedwigia 41: (255). 1902 (app. Meersburg).
Kneucker, A., Allg. bot. Z. 8: 192. 1902 (app. Meersburg).
Koster, J.Th., Taxon 18: 557. 1969 (herb. and types at ZT).

	Herb. 30(1): 267-268. 1947 (Pacific Isl. bibl.).

Urban, I., Symb. ant. 1: 151. 1898.
VanLandingham, S.L., Cat. diatom. 7: 4225. 1978.

De Toni f. (1936).

Schmidlin, Eduard (1808?-1890), German (Württemberg) botanist. (<em>Schmidlin</em>).

PAGE: 242
HEADING: SCHMIDLIN

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 1844-1845; Herder p. 365, 393; Jackson p. 39, 53,
194, 196; Langman p. 682; PR 8262-8264, ed. 1: 1850, 9191-9194; Rehder 1: 378, 5:
772; TL-2/see F.J. Niedenzu; Tucker 1: 632.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 42: 32. 1890 (d. 5 Feb 1890 in Dresden); Humboldt
	1890: 179 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 40: 214. 1890.
Heinsius, W., Allg. Büch.-Lex. 8(2): 225. 1838, 9(2): 248. 1849, 10(2): 231. 1849, 11(2):
	244. 1855, 12(2): 261. 1858, 13(2): 339. 1863, 14(2): 406. 1871, 15(2): 515-516. 1878,
	16(2): 435. 1882, 17(2): 522. 1887, 18(2): 493. 1890 (bibl.).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Schmidlin was a profilic popular author (see Heinsius). His sizeable <em>Populäre
Botanik</em> (ed. 1, Stuttgart, Krais &amp; Hoffmann, 1857, p.[i]-vi, [3]-712, <em>pl.1-62 Copy</em>: MO)
reached a fourth edition (1882-1883, by O.E.R. Zimmermann); he also published <em>Die
Blumensprache</em> (1839) and various books on gardening (e.g. <em>Die bürgerliche Gartenkunst</em>, ...
(1843)).

10.869. <em>Flora von Stuttgart</em>, oder Beschreibung der in der Umgegend von Stuttgart wild-
wachsenden sichtbar blühenden Gewächse. Mit einem Anhange über die in der Stutt-
garter Umgegend im Grösseren angebauten ökonomischen Gewächse ... Stuttgart
(Druck und Verlag der J.B. Metzler'schen Buchhandlung) 1832. Oct. (<em>Fl. Stuttgart</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1832 (p. viii: Aug 1832), p. [i]-viii, chart, [1]-559, [560, corr.]. <em>Copy</em>: B, NSUB.
<em>Ref</em>.: P., Flora 16(1) (Lit.-Ber. 1): 13-16. 28 Jan 1833 (rev.).

10.870. <em>Anleitung zum Botanisieren</em> und zur Anlegung der Pflanzensammlungen nebst einer
leichtfasslichen Unterweisung im Untersuchen der Pflanzen und einem praktischen
Schlüssel zum Auffinden der Gattungen und Arten. Für Anfänger in der Botanik und
insbesondere für Volksschulen bearbeitet von Eduard Schmidlin, ... Stuttgart
(Hoffmann'sche Verlags-Buchhandlung). 1846. Oct. (<em>Anleit. Bot.</em>).

<em>Ed</em>. [<em>1</em>]: 1846 (p. vi: Mai 1846), p.[i]-viii, [1]-407, [408, err.]. <em>Copies</em>: M, NY.

Schmidt, Adolf Wilhelm Ferdinand (1812-1899), German (Berlin) botanist, dia-
tomologist and malacologist; studied theology at Halle 1832-1835; theological exam.
1836-1837; private teacher at Merseburg, subsequently curate at Halberstadt and art
teacher at the Domgymnasium ib.; deacon (1846) and archdeacon (1848) at Aschersle-
ben (Saxony) until his retirement in 1895; Dr. phil. h.c. Halle 1890. (<em>Ad. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HAL; some further material at BRM.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 231 (b. 29 Aug 1812, d. 28 Jun 1899); BM 4:
1845; CSP 8: 869, 18: 539; De Toni 1: cxii, 2: civ, 4: li; Morren ed. 10, p. 8; MW p. 437,
suppl. p. 309; NI 1781, see also 3: 60; Quenstedt p. 385; TL-1/1172; TL-2/see indexes.

PAGE: 243
HEADING: SCHMIDT, AD.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1900: 47 (d.); Hedwigia 38: (297). 1899 (d.); Österr. bot. Z.
	49: 450. 1899 (d.); Leopoldina 35: 162-163. 1899 (obit. not.).
Böttger, D., Nachrichtsbl. deut. Malakozool. Ges. 32: 1-3. 1900 (obit.).

	main publ. Copy: G].

Koster, J.Th., Taxon 18: 557. 1969 (Diat. coll. at HAL).

Spence, The Microscope 5: 274. 1944.

10.871. <em>Atlas der Diatomaceen-Kunde</em> ... Leipzig (O.R. Reisland) [1874-1959]. (<em>Atlas
Diatom</em>.-<em>Kunde</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1874-1959 in Hefte of (usually 4) plates with accompanying text. For a full collat-
	ion see G. Dallas Hanna, <em>Index to Atlas der Diatomaceen-Kunde</em>, Lehre 1969. The details
	given below are mainly based on Hanna as well as on unpublished notes by R. Ross.
	<em>Copies</em>: B-S, BR, H, PH, U, USDA; IDC 5384.
<em>Editors and authors</em> (see Hanna, p. viii-ix)).
plates	signatures on plates
1-212	Adolf Wilhelm Ferdinand Schmidt (1812-1899)
213-216	Martin Schmidt (1863-?)
217-232	Friedrich Fricke (1863-1926)
233-240	Martin Schmidt &amp; Friedrich Fricke
241-244	Heinrich Heiden (x-1925)
245-246	Otto Müller (1837-1917)
247-248	Martin Schmidt &amp; Friedrich Fricke

285-290	Friedrich Hustedt
291	Friedrich Fricke &amp; Friedrich Hustedt
292-420	Friedrich Hustedt
433-480	"Phot. von Friedr. Hustedt"

The accompanying text for the first 20 Hefte (plates 1-80) was called <em>Vorläufige Erläute-
rungen</em>. Of this text a second edition exists for Hefte 1-7, 11 and 12, giving the dates of
the first publication. This text was superseded by <em>Erläuterungen</em>, one folio per plate, issued
with a second edition of the plates. This new text gives also dates of the first issue, but
these are, in some cases, erroneous. This second text was also published separately. From
plate 81 on each plate was accompanied by a sheet of vorläufige Erläuterungen. A.
Schmidt was responsible for plates 1-212 (145-212 in collaboration with H. Gründler, A.
Grunow, C. Janisch and O.N. Witt). Mr. R. Ross kindly provided the following analysis
of the first twenty Hefte:

PAGE: 244
HEADING: SCHMIDT, AD.

	benannten Varietäten nebst den mit angeführten Synonymen". Leipzig (O.R. Reis-
	land) 1890. Qu.
<em>Index to pl. 1-240</em>: 1902, p. [1]-69. <em>Copies</em>: U, USDA. – "<em>Verzeichnis s der in A. Schmidt's Atlas

Schmidt, Alfred (1886-?), German (Silesian) mycologist; travelled in East Africa 1910;
student of F. Pax; D. phil. Breslau 1912. (<em>Alfr. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: LS Suppl. 24754.

10.872. Aus dem botanischen Garten der Universität Breslau. Die <em>Verbreitung der copro-
philen Pilze Schlesiens</em>. Inaugural-Dissertation veröffentlicht mit Genehmigung der Hohen
Philosophischen Fakultät der Königl. Universität Breslau von Alfred Schmidt. Donners-
tag den 18. Januar 1912, ... Vortrag: Die Verbreitungsmittel der Pilzsporen und
Promotion. Breslau (Druck von Wilh. Gotti. Korn) 1912. Oct. (<em>Verbr. coproph. Pilze
Schlesiens</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: ca. 18 Jan 1912 (see t.p.; p. 2: 13 Dec 1911; Bot. Centralbl. 12 Nov 1912; Mykol.
	Centralbl. 25 Jul 1912; Nat. Nov. Nov(1) 1912), p. [1]-82. <em>Copies</em>: FH, NY.
<em>Ref</em>.: Matouschek, F., Bot. Centralbl. 122: 63-64. 21 Jan 1913 (rev.).

Schmidt, Carl [Karl] Friedrich (1811-1892), German (Berlin) botanical artist and
lithographer; teacher (art master) at the Berlin horticultural school 1843-1853, and
idem at the Friedrich-Werdersche Gymnasium ib. until 1887, ultimately with the title
professor; prolific artist who illustrated many of the German illustrated botanical works
of the 19th century; illustrator of the Botanische Zeitung 1843-1891. (<em>C.F. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L von Schlechtendal.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 232; BM 1: 139, 4: 1845; Herder p. 365; NI
2: 267 (index); PR 646, 4595; Rehder 5: 772; TL-1/594, 595, 668, 709, 713; TL-2/3521,
3523, 3736, 3739. 3741, 3743-3744, 3746, 3806, 4335, 4703-4704, 5483, 6183; Tucker 1:
632; Zander ed. 10, p. 712, ed. 11, p. 720, 813.

PAGE: 246
HEADING: SCHMIDT, C. F.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Jahrb. 15 (Beibl. 35): 15. 1892 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 23: 244. 1865
	(professor's title awarded by ministry of education and medicinal services), 28: 280.
	1870 (change of address of his "Atelier"), 49: 143. 1891 (ceases work for Botanische
	Zeitung); Flora 48: 431. 1865 (professor's title); Naturw. Wochenschr. 7: 252. 1892
	(d.).
Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Bot. Zeit. 17: 64. 1859 (started a natural history workshop
	(naturhistorisches Atelier) in Berlin, uniting various botanical artists).
Schmidt, C.F., Bonplandia 8: 172. 1860 (formation of "naturhistorisches Atelier").
Schumann, K., Bot. Zeit. 50: 289-291. 1892 (obit., b. 22 Dec 1811, d. 8 Apr 1892).

who took a dr. phil. degree at Freiburg i.B. in 1888 on a thesis: "<em>Vergleichende Untersu-

defended 6 Jul 1891 at Berlin (Dr. phil.), <em>Ueber den Blattbau einiger xenophilen Liliifloren</em>, p.

1891, 33-42. 25 Jul 1891, 97-107. 5 Aug 1891, 164-170. 12 Aug 1891.

10.873. <em>Darstellung und Beschreibung sämtlicher in der Pharmacopoea borussica aufgeführten off-
izinellen Gewächse</em> oder der Stoffe, welche von ihnen in Anwendung kommen, nach natür-
lichen Familien von Dr. O.C. Berg ... und C.F. Schmidt, ... Leipzig (Verlag von
Arthur Felix) [1853-1863] 4 vols. Qu. (<em>Darstell. Beschr. off. Gew.</em>).

<em>Senior author</em> (<em>text</em>): Otto Carl Berg (1815-1866).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1853-1863, in 34 Heften with <em>198</em> col. and <em>6</em> uncol. lithogr. with accompanying
	text. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH, NY, PH. – Copies with all plates uncolored were also issued.
	<em>1</em>: Hefte 1-8, 1853-1858, p. [i]-iv, [v, cont.], <em>pl. 1a-f, 2a-2f, 3a-3f, 4a-4f, 5a-5f, 6a-6f, 7a-

	1891-1902, see below.

HEADING: SCHMIDT, C. P.

10.874. <em>Atlas der officinellen Pflanzen</em>. Darstellung und Beschreibung der im Arzneibuche
für das Deutsche Reich erwähnten Gewächse. Zweite verbesserte Auflage von Darstel-
lung und Beschreibung sämmtlicher in der Pharmacopaea borussica aufgeführten off-
icinellen Gewächse von Dr. O.C. Berg und C.F. Schmidt. Herausgegeben durch Dr.
Arthur Meyer ... [und] Dr. Karl Schumann ... mit Tafel i-clxii. Leipzig (Verlag von
Arthur Felix) 1891-1902. 4 vols. Qu. (<em>Atlas off. Pfl.</em>).

	Meyer (1850-1922), Karl [Moritz] Schumann (1851-1904).
<em>Publ</em>.: in four volumes (28 Lieferungen) 1891-1902, as a second edition of <em>Darstell. Beschr.
	off. Gew.</em> See above. <em>Copy</em>: USDA.
	<em>1</em>: 1891-1893, Lief. 1-8, p. [i]-vi, [vii-xi], [1]-129, <em>pl. 1-32, 33a, 33b, 34-44</em> (col. liths.
	C.F. Schmidt).
	<em>2</em>: 1894-1896, Lief. 8-16, p. [i-iii], [1]-121, <em>pl. 45-69, 70a, 70b, 71-94.</em>
	<em>3</em>: 1896-1899, Lief. 17-23, p. [i-iii], [1]-102, <em>pl. 95-106, 107a, 107b, 108-132.</em> (Some pl. by
	T. Gürke).
	<em>4</em>: 1899-1902, Lief. 24-28, p. [i], [1]-79, <em>pl. 133a, 133b, 134-142, 143a, 143b, 144-157, 158a,
	158b, 159-162</em> (some pl. by T. Gürke).

Schmidt, Franz (1751-1835), Austrian (Moravian-born) botanist and gardener; garde-
ner at Mariahilf; from 1779 teacher of botany and forestry at the k.k. Theresianische
Ritterakademie, Wien. (<em>Franz Schmidt</em>).

Schmidt, Franz Wilibald (1764-1796), Bohemian botanist and physician; professor of
botany at Praha University; Dr. phil. Praha 1793. (<em>F.W. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: lost, except for some fragments at PRC and BP. We are grateful
to Dr. V. Skalicky from Prague for this information which is based on a thorough search
of all Bohemian herbaria; he was unable to reaffirm v. Wettstein's statement (1899) that
the major part of Schmidt's herbarium is incorporated in the herbarium of the then
existing German university in Prague (now PRC). Matouschek (1900) and Kláštersky
(p. 166) mention an <em>Agrostographia botanica</em> in the monastery of Osseg. Unpublished
drawings for the <em>Flora boëmica</em> are in the University library of Prague.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 2(1): 7; Barnhart 3: 231 (b. 7 Jul 1764, d. 2 Feb
1796); BM 4: 1847; CSP 5: 502; Dryander 3: 39, 163-164, 315, 417, 647, 650; Futak-
Domin p. 57 (bibl.); Hegi 6(2): 1269; Herder p. 148, 193; Hortus 3: 1203; Klášterský p.
166; Maiwald p. 93-95, 283 [index]; NI 2215; PR 8269-8271, ed. 1: 6693, 9202-9204;
Rehder 5: 772; RS p. 140; SO 135, 303a; TL-1/1173-1174; TL-2/see J.J. Roemer;
Tucker 2: xxxiv; WU 30: 243-244; Zander ed. 11, p. 813.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Preslia 48(1): 41. 1976 (biogr. not.).
Maiwald, P.V., Jahresber. Stifts-Obergymn. Braunau 1901: 5 (Opizische Periode flor.
	Erforsch. Böhm.).

PAGE: 249
HEADING: SCHMIDT, F. W.

	Stifte Osseg".

	bot. Z. 49: 96. 1899 (id.).

<em>Wilibalda</em> Sternberg ex A.W. Roth (1827).

	Beobachtungen</em> p. [223]-250, <em>Linnee's neunzehnte Klasse, erste Ordnung</em> p. [251]-286.

Schmidt, Friedrich [Karl] [Fedor Bogdanovich] (1832-1908), Livonian explorer,
botanist and geologist; studied at the University of Dorpat 1849-1853, bot. asst. id.
1856-1859; from 1859-1863 in charge of the activities of the Siberian expedition of the
Imperial Russian geographical Society in the Transbaikal, Sachalin, Daurian, Amur
and Mandchurian regions; working on the collections at St. Petersburg 1863-1866;
1866-1867 on the Mammuth expedition to the Enissej ("Mammuth-Schmidt"); from
1872-1874 geologist in Esthonia; in St. Petersburg from 1874, ultimately as director of
the Mineralogical Museum; adjunct (1872), extraord. (1874) and ord. (1885) member
of the Academy of Sciences, St. Petersburg; Dr. phil. h.c. Königsberg 1894. (<em>Friedr.
Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE; further material at MW. – The fossil plant collections from
the Amur Region are also at LE.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 729; Barnhart 3: 232 (b. 15/27 Jan 1832, d. 8/21
Nov 1908); BJI 1: 52; BM 4: 1847; Bossert p. 353; Bret. p. 619; CSP 5: 502, 8: 870, 18:
544-545; Herder p. 59, 201, 212; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 393; LS 24007-24008; MW
p. 438; PR 8272-8274, p. 574; Quenstedt p. 385; Rehder 5: 772; TR 1251-1258; Tucker
1: 632; Zander ed. 10, p. 712, ed. 11, p. 813.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Acta Horti bot. Univ. Jurjev. 9: 249. 1909 (obit. not.); Bot. Centralbl.
	110: 32. 1909 (d.); Bot. Not. 1909: 100 (d.); Cat. gén. livr. Bibl. natl. 166: 442. 1946;
	Flora 48: 43-44. 1865 (works on Flora of Sachalin; herbarium and fossil plant coll. to
	Acad. Sci., now LE); Hedwigia 48: (141). 1909 (d.); Nat. Nov. 30: 638. 1908 (d.);
	Trav. Mus. Bot. Acad. St. Petersburg 4: 143-147. 1908.

Schmidt, [Heinrich Christian] Friedrich (1819-1863), German (Franconio-
Bavarian) pharmacist and botanist at Wunsiedel; studied pharmacy in the Mohren-
Apotheke in Nürnberg and with Apoth. Strauss in Mosbach a. Neckar; at the Univers-
ity of München 1838-1840; studied botany and mineralogy at Berlin 1840-1841; from
1846 with the family pharmacy in Wunsiedel, from 1855 as owner; Dr. phil. Jena 1857.
(<em>H.C.F. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: CSP 5: 501, 6: 754.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Neu. Jahrb. Pharm. 20: 61-62. 1863 (obit., b. 9 Feb 1819 at Wunsiedel,
	d. 13 Jun 1863 ib.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: With J.C. Meyer, <em>Fl. Fichtelgeb.</em> 1854, see TL-2/5937. Since the publi-
cation of vol. 3 of TL-2 we learned through G. Wagenitz of the entry on Schmidt in W.-
H. Hein &amp; H.-D. Schwarz, Deutsche Apotheker-Biographie 2: 589-590, giving the

PAGE: 252
HEADING: SCHMIDT, H. C. F.

above biographical details as well as a bibliography. A further review of the <em>Fl. Fich-
telgeb.</em> is by S-n, Flora 37: 575-576. 28 Sep 1854. – See also Flora 42: 225-227. 1859.

Schmidt, Hermann of Elberfeld (1821/2-1905), German botanist and high school
teacher at Elberfeld (Rhine province, Prussia). (<em>H. Schmidt Elberf.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) H. Schmidt of Poischwitz, of whom no biographical details are known to us,
published a "<em>Führer in die Welt der Laubmoose</em>. Eine Beschreibung von 136 der am häufig-
sten vorkommenden deutschen Laubmoose", Gera (Druck und Verlag von Theodor
Hofmann) 1897, Oct., p. [1]-82, [1, app.], <em>pl. 1-4</em> with 20 dried specimens of musci.
<em>Copies</em>: B, FH (ÖbZ for Mai 1897; Hedwigia Mai-Jun 1897; Bot. Centralbl. 21 Apr 1897,
review by F. Matouschek; Bot. Centralbl. 73: 45-47, 5 Jan 1898). We do not know
whether this Schmidt is identical with the Baden bryologist Prof. H. Schmidt, at Frei-
burg i. Br. who published e.g. <em>Beiträge zur Moosflora Badens</em>, p. [1]-29, <em>copy</em>: U-V, re-
printed from Mitt. bad. Landesver. Naturk. Freiburg ser. 2. 2 (9/10, 11/12), 1927-1928.
(2) We have no further information on Heinrich Schmidt, b. 3 Aug 1884 in Hamburg,
who took a Dr. phil. at Göttingen in 1906 on a thesis "<em>Über die Entwicklung der Blüten und
Blütenstande von Euphorbia L. und Diplocyathium</em> n.g. which was preprinted from Beih. Bot.
Centralbl. 22(1): 21-69. 1907, with the imprint "Göttingen 1906", p. [1]-53, [54], <em>pl. 1-
4.</em> Oct. <em>Copy</em>: U. – ING 1: 550 notes "Genus [Diplocyathium] technically not described
as such, see Pax, Bot. Jahrb. Syst. 59: 151. 1924".
(3) Hermann Schmidt (1855-1930), also a high school teacher in Elberfeld, worked on
the bryology of Westfalen, Rheinland and Schwarzwald. He died in Freiburg i. Br.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 1848; CSP 18: 545.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1906: 47 (d. 1905 at the age of 83).

wildwachsenden Phanerogamen und Gefässkryptogamen ... Elberfeld (Im Verlage des
naturwissenschaftlichen Vereins in Elberfeld ...) 1887. Oct. (<em>Fl. Elberfeld</em>).

Schmidt, Hermann Rudolph (1814-1867), German (Prussian) high school teacher,
botanist and entomologist at the St. Johannisschule in Danzig. (<em>H.R. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schmidt, [Ernst] Johannes (1877-1933), Danish botanist, bacteriologist and
oceanographer; Dr. phil. Copenhagen 1903; botanical assistant with the Danish Com-
mission for investigation of the sea 1902-1909; director of the physiological department
of the Carlsberg laboratories 1910-1933; travelled in Thailand (1899-1900), in the Thor
to Iceland and the Færoes between 1903-1908, in the Mediterranean 1908-1910; across

PAGE: 253
HEADING: SCHMIDT, JOHS.

the Atlantic in the Dana 1921-1922, and, also in the Dana, around the world 1928-1930;
F.M.L.S. 1924. (<em>Johs. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: C; further material at L.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 231 (b. 2 Jan 1877, d. 22 Feb 1933); BJI 2:
156; BM 4: 1846; DSB 12: 190-191 (N. Spjeldnæs); Tucker 1: 632, 3: 272.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 83: 176. 1900 (back from trip to Thailand); Hedwigia
	38: (249). 1899 (to Thailand), 39: (195). 1900 (back from Thailand), 73: (198). 1933
	(d.).

	1939: 86-87. 1940 (bibl.), Dansk. bot. hist. 1: 766, 812, 830, 835, 852. 1926.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Ernst Johannes Schmidt signed himself Johs. Schmidt in his publications. The
German Ernst Schmidt (1834-1902) was co-owner of the Haage &amp; Schmidt nursery at
Erfurt (Johann Nicolaus Haage 1826-1878) who distributed e.g. Mexican plants. Emil
[Carl Wilhelm] Schmidt (1856-1897) was a Prussian botanist and high school teacher,
student of J. von Hanstein, ultimately teacher at the Berlin Friedrichs-Werdersche
Oberrealschule who published on plant anatomy and morphology.

Schmidt, Johann Anton (1823-1905), German (Hamburg) botanist; studied botany at
Heidelberg 1848-1849, Göttingen 1849-1850; Dr. phil. Göttingen 1850; in the Cape
Verde Islands 1851; habil. Heidelberg 1852; lecturer ib. from 1852-1855, extra-ordinary
professor of botany 1855-1863; from 1863-1904 in retirement at Hamburg; ultimately at
Elberfeld. (<em>J.A. Schmidt</em>).

PAGE: 255
HEADING: SCHMIDT, J. A.

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HBG; furher material, mainly from Cap Verde, at C, GOET,

Schmidt, Johann August Friedrich (<em>fl</em>. 1832), German (Thuringian) clergyman and

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 1848; PR 8280, ed. 1: 9209; Rehder 3: 100.

10.896. <em>Der angehende Botaniker</em> oder kurze und leichtfassliche Anleitung, die Pflanzen
ohne Beihülfe eines Lehrers kennen und bestimmen zu lernen. Eine gedrängte
Uebersicht der botanischen Grundsätze und Terminologie, der Pflanzen-Anatomie und
Physiologie und der künstlichen und natürlichen Pflanzen-Systeme von Linné, Jussieu
und Reichenbach, nebst einer neuen analytischen Methode, die in Deutschland und den
umgränzenden Ländern vorkommenden Pflanzengattungen auf eine leichte Weise zu
bestimmen, und einer kurzen Anweisung zum Anlegen eines Herbariums. Für die reifere
Jugend überhaupt, und für angehende Mediciner, Pharmaceuten, Forstmänner,
Oekonomen, Gärtner und Techniker insbesondere ... Ilmenau (Druck, Verlag u. Litho-
graphie von B. Fr. Voigt) 1832. Duod. (<em>Angeh. Bot.</em>).

<em>Ed</em>. [<em>1</em>]: 1832 (rev. Anon., Flora 15 (Int. Bl. 5): 67-68. 28 Dec 1832, Linnaea 7 (Litt.):
	76-77. 1832), frontisp. (portr. Linnaeus), p. [i]-xii, [1]-516, <em>pl. 1-35</em> (frontisp. is no.
	36). <em>Copies</em>: G, REG.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: n.v.
<em>Ed. 3</em>: 1836, Weimar, viii, 470 p., 36 pl. n.v.
<em>Ed. 4</em>: 1848, Weimar, xvi., 396 p., 36 pl. n.v. (Flora 7 Jan 1850).

Schmidt, Johann Carl [Karl] (1793-1850), German (Oberlausitz) botanist; high
school teacher at the Schloss Lenzburg educational institution; ultimately curator of the
R.J. Shuttleworth herbarium in Bern. (<em>J.C. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Various collections in the R.J. Shuttleworth her-
barium are attributable to him (Rytz 1922). For <em>Deutschlands Schwämme</em> see below.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: In the absence of sufficient biographical data we are not fully certain that the
"Johann Carl Schmidt" of <em>Deutschlands Schwämme</em> and <em>Mykologische Hefte</em> (see G. Kuntze,
TL-2/4036) is indeed identical with the Johann Karl Schmidt "Doktor der Medicin und
Chirurgie" of the <em>Allg. ökon.</em>-<em>techn. Fl.</em>

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 232 (b. 6 Apr 1793, d. 2 Dec 1850); BM 4:
1848; Frank 3 (Anh.): 91; Herder p. 393; Kelly p. 207-208; LS 24009; NI 1783 (J.K.

10.898. <em>Allgemeine ökonomisch-technische Flora</em> oder Abbildungen und Beschreibungen aller,
in Bezug auf Oekonomie und Technologie, merkwürdigen Gewächse ... Jena (bey
August Schmid) [1820-] 1827-1829 [-1831]. Oct. (<em>Allg. ökon.</em>-<em>techn. Fl.</em>).

<em>1</em>: 1820-1827 in 10 Hefte, p. [i], [1]-230, <em>pl. 1-50</em> (col. copp. auct.).
<em>2</em>: 1827-1831 in 5 Hefte, p. [i]-x, <em>pl. 51-75.</em>
<em>Copy</em>: G (vol. 1). – A note in Flora on Leipzig botanists (4(1): 138. 1821) states that the
	well-known mycologist and collaborator of G. Kunze "Hr. Dr. Schmidt" is no longer
	in Leipzig, but now in Jena". This points in the direction that J.C. Schmidt, born in
	the Oberlausitz, collaborator of G. Kunze at Leipzig, the author of the <em>Allg. ökon.-
	techn. Fl.</em> [as "Med. Dr." and "Johann Karl"] and the later teacher in Lenzburg and
	curator of the Shuttleworth herbarium are all the same.

Schmidt, Otto Christian (1900-1951), German (Berlin) botanist; Dr. phil. Berlin
1922; assistant at the Botanical Museum Berlin-Dahlem 1922-1939; lecturer (1931);
extraordinary professor of pharmacognosy Univ. Berlin (1938); at the Institut für
Pflanzenernährungslehre of the University of Berlin 1943-1949; at the University of
Münster 1949-1951. (<em>O.C. Schmidt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (mainly extant). – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 658; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8159-8160; BJI 2:
157; Christiansen p. 168, 320; MW p. 438; TL-2/1711, 4554; Zep-Tim. p. 101.

	sorship Berlin).

Schmidt, Robert (1826-1890), German teacher, meteorologist and botanist at Gera
(Thuringia/Reuss). (<em>Rob. Schmidt</em>).

77, 1927).
(5) <em>Musei selecti germaniae mediae</em>, fasc. 1-2, nos. 1-53. Jena 1888 (Herbarium 77, 1927).

Schmitz, [Carl Johann] Friedrich (1850-1895), German (Rhineland) botanist
(algologist); studied botany at Bonn with J.L.E.R. von Hanstein; participated in the
1870-1871 Franco-German war; Dr. phil. Bonn 1871; assistant with A. de Bary at Halle
and Strassburg 1872-1874; habil. Halle 1874; lecturer ib. 1874-1878; at Napoli zoolog-
ical station 1878; extraordinary professor of botany at Bonn 1878-1884; professor of
botany at Greifswald 1884-1895.
(<em>F. Schmitz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BM (collection of 7.457 microscope preparations of marine algae,
being the types of his Florideae ..., purchased 1899, Murray 1904). Some further types
of algae at L. – <em>Letters</em> to F.A.W. Miquel at U; further letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 122, 123, 319, 347; Barnhart 3: 233 (b. 8
Mar 1850, d. 24 Jan 1895); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8187-8188; BJI 1: 52; BM 4: 1850; Bossert
p. 354; CSP 8: 874, 12: 661; De Toni 1: cxii-cxiii, 2: civ-cv, 4: li-lii; Frank 3 (Anh.): 91;
Herder p. 121, 313, 434; Jackson p. 75, 84, 85, 91, 109, 159, 313; Langman p. 682; LS
24030-24032; Moebius p. 91, 92, 93, 94, 95, 175, 189, 198; Morren ed. 2, p. 7, ed. 10, p.
8; MW p. 438; Nordstedt p. 29; Rehder 5: 773; Saccardo 1: 149-150, 2: 99.

<em>Publ</em>.: 22-28 Aug 1841 (t.p.: 1841; p. viii: Mai 1841; received by Hinrichs 22-28 Aug
	1841), p. [i]-xlviii, [1]-512. <em>Copies</em>: B, BR, FI, G, HH, MO, NY, USDA.
<em>Ref</em>.: [Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von], Linnaea 15 (Litt.): 155-156. 1841-1842.

Schmoll, Hazel Marguerite (1891-x), American teacher and botanist; Dr. phil.
Chicago; BA and BE Univ. Colorado 1913; assistant in biology Vassar College 1913-
1917; curator of botany State History and Natural History State Museum Denver 1919-
1920, 1921-1933; curator Colorado State Bureau of Mines 1920-1921; after 1933 Senior
botanist, WPA project, Field Mus. Chicago. (<em>Schmoll</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: COLO; other material at E, NY.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Anon., Amer. men sci. ed. 5: 983. 1933, ed. 6: 1248.

Howes, D., ed., Amer. Women 2: 604. 1937.

Schmucker, Theodor (1895-1970), German (Bavarian) botanist; student of K. Goebel
and G. Hegi in München; Dr. phil. München 1922; assistant with K. Goebel, sub-
sequently "Privatdocent" (1927) and extraordinary professor (1933) of botany at Gött-
ingen; ordinary professor of forest botany and technical mycology at the forestry college
of Hann.-Münden (Forestry faculty of the University of Göttingen) 1937-1959.
(<em>Schmucker</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 234 (b. 5 Mai 1894, prob. err.); BFM 1631,
2442; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8192-8194; BJI 2: 157; BL 1: 114, 317, 2: 563, 715; Bossert p.
354; Hirsch p. 265; Langman p. 682; LS suppl. 24795; TL-2/see E.O.O. Kirchner.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Hedwigia 78: (75). 1938 (app. Hann.-Münden); Österr. bot. Z. 83: 79.
	1934 (prof. title), 87: 160. 1938 (app. Hann.-Münden).

Schnabl, Johann Nepomuk (1853-1899), German (Bavarian) teacher and botanist;
from 1877-1896 at the "girl's high school" at Sendling, München, from 1896-1899 at the
"höhere Töchterschule" München. (<em>Schnabl</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M; other material at C, H (2000 orig. fungi), L, NY, PC.

1897. Sets at B, C, FH, HBG, KIEL, L, LE, M, NY, PAD, PC. – Allescher continued
the series after Schnabl's death; a tenth century was published in 1909 (Herbarium 8:
58. 1909; also reported by FH); this century was published by A. Vill. – Reviews of
centuries 3-7: P. Magnus, Hedwigia 32: (245)-(246). 1893(3), 33: (167)-(168). 1894(4),
35: (59)-(60). 1896(5), 36: (174)-(175). 1897(6), 39: (190)-(191). 1900(7) and Bot. Cen-
tralbl. 83: 196-197. 1900(7). – Letters at G.

Schnarf, Karl (1879-1942), Austrian botanist and high school teacher; student of
Richard Wettstein in Wien 1899-1904; Dr. phil. Univ. Wien 1904; from 1904-1906 and
1912-1936 at the Bundes-Gymnasium, Wien vi, from 1923 "Privatdozent" for systematic
botany at the university, from 1931 with the title of professor. (<em>Schnarf</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schneevoogt, George Voorhelm (1775-1850), Dutch gardener and botanist.
(<em>Schneev</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. It is questionable whether they ever existed. The
<em>Icones</em> were started when Schneevoogt was 17 yrs old, under the direction of S.J. van
Geuns. Schneevoogt was then a horticulturist at Haarlem.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 234; Blunt p. 168; BM 4: 1850; Dawson p.

632; Zander ed. 10, p. 712, ed. 11, p. 813.

10.931. <em>Icones plantarum rariorum</em>. Delineavit et in aes incidit Henricus Schwegman; edidit
et descriptiones addidit G. Voorhelm Schneevoogt; scriptionem inspexit S.J. van Geuns
... Afbeeldingen van zeldzaame en fraaje bloem- en plant-gewassen naer t' leven gete-
kend, gegraveerd en gecouleurd door Hendrik Schwegman, met derzelver beschrijving
in 't Latijn, Neêrduitsch, Fransch en Hoogduitsch, door G. Voorhelm Schneevoogt.
Uitgegeven onder het opzigt van den Hoog Gel. Heer S.J. van Geuns Matth. Z. – te
Haerlem (Bij C. Plaat) [1792-] 1793 [-1795]. Fol. (<em>Icon.pl. rar.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1792-1795 in 16 parts, p. [i-iii], [1]-4, [5, index], <em>pl. 1-48</em> (1-40, 42-48 col. copp.,
	41 uncol. copp.; H. Schwegman) with text. <em>Copies</em>: B-S (48 pl.), BR (<em>39 pl</em>.), G (<em>42 pl</em>.),
	HH (<em>48 pl</em>.), MO (<em>48 pl</em>.), PH (<em>48 pl</em>.), Teyler; IDC 5721.

part	plates	dates	part	plates	dates
1	1-3	20 Apr 1792	9	25-27	14 Jul 1793
2	4-6	20 Apr 1792	10	28-30	25 Oct 1793
3	7-9	25 Mai 1792	11	31-33	Nov-Dec 1793
4	10-12	29 Jun 1792	12	34-36	Nov-Dec 1793
5	13-15	17 Aug 1792	13	37-39	1794
6	16-18	Sep-Dec 1792	14	40-42	1795
8	22-24	15 Mar 1793	16	46-48	post 16 Mai 1795

The first volume was to have contained 36 plates, but plates 37-48 (41/42 on one leaf) of
the unfinished second volume are usually bound together with those of the first; title
page and index of volume 2 not having been published.
The hand-coloured (except no. 41) plates are engravings of drawings by Hendrik
Schwegman; they are listed, with the modern names, by Stearn (1940, repr. HU 728).
Plate 8 is signed by Pieter van Loo. – Text in Latin, Dutch, French, and German.

Schnegg, Hans (1875-1950), German (Bavarian) mycologist and fermentation-
physiologist; assistant at the Institute for plant physiology at München; Dr. phil.
München 1901, as student of Karl Goebel; from 1913-1943 teacher at the agricultural
and brewery college of Weihenstephan, also extra-ordinary professor at the Technical
University of München. (<em>Schnegg</em>).

Schneider, Albert (1863-1928), American botanist (lichenologist), bacteriologist,
pharmacologist and criminologist; Dr. med. Chicago 1887; teacher and physician at
Spencer Academy, Indian Territory 1889; M.S. Univ. Minnesota 1894; Dr. phil.
Columbia University 1897; professor of botany, pharmacognosy and bacteriology,
School of Pharmacy, Northwestern University, Evanston, 1897-1903; id. College of
Pharmacy, San Francisco 1903-1913; professor of pharmacognosy and pharmacology at
the Nebraska School of Pharmacy, Univ. Nebraska 1919-1921; dean and professor at the
School of Pharmacy, North Pacific College, Oregon 1922-1928. (<em>A. Schneid.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at NY and UC. – <em>Letters</em> to W.G. Farlow at FH;
further letters at G.

24061, suppl. 24816-24818; NI 1785; Rehder 1: 234, 2: 4; SBC p. 131; Stevenson p.
1257; Tucker 1: 632.

Schneider, Camillo Karl (1876-1951), German (Saxonian) botanist (dendrologist);
studied in Wien with Richard von Wettstein 1901-1909; general secretary and traveller
for the Dendrologische Gesellschaft für Österreich-Ungarn; travelled in the Balkan
Peninsula and the Caucasus 1907-1908; in Western China 1913-1914; with the Arnold
Arboretum 1915-1919; from 1921 garden architect, horticultural journalist and author
in Berlin. (<em>C.K. Schneid.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: W (European herb.), Chinese material at A, G, GH, H, K, P,
PH, US, W. – Further European material at B (extant), BM, BP, G, K, PH. – Contri-
buted specimens to C. Baenitz, <em>Herbarium dendrologicum</em>. – The manuscript, drawings,
photographs and further material for his final <em>Berberis</em> monograph were destroyed 1-2
Mar 1943 at B. – Letters at G.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Not to be confused with the Vienna zoologist and philosopher Karl Camillo
Schneider, author of e.g. <em>Einführung in die Deszendenztheorie</em>, Jena 1906 (viii, 150 p., <em>2 pl</em>.).

Schneider, Gustav (x-ca. 1908), German (Silesian) botanist; mining administrator in
Cunnersdorf bei Hirschberg i. Schl., later in Kattowitz. (<em>Gus. Schneid.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Material (mostly <em>Hieracium</em>) at GOET, HAL, W and WRSL. – Unpublished drawings: <em>Icones hieraciorum in Europa sponte crescentium</em>, ca. 110 pl. left by S.
upon his death, offered for sale by T.O. Weigel (Herbarium 10: 81. 1909), see also H.Z.
(1909). – The original <em>Hieracium</em> herbarium (2702 nos.) went to B in 1904 and is no
longer extant. <em>Hieracia der Riesengebirges</em> were offered for sale, as exsiccatae, in 1885.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 1851; GSP 18: 558; Futak-Domin p. 528-529; IH
2: (files); Tucker 1: 633; Urban-Berl. p. 393.

(<em>Jos. Schneid.</em>).

Schneider, [Karl Friedrich] Robert (1798-1872), German (Silezian) high school
teacher, botanist and geographer; studied natural sciences at Breslau Univ., travelled
with H. v. Schubert 1824; teacher at Weissenfells until 1828; from then on at Bunzlau
(Bezirk Liegnitz). (<em>Rob. Schneid.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 235; BM 4: 1852; Herder p 477; PR 8296,
ed. 1: 9228; Rehder 1: 379, 532; Tucker 1: 633.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Jahresber. schles. Ges. vaterl. Kultur 49: 341-344. 1872 (obit.).
Pax, F., Bibl. schles. Bot. 4, 28, 55. 1929.
Wimmer, F., Fl. Schlesien ed. 2. 2: 152. 1845.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Schneider published in many fields, e.g. <em>Germania auf der Wacht</em>. Deutsche Lieder
zu Schutz, Trutz [Trotz] und Sanglust in schwerer Zeit ..., Wittenberg 1862, but also
<em>Deutsches Giftbuch</em>, oder die giftigen und gefährlichen Pflanzen, Thiere und Mineralien
Deutschlands zur Lehre und Warnung. Stolp 1854.

Schneider, [Eduard Karl] Ludwig [Pfeil], (1809-1889), German (Prussian) bota-
nist, magistrate and liberal politician; studied law at the University of Berlin; "Auscul-
tator" at the Magdeburger law-court 1834-1836; studied botany in Berlin with C.S.
Kunth 1836-1840; local administrator at Erfurt 1840-1844; burgomaster of Schönebeck
a.d. Elbe 1844-1856; member of the regional diet 1847, of the Prussian National
Assembly 1848, of the House of representatives 1849; from 1856-1858 and 1860-1861 in
Magdeburg; 1858-1860 in Switzerland; member of the House of representatives 1861-
1866; in Berlin 1861-1869, in retirement in Zerbst 1871-1878 and Schönebeck 1879-
1889.
(<em>Ludw. Schneid.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 234 (d. 9 Feb 1889); BFM 245; BM 4: 1852;
CSP 18: 559; Jackson p. 53, 307; Morren ed. 10, p. 26; Rehder 5: 774.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Leopoldina 25: 168. 1889 (d.).
Ascherson, P., Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 31: xliii-1. 1890 (obit., bibl., b. 26 Jun 1809,
	d. Feb 1889).
Ascherson, P. et al., Nachtr. Fl. Magdeburg 69. 1894.
Ascherson, P. &amp; P. Magnus, Ann. Bot. 3: 488. 1890 (brief biogr. sketch, bibl.).
Drude, O., Hercyn. Florenbezirk 8, 10, 12, 17.
Ebeling, C.W., Jahresber. Abh. nat. Ver. Magdeburg 1888: 62-69. 1889 (obit., b. 26 Jun
	1809).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: <em>Uebersicht der Boden</em>- <em>und Vegetations-Verhältnisse des Magdeburger Floren-
gebiets, in</em> Heyman Rosenthal, ed., Magdeburg. Festschrift für die Mittglieder ... der 57.
Sammlung Deutscher Naturforscher und Aerzte, Magdeburg, 1884, p. 105-124. (<em>Copy</em>:
UC, inf. R. Schmid).

	included in the copy at U. The cover has only the title of Schneider's paper. The

	"Ein Beitrag zur Phytostatistik".
<em>Follow-up</em>: Abh. natur. Ver. Magdeburg 6: 1-18. 1874.

Schneider, Oskar (1841-1903), German (Saxonian) naturalist, traveller and teacher;
Dr. phil. Leipzig 1866; studied at Leipzig 1860-1864; private teacher at Salzburg 1864-
1866; teacher at the "Böttger'schen Institut", Dresden 1866-1867; private teacher in
Egypt 1867-1869; teacher at the Freemason Institute, Dresden 1869-1872; teacher with
the title professor at the Annen-Realgymnasium Dresden 1872-1893. (<em>O. Schneid.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

560; KR p. 626; Rehder 1: 488; TL-2/see A. Grunow; Tucker 1: 633.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: A.C., Revue russe Entom. 3(1): 345. 1903 (d.).
Anon., Insekten-Börse 20: 313-314. 1903 (obit., portr.); Leopoldina 40: 39. 1904 (obit.
	not.).
Hantzsch, V., Biogr. Jahrb. 8: 45-49, 102*. 1905 (obit.).

	1906 (main biogr., bibl.).

	1121. 1923 (bibl.).

Schneider, Wilhelm Gottlieb (1814-1889), German (Silesian) mycologist and en-
tomologist; Dr. phil. Breslau 1843; private scientist dedicating himself to entomology
from 1843 and to mycology from 1864. (<em>W.G. Schneid.</em>).

Schnetzler, Johann Balthasar (1823-1896), Swiss (Schaffhausen) botanist; studied at
the Stuttgart Polytechnic; high school teacher for French at the Gymnasium of Schaff-
hausen 1844-1847; id. for natural sciences at the Collège de Vevey, nr Lausanne 1847-
1869; professor of botany at the Academy, later University of Lausanne 1869-1891.
(<em>Schnetzl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LAU(?). – <em>Letters</em> at G.

Schnittspahn, Georg Friedrich (1810-1865), German (Hessen) botanist; botany
teacher at Kranichstein 1831-1838; inspector of the Darmstadt botanical garden 1836,

PAGE: 279
HEADING: SCHNIZLEIN, A.

"Oberleiter" from 1841, director 1855; teacher at the technical school from 1841;
"Hofgartendirector" from 1849. (<em>Schnittsp</em>.).

Schnizlein, Adalbert [Carl Friedrich Helkvig Conrad] (1814-1868), German
(Bavarian) botanist and pharmacist; studied at the University of München; Dr. phil.
Erlangen 1836; spent training years in Genève (1837), Speyer (1838), Mainbernheim
(1839-1840); continued his botanical studies in München 1841-1842; pharmacist in
Erlangen 1843; habil. Erlangen 1845; from 1850-1868 professor of botany and director
of the botanical garden. (<em>Schnizl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ER. – For further notes see below under W. Schnizlein. – <em>Letters</em>
to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL. – A manuscript <em>Vorlesungen über allgemeine Botanik</em>,
1847, at M.

8230-8231; BM 2: 620, 4: 1853; Bossert p. 354; CSP 5: 517-518, 8: 877-878; De Toni 2:
cv; DTS 1: 268; Frank 3 (Anh.): p. 91-92; GR p. 134-135; Hegi 5(2): 1299; Herder p.

Zeit. 10: 593-595. 20 Aug 1852.
(3) With J.W. Sturm, q.v., senior author, <em>Verz. Pfl. Nürnberg</em> 1847, ed. 2. 1860.
(4) <em>Lacistemaceae</em>, Fl. bras. 4(1): 277-288, <em>pl. 77-80.</em> 28 Feb 1857 (fasc. 20).

10.964. <em>Iconographia familiarum naturalium regni vegetabilis</em> delineata atque adjectis fam-
iliarum characteribus adnotationibusque variis tum scientiam tum usum spectantibus
exornata ... Abbildungen der natürlichen Familien des Gewächsreiches gezeichnet und
mit den Charakteren der Familien, sowie verschiedenen wissenschaftlichen und prakti-
schen Anmerkungen begleitet ... Bonn (von Max Cohen &amp; Sohn) 1843-1870. 4 vols.
Qu. (<em>Iconogr. Jam. regn. veg.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 277 plates or sets of plates (in all 398 (possibly 397 or 399) accompanying text, the
	numbers corresponding to the numbers 1-277 of Endlicher's system. The plates and
	text were issued in 20 "Hefte" without regard to final arrangment; the text pages not

PAGE: 281
HEADING: SCHIZLEIN, A.

	numbered. Many of the plates are assigned new numbers in the indexes. Contents
	and dates of Hefte very incompletely known (but see the reviews of 1-14, cited below,
	by D.F.L. von Schlechtendal). The first Heft, 20 plates and 20 text sheets, appeared 3-
	4 Apr 1843 (Hinrichs), the final Heft (by A.W. Eichler) no. 20, came out Jun 1870.
	The plates are coloured lithographs of drawings by the author, partly in collaboration
	with A. Braun.
	All copies seen by us have different sets of introductory material. Below we list the
	composition of the copy at US which seems to be the most complete. Information on
	the contents and dates of the "Hefte" is still lacking. <em>Copies</em>: B, G, H, HH, NY, PH, U,
	US, USDA.
	The book was completed after S.'s death by A.W. Eichler who signed the preface
	material issued in 1870 "München, im Mai 1870" (p. vi).
<em>Preface matter 1</em>: (a) matter issued 1843: General t.p. (p.p. Gothic lettering) 1843 [i],
	Abbrev. [ii], Vorwort dated Dec 1842 [iii-iv], errata dated Dec 1842 [v].
	(b) matter issued 1846 [1849?] with vol. 1 only: t.p. Band 1 (id.), 1843-1846 [i],
	Abbrev. [ii], Schlusswort and errata dated Nov 1849 [iii-iv], Register Pflanzen-
	namen p. [1-5].
	(c) matter issued 1870: t.p. 1843-1846 (all Roman lettering) [i], Vorwort [iii]-vi,
	dated Mai 1870, by A.W. Eichler; Register [1]-6, Verzeichniss Tafeln [7].
	<em>2</em>: t.p. 1843-1870 [i]; Register [1]-7; Verzeichniss Tafeln [8-9].
	<em>3</em>: t.p. 1843-1870 [1]; Register [3]-6; Verzeichniss Tafeln [7].
	<em>4</em>: t.p. 1843-1870 [i]; Register [1]-4; Verzeichniss Tafeln [5].
<em>Plates 1</em> (Ordines 1-75. Cryptogamae et monocotyledonae), 1843-1846. <em>pl. 1-7, tabl. suppl.
	i, 8-25, 26a, b, 27-35, tabl. suppl. ii, 36-41, 41a, tabl. iii, 42, 42a-c, 43, 43a, 44-47, 47*, 48-51,
	51a-c, 52-55, 55b-d, 56, 56a-b, 57, 57 suppl., 58-64, 64-i, 65-66, 66a, 67-72, 72a, aa, b, bb, 73-
	74, 74a, 75, 75a-b</em> (numbers as given in index; numbers on plates may differ but
	changes indicated in index).
<em>Plates 2</em> (Ordines 76-161**. (Cupressineae-Galacineae). Gymnospermae, Dicotyleae
	apetalae et gamopetalae), 1843-1870. <em>pl. 76-77, 77a, 78-94, 94*, 94**, 95-96, 96*-96***,

	159*-159***, 1592, 160-161, 161a-d, 161**</em> [<em>161*</em>].
<em>Plates 3</em> (Ordines 162-228*. (Umbelliferae-Coriarieae). Dicotyleae dialypelae, pars
	prima), <em>pl. 162, 162a, 163-169, 169*-169**, 170, 170a, 170*-170**, 171-172, 172a, 172*-
	172**, 173-174, 174*, 175-178, 178a-b, 179, 179a, 180, 1802, 181, 181a-b, 182-185, 185*,
	186-189, 189*, 190-195, 195a, 196-204, 204a, 205, 206*, 270a-b, 208, 208*, 209-210, 210a,
	211-213, 213**, 214, 214*-214**, 215-216, 216*, 217-223, 223*, 223a, 224-228, 228*.</em>

	264-266, 266*, 267-268, 268*, 269, 269-i, 269-v, 269 +, 270-272, 272b-d, 273-275, 275a-b,
	275*, 276-277.</em>
<em>Reviews</em> by D.F.L. von Schlechtendal in Bot. Zeit. 1: 453-456. 1843 (Heft 1, 20 <em>pl</em>.), 2:
	380-381. 1844 (Heft 2), 3: 500-502. 1845 (Heft 3), 4: 330-331. 1846 (Heft 4), 7: 905-
	906. 1849 (Heft 5, 6), 9: 294-296. 1851 (Heft 7), 12: 723-725. 1854 (Heft 8, 9). 13:
	758-759. 1855 (Heft 10), 14: 863-865. 1856 (Heft 11) (all reviews cite contents). The
	20th and final Heft is announced in Bot. Zeit. 28: 392. 1870, to be published in Jun
	1870.

10.966. <em>Die Flora von Bayern</em> nebst den angrenzenden Gegenden von Hessen, Thüringen,
Böhmen, Oestreich und Tyrol sowie von ganz Wurtemberg und Baden. Ein Entwurf des
Inhaltes mit übersichtlicher Anordnung der unterscheidenden Merkmale aller Blüth-
enpflanzen, welche in diesen Ländern wild wachsen und auch zum Nutzen oder
Vergnügen allgemeiner gepflanzt werden; ... Erlangen (Verlag von Carl Heyder) 1847.
Oct. (<em>Fl. Bayern</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1847 (p. xiv: Nov 1846; Flora rd Apr-Mai 1847, 21 Jun 1847), p. [i]-cvi, [1]-373
	["733"], [374, err.]. <em>Copies</em>: B, FI, G, HH, M, MO, NY, USDA.

10.967. <em>Die Vegetations</em>- <em>Verhältnisse der Jura</em>- <em>und Keuperformation</em> in den Flussgebieten der
Wörnitz und Altmühl ... geschildert von Dr. Adalbert Schnizlein in Erlangen und
Albert Frickhinger in Nördlingen. Unter Mitwerkung von G. Ad. Hauser für Dink-

<em>Authorship</em>: junior author, Christian Albrecht Frickhinger (1818-1907; pharmacist in

Schnizlein, [Karl Friedrich Christoph] Wilhelm (1780-1856), German (Bavarian)
botanist and magistrate; lived some time (ca. 1806) in Austria, later "Landgerichtsarzt"
(law court physician) at Monheim and Erlangen; associate of E.G. von Steudel through
the Esslinger Reiseverein; father of Adalbert Schnizlein. (<em>W. Schnizl.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ER (via his son, q.v.; the herbarium numbered some 18.000

PAGE: 284
HEADING: SCHNIZLEIN, W.

species); duplicates at B (mainly destr.), BR, GJO, KIEL, M, MW, OXF, REG. These
collections are often attributed to A. Schnizlein, who, however, never lived in Austria.
W. Schnizlein contributed to the collections distributed by the Esslinger Reiseverein.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8230; BM 4: 1853; Clokie p. 240
(under A. Schnizlein); CP 5: 517; PR 8311.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 14: 192. 1856 (d.; leaves herb. of 18.000 sp.); Flora 39: 175.
	1856 (d. 9 Feb 1856, father of A. Schnizlein).
Schnizlein, W., Flora 12: 113-118. 28 Feb 1829 (Ueber die neueste Ecklon'sche Sendung
	getrockneter Kappflanzen, und über die Leistungen des naturhistorischen Reise-
	vereins zu Esslingen).
Zuchold, W., Jahresber. nat. Ver. Halle 5: 51. 1853.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Schnizlein published <em>Über die neueste Ecklon'sche Sendung</em> getrockneter Cap-Pflanzen,
und über die Leistungen des naturhistorischen Reisevereins zu Esslingen, Flora 12: 113-
118. 1829 and contributed <em>Schoenus</em> to J.C. Sturm, Deutschi. Fl.

gradu doctoris medicinae atque chirurgiae legitime obtinendo publicae eruditorum dis-
quisitioni submissit Carolus Fridericus Christophorus Guilelmus Schnizlein Ansba-
chensis. Die [in mss.: vta] Maii [deleted in mss., followed by "Junii"]. Erlangae (ex
officina Hilpertiana) 1804. (<em>De Sedo acri</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 5 Jun 1804, p. [1]-44, [45, err.]. <em>Copy</em>: NY.

Schnyder, Otto (<em>fl</em>. 1878), Argentine botanist; professor of botany at the University of
Buenos Aires. (<em>O. Schnyd.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – LZ (destr.) listed some material from "O.
Schnyder"; some bryophytes and phanerogams were at B (mainly destr.).

10.983. <em>Verzeichniss der Gehölze in den öffentlichen Gärten und Parkanlagen Magdeburgs</em> ...

Schönach, Hugo (1847-?), Austrian botanist; high school teacher at Brunek (until
1880) and Feldkirch, Vorarlberg (1881-1908); later in retirement in Innsbruck. (<em>H.
Schönach</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: IBF. Some further material at AK, C, KIEL, MANCH.
Contributed material to the <em>Flora exsiccata Austro-Hungarica</em>. – Schönach offered her-
barium material of Austrian (Tirol) plants for sale.

Schoenefeld, Wladimir de (1816-1875), Berlin-born botanist of Russian parentage; in
France from 1817-1833; in Berlin with C.S. Kunth 1833-1840; in Paris from 1840-1875;
student of Adr. de Jussieu; one of the founders and secretary of the Société botanique de
France 1854-1855, 1858-1861, secretary-general 1862-1875. (<em>Schoenef</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P; some further material in B (mainly destr.), CGE, E, FI,
KIEL, MANCH, MPU, W. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters
at G.

160, 715 (err. "Schoenfeld"); CSP 5: 535, 8: 881, 12: 662; IH 2: (files); Morren ed. 2, p.
21; Rehder 1: 220; Tucker 1: 633; Urban-Berl. p. 393.

Schoenichen, Walther (1876-1956), German (Rheinland/Preussen) botanist, ento-
mologist and conservationist; studied natural sciences at Halle; high school teacher at
Halle and in Berlin-Schöneberg 1899-1913; lecturer in biology at the teacher's college of
Posen 1913-1915; vice-director of the "Zentralinstitut für Erziehung und Unterricht",
Berlin 1915-1922; director of the "Staatliche Stelle für Naturdenkmalpflege in Preussen
1922-1938; in forced retirement 1938; ultimately at Leipzig and Goslar; lecturing at
Braunschweig Technical University. (<em>Schoenichen</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 237 (b. 18 Jul 1876); BFM 2610-2611, 3179-
3181; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8250-8252; BM 4: 1855, 8: 1159; Bossert p. 354; Collander p.
481; CSP 18: 566; Hirsch p. 266; LS 24144; Moebius p. 399.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Brit. Mus. gen. cat. print. books 215: 783; Nachrichtenbl. deut. Pfl.-
	Schutzdienst 8(9): 144. 1956 (80th birthday); Natürw. Rundschau 10: 41. 1957 (d.

Schönland, [later: Schonland] Selmar (1860-1940), German (Thuringian) botanist;
studied at Berlin and Kiel; student of A. Engler; Dr. phil. Kiel 1883; high school teacher
at Aschersleben 1884-1885; assistant with I.B. Balfour and S. Vines at Oxford, M.A.
Oxf. 1888; curator, later director of the Albany Museum, Grahamstown, S. Africa 1889-
1910; curator of the herbarium 1910-1925; professor of botany at Rhodes University
College 1905-1925; from 1925-1940 in retirement at Grahamstown. (<em>Schönl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GRA; other material at A, B (mainly destr.), BM, BR, MO, NH,
PRE, SAM, STU, WRSL, Z. – Schönland built up the Albany Museum Herbarium
(GRA) from 1000 specimens upon his arrival to 100.000 in 1925. – Documents and
correspondence at GRA.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 519; Barnhart 3: 237 (b. 15 Aug 1860, d. Mai
[err.] 1940); BJI 1: 52, 2: 157-158; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8253; BL 1: 29, 54, 317; BM 4:
1855, 8: 1159; Bossert p. 354; CSP 12: 662, 18: 566; Frank 3 (Anh.): 92; Herder p. 297;
Hirsch p. 266; Hortus 3: 1203; IFI 1 (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342; SIA 189; Tucker 1: 633;
Urban-Berl. p. 281, 393; Zander ed. 10, p. 713, ed. 11, p. 813-814 (d. Jun 1940, err.).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 37: 407. 1889 (was asst. Oxford; to South Africa,
	Grahamstown); Bot. Jahrb. 11 (Beibl. 24): 2. 1889 (from Oxford to Albany, S. Afr.).;
	Nat. Nov. 32: 460. 1910 (succeeded by J. Hewitt as director of the Albany Museum;
	retains supervision of herbarium); Nature 3699: 395. 1940 (obit. not.); Who's who
	(London) 1918-1939; Who was who 3 (1929-1940): 1204.

Gunn, M. &amp; L.E. Codd, Bot. Expl. S. Afr. 318. 1981 (biogr. sketch, portr., coll., refs.).

HEADING: SCHÖNLAND

Schönlein, Johann Lucas (1793-1864), German (Bavarian) physician and
palaeobotanist; studied natural sciences and medicine at Landshut and Würzburg; Dr.
med. 1816; lecturer in pathological anatomy at Würzburg 1817-1824, provisional head
(1819), subs, head (1824) of the medical clinic of the Julius Hospital; regular professor of
medicine 1824-1833, id. at Zürich (1833-1839) and Berlin 1839-1859; first physician in
ordinary to the King of Prussia. (<em>J. Schönlein</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Letters</em> to F.A.W. Miquel at U.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 315-319; Ainsworth p. 168-169; Barnhart 3:
237 (b. 30 Nov 1793, d. 23 Jan 1864); BM 4: 1855; Bossert p. 355; DSB 12: 202-203 (G.
Robinson); Herder p. 352; Jackson p. 185; NI 1788; PR 8315; Quenstedt p. 386.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 6: 52. 1858 (cogn. Leopoldina Marcus I).
Bulloch, W., Hist. bacteriol. 395-396. 1938.
Freund, H. &amp; A. Berg et al., Gesch. Mikroskopie 11, 12, 35, 36, 80, 81, 89. 1963.
Schwarzbach, M., auf dem spuren unserer Naturforscher, Stuttgart 23, 25. 1981.
Wittrock, V.B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(2): 142. 1903.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schoenleinia</em> J.F. Klotzsch (1846). <em>Note</em>: <em>Schoenleinium</em> Johan-Olsen (1897) may
also honor this author.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Most studies on Schönlein deal with his medical activities, see e.g. G. Robinson
(DSB), Isis cumulative bibliography 2: 452. 1971, and, for some contemporary literature
on him Brit. Mus., Gen. cat. print. books 215: 788-789.

11.004. <em>Abbildungen von fossilen Pflanzen aus dem Keuper Frankens</em> von Dr. J.L.Schoenlein ...
mit erläuterndem Texte nach dessen Tode herausgegeben von Dr. August Schenk ...
Wiesbaden (C.W. Kreidel's Verlag) 1865. Qu. (<em>Abbild. foss. Pfl. Keuper</em>).

<em>Editor and co-author</em>: [Joseph] August Schenk (1815-1891).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1865 (p. 6: 20 Jan 1865; Flora 22 Jul 1865; BSbF Nov 1865), p. [1]-22, <em>pl. 1-13</em>
	(uncol., C. Hohe, F. Hassler). <em>Copies</em>: PH, USGS.

Schoenlein, Philipp (1834-1856), Swiss-born botanist; educated in Berlin; travelled in
Upper Guinea 1855-1856; died at Cap Palmas, Liberia; son of J.L. Schönlein. (<em>P.
Schoenlein</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: 14 specimens in B (probably all destroyed).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 237 (b. 9 Feb 1834, d. 11 Feb 1856); BM 4:
1855; PR (alph.) 4731; TL-2/3741; Urban-Berl. p. 393.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 4: 160. 1856, 9: 61. 1861, 10: 353. 1862 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 14:
	296. 1856 (d., son of J.L. Schönlein).
Embacher, F., Lexik. Reisen 262. 1882.
Vallot, J., Bull. Soc. bot. France 29: 191, 204. 1882 (coll. Cap Palmas).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: J.F. Klotzsch, <em>Philipp Schoenlein s botanischer Nachlass auf Cap Palmas</em>,
1857, TL-2/3741.

PAGE: 292
HEADING: SCHÖPF

Schöpf, Johann David (1752-1800), German (Bavarian) botanist and physician; Dr.
med. Erlangen 1776; army physician with Ansbach ("Hessian") troups in the English
army during the American War of Liberation 1777-1783; travelled through Pennsyl-
vania, Maryland, the Carolina's and the Bahamas; court and military surgeon in Bay-
reuth 1784; president of the medical council of Ansbach 1795, id. of Bayreuth 1797.
(<em>Schöpf</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M (through Schreber, Martius 1851); a few specimens associated
with Schöpf in PH (Mears 1978). – Schreber also acquired the "Index Plantarum
Noveboracensium" (also at M; viii and 353 p. mss).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 31: 350-352 (F. Ratzel); Backer p. 519; Barnhart 3:
237 (b. 8 Mar 1752, d. 10 Sep 1800); BM 4: 1855, 8: 1159; Dryander 3: 369; Langman
p. 683; Lasègue p. 460; LS 24145; ME 1: 227, 3: 355, 651, 739; Merrill p. 208; PR 8316,
ed. 1: 9238; Quenstedt p. 387; Rehder 5: 776; SIA 7177; Tucker 1: 633.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Neue Schr. Ges. Naturf. Freunde Berlin 3: 600-605. 1801 (obit.);
	Pharm. Rundschau 4: 123-124. 1886.
Beard, E., Amer.-German Rev. 25(1): 27-29. 1958 ("doctor-naturalist on tour, 1783-
	1784").

Fenton, C.L. &amp; M.A., Giants of geology 124. 1952.
Goode, G.B., Ann. Rept. Smiths. Inst. 1897(2): 396-397. 1901.

Hoffmann, F., Pharm. Rev. 16: 260-265, 296-302. 1898 (notes from travel reports).
Kelly, H.A., Some Amer. med. bot. 15. 1929.
Kremers, E., Bull. Lloyd. Libr. 6 (reprod. ser. 3): 3-7. 1903 (biogr. sketch as preface to
	fasc. repr. of <em>Mat. med. amer.</em>), (see also Pharm. Rev. 21: 156).

	1851 (coll. and mss. at M).

	Schoepf, <em>Reise nordamer. Staat.</em>, Erlangen 1788.

	documented).
Peters, H., Pharm.-Rundschau 13(7): 151-156. 1895 (detailed account of his American

	(biogr., extensive biogr. refs.).
Rogers, D.P., Brief hist. mycol. N. Amer. ed. 2. 6. 1981.
Sabin, J., Dict. books America 19: 39. 1891.

Urban, I., Symb. ant. 3: 121. 1902.
Williams, G.H., Bull. Geol. Soc. Amer. 5: 591-593. 1894 (contr. to N. Amer. geology).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schoepfianthus</em> H.G.A. Engler ex E. De Wildeman (1907); <em>Schoepfiopsis</em> Miers
(1878). <em>Note</em>: <em>Schoepfia</em> Schreber (1789) probably also honors this author, but no ety-
mology was given.

Scholander, Per Fredrik (1905-1980), Norwegian botanist and zoologist; Dr. phil.
Oslo 1934; research fellow physiology, Univ. Oslo 1934-1939; Rockefeller fellow U.S.A.
1939-1943; research associate at Swarthmore College 1939-1949; at Harvard medical
school 1949-1951; Woods Hole 1952-1955; professor of zoophysiology Oslo 1953-1958;
professor of physiology, Scripps Inst. Oceanogr. 1958. (<em>Schol</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: O; other material in C, M, S.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 237; BL 1: 155, 317, 2: 460, 715; BM 8:

Schomburgk, [Moritz] Richard (1811-1891), German (Prussian Saxony) botanist,
explorer and gardener; in the Royal Guard, Berlin, 1831-1834; gardener at Sanssouci,
Potsdam 1835-1840; travelled (on behalf of the Prussian government) in British Guiana
with his brother Robert 1840-1844; in Berlin 1844-1849; settled in South Australia 1849;
ran a farm at the German colony of Buchsfelde near Gawler, 1849-1865; curator (direc-
tor) of the Adelaide botanical garden 1865-1891. (<em>Ri. Schomb.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Guyana plants at B (mainly destr.); duplicates at BM, BR, C,

PAGE: 296
HEADING: SCHOMBURGK, RI.

CGE, F, G, GOET, K, MO, L, NY, OXF, P, UPS, US, W. – Australian plants at AD
and K, duplicates at E, HBG, LE (impt. set), US, W. – <em>Letters</em> (e.g. to G. Bentham) at
K; to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 240-243; BB p. 270; BL 1: 244, 317; BM 4:

11.016. <em>Reisen in Britisch-Guiana</em> in den Jahren 1840-1844. Im Auftrag S.r Majestät des

PAGE: 297
HEADING: SCHOMBURGK, RI.

Königs von Preussen ausgeführt von Richard Schomburgk. Nebst einer Fauna und
Flora Guiana's nach Vorlagen von Johannes Müller, Ehrenberg, Erichson, Klotzsch,
Troschel, Cabanis und Andern. Mit Abbildungen und einer Karte von Britisch-Guiana
aufgenommen von Sir Robert Schomburgk ... Leipzig (Verlagsbuchhandlung von J.J.
Weber) 1847-1848, 3 vols. Qu. (<em>Reis. Br.</em>-<em>Guiana</em>).

<em>Map</em>: designed by Robert Hermann Schomburgk (1804-1865).
<em>1</em>: 24-27 Nov 1847 (p. viii: Mai 1847; Hinrichs rd 24-27 Nov; map, p. [i]-viii, [ix]-x, [1]-
	469, [470, imprint], map, <em>8 pl</em>. (uncol.).
<em>2</em>: 12-15 Jul 1848 (p. vi: Mar 1848; Hinrichs rd 12-15 Jul 1848), p. [i]-xiv, [1]-530, [1-2,
	err.], <em>8 pl</em>. (id.).
<em>3</em>. 7-10 Mar 1849 (t.p. 1848; Hinrichs rd 7-10 Mar 1849), p. [ii]-viii, [ix], [531]-1260,
	[1261, err.], [1262-colo.], chart A. – Other t.p.: "<em>Versuch einer Fauna und Flora von
	Britisch-Guiana</em>. nach Vorlagen von Johannes Müller ... und Andern. Systematisch
	bearbeitet von Richard Schomburgk." Flora on p. [787]-1260 (by Ri. Schomb. and
	collaborators listed on p. 785); the new names by F. Klotzsch are mostly, if not all,
	nomina nuda. Diatoms by Ehrenberg on p. 537-544 + chart A.

	1-3.
	<em>2</em>: 1923, p. [i-vi], err. slip, [vii-xi], [1]-443, <em>8 pl</em>., maps 4-10.

<em>Publ</em>.: 16 Oct 1879 (Kloot, 1980), p. [1]-13. <em>Copies</em>: B-S, BR, FI, G, HH, M, NY, PH, U.

	taxonomy and nomenclature, evaluation).

11.023. <em>On the Urari</em>: the deadly arrow-poison of the Macusis, an Indian tribe in British
Guiana, ... Adelaide (E. Spiller, ...) 1879. Qu. (<em>Urari</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1879, p. [1]-18. <em>Copies</em>: B, FI, HH, M. – See also Robert Schomburgk, Ann. nat.
	Hist. 7: 401-427. 1841 ("On the Urari"), and Ri. Schomburgk, Trans. Philos. Soc.
	Adelaide 2. 1866 (n.v.); as well as in his Pap. Philos. Soc. 1873, p. 29-42.

Schomburgk, Robert [Hermann] (1804-1865), German (Prussian Saxony; in 1804:
Thuringian) botanist and explorer; elder brother of Richard Schomburgk; commercial
employee in Leipzig 1823-1828; in Richmond, Va. 1828-1829; in St. Thomas 1829-1830;
explored Porto Rico, Tortola and Anegada 1831-1835; from 1835-1839 (discovery of
<em>Victoria regia</em>) and 1840-1844 in British Guiana for the Royal Geogr. Society and the
British Government; in Barbados 1846-1847; British Consul in Sto. Domingo 1848-1857;
id. Bangkok, Thailand 1857-1864; in retirement in Berlin 1864-1865; knighted ("Sir")
1844; Dr. phil. h.c. Königsberg 1844, id. Jena 1858. (<em>Ro. Schomb.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Guyana and Venezuelan collections at BM and K; other
material at AWH, B (mainly destr.), BR, CGE, DS, E, F, G, G-DC, HAL, L, LIVU,
LZ (destr.), MANCH, NY, OXF, P, PH, TCD, U, UPS, US, W. – Siamese plants at K
(240), dupl. B (mainly destr.), P. – The Virgin Island plants went to H.G.L. Reich-
enbach in LZ, those from Barbados and Thailand to B and K, those of St. Domingo in
B, K and P. – The Guyana collections listed as by "Schomburgk" will often be from
Richard rather than from Robert; some of the "other material" listed above may quite
well be of Richard Schomburgk, q.v. (but see Murray 1904 and Steyermark 1981). –
248 original water-colour drawings of British Guiana plants at BM (Woodward 1904). –
<em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G and K. – Field notes at
NY.

PAGE: 299
HEADING: SCHOMBURGK, RO.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schomburghia</em> [<em>sic</em>] A.P. de Candolle (1838); <em>Schomburgkia</em> Lindley (1838); many
names for orchid hybrid genera are based on Lindley's name.

11.024. <em>A description of British Guiana</em>, geographical and statistical: exhibiting its resources
and capabilities, together with the present and future condition and prospects of the
colony ... London (Simpkin, Marshall and Co., ...) 1840. Oct. (<em>Descr. Brit. Guiana</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 8 Mai 1840 (p. iii: Mai 1840; copy presented by author to Geol. Soc. London 8
	Mai 1840), map, p. [i-iv], [1]-155. <em>Copies</em>: Ewan, G, NY.
<em>Facsimile repr</em>.: 1970, London (Cass), (n.v.), 1970, Clifton, N.J. (Kelley), (n.v.).

11.025. Robert Hermann Schomburgk's <em>Reisen in Guiana und am Orinoko</em> während der
Jahre 1835-1839. Nach seinen Berichten und Mittheilungen an die Geographische
Gesellschaft in London herausgegeben von O.A. Schomburgk. Mit einem Nachwort von
Alexander von Humboldt und dessen Abhandlung über einige wichtige astronomische
Positionen Guiana's. Mit 6 colorirten Ansichten und einer Karte. Leipzig (Verlag von
Georg Wigand) 1841. Oct. (<em>Reis. Guiana &amp; Orinoko</em>).

<em>Editor</em>: Otto Alfred Schomburgk (1809-1857), Robert Schomburgk's younger brother;
	emigrated to Australia with the third brother Richard Schomburgk in 1849; died 16

PAGE: 301
HEADING: SCHOPF

	Aug 1857 in the German agricultural colony Buchsfelde, S. Australia. – Preface by
	F.W.H. Alexander von Humboldt (1769-1859), see TL-2/2: 363-371.
<em>Publ</em>.: 3-9 Oct 1841 (p. xxiv: Feb 1841; Hinrichs), p. [i]-xxiv, [1]-510, <em>6 pl</em>. (col. liths.),
	map. <em>Copies</em>: Ewan, HH, G, NY, Wurdack.
<em>English transl</em>.: 1931, by Walter E. Roth, "Robert Hermann Schomburgk's <em>Travels in
	Guiana and on the Orinoco</em> during the years 1835-1839. According to his reports and
	communications to the Geographical Society of London ..." The Argosy Company
	Limited, Georgetown, British Guiana 1931, p. [i]-viii, [1]-202, map, <em>6 pl. Copies</em>: HH,
	J. Wurdack.
<em>Preliminary publ</em>.: Communications by Ro. Schomburgk on his explanation of British
	Guiana and the West Indies were published by him in the Journal of the Royal
	Geographic Society of London as follows: 2: 152-170. 1832, 5: 23-37. 1835, 6: 224-
	284. 1836, 7: 285-301, 302-305. 1837, 10: 159-190, 191-247, 248-267. 1841, 12: 169-
	177, 178-198. 1842, 13: 18-74. 1843, 15: 1-103. 1845, 23: 264-284. 1853 [in Siam], 31:
	302-321. 1861. – Another series of papers, on "Travels in British Guiana" and on
	special discoveries was published in Ann. Mag. nat. Hist. 1: 63-68. 1838 (discovery of
	Victoria regia), 2: 255-260. 1839, 4: 322-328. 1840, 5: 29-35, 202-204, 282-288, 343-
	348, 399-405. 1840, 7: 151, 407-427 (on Urari). 1841, 20: 115-127 (Barbados), 396-
	409. 1847. German reports on the Guiana expeditions were published in the
	Monatschr. Ges. Erdk. Berlin 1: 196-204. 1844, 2: 66-75. 1845, on Barbados 4: 62-75.
	1847. For a detailed list of publications in journals between 1832 and 1863 see CSP 5:
	520-522.
