Schopf, James [Morton] (1911-1978), American palaeobotanist; Dr. phil. Univ.
Illinois 1937; assistant bot. dept. Univ. Illinois 1930-1933; with the Illinois State Geo-
logical Survey 1934; assistant geologist ib. 1935-1943; with the U.S. Bureau of Mines,

PAGE: 302
HEADING: SCHOPF

Pittsburgh 1943-1947; with the U.S. Geological Survey, Washington 1947-1949, id.
Coal Geology Lab., Columbus Ohio 1949-1976; member of the Editorial Committee of
the International Code of botanical Nomenclature 1969-1978; member, later chairman,
of the International Committee on the Nomenclature of fossil plants 1950-1978. (<em>Schopf</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ILLS. – Palaeobotanical types in Illinois Geological Survey,
Urbana, Ills., and in USGS.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 328; Barnhart 3: 238 (b. 2 Jan 1911); Bossert
p. 355; MW suppl. p. 309; Rehder 5: 777; Roon p. 100.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Andrews, H.N., The fossil hunters 130, 240-242. 1980.
Anon., Columbus Citizen-Journal 16 Sep 1978 (obit., d. 15 Sep 1978); I.O.P. Newslet-
	ter 7: I. Oct 1978 (d.); Ohio J. Sci. 79(4): 192. 1979 (obit. not; Mary Clark Thom-
	pson medal N.A.S. 1976).
Cattell, J.M. &amp; J., eds., Amer. Men Sci. ed. 6. 1251. 1938; ed. 7: 1567. 1944, ed. 8: 2197.

	1979, 4 p. (obit., portr., selected bibl.).

	231, 232. 1941, 7: 227. 1943.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: Mt. Schopf, Ohio Range, Central Antarctica; taxa: <em>Schopfia</em> Janssen (1940),
<em>Schopfiastrum</em> H.N. Andrews (1945), <em>Schopfites</em> Kosanke 1950, <em>Schopfipollenites</em> Potonié &amp;
Kremp. (1954), <em>Schopfitheca</em> Delevoryas 1964, <em>Schopfaspis</em> Palmer &amp; Gatehouse 1972.

Schopfer, William Henri (1900-1962), Swiss botanist and microbiologist; student of
R. Chodat, Genève; Dr. phil. Genève 1928; lecturer in plant physiology at Genève 1929-
1933; professor of botany and director of the botanical garden of Bern University 1933-
1962. (<em>Schopfer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schorler, Bernhard (1859-1920), German (Saxonian) botanist; studied in Jena and
Leipzig; high school teacher in Dresden 1887; curator of the herbarium of the Sächsische
Gartenbauschule, from 1898 at the herbarium and library of the Technische
Hochschule, Dresden. (<em>Schorler</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – Letters at G.

no. 486; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8275-8276; BJI 1: 52, 2: 158; LS 24159-24160; Nordstedt p.
14, suppl. 11; Rehder 1: 125, 137, 389; SO add. 884a; Tucker 1: 634.

breitesten Pflanzen Deutschland</em>, and eds. 10 (1912) and 11 (1919) of <em>Die Pflanzen Sachsens</em>.

Schott, Arthur [Carl Victor] (1814-1875), German (Württemberg) naturalist,
explorer and plant collector; manager of several estates in Germany and in charge of a
mining property in Hungary; travelled in S. Europe, Turkey and Arabia 1848; to the
United States 1850; in New York 1850-1851; surveyor on the Mexican Boundary Survey
1851-1864; in the field 1851-1853, 1854, 1855, 1857, but stationed at Washington D.C.;
in charge of a geological survey of Yucatan 1864-1866; in various Government functions
in Washington, D.C. 1866-1875. (<em>A. Schott</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Personal herbarium at F; Mexican Boundary Survey material at
NY and US. Duplicates: BM (1000, from Yucatan), G, GH, ILL, L, MEDEL, MO,
STU, W. Some material from Austria-Hungary in F. – Letters to John Torrey at NY.
Daniel (1981) remarks that the specimens collected on the Mexican Boundary Survey
often went directly to specialists, and that Schott's specimens went directly to John
Torrey (now NY). – <em>Letters</em> to W.G. Farlow at FH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 238 (b. 27 Feb 1814, d. 26 Jul 1875); BM 4:
1857; Bossert p. 355; CSP 5: 538, 8: 884; IF p. 729; Langman p. 683; Lenley p. 468
(Torrey corr.); ME 3: 651; Plesch p. 334; Rehder 2: 153, 396, 681; SIA 95, 201; TL-
1/see W.H. Emory; TL-2: 1616, 1670; see W.H. Emory; Tucker 1: 634.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Gaz. 23: 228. 1897 (complete personal herbarium acquired by F);
[-r], Flora 52: 47. 1869 (coll. Yucatan); Leopoldina 11: 164. 1875 (d.).
Barnhart J.H., J. New York Bot. Gard. 28: 132-133. 1927, 30: 280-281. 1928 (biogr.

HEADING: SCHOTT, A.

	sketch); <em>in</em> F.W. Pennell, Monogr. Acad. nat. Sci. Philadelphia 1: 618. 1935 (coll. F).

	John Torrey).
Embacher, F., Lexik. Reisen 263. 1882.

Schott, Heinrich Wilhelm (1794-1865), Moravian-born Austrian botanist; gardener
at the Belvedere palace, Wien 1815; with J.C. Mikan, Natterer and J.B.E. Pohl to Brazil
1817-1821; gardener at Schönbrunn 1821; director id. 1845-1865; Dr. phil. h.c. Jena
1858. (<em>Schott</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: <em>Aroideae</em> in W (destroyed by war action); general herbarium
(including Araceae) in BP (went to Mexico with Maximilian; came afterwards in the
hands of cardinal Haynald (Szujkó-Lacza 1975)); Duplicates: B (mainly destr.), BR, G,
H (mainly Schott Sr.), K, L, M, NY, OXF, STU, U, US, W (other Brazilian material).
– Material labelled Schott from the Vienna botanical garden 1802-1819 usually stems
from Heinrich Schott (1759-1819), Schott's father. – Ca. 3300 <em>water-colours and drawings</em>
made for Schott at W. Available on IDC microfiche no. 8801. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von
Schlechtendal at HAL, to F.A.W. Miquel in U; other letters at GH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 399-404 (E. Wunschmann); AG 7: 117; Backer
p. 519; Barnhart 3: 239 (b. 7 Jan 1794, d. 5 Mar 1865); BM 2: 529, 4: 1857-1858; Clokie
p. 240; CSP 5: 539-541, 8: 884, 12: 663; DTS 1: 270, 271; Frank 3 (Anh.): 92; GF p. 75;
Hegi 5(2): 1377. 6(1): 17; Herder p. 148, 271, 290, 317, 337; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p.
115, 123; Kanitz 219; Langman p. 683-684; Lasègue p. 332, 477, 505, 528; Maiwald p.
178; Moebius p. 404, 409; MW p. 440; NI 1789-1794, see also 1: 189, 191, 192; PR
8330-8341, 2693, ed. 1: 2992, 9258-9260, 9338; Quenstedt p. 387; RS p. 140; TL-1/ 351,
1177-1182; TL-2/1678, 6726, see S.F.L. Haynald, C.F. Nyman (see J.C. Mikan for coll.
Brazil); Tucker 1: 634; WU 31: 245-251; Urban-Berl. p. 394; Zander ed. 10, p. 713, ed.
11, p. 813, 814.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) Schott's father, Heinrich Schott (1759-1819), born in Breslau (Silesia), was
head gardener under J.F. von Jacquin of the University botanical garden Wien, 1802-
1819; for biogr. refs. see e.g. Klásterský p. 167 and Th. Kotzschy, Verh. zool.-bot. Ver.
Wien 7: 111-112. 1857.
(2) Main bibliography: Riedl, H., Taxon 14: 212-213. 1965, 15: 44. 1966.
(3) <em>Miscellanea botanica</em>, a facsimile ed. of various papers published in periodicals, was
offered for subscription Sep 1972, by Akad. Druck-Verlagsanst., Graz.
(4) <em>Illustrationes selectae Aracearum</em>, a volume of 60 col. plates reproduced from the
originals in W, was offered for subscription ca. 1972 by Akad. Buch-Verlagsanst. Graz.
The complee collection of drawings is now available on microfiche IDC 8801 (3300
drawings).
(5) For the publication of new taxa by Schott in the <em>Wiener Zeitschrift für Kunst, Literatur</em>,

PAGE: 306
HEADING: SCHOTT, H.

<em>Theater und Mode</em> 1829-1830, see D.H. Nicolson, Taxon 31: 549-551. 1982 (set of journal
at W). – Available on microfiche IDC 8866.
(6) 45 journal publications on Araceae, as listed in Taxon 14: 211-213. 1965, are
available on microfiche IDC 8862.

11.034. <em>Tagebücher</em> des k.k. Gärtners, Hrn. H. Schott, in Brasilien, von dessen Reisen in
die Campos am Paraiba und Paraibuna-Flusse [sic] und durch den Distrikt von Canta
Gallo; dann nach Macaçu und am Flusse gleiches Nahmens, von Rio de Janeiro aus ...
[Anhang, Nachrichten Brasilien, ed. K. v. Schreibers, Brünn (Bei Joseph Georg
Trassler) 1820]. Oct. (<em>Tagebücher</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1820 (p. 80: 18 Apr 1820), p. [1]-80, new Brazilian taxa in Anhang ii: [81]-114,
	[116, err.]. <em>Copy</em>: LC. – Appendix, independently paginated, to K. v. Schreibers,
	<em>Nachrichten von den kaiserl. österreichischen Naturforschern in Brasilien</em> und den Resultaten
	ihrer Betriebsamkeit. Aus den Amtsrelationen der k.k. Gesandtschaft am Hofe von
	Rio de Janeiro an das k.k. Ministerium der auswärtigen Angelegenheiten in Wien,
	aus den Berichten und Briefen der Naturforscher an den k.k. Hof-
	Naturalienkabinetsdirector, Herrn Karl von Schreibers, als Referenten des wissen-
	schaftlichen Antheiles der Expedition, und nach Untersuchung und Befund der ein-
	gesendeten naturhistorischen Gegenstände der k.k. Hof-Naturalienkabinetsdirection.
	Brünn (Bei Joseph Georg Trassler) 1820. Oct.

11.035. <em>Neue brasilianische Pflanzen</em>. Gesammelt und nach der Natur beschrieben von
Heinrich Schott, k.k. Gärtner in Brasilien. Erste Lieferung. Aus den medicinischen
Jahrbüchern vi. Bd. ii. St. besonders abgedruckt [Wien, 1820]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1820, p. [1]-9. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted and to be cited from Med. Jahrb. k.k.
	Oesterr. Staat. 6(2): 59-67. 1820. – Diagnoses reprinted in Flora 4(1): 196-198. 7 Apr
	1821. – Not continued in this form but see below.
<em>Second fascicle</em>: 1827, Henrici Schott <em>fasciculus plantarum brasiliensium</em>, in K.P.J. Sprengel,
	Syst. veg. 4(2)(curae post.): 403-410. 1827.

11.036. <em>Meletemata botanica</em> auctoribus Henrico Schott &amp; Stephano Endlicher. Vindo-
bonae [Wien] (typis Caroli Gerold) 1832. Fol. (<em>Melet. bot.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Stephan Ladislaus Endlicher (1804-1849).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1832, p. [i, iii], [1]-36, <em>pl. 1-5</em> (uncol. liths. by J. Zehner). <em>Copies</em>: G, HH, NY,
	USDA; IDC 722. – Authorship of new genera is joint except where abbreviated
	names are appended (e.g. "Schtt" for Schott in the Araceae). Ten copies were sent by
	Endlicher to Bentham, (letter K on 9 Jan 1834; on 12 Mai 1833 Endlicher states that
	only 50 copies were issued, none of them for sale. This accounts for the rarity of the
	book as well for the circumstance that the book is rarely mentioned in the contempor-
	ary literature.
<em>Facsimile ed</em>.: Dec 1964, published by J. Cramer (Weinheim), Christmas gift; 100 copies.
	No new text; the reprint is identified by a label on p. 2 of the cover. <em>Copies</em>: B, FAS(2),
	Nicolson, U.
<em>Ref</em>.: Guillemin, A., Arch. bot. 1: 246-252, 422-428. 1833.
	Hooker, W.J., J. Bot. 1: 161. 1834.

11.037. <em>Rutaceae</em>. Fragmenta botanica, auctore H. Schott. Vindobonae [Wien] (apud
Joannem Bapt. Wallishausser) 1834. Fol. (<em>Rutaceae</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1834, p. [i-iii], [1]-14, <em>pl. 1-7</em> (uncol. liths. J. Oberer, J. Zehner, Fe. Bauer). <em>Copies</em>:
	B-S, G, HH, USDA. – See also Ann. Sci. nat. Bot. ser. 2: 230-234. 1834.

11.044. <em>Analecta botanica</em>. Scripta a H. Schott, adjutoribus C.F. Nyman et Th. Kotschy. I.
Vindobonae [Wien] (Typis Caroli Gerold &amp; Filii) 1854. †. (<em>Analect. bot.</em>).

<em>Contributors</em>: Carl Fredrik Nyman (1820-1893), Carl Georg Theodor Kotschy (1813-
	1866).
<em>Publ</em>.: Mar 1854 (p. viii "mense Martio"; Bot. Not. Nov-Dec 1854), p. [i]-viii, [1]-64.
	<em>Copies</em>: B, B-S, FI, G, HH, MO, NY, Teyler, USDA; IDC 699.
<em>Commentary</em>: A. Neilreich, <em>Über Schott's Analecta botanica</em>, Sitz.-Ber. Akad. Wiss., Wien
	58(1): 552-574. 1868 (TL-2/6726), a study of Schott's new taxa on the basis of the

PAGE: 308
HEADING: SCHOTT, H.

	type specimens in his herbarium, then in the hands of Haynald, now at BP. – Neil-
	reich states that Schott was indeed the real author and that the contributions by
	Nyman and Kotschy were negligible.
<em>Extracts</em>: Österr. bot. W. 5: 341-343, 349-351, 357-358, 366-367, 373-374, 381-391, 396-
	398, 406, 413-414. 1855, 6: 3-4, 14-15, 22-23, 29-30, 37-38, 45-46, 55. 1856.
<em>Ref</em>.: A.K., Flora 52: 323-325. 1869 (rev. Neilreich's paper).

11.046. <em>Synopsis Aroidearum</em> complectens enumerationem systematicam generum et spec-
ierum hujus ordinis. Auctore H. Schott. I. Vindobonae [Wien] (Typis Congregationis
Mechitharisticae) 1856. Oct. †. (<em>Syn. Aroid.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Mar 1856 (Bonplandia 15 Apr 1856; "M. Martio 1856), p. [i, iii], [1]-140. <em>Copies</em>:

	Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Bot. Zeit. 17: 368. 28 Oct 1859 (rev.).
<em>Note</em>: the book was printed by the print shop of the Mechitarists, an order of Armenian
	monks founded by Peter Mekhitar (1701, Constantinople) with a chief seat in San
	Lazzaro nr Venice, and an independent monastery in Vienna.

11.047. <em>Icones aroidearum</em> editae a H. Schott. Vindobonae [Wien] 1857 [-1859]. Fol. (<em>Icon.
aroid.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1857-1859 [-1860?] (in four fascicles; Heft 1, <em>pl. 1-10</em> rev. Bonplandia 15 Aug 1857,
	Hooker (1857) Dec 1857; fasc. 4. by Jul 1861 BSbF; fasc. 2/3 came out in a combined
	Heft in 1857 or 1858), p. [i], <em>pl. 1-40</em> (uncol. liths. Joh. Oberer; originals in W). <em>Copies</em>:
	BR, FI, G, HH, NSUB, NY; IDC 1031. – Eduard Hölzel, bookseller in Olmütz
	announces in Bonplandia 7: 12. 15 Jan 1859 that he has received the book in Com-
	mission. Three Hefte, <em>30 pl</em>. are out and available in black and white and with
	coloured plates. From this announcement it is clear that by 15 Jan 1859 Heft 4 (<em>pl. 35-
	40</em>) had not yet been published. The fourth fascicle is announced as "recently pub-
	lished" by Bull. Soc. bot. France 8: 256. Jul 1860.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon. Bonplandia 5: 247. 15 Aug 1857 (rev. fasc. 1, <em>pl. 1-10</em>).
	Hooker, W.J., J. Bot. Kew Gard. Misc. 9: 380. Dec 1857 (rev. fasc. 1).

Schottky, Ernst Max (1888-1915), German (Zürich-born) botanist; studied natural

PAGE: 309
HEADING: SCHOUSBOE

sciences and geography at the University of Berlin; especially botany under A. Engler;
Dr. phil. Berlin 1912; active in the "Wandervögel" movement; on active duty (war-time
volunteer) in the German army 1914; fell at La Bassée on 12 Jan 1915. (<em>Schottky</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (material on which his thesis was based; destr.).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 661; Barnhart 3: 239 (b. 17 Feb 1888, d. 22
Jan 1915); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8279; BJI 2: 158; DTS 6(4): 194; Hortus 3: 1203; MW p.
440; WU 31: 251-253. 1836.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Torreya 15: 60. 1915 (on correspondence from battlefield near Arras on
	ferns); Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 57: 244. 1916 (d.).
Harms, H., Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 58: 1-5. 1916 (obit.).
Schottky, E., Ernst Schottky's Lebensbeschreibung, von ihm selbst erzählt (1913), with
	additional text on 1914-1915 by the Schottky family <em>in</em> Gedenkblatt an Dr. Ernst
	Schottky, Kriegsfreiwilligen im 169. badischen Infanterie-Regiment, gefallen am 12
	Januar 1915 bei La Bassee. Seinen Freunden und allen die ihm nahe standen gewid-
	met von der Familie Schottky. [Berlin, Rosenthal &amp; Co., 7 p., <em>copy</em>: Engler coll. at
	DS].
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 3: 22. 1937.

11.050. <em>Die Eichen des extratropischen Ostasiens</em> und ihre pflanzengeographische Bedeutung.
Inaugural-Dissertation zur Erlangung der Doktorwürde genehmigt von der Philosophi-
schen Facultät der Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität zu Berlin ... [1912]. Oct. (<em>Eichen
extratrop. Ostas.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 8 Mai 1912 (as thesis), p. [i-iii], [617]-707, [1, vita], <em>pl</em>. 37. <em>Copies</em>: B, FAS. –
	Preprinted from Bot. Jahrb. 47: [617-707, [708, expl. <em>pl. 38</em>], <em>pl. 37-38</em>. – The map on
	<em>pl. 38</em> and the accompanying text on p. [708] of the journal are not included in the
	thesis.

Schousboe, Peder Kofod Anker (1766-1832), Danish botanist and traveller; studied
botany in Copenhagen with e.g. Rottbtøll; associated with the Copenhagen Botanical
Garden and as such sent to collect in Spain and Morocco 1791-1793; counseller at the
college of economic and commercial studies 1797; travelled in Spain and Portugal 1797-
1798; consul for Denmark at Tangier 1801-1821, consul general 1821-1832. (<em>Schousb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: C; main set of algae (and 431 unpublished plates) acquired by
Cosson; now at PC. Other material in B-W (100 specim. from Portugal, extant), BM,
BR, FI, GOET, K (927), KIEL, L, LD, P, S, UPS (Thunberg), W. Sets of algae
collected by Schousboe were distributed, with identifications, by Thuret and Bornet,
through L. Kralik in 1883. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Algae Schousboeanae</em>, fasc. 1-4, nos. 1-494. 1883
(see E. Bornet, Rev. gen. Bot. 1: 5. 1889).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 661; Barnhart 3: 239 (bapt. 17 Aug 1766, d. 26
Feb 1832); BM 4: 1858; Frank 3 (Anh.): 92; Herder p. 218; Hortus 3: p. 1203; Jackson
p. 351; KR 629-630; Lasègue p. 441, 504; PR 8343, ed. 1: 9264; Rehder 5: 777; TL-
2/665; Tucker 1: 635; Urban-Berl. p. 268, 394, 415; Zander ed. 10, p. 713, ed. 11, p.
814.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 41: 487. 20 Jul 1883 (sets of algae distr. by L. Kralik); Dansk
	biogr. Leks. 21: 331. 1941.
Bornet, E., Mém. Soc. Natl. Sci. nat. math. Cherbourg 28: 165-376. 1892 (Les algues de
	P.-K.-A. Schousboe).
Candolle, Alph. de, Phytographie 448. 1880 (coll.).
Christensen, C., Dansk. bot. hist. 1: 123, 127, 153, 188, 250. 1924 (portr.), 2: 140-142.
	1924 (bibl.), Dansk biogr. Leks. 21: 331. 1941.
Cosson, E., Comp. fl. atl. 1: 10-11, 90. 1881.
Cosson &amp; Durieu, Exp. sci. Algérie, Bot. 2: xvii, xlv. 1868; Intr. fl. Alg. xvii.
Hornschuch, C.F., Flora 8(1): 315. 1825 (S. plans to publish a treatise on Mediter-
	ranean algae; many plates ready).

PAGE: 310
HEADING: SCHOUSBOE

Hornemann, J., Nat. Tidskr. 1: 577-578. 1837.
Koster, J.T., Taxon 18: 557. 1969 (coll. algae).
Fischer-Benzon, R.J.D. von, <em>in</em> P. Prahl, Krit. Fl. Schlesw.-Holst. 2: 53. 1890.
Maire, R., Bull. Soc. Hist. nat. Afr. Nord 16: 4-7. 1925 (biogr. sketch, portr.).
Schouw, J.F., Flora 7(1): 286. 1824 (still actively coll. algae in Morocco).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 150. 1982.
Warming, E., Bot. Tidsskr. 12: 92-93. 1880 (bibl.).
Zimsen, E., The type material of I.C. Fabricius 13. 1964 (brief note; entomol. coll.).

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: J.B.E. Bornet, <em>Alg. Schousboe</em> 1892, TL-2/665; IDC (6344). – Treat-
ment of the algae collected by Schousboe between 1815 and 1829; reviewed by P.
Hariot, Bull. Soc. bot. France 40(bibl.): 137-139.
1893.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Webbia 32(1): 34 (no. 68). 1977.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schousboea</em> Willdenow (1799); <em>Schousboea</em> H.C.F. Schumacher (1827).

11.051. <em>Iagttagelser over Vextriget i Marokko</em>. Förste Stykke Ved P.K.A. Schousboe ...
Kjöbenhavn (Trykt for Forfatteren hos K.H. Seidelin] 1800. Qu. (<em>Iagttag. Vextrig.
Marokko</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1800 (preprint dated 1800; t.p. journal 1800(1): 1801), p. [1]-204, [1, err.], <em>pl. 1-4,
	5a, 5b, 6-7</em> (uncol. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: B-S, HH. – Preprinted from K. Danske Vid. Selsk.
	Skr. 1800(1): 1-204 [205, err.], <em>pl. 1-4, 5a, 5b</em>, 6-7. 1801.
<em>German transl</em>.: 1801, Schr. phys. Klasse Kön. Dän. Ges. Wiss. Kopenhagen 1(1): [i]-xvi,
	[1]-186, <em>pl. 1-2</em>. 1801. – Also issued separately as "P.K.A. Schousboe's <em>Beobachtungen</em>
	über das Gewachsreich in Marokko gesammelt auf einer Reise in den Jahren 1791-
	1793. Erster Theil. Mit Kupfern. Aus dem Dänischen übersetzt von Johannes
	Ambrosius Markussen," Kopenhagen und Leipzig (bey Johann Heinrich Schubothe)
	1801, Oct., p. [ii*-iii*], [i]-xvi, [1]-186, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (col.). <em>Copies</em>: G, HH.
<em>French transl</em>.: 1874, "Iagttagelser over Vextriget i Marokko. <em>Observations sur le règne végétal
	au Maroc</em> ... édition Française-Latine ... par le Dr E.-L. Bertherand ... et augmentée
	de la synononymie actuelle par M. le professeur J. Lange ..." Paris (chez J.-B.
	Baillière et fils, ...) 1874. Oct. (<em>Obs. règne vég. Maroc</em>), p. [i]-xvi, [1]-202, <em>pl. 1-4, 5a, 5b,
	6</em>, 7 (uncol. liths., de Labruyère). <em>Copies</em>: BR, G, HH, MO, USDA. – A copy was sent
	by Bertherand through Trabut to the Société botanique de Lyon from Algeria on 10
	Mar 1874, see Ann. Soc. bot. Lyon 2: 43-44. 1875 (report séance 19 Mar 1874); J.
	Bot. Jun 1874; Bull. Soc. bot. France séance 13 Mar 1874. The book was printed in
	Algeria.

Schoute, Johannes Cornelis (1877-1942), Dutch botanist; studied at the University of
Groningen, student of J.W. Moll; Dr. phil. Groningen 1902; assistant for botany ib.
1900-1902; in Buitenzorg, Indonesia 1903; with the State Seed Testing Station at
Wageningen 1903-1907; high school teacher at Gouda 1908-1911; at Bussum 1911-1917;
professor of botany at Groningen 1917-1931; in early retirement at Groningen dedicat-
ing himself mainly to research on plant morphology. (<em>Schoute</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GRO; duplicates at L.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 239 (b. 16 Mai 1877); BFM no. 2443; Biol.-
Dokum. 16: 8280; BJI 2: 158; BM 4: 1848; Hirsch p. 266; JW 1: 448, 2: 200, 4: 405 (q.v.
for Dutch refs. to obits.); Moebius p. 209, 218, 220; SK 1: 475, 4: cxxix, cxli; TL-2/6219;
Tucker 3: 274.

Schouw, Joakim Frederik (1789-1852), Danish botanist; Dr. phil. Copenhagen 1816;
travelled in Germany, Italy, France and Switzerland 1816-1820; extraordinary professor
of botany Copenhagen 1821; in Italy and Paris 1829-1830; journal editor 1831-1836,
1842-1846; teacher at the Copenhagen polytechnic 1832-1840; director of the Copenha-
gen botanical garden 1841; ordinary professor of botany ib. 1845; state counsel 1847; co-
founder "Naturhistorisk Forening". (<em>Schouw</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: C. – Further material at G, G-DC, P, TRH. – Correspondence
and manuscripts at C (see Christensen 1924, p. 179). – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlech-
tendal at HAL, to F.A.W. Miquel at U, other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 5(4): 171; Barnhart 3: 239 (b. 7 Feb 1789, d. 28 Apr
1852); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8281; BM 4: 1858; Bossert p. 355; Christiansen p. 23, 295; CSP
5: 542-543, 6: 755; DSB 12: 214-215 (A.P.M. Sanders); DTS 1: 400; Frank 3 (Anh.): 92;
GR p. 685; Herder p. 148, 167, 168, 194, 294, 295, 296; Jackson p. 223, 445; Kleppa p.
235, 236, 263; KR p. 630; Langman p. 684; Lasègue: p. 532, 540; LS 24181, 41718;
Moebius p. 372; PR 8344-8350, 4167, 6799, ed. 1: 4612, 7601, 9265-9276; Rehder 5:
777; Saccardo 1: 150, 2: 99; SO 1061; TL-1/933; TL-2/7001, see F.M. Liebmann, E.E.
Nolte; Tucker 1: 635.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 1: 51, 110. 1853, 2: 267. 1854 (cogn. Leopoldina: Bergius);
	Bot. Zeit. 1: 783-784. 1843 (co-founder Naturh. For.), 4: 160. 1846 (ord. prof. bot.),

	Prominent Danish Scientists 100-103. 1932.

<em>English</em>: 1852, map, p. [i-iv], [1]-240. <em>Copies</em>: MO, PH. – Christensen 94b. – <em>The Earth,
	plants, and man</em>. Popular pictures of nature ... translated and edited [from the German
	ed.] by Arthur Henfrey, ... London (Henry G. Bohn, ...) 1852. Oct.
(<em>Earth, pl., man</em>).

Schrader, Christian Friedrich (174.-1816), German (Prussian) botanist and clergy-
man; at a teacher's college in Halle, pastor at Burg; ultimately first pastor and inspector
of schools and churches at Burg in the Jerichow district nr Magdeburg. (<em>C. Schrad.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 239 (d. 9 Jun 1816); BM 4: 1859; Dryander
3: 33, 122; Herder p. 142; Jackson p. 427; PR 8351-8352, ed. 1: 9275-9276; Rehder 1:
44, 254.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Hamburger-Meusel, Gelehrte Deutschl. 7: 293-294. 1798, 10: 621. 1803, 20:
	265. 1825.
Hultén, E., Bot. Not. 1940: 312. (expl. Alaska; coll. at US).

11.077. <em>Index plantarum horti botanici paedagogii regii Glauchensis</em>. Duod. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1772 (NZgS 18 Mar 1773), 52 p. (n.v.; copy at BM, Bloomsbury).

11.078. <em>Genera plantarum selecta</em> in usum tironum botanophilorum methodo tabellari ador-
navit M. Christianus Fridericus Schrader paedagogii regii inspector. Halae [Halle a.S.]
(typis Orphanotrophei) 1780. Oct. (<em>Gen. pl. select.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1780, p. [1]-54. <em>Copies</em>: B, HH, NY.

Schrader, Frank Charles (1860-1940), American geologist and botanist; A.M.
Harvard 1893; assistant entomologist Kansas 1889-1891; with Massachusetts Board of
Agric. 1893-1894; teacher geology Harvard 1895-1896; assistant geologist and geologist
U.S. Geol. Survey from 1896; as such on Capt. Abercrombie's Military Exploring
Expedition in Alaska 1898-1902. (<em>F. Schrad.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: US (300 specimens Alaska, coll. 1898-1902).

PAGE: 316
HEADING: SCHRADER, F.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 239 (b. 6 Oct 1860); BM 4: 1859.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Cattell, J.M., Amer. men Sci. ed. 2. 414. 1910.
Hulten, E., Bot. Not. 1940: 423 (Alaska coll.).
Marquis, A.N., ed., Who's who in America 8: 2072-2073. 1914.

11.079. <em>A reconnaissance in northern Alaska</em> across the Rocky Mountains, along Koyukuk,
John, Anaktuvuk, and Colville Rivers, and the Arctic Coast to Cape Lisburne, in 1901
... Washington (Government Printing Office) 1904. Oct. (<em>Reconn. n. Alaska</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1904 (p. 9: 3 Aug 1903), p. [1]-139, <em>pl. 1-16. Copy</em>: US. – Prof. Paper U.S. Geol.
	Surv. no. 20, 1904. – Plants on p. 130-134.

Schrader, Heinrich Adolph (1767-1836), German (Hildesheim/Hannover) botanist;
Dr. med. Göttingen 1795; lecturer (1797); extra-ordinary professor (1802/3) and regular
professor of botany (1809) at Göttingen University; director of the Göttingen botanical
garden 1802/3-1836, succeeding G.F. Hoffman. (<em>Schrad</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE. – Other material at B (mainly destr.), BP, FI (garden pl.), G
(through herb. Ventenat), GOET (incidental and exsicc), H-ACH, LIV, LZ (destr.),
M, UPS (gard. pl.), PH (grasses and sedges through Muhlenberg). – <em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Systemat-
ische Sammlung cryptogamischer Gewächse</em>, fasc. 1-2, nos. 1-174, Göttingen 1767-1795 (1: nos.
1-90, 1796, 2: nos. 91-174. 1797; 1-24 pterid., 25-91 mosses, 92-115 hep., 116-174 lich.).
<em>Index</em>: Usteri, P., Ann. Bot. 20: 100-115. 1796, 22: 75-87. 1797. <em>Sets</em>: B (destr.), GOET,
HAL, KIEL, L, M. – <em>Text</em> see below. – <em>Letters</em> to J.E. Smith at LINN; to D.F.L. von
Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 429-430 (E. Wunschman); AG 2(1): 628, 12(2):
206; Backer p. 520; Barnhart 3: 239 (b. 1 Jan 1767, d. 21 Oct 1836); BM 4: 1859, 8:
1161, 1860; Bossert p. 355; CSP 5: 534-544; Dryander 3: 119-152, 498; DTS 1: 271; DU
279; Frank 3 (Anh.): 92; GR p. 46, cat. p. 71; Hawksworth p. 185; Hegi 6(1): 16, 6(2):
1264; Herder p. 477 [index]; IF p. 729; IH 1 (ed. 7): 342; Jackson p. 146, 292, 350, 426;
Krempelh. p. 52-54; Langman p. 684; Lasègue p. 70, 339; LS 24182-24186; MW p. 440;
NI 1795-1802; PR 8355-8371, 8874, ed. 1: 9280-9298 9849; Rehder 5: 778; RS p. 140;
Saccardo 1: 150, 2: 99; SBC p. 131; Stevenson p. 1257; TL-1/1183-1189; TL-2/9769, see
J.H.F. Link; Tucker 1: 635, 3: 274; Urban-Berl. p. 262, 290; Zander ed. 10, p. 713, ed.
11, p. 814.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: Editor, with K.P.J. Sprengel and H.F. Link of <em>Jahrbücher der
Gewächskunde</em> [1818]-1820 (only one volume published). See under K.P.J. Sprengel.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Webbia 32(1): 37. 1977 (no. 70).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) D.F.L. von Schlechtendal published <em>Reliquiae Schraderianae</em> in Linnaea 12: 360-
476. Apr-Sep 1838, containing those passages in the unpublished mansucripts left upon
Schrader's death which "looked worth while to be published".
(2) Diagnoses of new species published by H.A. Schrader in <em>Index seminum horti academici
goettingensis</em> 1831, 1832 were reprinted in Linnaea 8 (Litt.): 22-27. 1834; those in the
Index for 1834 in Ann. Sci. nat., Bot. ser. 2. 6: 98-102. Aug 1836.
(3) For eponymy see addenda (last page volume).

11.081. <em>Sertum hannoveranum</em> seu plantae rariores quae in hortis regiis Hannoverae vicinis
coluntur. Descriptae ab Henrico Adolpho Schrader delineatae et sculptae a Joanne
Christophoro Wendland ... Goettingae [Göttingen] (prostat venale apud Vandenhoeck
et Ruprecht) 1795-1798, 4 parts. †. Fol. (<em>Sert. hannov.</em>).

	Wendland (1755-1828).
<em>Publ</em>.: in four parts 1795-1798, see below. <em>Copies</em>: G, HH, M(part 1); IDC 5724.

	Continued by J.C. Wendland as <em>Hortus herrenhusanus</em>, 4 parts, 1798-1801.
<em>Ref</em>.: Usteri, P., Neue Ann. Bot. 9: 114-117. 1795 (rev. fasc. 1).

11.083. <em>Nova genera plantarum</em> ... Pars prima ... Lipsiae [Leipzig] (apud Siegfried

11.084. <em>Journal für die Botanik</em>. Herausgegeben vom Medicinalrath Schrader. Erster

PAGE: 318
HEADING: SCHRADER, H. A.

Band. 1799 ... Göttingen (bei Joh. Christ. Dieterich) 1799. Oct. [in all 5 vols., 1799-
1804]. (<em>J. Bot.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: The original scheme was to publish 2 vols. (Bände) each year, in two parts
	(Stücke); volumes identified by year date followed by (1) or (2). This scheme could
	not be maintained: the one volume for 1801 came out between Apr 1803 and Apr
	1804; Schrader then changed the title to <em>Neues Journal für die Botanik</em> and designated
	the volumes with numbers (1-4) only (see below). <em>Copies</em>: B-S, BR, FI, G, HH, H-UB,
	MO, NY, PH.
	<em>1799</em>(<em>1</em>), <em>Stück 1</em>: Feb 1799, p. [i]-viii, [1]-272, <em>pl. 1-3</em> (uncol. copp.).
	<em>1799</em>(<em>2</em>), <em>Stück 2</em>: Aug 1799, p. [i], [273]-526, [1, err.], <em>pl. 1-3</em> (id.); <em>preface matter</em> for
	entire volume: frontisp. portr. C.P. Thunberg, p. [i-vi].
	<em>1799</em>(<em>2</em>), <em>Stück 1</em>: Sep 1799, p. [i*], [i]-lii, [1]-200, <em>pl. 1-3</em> (uncol. copp. O. Swartz).
	<em>1799</em>(<em>2</em>), <em>Stück 2</em> (also as "Viertes Stück): Apr 1800, p. [i], [201]-502, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (uncol.
	copp.); t.p. vol. 2 for 1799: [i**], dated 1799, with frontisp. portr. N.J. Jacquin for
	entire volume.
<em>1800</em>(<em>1</em>), <em>Stück 1</em>: Jun 1800, [i-vi], [1]-220, <em>pl. 1/2, 3/4, 5-7</em> (id.).
	<em>1800</em>(<em>1</em>), <em>Stück 2</em>: Apr 1801, p. [221]-446, [447-448], <em>pl. 1-2</em> (id.); t.p. vol. 1 for 1800:
	[i*], dated 1801; issued with frontisp. portr. M. Vahl for entire volume.
	<em>1800</em>(<em>2</em>), <em>Stück 1, 2</em> "1800": Oct-Dec 1801 (Intell. Bl. Allg. Lit. Zeit. 5: 1994. 26 Dec
	1801) (sic: second volume for 1800, 2 Stücke combined; t.p. dated 1801), frontisp.
	portr. J.E. Smith, p. [i-vi, [1]-487, <em>pl. 1, 2/3, 4-7</em> (id.).
	<em>1801</em>(<em>1</em>), <em>Stück 1</em> "1801": Apr 1803 (first volume for 1801, 2 Stücke separate, t.p. Stück
	1, 1802, publ. Apr 1803), p. [i]-vi, [1]-272, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (id.).
	<em>1801</em>(<em>1</em>), <em>Stück 2</em> "1801": 13 Dec 1803 (GGA 13 Dec 1803), p. [i, t.p. volume dated
	1803], [iii, t.p. Stück 2, dated 1803]-viii, 273-504, <em>pl. 1-4</em> (id.); also p. [i*], t.p. for
	entire volume 1800(1), with frontisp. portr. O. Swartz.
For details on the dates see G. Sayre (SY p. 73-75), M.J. van Steenis-Krusemann (Fl.
	males. Bull. 15: 742. 1960) and R.E.G. Pichi-Sermolli, Webbia 9: 418. 1953 and in
	lit. 23 Sep 1976.

11.085. <em>Abermahlige Revision der Gattung Usnea</em> in des Herrn Professor's Hoffmann Flora
Deutschlands zweiten Theile ... Beleuchtung der in der Jenaer Literatur-Zeitung Nro.
240. 1799 befindlichen Recension des ersten Stucks des botanischen Journals ... Göttin-
gen (Bei Johann Christian Dieterich) 1799. Oct. (<em>Abermahl. Revis. Usnea</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Aug-Dec 1799 (p. lii: Aug 1799), p. [i*], [i]-lii. 1799. <em>Copies</em>: G, H-UB. – The
	original revision was published in Schrader, J. Bot. 1: 42-85. Feb 1799 ("Über die
	Gattung Usnea, nebst einigen vorausgeschickten Bemerkungen über der zweiten
	Theil der Hoffmannischen Flora Deutschland"). For G.F. Hoffmann, <em>Deutschl. Fl</em>.
	2(Crypt.), 1795 see TL-2/2887. We have not seen the review of this first paper in the
	Jenaer Literatur-Zeitung 240, 1799.

11.087. <em>Neues Journal für die Botanik</em> ... Erfurt (bei Friedrich August Knick) 1805-1810, 4
vols. Oct. (<em>Neu. J. Bot.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1805-1810 in 4 volumes, each published in parts (Stücke). Contrary to the <em>J. Bot</em>.
	(see above) the volumes are numbered in sequence and not by year. <em>Copies</em>: B-S, BR,
	FI, G, H-UB, HH, MO, NY, USDA.
	<em>1</em>(<em>1</em>): Jun 1805, p. [i-vi], [1]-184, <em>1 pl</em>. (uncol. copp.).
	<em>1</em>(<em>2</em>): Nov 1805 (t.p. "1806"), p. [i-iv], [1]-204, [1-4, adv.], <em>pl. 2-3</em> (id.).
	<em>1</em>(<em>3</em>): Jan 1806, p. [i-iv], [1]-200, <em>pl. 4-6</em> (id.) and [i*] volume t.p. with frontisp. portr.
	A.J. Cavanilles.
	<em>2</em>(<em>1</em>): Jan-Jun 1807, p. [i-iv], [1]-172, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (id.).
	<em>2</em>(<em>2, 3</em>): Jan-Jul 1808, frontisp. portr. A.L. Jussieu, p. [i-vi], [1]-376, <em>pl. 3</em> (id.); with
	[i*] t.p. volume and frontisp. portr. A.L. de Jussieu.
	<em>3</em>(<em>1, 2</em>): Apr 1809, frontisp. portr. C.L. Willdenow, p. [i-iv], [1]-260, <em>pl. I.</em> – Erfurt
	(bei Knick und Müller) mentions books, publ. Jubilate Messe 1809.
	<em>3</em>(<em>3, 4</em>): Sep 1809, p. [i-iv], [1]-294, <em>pl. 2-3.</em> – Erfurt (bei J.C. Müller), with p. [i*] t.p.
	for entire volume and frontisp. portr. C.L. Willdenow.
	<em>4</em>(<em>1, 2</em>): Dec 1810, p. [i]-iv, [1]-288, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (id., Besemann). – Göttingen (Justus
	Friedrich Danckwerts).
	<em>4</em>(<em>3, 4</em>): was announced for the the Jubilate-Messe (Mai) 1811, but never published.
	For dates see e.g. G. Sayre (SY p. 73-75) and R.E.G. Pichi-Sermolli, Webbia 8: 436-
	442. 1952.

	Bot. 3(2): 58-92. Apr 1809.

11.092. <em>Monographia generis Verbasci</em> ... Gottingae [Göttingen] (apud Henricum Diete-

<em>Publ</em>.: 1827 (mss. submitted 18 Sep 1825; t.p. reprint 1827), p. [1]-54, <em>pl. 1-4</em> (uncol.

	paper which gives the main contents of the 1827 publication (name, as nom. nud.,

<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Linnaea 3(4): Litt.: 166-169. Oct 1828 (repeats, de-

11.095. <em>Analecta ad floram capensem</em>. I. Cyperaceae ... Gottingae [Göttingen] (sumtibus
Dieterichianis) 1832. Qu. †. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1832 (t.p. reprint; mss. submitted 29 Sep 1831), p. [i-iii], [1]-55, [56], <em>pl. 1-4</em>
	(uncol. copp. C. Schmidt). <em>Copies</em>: B-S, FI, G, HH (journal pagination); IDC 5160. –
	Reprinted from Comm. recent. Soc. reg. Sci. Gott., Cl. phys. 7: 101-152. 1828-1831
	[1832]. – See also GGA 1821, no. 208, p. 2065-2078 which speaks of a second instal-
	ment "Sect. ii. Cyperaceae, Gramineae"; this first part was treated in Gött. gel. Anz.
	1819, no. 92.
<em>Note</em>: C.G. Nees von Esenbeck published his treatment of the Cyperaceae of the <em>Plantae
	Eckloniae</em> in Linnaea 7(4): 491-538. Jan 1832, which must be assumed to antedate the
	<em>Analecta</em>. See also C.G. Nees von Esenbeck, Linnaea 8(1): 75-94. Apr-Jul 1833 in
	which Nees compares his treatment of the Ecklon Cyperaceae with that of Schrader
	who had plants collected by Hesse.

unvollendete botanische Abhandlungen. Aus dem 12ten Bande der Linnaea besonders
	abgedruckt. Halle (Druck der Gebauerschen Buchdruckerei) 1838. Oct. (<em>Reliq. Schrad.</em>).

	left upon Schrader's death which "looked worth while to be published", preceded (in
	the journal) by a biography on p. 353-359.

Schrader, Johann Christian Carl [Karl] (1762-1826), German (Prussian Saxony)

pharmacist; from 1796 owner of the pharmacy "am Königstor" in Berlin; from 1803

Schrader, Johann Eduard Julius (1809-1898), German (Berlin/Prussian) librarian
and botanist in Berlin; Dr. phil. Bonn 1834; student of C.F.P. von Martius, J.H. Link
and L.C. Treviranus. (<em>J.E.J. Schrad.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Arbeitsstelle für Paläobotanik, Deutsche Akademie der Wissen-

and high school teacher; Dr. phil. Halle, teacher at Halle and Erfurt. (<em>W. Schrad.</em>).

HEADING: SCHRAMM, ALPH.

Schramm, Alphons (1823-1875), French (Alsatian) government official and botanist
in French Guiana and, from 1848-1873 in Guadeloupe. (<em>Schramm</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The original herbarium made jointly with H.P. Mazé (q.v.) was
destroyed by fire in Guadeloupe in 1871. – Some material at B (destr.), PC and US.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 1 Aug 1823, d. Mar 1875); BM 4:
1860; CSP 8: 885, 11: 341; De Toni 1: cxiii; Jackson p. 370; PR 8377; TL-2/5759, 7772,
see H.P. Mazé.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 7: 679-680. 1849 (obit. notice).
Lindemann, E. von, Bull. Soc. imp. Natural. Moscou 61(1): 68. 1886.
Urban, I., Symb. ant. 1: 105-107. 1898, 3: 123. 1902.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: With H.P. Mazé, <em>Essai alg. Guadeloupe</em>, see TL-2/5759. – <em>Note</em>: The
date of the facsimile edition, Berlin (W.Junk) is given as 1904 by Bot. Centralbl. (14
Jun 1904) and Hewigia (15 Jul 1904).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schrammia</em> P.A. Dangeard (1889); <em>Note</em>: <em>Schrammia</em> N.L. Britton et J.N. Rose
(1930) probably honors J.R. Schramm (1885-?), American biologist and early editor of
<em>Biological abstracts</em>.

Schramm, [Johannes] Augustin (1773-1849), German (Silesian) botanist and high
school teacher at the royal roman-catholic gymnasium of Leobschütz. (<em>Aug. Schramm</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown; a single specimen collected by him is mentioned by
Lindemann (see TL-2/3: 41).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 240 (d. 9 Aug 1849); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8283;
BM 4:1860; Futak-Domin p. 530; PR 8378-8379, ed. 1: 9302-9303; Rehder 1: 380.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Fiek, E., Fl. Schlesien 117. 1881.
Wimmer, F., Fl. Schlesien 149. 1844.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Karl Traugott Schramm, at Dresden, about whom no further details are available
to us, was the editor of the short lived botanical journal "<em>Mittheilungen über Flora</em>,
Gesellschaft für Botanik und Gartenbau in Dresden", 3 Hefte, Dresden 1841-1843.

11.099. <em>Die Pflanzen des Leobschützer Stadtwaldes</em>, ein Unterrichtsmittel der Lehranstalt von
Augustin Schramm, Professor am Königl. kathol. Gymnasium zu Leobschütz. Ratibor
(Gedruckt bei F.M. Langer) 1833. Oct. (<em>Pfl. Leobschütz. Stadtwald.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1833, p. [1]-92. <em>Copies</em>: B, M.

11.100. <em>Die selteneren Pflanzen der schlesischen Flora</em> in den Umgebungen von Leobschütz,
nebst einigen Beobachtungen über gemeinere von Prof. Schramm. Leobschütz (gedruckt
bei Joseph Schubert) 1840. Oct. (<em>Selt. Pfl. schles. Fl.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1840, p. [i], [1]-45. <em>Copies</em>: B, B-S.

Schramm, Otto Christoph (1791-1863), German (Prussian) agronomist and botanist;
in the Prussian army 1813-1815; from 1820 government employee for agronomy in
Pommerania 1820-1844, ultimately as "Oekonomie-Kommissionsrat", in early retire-
ment because of ill-health in Brandenburg a.d. Havel from 1845. (<em>O.C. Schramm</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Schramm had a large herbarium which he left to the
Gymnasium and Realschule at Saldern, Brandenburg (Ascherson 1908). – Some
material in H and REG.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 24 Aug 1791, d. 4 Aug 1863); DTS
1: 271; Hegi 4(1): 50; PR 8376; Rehder 1: 384; Saccardo 1: 150; Tucker 3: 274.

HEADING: SCHRANK

<em>Ref</em>.: Ascherson, P., Bot. Zeit. 15: 782-784. 6 Nov 1857, Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg
	3/4: 385-386. 1862 (rev.).
	Anon., Flora 41: 745-747. 1858 (rev.).

Schrank, Franz von Paula von (1747-1835), German (Bavarian) botanist and en-
tomologist; Jesuit teacher until the abolition of the order; ord. 1774; dean in Passau
(1774), Wien (1775); Dr. theol. Wien 1775 (or 1776); professor of physics and mathema-
tics in Amberg (1776); professor of botany and agronomy at Ingolstadt, later Landshut
(1784-1809); first director of the botanical garden at München 1809-1832. (<em>Schrank</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M; types often in BR (gen. herb., through herb. Martius); some
further material in FI, GDOR, H, P. – Hertel (1980) notes that the actual holdings at
M of Schrank material are rather modest. There are no lichens mentioned in his
"Baierischen Flora", whereas there are also few phanerogams. Schrank may have given
material to Martius, which would now be in BR, but Hertel states also that v. Schrank
was not really interested in collecting herbarium material. C.F.P. von Martius (1851)
describes the Schrank collections as received in 1832. From this it appears that most
collections handed over by v. Schrank in 1832 had indeed been made by others, but also
"Dieselbe Begriff ... das Material zu des berühmten Naturforschers Flora von Bayern,
..." the whole in "42 Holzkästen aufgestellt". – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 450-452 (E. Wunschmann); AG 2(2): 428;
Backer p. 520; Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 21 Aug 1747, d. 23 Dec 1835); Biol.-Dokum. 16:
8286; BM 4: 1860-1861; Bossert p. 355; CSP 5: 545-546, 8: 885; De Toni 1: cxiii, 2: cv;
Dryander 3: 12, 48, 83-84, 154, 215, 288, 346, 388, 415, 433, 444; DTS 1: 271-272, 6(4):
194; DU 280-281; Frank 3 (Anh.): 93; Futak-Domin p. 530; GF p. 75; GR p. 46, cat. 71;
Hawksworth p. 185; Hegi 4(1): 286; Herder p. 477 [index]; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p.
307, 429; Kelly p. 257; Krempelh. 1: 482, 545, 612, 3: 91; Langman p. 684; Lasègue p.
336, 536; LS 24190-24198; Maiwald p. 173; Moebius p. 75, 252; MW p. 440; NI 1803-
1806, 3: 61; Nordstedt p. 29; PR 8380-8392, 1214, 3858, 5893, ed. 1: 1384, 4220, 6595,
6602, 9305-9324; Quenstedt p. 387; Rehder 5: 778; RS p. 141; Saccardo 1: 150, 2: 99;
SBC p. 131; SO see index p. 48; Sotheby 686; Stevenson p. 1257; TL-1/488, 1190-1194;
TL-2/2490, 5530, see J.N. Mayrhofer, K.M.E. von Moll; TR 258; Tucker 1: 635, 3: 274;
Zander ed. 10, p. 713, ed. 11, p. 814.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: (1) With C.F.P. von Martius, <em>Hort. reg. monac.</em> 1829, TL-2/5530.
<em>Copies</em>: B-S, G, H, HH, M, NY, PH, USDA. – For authorship see p. vi.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Candollea 33: 179-180. 1978.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) For an account by von Schrank himself on the history of the botanical garden
at München see Flora 1: 533-559. 1818. With respect to contemporary criticism that

PAGE: 325
HEADING: SCHRANK

München, because of altitude and its allegedly not very fertile soil was not a suitable
location for a botanical garden ("beynahe lächerlich), v. Schrank remarks: "Man würde
weniger deräsonniren, wenn mann über nichts räsonnirete, was man nicht versteht".
The present glorious state of the garden bears out Schrank's early and wise judgment.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (2) Main biography and bibliography: Zimmermann (1981).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schrankia</em> Willdenowa (1806, <em>nom. cons.</em>). <em>Note</em>: <em>Schranckia</em> J.F. Gmelin (1791,
<em>nom. rej.</em>); <em>Schrankia</em> Medikus (1792) and the derived name <em>Schranckiastrum</em> Hassler (1919)
were probably also named for this author, but no etymology was given.

11.102. <em>Beyträge zur Naturgeschichte</em> von Franz von Paula Schrank Weltpriester ...
Augsburg (verlegt von den Gebrüdern Veith) 1776. Oct. (<em>Beytr. Naturgesch.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1776, p. [i-viii], [1]-137, [138-140], <em>7 pl</em>. (uncol.copp. auct.). <em>Copies</em>: M, NSUB,
	PH. – Review: J. Beckman, ed., Phys.-oek. Bibl. 7: 469-472. 1776.

11.118. <em>Flora monacensis</em> seu plantae sponte circa Monachium nascentes, quas pinxit et in
lapide delineavit Joannes Nepomucenus Mayrhoffer. Commentarium perpetuum ad-
didit Franciscus de Paula Schrank ... Monachii [München] (venditur in Instituto litho-
graphico Scholae festivalis) 1811-1818, 4 vols. Broadsheet. (<em>Fl. monac.</em>).

<em>Artist</em>: Johann Nepomuk Mayrhoffer (1764-1832), see TL-2/3: 391.
<em>Publ</em>.: in 4 volumes, with 2 portraits and 400 coloured liths. with accompanying text;
	each text leaf carrying the same number as the accompanying plate. See DU 280, NI
	1803; according to Thieme-Becker, Künstlerlex. 27: 383, J. Prestele was also involved

PAGE: 327
HEADING: SCHRANK

	in this work. – We know nothing about a possible publication in parts even though
	this is likely.
	<em>1</em>: 1811, [i, t.p.], engr. Dedic, [iii-iv], plates with text nos. <em>1-100</em>.
	<em>2</em>: 1814, p. [i], id. <em>pl. 101-200.</em>
	<em>3</em>: 1816, portr. Schrank, [i], id. <em>pl. 201-300.</em> – "Venditur in Instituto lithographico
	Scholae festivalis et apud editorem Jo. Nep. Mayrhoffer".
	<em>4</em>: 1818, portr. J.N. Mayrhoffer, [i,t.p.], id. <em>pl. 301-400</em>, [1-2, index].
	<em>Copies</em>: BR, G, M, MO, NY. – Produced at the "Lithographische Kunstanstalt an der
	Feiertagsschule für Künstler und Techniker" München, an early German litho-
	graphic studio, under the direction of Hermann Mitterer. Mayrhoffer was one of
	the artists on the "Anstalt", he produced the first botanical lithographs (fide NI
	1323).

11.119. <em>Catalogus plantarum</em> quae <em>Monachii</em> in horto regiae Academiae scientiarum anno

<em>Publ</em>.: 1814, p. [1]-56. <em>Copy</em>: M. – Anonymous, but Schrank was in charge of the garden
	in 1814.

11.120. <em>Plantae rariores horti academici monacensis</em>, descriptae et observationibus illustratae
... Monachii [München], [1817-] 1819 [-1822], 2 vols. Fol. (<em>Pl. rar. Hort. monac.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 2 vols., in 10 Hefte, 1817-1822, see below. The plates are accompanied by text
	leaves with text on recto, numbered in agreement with the accompanying plates.
	These are unsigned coloured liths.
	<em>1</em>: 1817-1819, p. [i, t.p.], <em>pl. 1-13, 13 bis, 15-42, 43, 44-50</em> with text leaves "Fol." 1-13, 14
	[sic acc. <em>plate 13 bis</em>], <em>15-42</em>, "<em>45</em>" [for 43], <em>44-50</em>.
	<em>2</em>: 1820-1822, p. [i, t.p.], <em>pl. 51-100</em>, with idem text leaves "Fol." 51-100.
<em>Copies</em>: G, MICH (3 fasc.), MO (3 fasc), Teyler; IDC 771. – See also DU 281, NI 1804,
	TL-1 and Stearn 1938 (dates). – E. Irmscher, in his Syst. Stud. Begon. trop. Südam-
	erikas (1953), states on p. 12 that according to a note by Suessenguth, fasc. 6, <em>pl. 57</em>
	came out in 1817. In the absence of further details we cannot understand the discrep-
	ancy between Stearn's data (1938, accepted by us) and this statement.

11.121. <em>Aufzählung einiger Pflanzen aus Labrador</em>, mit Anmerkungen ... [Denkschr. k.-
baier. bot. Ges. Regensburg 1(2), 1818]. Qu. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1818, Denkschr. k.-baier. bot. Ges. Regensburg 1(2): [1]-30. 1818. – Description
	of plants collected by Benjamin Gottlieb Kohlmeister (b. 1775) in Labrador of which
	Schrank received a set. Other material from Kohlmeister is at BM, LINN and PH.

<em>Publ</em>.: 1819, p. [i-xv, list plates], <em>pl. 1-24</em> (uncol. liths. Joseph Prestele). <em>Copy</em>: Saint

11.124. <em>De plantis Gnaphaloides</em> in genere, cum descriptionibus quarundam Capensium.
[München, 1824]. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1824 (in Journal; reprint not dated), p. [1]-32. <em>Copy</em>: M. – Reprinted and to be
	cited from Denkschr. k. baier. Akad. Wiss. 8 (1821-1822): 141-172. 1824.

Schreber, Johann Christian Daniel von (1739-1810), German (Thüringian) bota-
nist and zoologist; studied medicine, natural sciences and theology at Halle; Dr. med.
Uppsala 1760 (with C. Linnaeus), practicing physician at Bützow, Mecklenburg with a
readership at the University 1761; secretary of the "Oekonomische Gesellschaft" Leipzig
1764; third professor of medicine (incl. botany) ar Erlangen 1770; director of the Erlan-
gen botanical garden 1773; professor of natural history ib. 1776; 1791 second, 1793 first
professor of medicine; president of the Leopoldina 1791-1810. (<em>Schreb</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M. – Some of the original drawings of the <em>Beschreibung der Gräser</em>
at ER. Schreber's herbarium constitutes the basis of the Munich herbarium (acquired
1813). It contained about 12.000 species. Many collectors are represented (e.g. Swartz,
Pallas, Forster, Thunberg, Vahl) whereas the entire Güldenstädt herbarium had been
acquired by Schreber. The latter had himself collected numerous grasses and Cyper-
aceae. Some further material at LINN, MW, PH, SBT, US. – Letters to Adanson at
HU; other letters at G. Some original drawings at ER (fide NI).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 465-466 (E. Wunschman); AG 2(2): 32; Ain-
sworth p. 255, 347; Backer p. 520; Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 16 Jan 1739, d. 10 Dec 1810);
BM 4: 1861, 8: 1161; Bossert p. 355; Dawson p. 736-737; De Toni 1: cxiii; Dryander 3:
81, 161, 167, 175, 202, 212, 279, 294, 299, 312, 340, 341, 543; DTS 1: 401; Frank 3
(Anh.): 93; GR p. 46-47, cat. p. 71; Hawksworth p. 185, 197; Herder p. 23, 188, 212,
266, 277, 311, 394; Hortus 3: 1203; IF p. 729; IH 1 (ed. 6): 364, (ed. 7): 342; KR p. 630;
Krempelh. 2: 40, 48-49; Lasègue p. 335; LS 24199-24201; Maiwald p. 92; Moebius p.
85; NI 1807-1808, see indexes; Plesch p. 402; PR 8393-8404, 2665, 5412, 5415, 5416,
5424-5425, 9026, ed. 1: 44, 2962, 4677, 5985, 5991-5992, 5995-5996, 9324-9326;
Quenstedt p. 387; Rehder 5: 778; RS p. 141; SBC p. 131; SO see index p. 48-49; TL-

11, p. 814.

<em>1</em>: 1766-1769 (see below; p. [xiv]: Hornung [Feb] 1769), p. [i-xvi], [1]-154, <em>pl. 1-3</em>, [<em>4</em>],
	<em>5-20</em> (col. copp. C.L. Crusius, C.G. Geyser (<em>1-28</em>).- Errata sheet [xvi], sometimes
	bound at the end.
<em>2</em>: 1770-1810 (see below; p. vi: Apr 1810; t.p. dated 1810), p. [i-vi], 1-88, <em>pl. 21-29</em>, [<em>30</em>],<em>
	31-40</em> (id. C.L. Crusius, C.G. Geyser, J.D. Kretsch), 89-160, <em>pl. 41-54</em> (id. E.F.C.
	Lang; G.F. Hoffmann). – Some original plates at ER (fide NI).
<em>Copies</em>: B, B-S, BR, G, H, M, MO, NY, PH, Teyler, U, US, USDA; IDC 233.

vol.	fasc.	pages	plates	dates
1	1	1-36	1, 2	1766
	2	37-48	3, [4]	1767
	3	49-64	5, 6	1767
	4	65-108	7-14	1767
	5	109-146	15-20	1768
	6	147-154, t.p.,
pref.		1769
2	1	1-20	21-24	1770
	2	21-56	25-29	1772
	3	57-88	[30]-40	1779
	4	89-160, t.p.,
pref.	41-54	1810

The above information stems from annotations by J.H. Barnhart in A.S. Hitchcock's
copy at the Smithsonian Institution. The contents of the fascicles 2-6 of the first volume
are stated to be "merely probable". Part 1 (4) may well have been published late 1767 or
early 1768. – Part 4 of vol. 2, which came out only 1810, is sometimes called vol. 3;
however, all copies seen by us have a t.p. for vol. 2, dated 1810.
<em>Ref</em>.: Fuchs, H.P., Bauhinia 1: 355-356. 1960.

11.128. <em>De Phasco</em> disserit et ad orationem muneris academici a serenissimo principe ac
domino domino Christiano Friderico Carolo Alexandro ... rectore academiae mag-
nificentissimo clementissime sibi demandati adeundi caussa d. [handwriting: xxv] aug.
[1770] recitandam invitat D. Johannes Christianus Daniel Schreber ... Erlangae (ex
officina Wolfgangi Waltheri) [1770]. Qu. (<em>De Phasco</em>).

<em>Oration issue</em>: 25 Aug 1770, p. [i*], [i]-xxii, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (uncol. copp. J.G. Köhler). <em>Copies</em>: HH,
	NY.
<em>Commerical issue</em>: Aug-Sep 1770 (p. iv* Aug 1770), p. [i**], [i*-iv*], [i]-xxii, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (id.).
	<em>Copies</em>: B-S, G, H, MO, NY, Teyler, US. – "<em>De Phasco</em> observationes quibus hoc genus
	muscorum vindicatur atque illustratur. Auctore D. Joh. Christiano Daniele Schrebero
	..." Lipsiae (apud Sigf. Lebr. Crusium) 1770. Qu.

11.129. D.Jo. Christ. Dan. Schreberi ... <em>Spicilegium florae lipsicae</em> ... Lipsiae [Leipzig]
(prostat in bibliopolio Dykiano) 1771. Oct. (<em>Spic. fl. lips.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 9 Jul-25 Oct 1771 (p. [xii]: 9 Jul 1771; Jenaische gel. Zeit. 25 Oct 1771), p. [i-xii],
	[1]-148, [1-32, indexes, emend., err.]. <em>Copies</em>: B, BR, FH, G, H, MO, NY, USDA;

	Lips. indig.</em> 1750, TL-2/582.

11.130. Joh. Ellis ... de <em>Dionaea muscipula</em> planta irritabili nuper detecta ad ... Car. a
Linné ... epistola. Beschreibung der Dionaea muscipula einer neu entdeckten merkwür-
digen empfindlichen Pflanze, in einem Schreiben an den Herrn ... von Linné von Herrn
Johann Ellis. Aus dem Englischen übersezt [sic] und herausgegeben von D. Johann
Christian Daniel Schreber. ... Erlangen (in Verlag Wolfgang Walthers) 1771. Qu. (<em>Dionaea muscip</em>.).

<em>Author</em> of main part of text: John Ellis (1711-1776).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1771, p. [i]-xviii, <em>1 pl</em>. (col. copp.). <em>Copies</em>: G, NSUB. – Original English publicat-
	ion <em>Directions for bringing seeds</em> and plants, from the East-Indies and other distant
	countries, in a state of vegetation. London 1770, Qu. includes the description of
	<em>Dionaea muscipula</em> on p. 35-41. See Dryander 3: 277, 612.

HEADING: SCHRECK

<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1780, p. [i]-xxviii, <em>pl. 1-3</em> (col. copp. James Roberts). <em>Copies</em>: B, MO. – <em>Beschreibung
	der Dionaea muscipula</em> einer merkwürdigen empfindlichen Pflanze, in einem Schreiben
an den Herrn Archiater und Ritter von Linné von Johann Ellis ... aus dem Englis-
chen. Zwote Auflage mit der Beschreibung einer neuentdeckten Pflanze welche ohne
Grund für die Dionaea ausgegeben werden wollen vermehrt von D. Johann Christian
Daniel Schreber ... Erlangen (im Verlage Wolfgang Walthers) 1780. Qu.

Schreiber, Franz (1839-?), German (Rhein-Hessen) botanist; Dr. phil. Bonn 1865. (<em>F.
Schreiber</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL.

Schreiber, Hans (1859-1936), Bohemian-Austrian botanist; in charge of the German-
Austrian moorland society at Staab in Bohemia. (<em>Ha. Schreiber</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: CB.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 25 Dec 1859, d. Jan 1936); BJI 2:
158; Futak-Domin p. 530-531; Klásterský p. 167; LS 39017-39018; Rehder 3: 296, 301,
308.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Chron. bot. 3: 89. 1937 (d. early Jan 1936).
Murr, J., Neue Übers. Farn- Bl.-Pfl. Vorarlberg 1/2: xxi. 1923.
Schmid, B. &amp; C. Thesing, Biol.-Kalend. 1: 309. 1914.

11.135. <em>Die Moore Vorarlbergs</em> und des Fürstentums Liechtenstein in naturwissenschaftli-
cher und technischer Beziehung. Herausgegeben vom Geschäftsleiter des Deutschösterrei-
chischen Moorvereines Hans Schreiber auf Grund der Erhebungen der Vereins-Moorkom-
missäre Lorenz Blechinger, Richard Eberwein, Wilhelm von Eschwege, Franz Matou-
schek, Peter und Hans Schreiber ... Staab (Verlag des Deutschösterreichischen Moorver-
eines in Staab, Böhmen) 1910. Oct. (<em>Moore vorarlbergs</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan 1910 (p. viii: Jul 1909; ObZ for Jan 1910; Bot. Zeit. 1910, AbZ 15 Mai 1910),
	p. [i]-viii, [1]-177, map, <em>20 pl. Copies</em>: B, NY. – Mosses by Franz Matouschek (1871-?).
<em>Ref</em>.: Kneucker, A., Allg. bot. Z. 16: 59-60. 15 Apr 1910 (rev.).
	Matouschek, F., Hedwigia 50: (19)-(20). 26 Apr 1910.
<em>Note</em>: similar treatments were published for other regions: <em>Die Moore Salzburgs</em> ... Staab,
	Jun 1913, 270 p., and <em>Moore des Böhmerwaldes</em> ... Praha 1924, 119 p.

Schreiber, Herrmann [Hermann?] Rudolf Ferdinand (1811-1853), German (Prus-
sian) botanist. (<em>He. Schreiber</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 5 Nov 1811, d. 15 Apr 1853); CSP 5:
547; Tucker 1: 636.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: <em>Flora der Umgegend von Graben und Ludwigslust</em>, in Arch. Ver. Fr. Naturgesch.
Meklenburg 7: 200-254. 1853 (rev. Bot. Zeit. 11 Nov 1853).

Schreibers, Carl Franz Anton [Ritter] von (1775-1852), Austrian zoologist and gen-
eral naturalist; Dr. med. Wien 1798; practicing physician in Vienna from 1798-1805;
lecturer for natural history at Vienna University 1802-1806; director of the united "k.k.
Hof-Naturaliencabinete" (now Natural History Museum) at Vienna 1806-
1852. (<em>Schreibers</em>).

PAGE: 333
HEADING: SCHRENK, A.

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) see H. Scholler 1952/53 for first names; Carl Nikolaus Joseph Schreibers
(possibly his son) edited <em>C. Linnaei Epistolae</em>, 1841 (with S. Endlicher) (Hinrichs 19-25
Dec 1841).
(2) Schreibers' wife Isabella was the daughter of J.F. von Jacquin and edited the second
volume of the latter's <em>Ecl. pl. rar.</em>, TL-2/3236.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 240 (b. 15 Aug 1775, d. 21 Mai 1852); BM
8: 1161; Bossert p. 355; DSB 12: 215-216. 1975 (N. Spjeldnaes); NI 1789; PR 5403, ed.
1: 9338 (names err.); SO 1231; Tucker 1: 636; WU 31: 283-287.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 2: 267. 1854 (cognomen Leopoldina <em>Archias</em>; first names
	given as Carl Nicolaus Joseph; death notice); Bot. Zeit. 10: 925. 1852 (d. 21 Mai
	1852, first names given (err.) as Karl Nikolaus Joseph); Flora 19: 126. 1836
("Hofrath"), 36: 32. 1852 (d.); Österr. Lexik. 2: 1037. 1966.
Carpenter, M.M., Amer. Midl. Natural. 33(1): 93. 1935 (entom. biogr. ref.).
Dawson, W.R., Smith papers 86. 1934 (letter to J.E. Smith).
Fischer, E., Gutenberg Jahrb. 1933: 201-202 (Nature printed ills. meteorites).
Gräffer und Czikau, Oesterreichische National-Encyklopädie 4: 590-593. 1837.
Jessen, K.F.W., Bot. Gegenwart Vorzeit 298. 1864.
Marschall, A., Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 2(S.B.): 46-51. 1853 (obit.).
Neilreich, A., Verh. zool.-bot. Ver. 5: 50. 1855 (director nat. hist. mus. 1805; started the
	botanical division for which he attracted Trattinick as curator) [WU says director
mus. 1806].
Nissen, C., Zool. Buchill. 374. 1969.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr. lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 843. 1863.
Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 575, 617. 1900.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schreibersia</em> Pohl ex Endlicher (1838).

11.136. <em>Nachrichten von den</em> kaiserl. <em>österreichischen Naturforschern in Brasilien</em> und den
Resultaten ihrer Betriebsamkeit. Aus den Amtsrelationen der k.k. Gesandtschaft am
Hofe von Rio de Janeiro an das k.k. Ministerium der auswärtigen Angelegenheiten in
Wien, aus den Berichten und Briefen der Naturforscher an den k.k. Hof-
Naturalienkabinettesdirector, Herrn Karl v. Schreibers, als Referenten des wissenschaft-
lichen Antheils der Expedition, und nach Untersuchung und Befund der eingesendeten
naturhistorischen Gegenstände der k.k. Hof-Naturalienkabinetts-Direction. Brünn (Bei
Joseph Georg Trassler) 1820. Oct. (<em>Nachr. österr. Naturf. Bras.</em>).

<em>Heft</em> [<em>1</em>]: 1820 (p. 191: 1 Sep 1819), frontisp., p. [i]-vi, [7]-191, map.
<em>Heft 2</em>: 1822 (p. 66: 10 Jan 1820), p. [i], [1]-112, Anhang H. Schott [1]-66, Reise nach
	Macaar [67]-114, [1-2, err.]. – This second Heft is "Aus den vaterländischen Blättern
	für den österreichischen Kaiserstaat vom Jahre 1819 und 1820, besonders abgedruckt
	und mit nachträglichen Bemerkungen und Zusätzen vermehrt". The <em>Appendix</em> by
	H.W. Schott is entitled "Tagebücher des k.k. Gärtners, Hrn. H. Schott, in Brasilien,
	von dessen Reisen in die Campos am Paraiba von Canta Gallo; dann nach Macaçu
	und am Flusse gleiches Nahmens, von Rio de Janeiro aus". For a review with re-
	petition of diagnoses of new taxa by Schott see Isis, Oken, 23(10): 1042.

Schrenk [Schrenck], Alexander Gustav von (1816-1876), Baltic-German botanist;
studied in Dorpat (Tartu) 1834-1837; traveller-botanist for the St. Petersburg botanical
garden 1837-1844, in the arctic Ural, Lapponia and northern Finland, the Songarian
Steppes and other parts of Central Asia; lecturer at the University of Dorpat 1846-1876.
(<em>Schrenk</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LE.– Further material at A, B (extant), BM, BR, C, CN, E, G,
GOET, H, HH, K, KIEL, LY, M, MANCH, MO, MW, NA, OXF, PH, TB, TU, U,
US, W.

PAGE: 334
HEADING: SCHRENK, A.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: (1) F.E.L. von Fischer &amp; C.A. von Meyer, <em>Enumeratio plantarum
novarum</em> a cl. Schrenk lectarum, 1841-1842, 2 parts, see TL-2/1787. Several of the taxa
are attributed to Schrenk. Fischer and Meyer signed the preface but must have con-
tributed significantly to the text (see also the preface itself) as is shown by other taxa
which are attributed to themselves. <em>Copies</em>: B-S, BG, G, HH, KNAW, NY, US. <em>Review</em>:
D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, Linnaea 16 (Litt.): 148-152. 1843.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Lipschitz, S.V. &amp; I.T. Vasilczenko, Central Herbarium SSSR 34. 1968.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schrenkia</em> F.E.L. Fischer et C.A. Meyer (1841).

	1842. – TR 384, attributed to the editors F.E.L. Fischer &amp; C.A. Meyer; the new taxa

HEADING: SCHRENK, H.

11.138. <em>Diagnoses plantarum novarum</em>, a cl. A. Schrenk in itinere ad fluvium Tschu versus
lectarum. (Lu le 15 septembre 1843). [St. Petersburg 1844]. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 1844, p. [1]-9. <em>Copy</em>: G. – Reprinted and to be cited from Bull. phys.-math. Acad.
	Sci. St.-Pétersbourg 2(13): 193-199. 1844. – TR 387, attributed to the editors F.E.L.
	Fischer &amp; C.A. Meyer; of the new taxa two are attributed to the editors; the new
	genus (Diploloma) and 20 new species are attributed to Schrenk.

Schrenk, Hermann von (1873-1953), American botanist; M.A. Harvard 1894; Dr.
phil. Wash. Univ. St. Louis 1897; botanical assistant, Harvard 1893-1894; St. Louis
Manual Training School 1894-1896, with Shaw School of botany St. Louis 1896-1903;
connected with the U.S. Dept. Agriculture, Missouri Valley Auth. 1901-1907; plant
pathologist at the Missouri Botanical Garden, St. Louis 1907; Biltmore Forest School
lecturer 1906-1913. (<em>H. Schrenk</em>).

Schröder, [Theodor] Julius [Reinhold] von (1843-1895), Baltic-German (Estonian-
born) botanist and chemist; studied at Dorpat; assistant to Carl Schmidt ib. 1866-1868;
continued his studies in Heidelberg; assistant, later professor of chemistry at the Forest
College of Tharandt from 1869; specialist on tanning.
(<em>J. Schröd.</em>).

Schröter, Carl [Joseph] (1855-1939), German-born (Silesian origin) Swiss botanist;
from 1865 in Zürich (Swiss citizen from 1867); studied at the Zürich Polytechnic (later
E.T.H.); botanical assistant 1878; Dr. phil. Zürich 1880 with Oswald Heer; professor of
systematic botany 1884-1926; widely travelled leading plant-geographer; co-founder
Schweizerische botanische Gesellschaft. (<em>Schröt</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: ZT; further material in A, BAS, BERN, BO, BR, C, LAU, M
(lich.), PRE, Z. Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 828; Andrews p. 321; Barnhart 3: 520; BFM
1170, 1171, 2129, 2607; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8314; BJI 1: 52, 2: 158; BL 1: 1, 2: 559, 563,
565, 566, 576, 581-582, 585-586, 591, 715; BM 4: 1864; Bossert p. 355 (b. 19 Dec 1855,
d. 7 Feb 1939); CSP 11: 346, 12: 665, 18: 590; De Toni 4: lii; DTS 1: 272, xxiii, 6(4):
194-195; Hegi 6(2): 915; Hirsch p. 267; Hortus 3: 1203; LS 24239, 32339-32340;
Moebius p. 364; Morren ed. 10, p. 110; MW p. 440, suppl. 309; NI 1810-1814, 3: 61;
Nordstedt suppl. p. 15; Plesch p. 402; Quenstedt p. 388; Rehder 5: 779; Saccardo 2: 99;
SK 1: 476-477; TL-2/6764, see J. Jäggi, E.O.O. Kirchner; Tucker 1: 637, 3: 274.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) Ludwig Schröter (b. 23 Aug 1861, d. 18 Jan 1929), botanical artist, was a
brother of C.J. Schröter. He provided the drawings for several of S.'s early publications;
especially well-known are the plates of the <em>Taschenbuch des Alpen-Wanderers</em> (see below).
(2) <em>Main bibliography</em>: E. Rübel, Carl Schröter 1855-1939, Zürich 1940, p. 57-74.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Neoschroetera</em> Briquet (1926); <em>Schroeterella</em> Briquet (1925); <em>Schroeterella</em> Herzog
(1916).

11.185. <em>Flora des Südens</em> d.h. "Insubriens" des südlichen Tessins und Graubündens und
des Gebietes der oberitalienischen Seen (Langensee bis und mit Gardasee) ... Zürich
und Leipzig (Rascher Verlag) 1936. Oct. (<em>Fl. Süd.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jan-Mar 1936 (Nat. Nov. Apr 1936), frontisp., p. [i]-viii, [1]-151, <em>pl. 1-69, 15a-d,
	37a, 38a, 39a</em>, (of which 32 in color), with text. <em>Copies</em>: B, BR, FI, G, M, MO, PH.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1956 (p. 9: Apr 1956), p. [1]-167, <em>pl. 1-105</em> with text. <em>Copies</em>: G, H, M, NY, PH,
	Wagenitz. – "<em>Flora des Südens</em> die Pflanzenwelt Insubriens (Täler zwischen Ortasee
	und Comersee). Zweite Auflage, vollständig neu bearbeitet von E. Schmid ..."
	Rascher Verlag, Zürich und Stuttgart.
<em>Italian translation</em> (of orig.), 1950, p. [i]-xii, [1]-151, [152, printed Sep 1950], <em>pl. 1-69,
	15a-d, 37a, 38a, 39a</em>, with text. <em>Copy</em>: G. – <em>Flora d'Insubria</em> ossia del Ticino e dei Grigioni
	meridionali e dei laghi dell'Alta Italia (dal Verbano al Garda) ... versione italiana
	del Dr. M. Jäggli. [Mano Jäggli, 1880-1959, see TL-2/3268-3269].

Schröter, Joseph (1837-1894), German (Silesian) physician and botanist (especially
mycologist); Dr. med. Berlin 1859; military physician with the Prussian army in Saar-
louis, Jülich, Aachen and, from 1865-1870, with the Garde-Grenadier-Regiment
Königin Elisabeth in Breslau; associated with F. Cohn at the plant physiological in-
stitute; on active duty in the Franco-Prussian war 1870-1871, involved in the battle of
Sedan; from 1871-1874 at Rastatt; from 1874 again stationed in Breslau; habil. Breslau
(mycology and bacteriology) 1886; from 1890 with the professor's title; retired from the
army in 1892. (<em>J. Schröt.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: WRSL. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Die Pilze Schlesiens</em>, sets at C, H, PAD, S. –
<em>Letters</em> to W.G. Farlow at FH.

Schrüfer, Theodor (1836-1908), German (Bavarian) priest and palaeobotanist; high

Schube, Theodor (1860-1934), German (Silesian) botanist and high school teacher;
pupil of Engler at the Breslau Magdalenäum in 1870; studied at the University of
Breslau with F. Cohn, A. Engler and F. Pax; Dr. phil. ib. 1885; high school teacher ib.
from 1885; active floristic botanist and conservationist. (<em>Schube</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: WRSL. – <em>Letters</em> at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 242 (b. 8 Oct 1860, d. 6 Jun 1934); BFM
265, 266, 279, 280, 3036; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8320; BJI 1: 52, 2: 159; BM 4: 1865; CSP 18:
592; DTS 6(4): 195; Futak-Domin p. 531-534 (bibl.); Herder p. 434; Hirsch p. 267; IF
suppl. 4: 338; Klásterský p. 168; Rehder 5: 780; TL-2/7544; Tucker 1: 637, 3: 274.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 52: 283. 1934 (d.).
Limpricht, W., Jahresber. Schles. Ges. vaterl. Cult. 107: 28-35. 1935 (obit.).
Pax, F., Bibl. schles. Bot. 2, 23, 25, 29, 38, 39, 41, 46, 49, 50, 57, 68, 73, 74, 75, 76, 82,
	85, 87, 88, 92, 93, 141, 144, 148, 149, 153, 154. 1929; Grundz. Pfl.-Verbr. Karpathen

Schalow, E., Jahresber. Schles. Ges. vaterl. Cult. 107: 35-43. 1935 (on S.'s floristics).

	und zum Naturschutze; autobiogr.).

	horticulture).

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schubea</em> Pax (1899) very likely honors Schube, but no etymology was given.

Schubert, Gotthilf Heinrich von (1780-1860), German (Saxonian) philosopher,
physician and natural scientist; Dr. med. Jena 1803; practicing physician at Altenburg
1803-1805, in Freiberg 1805-1807, in Dresden 1807-1809; teacher at Nürnberg 1809-
1816; private teacher at Ludwigslust 1816-1818; professor of general natural history and
philosophy at Erlangen 1819-1827, id. at München, also curator of the zoological and

PAGE: 352
HEADING: SCHUBERT, G.

mineralogical collections of the state of Bavaria ibid. 1828-1853; travelled in Egypt,
Palestine, Lebanon and "Arabia petraea" in 1836-1837. (<em>Schub</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The collections made on the trip to the Middle East (presumably
not by Schubert but by J.R. Roth) are at M (through Zuccarini). – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 631-635 (W. Hess); AG 3: 164; Backer p. 520
(err.); Barnhart 3: 242 (b. 26 Apr 1780, d. 1 Jul 1860); BM 4: 1865, 8: 1163; Bossert p.
356; CSP 5: 558.; Herder p. 33, 59; Jackson p. 46, 96; KR p. 630-631; NI 1814n, na, 3:
61; PR ed. 1: 4312, 7422, 9107, 9353-9355; Quenstedt p. 309; Rehder 1: 85, 87, 309; SO
add. 879***; TL-2/6679; see C.F. Hochstetter, J.R. Roth.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Biogr. Jahrb. deut. Nekrol. 2: 39*. 1898; Bonplandia 8: 248, 363 1860
	(d.); Bot. Zeit. 11: 662 (decoration), 768 (Geheimrath) 1853, 18: 252. 1860 (obit.);
	Brit. Mus., Gen. cat. print. books 216: 340-344. 164 (82 nos.); Flora 37: 15. 1854
	(order of Maximilian), 43: 768. 1860 (d.); Österr. bot. Zeit. 10: 231. 1860 (d.).
Bendixen, R., Bilder aus der letzten religiösen Erweckung in Deutschland 63-80. 1897
	(n.v.).
Blatter, E., Rec. Bot. Survey India 8(5): 466, 467. 1933 (travels, coll. Aden).
Gager, C.S., Brooklyn Bot. Garden Record 27(3): 223. 1938 (dir. bot. garden Erlangen
	1818-1824).
Heinsius, W., Allg. Büch.-Lex. 3: 646. 1812, 5: 505. 1807, 6: 764. 1822, 7(2): 294-295.
	1829, 8(2): 246. 1838, 9(2): 269-270. 1849, 10(2): 248. 1849, 11(2): 265-266. 1855,
	12(2): 287. 1858, 13(2): 364. 1863, 14(2): 438. 1871, 15(2): 555. 1878.
Hönncher, G.H. von, Klin. Wochenschr. 1: 1366-1368. 1936 (S. and the psychology of
	the "Romantik").
Koenen, H.J., Gedachtenis-Rede op G.H. von Schubert. Eene voorlezing. Amsterdam
	(H. Höveker) 1861, 48 p. (biogr., bibl., handwriting, portr.; mainly on S.'s theolog-
	ical attitude as a Christian mystic).
Lothar-Reinsch, E., <em>in</em> A. Chroust, ed., Lebensläufe aus Franken 5: 349-358. 1936 (de-
	tailed biogr.; bibl.).
Martius, C.F.P. von, Akad. Denkreden 442. 1866 (brief note).
Merkel, F.R., Der Naturphilosoph G.H.S. und die deutsche Romantik, 1913.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 852. 1863, 7a (suppl.): 606-609. 1971
	(extensive treatment, many biogr. refs. and secondary refs.).
Schiff, J., Mitt. Gesch. Med. 18: 17-23. 1919.
Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturw. 575-576, 617. 1900.
Wagner, A., Denkrede auf Gothilf Heinrich von Schubert, München 1861, 54 p. (obit.,
	bibl.).
Zischka, G.A., Allg. gelehrt.-Lex. 587. 1961 (b. 26 Apr 1780, d. 1 Jul 1860).
Zittel, K.A. von, Gesch. geol. Paläont. 202, 247. 1899; Hist. geol. palaeont. 166. 1901.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) Published a <em>Lehrbuch der Naturgeschichte</em> für Schulen und zum Selbstunterricht.
Erlangen (Heyder) 1823; ed. 15 ib. 1846 (fide PR ed. 1, no. 9353). – The botanical part
was republished with plates by Ch.F. Hochstetter, as <em>Naturgeschichte des Pflanzenreiches in
Bildern</em>, Stuttgart &amp; Esslingen 1854; ed. 2. 1865, ed. 3. 1870, facs. ed. 1879, see below.
This was preceded by a Dutch edition of the botanical part, <em>Leerboek der Plantkunde</em>,
Gouda 1846 (publ. 28 Sep-3 Oct 1846), iv, 134 p.
(2) A. Schenk, <em>Plantarum species, quas in itinere per Aegyptum, Arabiam et Syriam</em> cli. viri.
G.H. de Schubert, M. Erdl, et J.R. Roth collegerunt. Recensuit et ex parte descripsit A.
Schenk, ... Monachii [München] 1848, vi, 46 p., index, see under A. Schenk.
(3) Schubert was a nature-philosopher who drifted towards a Christian mystic-ascetic
attitude. He published a treatise on the <em>Nachtseite der Naturwissenschaft</em> and many literary
and philosophical-theological treatises. His trip to the Middle East with J.R. Roth (who
collected the plants) was made for religious reasons and considered by him to be a
pilgrimage.
(4) For a very extensive list of biographical and bibliographical references see
Poggendorff 7a: 606-609.

PAGE: 353
HEADING: SCHUBERT, M.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Koenen, H.J., Gedachtenis-Rede op G.H. von Schubert, Amsterdam
1861, chart.

Schubert [Szubert], Michael [Mikael] (1787-1860), German-born botanist; professor
of botany and director of the botanical garden at Warsaw. (<em>M. Schub.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: WA; further material at LE, MW. – Letters at G.

PAGE: 354
HEADING: SCHUBERT, M.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Barnhart 3: 242 (d. Mai 1860); BM 4: 2068; Herder p. 162; PR 8407-8409, ed.
	1: 9356-9359; Rehder 1: 41, 4: 79; TR 285.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 8: 218. 1860 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 18: 328. 1860 (d.); Österr. bot.
	Z. 10: 201. 1860 (d.).
Candolle, Alph. de, Phytographie 448. 1880 (herb., 12.780 sp., at Warsaw bot. gard.).
Hryniewicki, B., Bibl. fl. Polsk. 17, 133. 1925; Edward Strasburger 8, 41, 87. 1938; Acta

Schuchardt, [Conrad Gideon] Theodor (1829-1892), German (Silesian) botanist;
Dr. phil. Göttingen 1853; high school teacher at Dresden 1856-1857; idem at the agric-
ultural college of Regenwalde (Hinterpommern) 1857-1858; lecturer in botany and dir-
ector of the botanical garden of the agricultural college of Waldau nr Königsberg 1858-
1859; later at Görlitz as founder and owner of a chemical phamaceutical factory.
(<em>Schuchardt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GLM. – Schuchardt left a considerable herbarium which was
offered for sale after his death. – 3 fascicles of exotic lichens were at B (Urban, Gesch. p.
290). – Correspondence with D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 242 (b. 22 Jun 1829); BM 4: 1865; CSP 5:
562; Herder p. 335; LS 24324-24326; PH 1-B; PR 8412; Rehder 2: 429; Tucker 1: 637;
Urban-Berl. 290.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 6: 133. 1858 (to Waldau); Bot. Centralbl. 52: 144. 1892
	(herbarium for sale); Bot. Jahrb. 15 (Beibl. 35): 15. 1892 (d. 15 Apr 1892); Bot. Zeit.
	14: 192. 1856 (teacher at Blochmann-Institute, Dresden), 16: 152. 1858 (to Waldau),
	17: 328. 1859 (has left Waldau); Flora 39: 287. 1856 (app. Dresden), 41: 304. 1858
	(from Regenwalde to Waldau).
Ascherson, P.F.A., Nachtr. Fl. Magdeburg 71. 1894.
Glotz, E., Abh. Ber. Naturk.-Mus. Görlitz 30, 32. 1961.

11.206. <em>Synopsis Stackhousiacearum</em> [Linnaea 26(1), 1854]. Oct.

Schübeler, Frederik [Fritz] Christian (1815-1892), Norwegian botanist; cand.-med.
Christiania (Oslo) 1840, practicing at the state hospital in Christiania 1840-1843, sub-
sequently, until 1847, Odalen and Lillesand; travelled in western and central Europe
1848-1851 dedicating himself to botany; lecturer for botany 1851, and, from 1852-1861
curator of the botanical museum of Christiania University; extraordinary professor
(1864), and ordinary professor of botany (1866) ib., also director of the University
botanical garden 1864-1892. (<em>Schübeler</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: O; further material in C. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 243 (b. 25 Sep 1815, d. 20 Jun 1892); BJI 1:
52; BL 2: 444, 715; BM 4: 1865, 8: 1163; Bossert p. 356; CSP 5: 555, 8: 889, 18: 595; De
Toni 1: cxiii; Frank 3(Anh.): 93; GR p. 719; Herder p. 168, 195, 236; Jackson p. 334,
414 (err. Schuebler); Kleppa p. 331 (index, bibl.); KR p. 634; LS 24328, 39055; Morren
ed. 2, p. 31, ed. 10, p. 108; PR 8413-8415; Rehder 5: 780-781; Tucker 1: 637-638;
Urban-Berl. p. 268, 272.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 51: 127. 1892 (d.); Bot. Jahrb. 16 (Beibl. 36): 42. 1892
	(d.); Bot. Not. 1851: 255 (lecturer Christiania), 1858: 102 (stipend), 1871: 69
	(lectures), 1873: 31 (id.); Bot. Not. 1892: 184-186 (obit.); Bot. Zeit. 18: 304. 1860
	(descr. coll. Christiania; Schübeler curator Bot. Mus.); Flora 47: 540. 1864 (app.
	Christiania); Leopoldina 28: 157. 1892 (obit. not.); Norsk Havetidende 17(10): 149-

	Brandenburg 34: lxxix. 1893 (d.).

Nordhagen, R., Norsk biogr. leks. 13: 60-66. 1958 (b. 25 Sep 1815, d. 20 Jun 1892).

Schübler, Gustav (1787-1834), German (Württemberg) natural scientist; Dr. med.
Tübingen 1810; practicing physician at Stuttgart ca. 1811; teacher of natural sciences at
Hofwyl (Fellenberg Inst.) 1812-1817; professor of botany, natural history and agricul-
tural chemistry at Tübingen 1817-1834. (<em>Schübl</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at HOH and M.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 639-640 (E. Wunschman); Barnhart 3: 243 (b.
15 Aug 1787, d. 8 Sep 1834); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8332; BM 4: 1866-1867, 8: 1164; CSP 5:
559-562 (bibl.); DTS 1: 272-273; Frank 3 (Anh.): 93; Futak-Domin p. 534; Herder p.
121, 168, 188, 189, 254, 277; Hortus 3: 1203; PR 8416-8453, 2581, 5848, 8107, ed. 1:
116, 2872, 9362-9400; Quenstedt p. 390; Rehder 5: 780; TL-2/4270, 5480, see C.A.
Kemmler; Tucker 1: 638; Zander ed. 10, p. 714, ed. 11, p. 814.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Flora 9: 349. 1826 (bot. activities Tübingen), 16: 269-270. 1833, 18: 416.
	1835 (succeeded by H. Mohl at Tübingen); Index biogr. Acad. Sci. 462-463. 1954.
Günther, Arch. Gesch. Naturw. Techn. 3: 241-249. 1910 (on Sch. as phenologist).
Heinsius, W., Allg. Büch.-Lex. 8(2): 247. 1838, 9(2): 270. 1849.
Kern, D., <em>in</em> G. Schübler &amp; G. v. Martens, Fl. Württemberg 1834, p. 1-6 (biogr.), see
	also Linnaea 9 (Litt.): 137-140. 1834.
Künkele, S. &amp; S. Seybold, Jh. Ges. Naturk. Württemberg 125: 152. 1970 (some herb.
	mat. at HOH).
Lehmann, E., Schwäbische Apotheker 26-27, 40, 48, 98, 179, 202, 209. 1931.
Martens, G. von &amp; C.A. Kemmler, Fl. Württemberg ed. 2. 1865, p. 781.
Poggendorff, J.C., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 853-855. 1863 (bibl.).
Pritzel, G.A., Linnaea 19: 461. 1846.
Ratzeburg, J.T.C., Forstwiss. Schriftst.-Lex. 466. 1872 (biogr. sketch).
Schmid, G., Goethe u.d. Naturwiss. 576. 1940.

<em>Copies</em>: B-S, G, HH, M, NY. <em>Date of publication</em>: 20-21 Sep 1834 (Vers. deut. Naturf. 23 or

Oct 1834). <em>Reviews</em>: Anon., Flora 18(1), Lit.-Ber. 1: 1-10. 21 Feb 1835. <em>Supplement</em>: see W.
Lechler. <em>Suppl. Fl. Württemberg</em> 1844, TL-2/4270. – See also J. Holub, Folia geobot.
phytotax. 18(3): 325-328. 1983 (some neglected subspecies names from Schübler and
Martens).

11.216. <em>Chemische Untersuchung der Hanfblätter</em>. Eine Inaugural-Dissertation, welche zur

11.221. <em>Untersuchungen über die Farben der Blüthen</em> und einige damit in Beziehung stehende
Gegenstände. Eine Inaugural-Dissertation, welche nebst Beifügung chirurgischer
Thesen zur Erlangung der Doctorwürde in der Medicin und Chirurgie unter dem
Präsidium von G. Schübler ... im December 1925 der öffentlichen Prüfung vorgelegt
Carl August Franck von Nürtingen. Tübingen (gedruckt mit Schönhardt'schen Schrif-
ten) [1825]. Oct. (<em>Unters. Farb. Bl.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Dec 1825, p. [i]-iv, [5]-38, [39-40], 5 p. charts. <em>Copies</em>: BR, U, USDA. – Several

PAGE: 359
HEADING: SCHÜBLER

	dissertations were published by Schübler on the color of flowers; see e.g. PR 8436,
