Schütt, Bruno (1876-1956), German (Schleswig) botanist; Dr. phil. München 1900;
further study in Göttingen; teacher's examination 1906; assistant at the botanical
garden Göttingen 1906-1907; from 1908-1942 high school teacher at Bremen (on active
service 1914-1918) collected in Yugoslavia and Albania 1927-1939; teacher at the
Hermann Lietz-Schule, Bieberstein, Rhon 1939-1945; in retirement at Bieberstein and,
from 1950, in Bremen. (<em>B. Schütt</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BREM; further material at G, GOET.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 243; BFM 23; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8341; GR p.
176; TL-2/867.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Pfeiffer, H.H. &amp; G. Kollmann, Abh. naturf. Ver. Bremen 37: 197-202. 1967
	(biogr., portr., bibl. [but see also Biol.-Dokum.]).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 152. 1982.

B.R. Schütt". Bremen (Arthur Geist Verlag) 1936. Oct., p. [1]-448. <em>Copy</em>: Wagenitz.

Schuette, Joachim Heinrich (1821-1908), German (Hanoverian) teacher; went to the
United States in 1874; edited a newspaper at Green Bay, Wisconsin until 1884; en-
thusiastic plant collector, especially interested in native roses. (<em>J. Schuette</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: F (30.000); duplicates at A, DS, K, L, NY, US.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Johannes Henricus Schuette (1694-1774) edited H.B. Ruppii Flora jenensis ...
1718, see under Ruppius. See also BM 4: 1867.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 243 (b. 20 Apr 1821, d. 21 Jul 1908);
Rehder 1: 315, 2: 283; Tucker 1: 638.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Herbarium 10: 80. 1909 (herb. for sale; brief descr.); J. New York Bot.
	Gard. 20: 94. 1919 (herb. material rd from F; note on botanical activities); Proc.
	Amer. Ass. Adv. Sci. 56-61: 316. 1910 (d.).
Schuette, C., letter (on her father J.H. Schuette) to J.H. Barnhart 23 Sep 1919, at NY.

11.253. <em>The Hawthorns of northeastern Wisconsin</em> ... Proc. Biol. Soc. Washington 1903. Oct. 

<em>Publ</em>.: 25 Jun 1903, p. 91-98. <em>Copy</em>: US. – Reprinted an'd to be cited from Proc. Biol. Soc.
	Washington 16:91-98. 1903.

Schuez, [Georg] Emil [Carl Christoph] (1828-1877), German (Schwabian) physi-
cian and botanist; studied at Tübingen Univ. 1846-1851; from 1853 practicing physician
at Calw, Nordschwarzwald, Oberschwaben; Dr. med. Tübingen 1858. (<em>E. Schüz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: STU (Künkele &amp; Seybold 1970).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: BM 4: 1867 (d. 1877); PR 8455, 8422; Rehder 1: 384.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Österr. bot. Z. 28: 38. 1878 (d. Oct 1878 sic).
Greiner, S., in R. Uhland, ed., Lebensbild. Schwaben u. Franken 12: 258-275. 1972 (b.
	12 Aug 1828, d. 6 Apr 1877, detailed biogr., bibl., sources, portr.).
Künkele, S. &amp; S. Seybold, Jh. Ges. Naturk. Württemberg 125: 149. 1970 (herb. at
	STU).
Metzger, E., Jahresber. Württ. Ver. Handelsgeogr. 7-8: 158-159. 1890 (biogr. sketch; b.
	12 Aug 1828, d. 6 Apr 1877; bibl.).

Schuler, Johann Alois Ernst (1853-1946), Austrian botanist; high school teacher
(with the title professor) at the "Staatsoberrealschule" in Triest 1886-1895; idem at the
Marine Academy of Fiume 1895-1913; in retirement in Triest 1913-1921, later in
Fiume. (<em>Schuler</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: BREG.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 244; GR p. 440 (b. 11 Jul 1873, d. 4 Jun
1946), cat. p. 71; LS 24349-24350; SBC p. 131; Tucker 1: 638.

11.255. <em>Zur Flechtenflora von Fiume</em> ... Fiume (Buchdruckerei P. Battara) 1902. Oct. (<em>Flechtenfl. Fiume</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1902, p. [1]-122. <em>Copy</em>: B. – Reprinted from Mitt. naturw. Clubs Fiume 6, 1902
	(journal n.v.).
<em>Ref</em>.: Zahlbruckner, A., Bot. Centralbl. 90: 445-446. 22 Oct 1892.

Schultes, Josef August (1773-1831), Austrian botanist; Dr. med. Wien 1796; professor
of zoology, botany and mineralogy at the Theresianum, Wien 1797; from 1806 id. of
chemistry and botany at Cracow; from 1808 of natural history and chemistry at
Innsbruck; from 1809-1831 professor of general natural history and botany at the Univ-
ersity of Landshut, Bavaria, as well as director of its surgical school. (<em>Schult</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M (the greater part of the original herbarium, acquired 1826).
Many of the Roemer and Schultes types are in the Shuttleworth herbarium, now at BM.
Another part of the herbarium is reported (ÖbW 1854; Lindemann 1886) to have been
acquired in 1853 by CW. We have no recent information on these collections. Mosses
collected by Schultes are in the Schwaegrichen herbarium at G (fide Sayre, 1979).
Further material at L, OXF. – <em>Correspondence</em> with D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL;
other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 693 (W. Hess); AG 2(1): 410; Backer p. 520;
Barnhart 3: 244 (b. 15 Apr 1773, 21 Apr 1831); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8361; BM 4: 1868;
Bret. p. 277; Clokie p. 240; CSP 5: 656; Dawson p. 737; DTS 1: 273; Frank 3 (Anh.): 93;
Hegi 6(1): 210, 6(2): 1205; Herder p. 59, 70, 148, 150, 193; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 6):
364, (ed. 7): 342; Jackson p. 3, 263, 416, 428; LS 24353-24354; MW p. 440; PR 8456-
8461, 5430, 7715, 8745, 9262, 10277, ed. 1: 6009, 8674, 9406-9414, 10235, 10394, 11256;
Rehder 5: 782; RS p. 141; SK 4: ciii; SO see index; SY p. 20; TL-1/1097, 1199-1200,
1308; TL-2/1462, 8304, 8876, 9408, 9624, 9635, see F.W.H.A. v. Humboldt, J.J.
Roemer; Tucker 1: 638; WU 32: 171-177 (b. 15 Apr 1773, d. 21 Apr 1831); Zander ed.,
p. 714, ed. 11, p. 814.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Biogr. Lex. hervorr. Ärzte 5: 156-157. 1934; Bot. Zeit. 3(1): 16. 1845
	(description of S.'s herbarium of ca. 19.000-20.000 sp., list of collectors. Should be
	deposited in a public institution); Flora 6(1): 345. 1823, 7(2): 574-575. 1824 (trip to
	W. Europe), 14(1): 304. 1831 (d.); Neu. Nekrol. Deut. 9: 350-352. 1831; Österr. bot.
	W. 4: 111. 1854 (herbarium acquired by Univ. Charkow).

	Innsbruck 1808).
Heinsius, W., Allg. Büch.-Lex. 3: 654-655. 1812, 6: 767. 1822.

Schultes, Julius Hermann (1804-1840), Austrian-born German (Bavarian) botanist;
son of J.A. Schultes; studied natural sciences and medicine at the University of
Landshut; Dr. med. ib. 1825; practicing physician and director of the Landshut surgical
school 1826-1831; from 1831-1840 practicing physician in München. (<em>J.H. Schult.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: M (see under J.A. Schultes); some further material in FI.
– <em>Correspondence</em> with D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 12(1): 89; Backer p. 661; Barnhart 3: 244 (b. 4 Feb
1804, d. 15 Sep 1840); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8361; BM 4: 1868; Hortus 3: 1203 ("Schult.
f."); IH 1 (ed. 7): 342; MW 440; PR alph. 5430 ed. 1: 6009, 8674; Rehder 5: 782; TL-
1/1097, 1200; TL-2/2671, 9408; Tucker 1: 638; Zander ed. 10, p. 714, ed. 11, p. 815.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Biogr. Lex. hervorrag. Ärzte 5: 157. 1934.; Bot. Not. 1840: 211 (d.);
	Flora 23(2): 544, 694-704. 1840 (obit., ex Polytechn. J. 1810); Polytechn. J. 78: 77-80.
	1840 (detailed obit.).
Gray, J.L., Letters A. Gray 235, 239. 1893.
Heinsius, W., Allg. Büch.-Lex. 782): 297. 1829, 9(2): 273. 1849.
Poggendorff, J.H., Biogr.-lit. Handw.-Buch 2: 859-860. 1863.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: With J.A. Schultes, <em>Syst. veg.</em> vol. 7 and <em>Mantissa</em> in volumen tertium
... 1827, see above under J.A. Schultes.

<sm>THESIS</sm>: <em>De nosocomiis quibusdam Belgicis, Britannicis, Gallicis commentariolum</em>. Landishuti
1825; fide L. Resch &amp; L. Buzas, Verz. Dokt. Diss. Univ. Ingolstadt-Landshut-München
1472-1970, 2: 65. 1976.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Candollea 33: 373-374. 1978.

Schultes, Julius Hermann (1820-1887), German (Bavarian) botanist; son of J.A.
Schultes (the second named Julius Hermann sic); Dr. med. Landshut 1843; assistant at
the Rijksherbarium Leiden with Blume 1843-1852; assistant with C.F.P. von Martius
1852, active as assistant physician in München 1854; assistant at the Royal Herbarium
München 1854-1887. (<em>J.H. Schult. II</em>).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Dr. A. Schreiber, München, unravelled the mystery of the two sons of J.A.
Schultes who were <em>both</em> named Julius Hermann, J.H. Schultes II signed himself "J.",
"J.H." as well as "H." Schultes. Dr. Schreiber notes: "J.H. Schultes gab in jüngeren
Jahren häufig Anlass zu Beschwerden seitens Prof. v. Nägeli beim Generalconserva-
torium. Gerügt wurden: Unverträglichkeit, hoher Tabakconsum, Ordnungsarbeiten
(das Herbar sollte von ihm katalogisiert werden) nach Belieben, ohne System, "hinter-
her alles wieder durcheinandergebracht", keinerlei wissenschaftliche Publikationen
(Gegensatz zu Dr. Adolf Engler hervorgehoben).
Schultes wurde schliesslich ein eigener Raum, abseits von den anderen, zugewiesen.
Aufträge: sich einzig und allein nach den Anweisungen des Konservators richten.
Nach der Verheiratung [mit Elisabeth Wiedmer, 1875] hörten Nägelis Klagen auf.
Ich kann es mir nicht verkneifen Ihnen noch eine weitere Beobachtung mitzuteilen.

PAGE: 369
HEADING: SCHULTZ, A.

Eine Nichte von Nägelis, Elisabeth <em>Widmer</em> (1862-1952), promovierte mit einer Arbeit
über die Gattung Primula und heiratete den Botaniker C. Correns, einen Schüler
Nägelis. Aus dem Mitgliederverzeichnis der Bayer. Bot. Gesellschaft Bd. I (1892) geht
hervor, dass sich Frau Correns – wie schon Frau Schultes geb. Wiedmer – <em>Elise</em> schrieb.
Leider konnte ich nirgendwo einen Hinweis finden, dass ein Verwandtschaftsverhältnis
zwischen Prof. Nägeli und der älteren Elise Wiedmer bestand; es erscheint aber
naheliegend.
Die Eingaben Schultes' bezüglich Pragmatisierung wurden von Nägeli <em>in keiner Weise
unterstützt</em>, im Gegenteil! Aber gerade v. Nägeli regte an "<em>eine andere Form der Absicherung
zu erwägen!</em>"
Sie sehen, der jüngere J.H. Schultes ist nicht gerade "ein mann zum Herzeigen", ganz
totschweigen sollte man ihn aber vielleicht doch auch nicht."

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 244 (d. 7 Sep 1887); BM 4: 4: 1868; Hortus
3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 7): 342; PR 4151; Rehder 1: 75; TL-2/see Radde.

Schultz, Arthur (1838-1915), German (Silesian) floristic botanist and physician pract-

Schultz, Carl [Karl] Heinrich "Bipontinus" (1805-1867), German (Rhenisch Palat-
inate) botanist and physician; state medical examination München 1829; practicing

PAGE: 371
HEADING: SCHULTZ-BIP.

physician ib. 1829-1832; imprisoned for political reasons 1832-1835; physician at the
Deidesheim hospital 1836-1867; specialist on <em>Compositae</em>; founder and director of the
Pollichia society. (<em>Schultz-Bip</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: P (Compositae herb. through E. Cosson, q.v.); further her-
barium material in BM, BR, CGE, FI, H, K, L, LI, MANCH, MW, OXF, PH, REG,
W. – Collections by others containing Schultz types are e.g. FI, FR.
<em>Exsiccatae</em>: <em>Cichoriaceotheca</em> s. Cichoriacearum exsiccatorum collectio auctore C.H.
Schultz-Bipontino. Deideshemii, Palatinatus ad Rhenum, 1862-1866. Fol., ... nos.
<em>Review</em> (e.g.) D.F.L. von Schlechtendal, Bot. Zeit. 21: 56. 1863. <em>Announcement</em> by C.H.
Schultz (e.g.): Bonplandia 10: 330. 1862. <em>Collectors</em> e.g.: P.C. Billot, H. Bordère, C.
Brunner, J.C. Doell, Fr. Dolliner, G. Engelmann, C. Geyer, F. Facchini, J. Heuffel, R.
Hinterhuber, C. Koenig, F.J. Logger, S.B. Mead, D. Pacher, H.G.L. Reichenbach, C.

Siegert, P.M.E. Timbal-Lagrave, M.G.S. de Tommasini, N. v. Turczaninow (for ad-
ditional collections see C.H. Schultz 1865 (Bot. Zeit.)). –<em>Sets</em>: BM, G, GOET, K, P, W.
<em>Library</em>: sold by auction.
<em>Manuscripts</em> (and correspondence received): with the Pollichia Society (see Spilger,
1942).
<em>Correspondence</em> with D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL, with F.A.W. Miquel at U; other
letters at G, GH.

11.277. <em>Commentationes botanicae</em> auctoribus fratribus Schultz, bipontinus, quibus Polli-
chia, societas historiae naturalis Palatinus rhenanae, gratulatur Gymnasio illustri
bipontino dei ix m. Augusti a mdccclix tertium solemnia secularia celebranti. Seorsum
exscriptum e xvi. et xvii. libro annalium Pollichiae. Neapoli Nemetum [Neustadt a./H.].
(Typis D. Kranzbühler jun.) 1859. Oct. (<em>Comm. bot.</em>).

<em>Co-author</em>: Friedrich Wilhelm Schultz (1804-1876).

Schultz-Schultzenstein, Carl [Karl] Heinrich (1798-1871), German (Prussian)
botanist at Berlin; habil. Berlin 1822; with the University of Berlin as lecturer ("Privat-
dozent") 1822, later as professor of botany. (<em>Schultz-Sch</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 32: 723; Barnhart 3: 245 (b. 8 Jul 1798, d. 22 or 23

Bip. items); BM 4: 1868-1869; Bossert p. 356; CSP 5: 569-571, 6: 755, 8: 892, 12: 666;
Frank 3(Anh.): 94; Herder p. 33, 122, 142, 365; Hortus 3: 1203; LS 24360-24361;
Moebius 167, 207, 267; Plesch p. 402; PR 8474-8484, ed. 1: 9424-9432; Ratzeburg p.
466-468; Rehder 5: 782-783.

Schultz, Franz Johann (<em>fl</em>. 1785-1847), Austrian botanist and artist. (<em>F.J. Schultz</em>).

HEADING: SCHULTZ, F. J.

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: NI 1815, 1: 186; PR 8463, ed. 1: 9415; Rehder 1: 293.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Neilreich, A., Verh. zool.-bot. Ver. Wien 5: 34-35. 1855.

Schultz, Friedrich [Wilhelm] (1804-1876), German (Rhenisch-Palatinate) pharma-
cist and botanist; brother of C.H. Schultz Bipontinus; studied pharmacy at München
1827-1829; Dr. med. Tübingen 1829; state examination pharmacy München 1831; from
1832-1836 practicing pharmacist in Bitsch [Bitche] (Elsass); from 1876 dedicating him-
self to botany; from 1853-1876 at Weissenburg (Elsass). (<em>F.W. Schultz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Exsiccatae</em>:
(1) <em>Flora Galliae et Germaniae exsiccata</em> (see below TL-2/11.292, cent. 1-16, 1836-1852. Sets
at BERN, BM, G, HAL, LE, LZ (destr.), M (lich.), MPU, NCY, OXF, P. – For an
analysis of this series see Sayre (1969). For accompanying texts see below <em>Fl. Gall. Germ.
exs.</em> (1836-1840), <em>Arch. fl. France Allem.</em> (1842-1855).
(a) <em>Original set</em>: <em>Flora Galliae et Germaniae exsiccata</em>. Herbier des plantes rares et critiques de
la France et de l'Allemagne, recueillis par la Société de la Flore de France et
d'Allemagne, publié par le docteur F. Schultz. Cent. 1-16, nos. 1-1600, Bitsch 1836-
1852.
<em>1-4</em>: described below under TL-2/11.292.

	<em>5-6</em>: nos. 401-600. Nov 1842, text <em>Arch</em>. p. 1-48.

	<em>9-10</em>: nos. 801-1000. 28 Dec 1847, text <em>Arch</em>. p. 79-106.
	<em>11-12</em>: nos. 1001-1200. 25 Feb 1848, text <em>Arch</em>. 120-142.
	<em>13-14</em>: nos. 1201-1400. 29 Jan 1851, text <em>Arch</em>. p. 167-186.
	<em>5-16</em>: nos. 1401-1600. 16 Dec 1852, text <em>Arch</em>. p. 207-258.
(b) <em>Continuation</em>: <em>Flora Galliae et Germaniae exsiccata</em>. Herbier servant de <em>Complément</em> à celui

3301-4000. Besançon, 1864-1870 as <em>Flora exsiccata de C. Billot.</em> [Vital Badoux; Albert
Guichard (1822-1901), Paul Guichard (x-1909), Justin Paillot (1829-1891).
	<em>34-35</em>: nos. 3301-3500. Mai 1864, text in <em>Billotia</em> p. 5-10.
	<em>36-37</em>: nos. 3501-3700. Mar 1866, text ib. 52-57.
	<em>38-40</em>: nos. 3701-4000. Mai 1869, text ib. p. 101-108.
(2) <em>Herbarium normale</em>. Herbier des plantes nouvelles peu connues et rares d'Europe prin-

Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 152. 1982.

<sm>NOTE</sm> (1): Schultz notices in Pollichia 15: 97. 1857, that in various publications he is
referred to as F., F.W., F.G. (Fréd. Guill.) and Fr. Schultz, as if these were four different
persons. "Ich heisse Friedrich Wilhelm (Fr. Guil.), schreibe aber nur F. Schultz".
(2): When Schultz moved from Bitsch to Weissenburg the waggon carrying the boxes
with his herbarium, and especially the material for future issues of the <em>Fl. Gall. Germ.</em>

PAGE: 378
HEADING: SCHULTZ, F. W.

<em>exsicc</em>., met with an accident with led to the loss of the material through water damage.
According to Lauterborn (1906) this led to the abandoning of the first series of exsic-
catae, which, at Weissenburg, was replaced by the simpler <em>Herbarium normale</em>, bringing
material from all over Europe.

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: (1) With C.H. Schultz-Bip., <em>Comm. bot.</em> 1859.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Candollea 33: 377-378. 1978.

11.291. <em>Beitrag zur Kenntnis der deutschen Orobanchen</em> ... München 1829. Fol. (<em>Beitr. Kenntn.
deut. Orobanch.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1829 (p. [3]: 30 Mar 1829; Flora 21 Dec 1829), p. [1]-12, <em>1 pl</em>. (uncol. lith.).
	<em>Copies</em>: G, M, MO, NY, USDA. – Privately published; not issued through the book

11.295. <em>Flora der Pfalz</em> enthaltend ein Verzeichniss der bis jetzt in der bayerischen Pfalz
und den angrenzenden Gegenden Badens, Hessens, Oldenburgs, Rheinpreussens und
Frankreichs beobachteten Gefässpflanzen, mit Angabe der Dauer und der Blüthezeit,
aller bis jetzt bekannt gewordenen Fundorte und Finder, der Natur der Fundorte und
der geognostischen Beschaffenheit des Bodens, mit Merkmalen neuer und zweifelhafter
Arten und anderen Bemerkungen, nach Kochs Synopsis und Taschenbuch der Deu-
tschen und Schweizer Flora geordnet, und nebst Beifügung der Anordnung der Gattun-
gen nach dem Linneischen Sexualsysteme, der tabellarischen Uebersicht der Ordnungen
des natürlichen Systems, sowie der Gattungs- und Artenmerkmale, im Auszuge aus
diesen Werken, ... Speyer (Verlag von G.L. Lang) 1846 [i.e. 1845]. Oct. (<em>Fl. Pfalz</em>).

Schultze, Maximilian Johann Siegmund [Max Sigmund] (1825-1874), German
(Baden) diatomologist, microscopist and zoologist; studied in Greifswald and Berlin; Dr.
med. Greifswald 1849 (1850); lecturer ("Privatdozent") Greifswald and prosektor 1825-
1845; extraordinary professor of zoology at Halle 1845-1859; professor of anatomy at the
University of Bonn 1859-1872. (<em>M. Schultze</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – <em>Correspondence</em> with D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at
HAL.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: For his grandson Max Schultze (1886-1909), Würzburg botanist, see Abh.
naturw. Ver. Würzburg 12: 28-64. 1971 (1973).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 245 (b. 25 Mar 1825, d. 16 Jan 1874); BM 4:
1870; CSP 5: 571-573, 8: 894-895, 11: 353, 17: 666; De Toni 1: cxiv, 2: cvi; Herder p. 38,
122; Moebius p. 179; PR 8489.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Encycl. brit. ed. 11. 24: 383. 191.
Freund, H. &amp; A. Berg et al., Gesch. Mikroskopie 69, 180, 202, 203, 207, 213, 318, 320.
	1963.
Hast, T.H., Ann. med. Hist. 3: 166-178. 1931 (portr., bibl.).

VanLandingham, S.L., Cat. Diat. 6: 3589. 1978.

11.310. <em>Das Protoplasma</em> der Rhizopoden und der Pflanzenzellen. Ein Beitrag zur Theorie

	Nachtrag, Organismen in heissen Quellen). <em>Copies</em>: NSUB, NY.
<em>Ref</em>.: Fournier, E., Bull. Soc. bot. France 10: 513. Apr 1864 (rev.).

Schulz, August [Albert Heinrich] (1862-1922), German (Prussian) botanist; studied
medicine at Halle, state examination 1890; Dr. phil. Halle 1893, habil. ib. 1894; lecturer
at Halle under Gregor Kraus 1894; professor's title 1908; librarian of the "Leopoldina"
1918. (<em>Aug. Schulz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: The wheat collection (1910-1920) and the central German her-
barium (1900-1922, incl. types) went to Bertram Kalt (Rossleben, Querfurt) upon
Schulz's death; no longer traced after World War II. It is not known what happened to
Schulz's extensive general herbarium after his death. (Inf. K. Werner, Halle).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 245 (b. 8 Dec 1862, d. 7 Feb 1822); BFM
407, 4255, 459, 2665; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8389-8392; BJI 2: 159-160; BM 4: 1870-1871;
Christiansen p. 70; CSP 18: 607; DTS 1: 276; Futak-Domin p. 534; Kleppa p. 237, 238;
KR p. 631; Moebius p. 384; Rehder 1: 350 358; TL-2/1948, 8213; Tucker 1: 638.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 59: 352. 1894 (habil.), 108: 160. 1908 (prof. title); Bot.
	Not. 1922: 175, 288 (d.); Deut. biogr. Jahrb. 4 (1922): 370. 1929; Hedwigia 48: (90).
	1908 (prof. title), 63: (150). 1922, 64: (69). 1923 (d.); Nat. Nov. 44: 77. 1922 (d.);
	Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 64: 244. 1922 (d.).

Schulz, Hermann (1882-1970), German botanist and teacher; at the Seminar für
Lehrerbildung, Homberg, 1900-1903; teacher at Meckbach 1903-1907; in various
educational functions in Kassel 1907-1927; director of the botanical garden, ib., 1927;
administrator of the Waldschule Kassel-Wilhelmshöhe 1927-1935; in charge of the
botanical collections of the Kassel Naturkundemuseum 1929; evacuated to Witzen-
hausen 1943-1945; in charge of the Naturkundemuseum Kassel 1951-1966. (<em>H. Schulz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: KASSEL. – <em>Phytopathologisches Herbarium</em> (see announcement in
Herbarium 29: 262-263. 1913 and ÖbZ 63: 90. 1913).

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 245; BFM 2933; IH (ed. 7): 342; Tucker 1:
638.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Sauer, H., Hess. florist. Briefe 11: 5-6. 1962 (n.v.) (see also 6: 4. 1957).
Wiedemann, H., Philippia 1: 44-51. 1970 (obit., portr., bibl.).

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: <em>Der Obstbau, seine Geschichte und Praxis</em>, in <em>Das Leben der Pflanze</em> iv. Die
Pflanzen und der Mensch, Band 1, 1913.

Schulz, Johann Heinrich (1799-1870), German (Pommerian) naturalist and high
school teacher; on active service in France 1815-1816; teacher at a private Berlin school
1816-1822; high school teacher at the Königliche Realschule Berlin 1823-1831; from
1831-1866 "Oberlehrer".
(<em>J.H. Schulz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 245; BM 4: 1871; PR ed. 1: 9441; Rehder 1:
88.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Jahres. Ber. k. Realschule Berlin 1870: 70-72. (obit.).
Ascherson, P., Fl. Prov. Brandenburg 1: 13. 1864.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: J.H. Schulz published <em>Gedanken über die dem weiblichen Geschlechte zugesprochene Fähig-
keit zum Unterrichten</em> in wissenschaftlichen Disciplinen in der Schule, Berlin, 1837, which
evoked a reply from T. Homberg, <em>Gedanken zur Erziehung</em> ... zur Widerlegung der Schrift
des Herrn J.H. Schulz "Gedanken ..." 1845.

11.333. <em>Wegweiser für die botanischen Excursionen</em> in der Mark <em>Brandenburg</em> besonders in der
Umgebung Berlins ... Die Phanerogamen, Farrn, Equisetaceen, Lycopodiaceen, Mar-

siliaceen und Characeen enthaltend. Ein Hülfsbuch für Botaniker, Mediciner, Phar-

<em>Publ</em>.: 1857 (Bull. Soc. bot. France Oct-Dec 1857, rev.), p. [i]-viii, [1]-171. <em>Copy</em>: NY.

Schulz, Otto Eugen (1874-1936), German (Berlin) botanist; educated at Berlin
(Friedrichs-Gymnsasium, Kön. Seminar für Stadtschullehrer); high school teacher at
various schools in Berlin 1906-1931; from 1931 in retirement because of invalidity; colla-
borator with I. Urban for West Indian plants and with A. Engler and H. Harms on the
Pflanzenreich and Nat. Pflanzenfam., ed. 2; specialist on Cruciferae and Erythroxy-
laceae. (<em>O.E. Schulz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (extant; collections made with Roman Schulz, Fl.
Brandenburg 1895-1925). – Letters at G.

Schulz, Paul Franz Ferdinand (1872-1919), German (Berlin) botanist; teacher at
various Berlin schools; popular writer on cultivated plants. (<em>P.F.F. Schulz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. – Schulz ran a "Tauschvermittlung für Herbarpflan-
zen" and published annual catalogues (at least 1899-1904) in which herbarium material
was offered for sale or exchange. The "4. jährl. Verzeichniss" issued 1 Jan 1903, for
instance, offered not less than 7500 different taxa coming from 90 countries. Many
cultivated plants were included. – 36 Fungi were at B (rd 1903).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) For the diatomologist Paul Schulz (<em>fl</em>. 1926-1935), see below under Schulz-
Danzig.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (2) [Karl Friedrich] Paul Schulz, b. 26 Nov 1858 in Berlin, is the author of <em>Das
Markstrahlengewebe</em> und seine Beziehungen zu den leitenden Elementen des Holzes,
Inaugural-Dissertation, Univ. Berlin 15 Nov 1882, p. [1]-28, <em>1 pl. Copy</em>: B.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 246 (b. 18 Jul 1872, d. 4 Dec 1919); Biol.-
Dokum. 16: 8401; Tucker 1: 638; Urban-Berl. p. 282.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Gartenflora 68: 308. 1919 (d. 4 Dec 1919); Hedwigia 62: (83). 1920
	(d.).; Verh. bot. Ver. Brandenburg 61: 119. 1920 (d.).

	gen in E).

	for his "Tauschvermittlung").

Schulz, Roman (1873-1926), German (Berlin) botanist; brother of O.E. Schulz;
educated in Berlin at the "Kön. Seminar für Stadtschullehrer" and the
"Lehrerseminar"; teacher at various Berlin schools; active populariser of mycology and
specialist on the flora of the Mark Brandenburg. (<em>Ro. Schulz</em>).

Schulze, Georg [Martin] (1909-x), German (Prussian-Saxony) botanist; Dr. phil.
Univ. Berlin 1934; from 1933-1952 assistant (in various ranks) at the Botanical Garden
and Museum, Berlin-Dahlem, curator 1952, in charge of the division of phanerogams
1960; "wissenschaftlicher Oberrat" 1966, 1969 director; from 1971-1974 also professor of
botany at the Free University of Berlin; from 1959-1968 lecturer at the horticultural
college Berlin-Dahlem; from 1974 in retirement; specialist on Balsaminaceae; member of
the editorial committee for the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature 1954-
1972. (<em>G.M. Schulze</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (pre-1943 destr.), BM, LISU. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 246 (b. 14 Aug 1909); Biol.-Dokum. 16:
8411; Bossert p. 356; IH 1 (ed. 1): 10, (ed. 2): 23, (ed. 3): 26, (ed. 4): 27, (ed. 5): 19, (ed.
6): 25, (ed. 7): 26; Langman p. 687; MW p. 441, suppl. p. 310; Roon p. 101; Zander ed.
10, p. 714, ed. 11, p. 815.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Pilger, R., Mitt. Bot. Gard. Mus. Berlin-Dahlem 1(1): 16. 1953 (1943-1947
	activities).
Rollins, R.C., Taxon 5: 3. 1956 (portr. in group).
Schulze, G.M., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 64 (Beih.): 13-22. 1951 (Die gegenwärtige Situation
	der Systematik).

<sm>COMPOSITE</sm> <sm>WORKS</sm>: (1) Exell, A.W. &amp; F.A. Mendonca, <em>Conspectus florae angolensis</em> 2(2),
<em>Balsaminaceae</em>, Lisboa 1956.
(2) <em>Internationaler Code der Botanischen Nomenklatur</em> angenommen vom siebenten Internat-
ionalen Botanischen Kongress, Stockholm, Juli 1950 ... prepared by J. Lanjouw, ...
F.A. Stafleu, ... Deutsche Fassung 1954. Gedruckt bei A.W. Hayn's Erben. Berlin SO
36, Jun 1954, p. [1]-184. <em>Copy</em>: FAS.
(3) Co-editor specifically responsible for the German text of <em>International Code of Botanical
Nomenclature</em> [adopted ... Paris 1954] 1956, [adopted ... Montreal 1959], 1961, [adop-
ted ... Edinburgh 1964] 1966, [adopted ... Seattle 1969]. 1972.

Schulze, [Carl Theodor] Maximilian (Max Schulze (Jena)) (1841-1915), German
(Prussian-Saxony) botanist; trained to be a professional soldier (Kriegsschule Erfurt;
officer 1862) but discharged after an accident; student-pharmacist 1862-1868; studied
pharmacy and botany at Halle 1868; state examination pharmacy 1870; pharmacist at
Hildburghausen 1871-1878; from 1878 in Jena devoting himself to botany, especially
rhodology and orchidology; from 1912 with the title of professor. (<em>M. Schulze</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (mainly destr.). – Further material at BAS, BHU, C, GOET,
L, OXF, W. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 4: 751, 6(1): 77; Backer p. 521; Barnhart 3: 246 (b.
24 Nov 1841, d. 28 Mai 1915); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8413-8414; BM 4: 1872; Bossert p. 356;
Clokie p. 241; CSP 18: 614; DAB 2: 608. 1978; DTS 1: 276, 6(4): 196-197; GF p. 75;
Hegi 4(2): 1013; Morren ed. 10, p. 24; NI 1817; Rehder 5: 783; Tucker 1: 638, 3: 274;
Urban-Berl. p. 395.

HEADING: SCHULZE, M.

	The date and contents of the 13 Lieferungen, so far as known, are listed below. The
text to accompany the plates was not always published simultaneously with the
plates.
<em>1</em>: Aug 1892 (provisional preface dated Aug 1892; Bot. Zeit. 4 Nov 1892; Bot. Centralbl.
	13 Oct 1892; ÖbZ for Aug 1892; Nat. Nov. Oct(2) 1892).
<em>2</em>: Jan 1893 (ÖbZ for Jan 1893; Bot. Centralbl. 22 Feb 1893; Bot. Zeit. 16 Mar 1893;
	Nat. Nov. Feb(1) 1893), <em>pl. 27, 28, 28b-c, 31, 31b-d</em>, with 12 p. text.
<em>3</em>: Feb 1893 (ÖbZ for Feb 1893; Bot. Centralbl. 28 Feb 1893; Nat. Nov. Mar(1) 1893),
	<em>pl. 6, 14, 26, 37, 37b</em> [and possibly <em>pl. 60, 68</em>], with 16 p. text.
<em>4/5</em>: Apr 1893 (Bot. Zeit. 16 Jun 1893; ÖbZ for Mai 1893; Nat. Nov. Mai(1) 1893).
<em>6/7</em>: Jul 1893 (Bot. Zeit. 16 Oct 1893; Bot. Centralbl. 16 Aug 1893; ÖbZ for Jul 1893;
	Nat. Nov. Aug(1) 1893).
<em>8</em>: 1893 (Bot. Centralbl. 25 Oct 1893; Nat. Nov. Nov(1) 1893), <em>pl. 9, 9b-c, 33, 36, 64</em> and
	text for <em>pl. 9, 9b-c, 30, 33, 36, 49, 50, 64, 66, 67, 70.</em>
<em>9/10</em>: Feb 1894 (ÖbZ for Feb 1894; Nat. Nov. Mar(1) 1894), <em>pl. 2, 3, 4, 13, 16, 18, 20, 20b,
	24, 25, 32, 52, 54, 55, 56, 56b</em>, text for <em>pl. 3, 4, 13, 16, 34, 35, 52, 54, 56.</em>

	7, 7b, 12, 13b, 19, 19b, 19c, 21, 21b, 23, 29, 34, 35, 42, 62, 65, 69, pl.</em> [0, general], portr.,
	Reichenbach, text for <em>pl. 2, 7, 12, 18, 19, 20, 21, 23, 24, 29, 32, 62</em>, definitve t.p., preface,
	introd., index and err.
The instruction to the binder on the cover of 11/13 states that the provisional preface
from Lief. 1 is to be discarded; furthermore plates 42, 65, 69, with dark background
were to be replaced by the <em>replacement plates 42</em>[<em>bis</em>], <em>65</em>[<em>bis</em>], <em>69</em>[<em>bis</em>]. The second sheet
text of 67 was to go with <em>pl. 48.</em> The ideal copy ws to be bound: title, dedic, portr. Rchb.
fil., preface, text Orchidaceae Juss. 1-17, general plate [0], text and plates, alphabetical
index, errata et corrigenda.

Schulze-Menz, Georg Karl Wilhelm (1908-1978), German (Prussian) botanist;
studied at the University of Berlin 1928-1935; Dr. phil. 1936; temporary scientific assist-
ant at the Botanical Museum and Garden, Berlin-Dahlem, 1934-1935; with the Bot.
Staatsanstalten München 1935-1936; again in Berlin-Dahlem 1936; regular assistant
1940, in active service and prisoner-of-war 1941-1948; scientific officer at the office of
plant conservation, Berlin 1948-1952; from 1952 again with Berlin-Dahlem as scientific
officer 1952, curator 1953, divisional superintendent 1962, head curator 1968, director
1972-1973, also as professor of botany; specialist on Rosales. (Schulze-Menz as of 10 Sep
1938); (<em>Schulze-Menz</em>).

PAGE: 396
HEADING: SCHULZE-MENZ

Roon p. 101; Zep-Tim p. 103 (b. 17 Aug 1908).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Taxon 27: 492. 1978 (d.), 28: 44. 1979 (d. 18 Aug 1978).

Berücksichtigung der südamerikanischen Arten, Bot. Jahrb. 67: 436-493. 1936.

Schulzer von Müggenburg, Stephan (1802-1892), Austrian soldier and botanist of
German/Croatian descent; trained as a professional soldier at the military school of
Olmütz (Olomouc) 181 7-1820; on active service 1820-1845; organised military hospitals
in Vinkovci, 1849, and Slavonski Brod 1851; director of various military schools 1851-
1858/59; in retirement from 1859 dedicating himself to mycology, living in Slavonia.
(<em>Schulzer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Schulzer made many drawings of fungi but relatively few her-
barium specimens. Some material is at W. Manuscript (incl. drawings) "Schwämme
und Pilze aus Ungarn und Slavonien" bought by the Hungarian Academy of Sciences
1869; idem "Pilze aus Slavonien" in the University library Zagreb. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 4: 490; Barnhart 3: 246 (b. 19 Aug 1802, d. 5 Feb
1892); Biol.-Dokum. 6: 8420; BM 4: 1872, 8: 1166; Bossert p. 356; CSP 5: 575, 8: 897-
898, 11: 356-357, 12: 667, 18: 614; Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; GR p. 653, cat. 71; Hawksworth
p. 185; Herder p. 193, 245, 247, 434; Jackson p. 497; Kanitz 275; Kelly p. 209, 257; LS
24373-24437; Morren ed. 2, p. 42; NI 191, 1020; PR 8504; Rehder 1: 447, 3: 433;
Stevenson p. 1257; TL-2/740, 3485, 9903, see A. Kanitz, J.A. Knapp; WU 32: 204-205.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Centralbl. 49: 384. 1892 (d.); Bot. Jahrb. 15 (Beibl. 34): 17. 1892
	(d.); Nat. Nov. 14: 135. 1892 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 30: 1-5. 1880 (biogr. sketch, portr.),
	42: 111. 1892 (d.).

Vouk, V., Act. Soc. Sci. nat. Croat. 39/40: 85-94. 1928, also separately p. [1]-10. 1928.

	Stephan Schulzer von Müggenburg).
Wittrock, V.B., Acta Horti Berg. 3(2): 158. 1903 (on portr.).

Aufzählung ..." mentioned above. See Tortic (1970) p. 95 for the part of Schulzer in
this undertaking. Schulzer should at any rate be considered co-author. – Other <em>copies</em>:
BR, MO, NY.

Schumacher, Albert (1893-1975), German (Rhine-Prussian) botanist and school
teacher; teacher's examination 1919 and 1921; teacher at Waldbröl 1921-1958; active
floristic botanist, batologist and bryologist. (<em>A. Schumach.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: MSTR (fide F. Runge 1967); some further material in C, DBN
(bryo.), DPU (bry.), GB, M (lich.), NMW. – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8420; Roon p. 101.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Koppe, F., Abh. Naturw. Ver. Bremen 36: 256. 1964.
Paul, H., Decheniana, Bonn 130: 4-15. 1977 (obit., portr., bibl. by T. Butterfass).
Runge, F., Abh. Landesmus. Naturk. Münster Westfalen 29: 33, 34, 35. 1967 (private
	herb. in Westfälischen Provinzial-Herbar, MSTR).
Sayre, G., Bryologist 80: 517. 1977.
Schumacher, A., Personal communication to senior author 1957 (herb. private).

Schumacher, [Heinrich] Christian Friederich (1757-1830), Danish (Holstein)

PAGE: 398
HEADING: SCHUMACHER

botanist and physician; Dr. med. Copenhagen 1817; surgeon at Rendsborg 1773; pro-
sector Univ. Copenhagen 1778; private anatomy teacher 1781, ship's surgeon 1784,
lecturer in chemistry at the Copenhagen medical school 1785; military surgeon 1792,
hospital physician and professor of surgery 1795-1813; in retirement 1813-1816; practic-
ing again in Copenhagen 1816; ordinary professor of anatomy 1819. (<em>Schumach</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: C (35.000); other material at LE. – The types of the new taxa
described in the <em>Beskr. Guin. Pl.</em> (1827) are in the Isert and Thonning herbarium at C,
available on IDC microfiches (IDC 2203). For manuscripts see Christensen 2: 117.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 23: 31-32 (W. Hess); Backer p. 661; Barnhart 3: 246
(b. 15 Nov 1757, d. 9 Dec 1830); BM 4: 1872; Dawson p. 737; Dryander 3: 237; Frank 3
(Anh.): 94; GR p. 679, cat. 71; Herder p. 194, 218; Hortus 3: 1203; IF 729; Lasègue p.
316, 339, 345, 444; LS 24438, 41720; NI 2219-2350; PR 8505-8509, ed. 1: 9460-9464;
Rehder 5: 784; RS p. 141; SBC p. 132; SK 4: ccxii; Stevenson p. 1257; SY p. 16; TL-
1/1207-1207a; Tucker 1: 639; Zander ed. 10, p. 714, ed. 11, p. 815.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Flora 14: 540-544. 1831 (obit.); Leipz. Lit. Zeit. 1831(1): 633-638, 681-
	685, 729-731.
Buchheim, G., Huntia 3(3): 166. 1979 (provided designs for drawings for Fl. Danica
	plates 1292-1320).
Candolle, Alph. de, Phytographie 449. 1880 (coll.).
Christensen, Dansk. Bot. Hist. 1: 89, 91, 159, 221-224, 295. 1924, 2: 115-117. 1924
	(main bibl.; further biogr. refs.).
Henriksen, K.L., Entom. Meddel. 15(3): 110-111. 1923 (portr.).
Herholdt, J.D., Oratio quam ad festum semiseculare CF. Schumacheri celebrandum
	habuit ... Hafniae 1828, 20 p. (n.v.).
Hornemann, J., Nat. Tidskr. 1: 576. 1837 (epon.).

11.358. <em>Catalogus herbarii J. Ryani</em> M.D. ... [p. 38: Havniae (typis E.M. Cohen) 1809]. 

PAGE: 399
HEADING: SCHUMANN, J.

<em>Authorship</em>: Anonymous but most likely by C.F. Schumacher, who obtained Ryan's her-
	barium as a gift, fide A. Hansen. John Ryan (<em>fl</em>. 1770-1800) collected plants in Santa
	Cruz, Montserrat and Trinidad. Correspondent of M. Vahl. – Other material at BM.
<em>Publ</em>.: 1809, p. [1]-38. <em>Copy</em>: C.

11.359. <em>Medicinsk Plantelære</em> for studerende Læger og Pharmaceutiker ... Kjöbenhavn
(paa Udgiverens Forlag trykt hos Directeur Jens Hostrup Schulz, ...) 1825-1826, 2 vols. (<em>Med. plantel.</em>).

<em>1</em>: Sep-Dec 1825 (p. viii: 1 Sep 1825), p. [i]-viii, [1]-662.
<em>2</em>: Sep-Dec 1826 (p. iv: 12 Sep 1826), p. [i]-iv, [1]-736, [737-800 indexes].
<em>Copies</em>: B-S, NY. – Christensen no. 6.

11.360. <em>Beskrivelse af Guineeiske planter</em> som ere fundne af dankse Botanikere, især af Etats-
raad Thonning ved F.C. Schumacher, ... Saerskilt aftrykt af det kongelige danske
Videnskabers Selskabs Skrifter. Kjöbenhavn (trykt i Hartv. Frid. Popps Bogtrykkerie)
1827. Qu. (<em>Beskr. Guin. pl.</em>).

<em>Collector</em> (and author of some of the new taxa, see below): Peter Thonning (1775-1848).
<em>Publ</em>.: 1827 (t.p.), p. [1]-466. <em>Copies</em>: C, G, NY; IDC 5279. – Preprinted from Danske
	Vid. Selsk. Skr. 3: 21-248. 1828 and 4: 1-236. 1829. The t.p., dated 1827, came with
	the preprint of the first part; it is therefore not quite certain that the second part was
	also preprinted; this part (p. 227-466) may have come out in 1829. The reviews of the
	preprint as a whole date from 1829 or later. However, in the absence of evidence to
the contrary, the title page date of the preprint, 1827, must be accepted.
<em>Note</em>: G. Brizicky, in a letter dated 18 Mar 1968, informed us that of the total of 345 new
	species described in this work about 245 were supplied with Latin descriptions made
	by Thonning and only about 100 with such descriptions made by Schumacher.
	However, Schumacher wrote the great majority of the Latin diagnoses of the new
	species except for those (about 45 species and 5 genera) marked Th. There are 18 new
	genera, the names of five of which are initialled "S." Ten names have no initial and
	must be ascribed to Schumacher; five genera have "Th." after the name and the
	diagnosis or after the diagnosis alone and must be attributed to Thonning.
	Specific names followed by diagnoses and descriptions signed "S." must be ascribed
	to Schumacher, those followed by Th. to Thonning; many names are followed by a
	diagnosis signed "S." and a description signed "Th." It seems reasonable to attribute
	these to Schumacher in accordance with the botanical custom of the time although
	joint authorship can also be defended. Unsigned names or diagnoses should be attri-
	buted to Schumacher. The title-page gives Schumacher as the author; Thonning's
	name appears only as collector.
<em>Ref</em>.: Ascherson, P., Z. Ethnologie 11: 231-258. 1879 (German version of Bot. ethnol.
	notes by Thonning in the <em>Beskr. Guin. pl</em>).
	Junghans, J., Bot. Tidsskr. 57: 310-355. 1961, 58: 82-122. 1962 (enumeration of
	Thonning's and Isert's collections from Danish Guinea (Ghana), with many refs. to
	Schumacher's work).
	Marshall, H.S., Kew Bulletin 1953: 280.

Schumann, Julius [Heinrich Karl] (1810-1868), German (Prussian) diatomologist,
geologist and high school teacher; studied mathematics at the University of Königsberg
i.Pr., teacher's examination 1840; teacher at the Realschule, Elbing 1841-1844; id. at
the Altstädtisches Gymnasium 1840-1841, 1844-1868. (<em>J. Schum.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Some material at DBN and PH.

Toni 1: cxiv, 2: cvi; Herder p. 254; Jackson p. 269; PR 8513.

Schumann, Karl Moritz (1851-1904), German (Silesian) botanist; Dr. phil. Breslau
1873; assistant with H.R. Göppert at the Botanical Institute, Breslau 1872-1876; state
teacher's examination 1875; high school teacher at Breslau 1876-1884; curator at the
Botanical Museum, Berlin 1884-1904; professor's title 1892; habil. Univ. Berlin 1893;
one of the most productive phanerogam taxonomists of the Engler era with an emphasis
on morphological and flower-biological methodologies. (<em>K. Schum.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (museum material). – Schumann collected only occasionally;
the number of his types, however, was considerable. Most of them are no longer extant.
Some herbarium material from Silesia and Bavaria is at L. The Lauterbach herbarium,
containing types from Schumann &amp; Lauterbach, <em>Fl. deut. Schutzgeb. Südsee</em> is at WRSL. –
Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 4: 207; Backer 521; Barnhart 3: 247 (b. 17 Jun 1851,
d. 22 Mar 1904); BFM 2384a; Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8431-8432; BJI 1: 51-53, 2: 160-161; BL
1: 116, 121, 317; BM 1: 288, 4: 1873; Bossert p. 356; CSP 11: 357, 18: 616-619 (bibl.);
De Toni 2: cvi, 4: lii-liii; GR p. 136; Herder p. 417; Hortus 3: 1203; IF p. 729; Jackson
p. 80; Langman p. 687-688; LS 5427, 7715, 24440-24447; Moebius p. 156, 434; Morren
ed. 2, p. 6, ed. 10, p. 10; MW p. 441; NI 1818; Quenstedt p. 389-390; Rehder 5: 784; RS
p. 141; SK 1: 313-314, cxxv, 4: cxxviii, cli; TL-1/1208-1208a; TL-2/1592, 1635-1636,
1643, 1709, 1713, 4329, see indexes; Tucker 1: 639, 2: xxxiv, 3: 274; Urban-Berl. p. 290,
395; Zander ed. 10, p. 714, ed. 11, p. 815; Zep-Tim p. 103-104.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: G. Volkens, in his obituary of Schumann in Ber. deut. bot. Ges. (1904), poses the
question how Schumann's great productivity can be explained. He had many
administrative-technical responsibilities as curator of the Berlin Botanical Museum in its
old location, overfilled at a time of a rapidly increasing stream of material from all
corners of the world. A really convincing and comprehensive answer is not possible.
Schumann's creative urge and scientific inquisitiveness never relaxed and the solution
can also be found in "seiner gewissenhaften Innehaltung eines täglichen Arbeits-
pensums" in many ways comparable with his only seven years older colleague and
director Adolf Engler; Volkens: "The solution is to be found in his creative impulse, ...
and in his conscientious desire to crowd into his daily task the full force of his intellectual
activities".

<sm>THESIS</sm>: Dickenwachstum und Cambium. Historisch-experimentelle Untersuchungen.
Inaugural-Dissertation Görlitz 1873. Oct., 41 p. (Bot. Zeit. 31: 672. 17 Oct 1873).

Schummel, [Theodor] Emil (1785-1848), German (Silesian) botanist, entomologist
and high school teacher at the medical college, Breslau. (<em>Schummel</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: WRSL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 6(1): 582; Barnhart 3: 247 (b. 23 Mai 1785, d. 24
Nov 1848); BM 4: 1873 (b. 1786); CSP 5: 578-579, 18: 621; Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; Kláster-
ský p. 168; LS 24448; PR 8514, ed. 1: 9466; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 815.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Zeit. 18: 192. 1860 (mentions Schummel as a pharmacist).
Kahlert, A., Denkschr. Feier 50-j. Best. Schles. Ges. vaterl. Kult. 15. 1853.
Letzner, K., 50-j. Bestehen Schles. Ges. vaterl. Kult., Entom. Sekt. 16-18. 1958.
Pax, F., Bibl. schles. Bot. 122, 133. 1929.
Wimmer, F., Fl. Schlesien 147. 1844.

11.393. <em>Ueber die giftigen Pilze</em>, mit besonderer Rücksicht auf Schlesien. Als Einladungs-
Programm zu der an der hiesigen königlichen medicinisch-chirurgischen Lehr-Anstalt
den 8. September Vormittags um 10 Uhr im Musiksaale der Universität stattfindenden
öffentlichen Prüfung vom Lehrer Schummel ... Breslau (gedruckt bei Grass, Barth und
Comp.) 1838. Qu. (<em>Gift. Pilze</em>).

<em>Orig</em>.: shortly before 8 Sep 1838 (see t.p.), p. [1]-40, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (uncol. liths.). <em>Copies</em>: HBG,
	Stevenson.
<em>Commercial ed</em>.: 1840 (p. iv: 10 Nov 1838), p. [i]-iv, [1]-28, <em>pl. 1-2</em> (col. lith.). <em>Copy</em>: NY. –
	"Mit einem Vorworte vom Geheimen Medicinal-Rath Professor Dr. Wendt" ...
	Breslau (id.) 1840. Qu.

Schur, [Philipp Johann] Ferdinand (1799-1878), German (Prussian) botanist;
studied at Königsberg and Berlin; state examination pharmacy Berlin; Dr. phil. ib.;
director of a chemical factory at Liesing (Wien); subsequently in similar factories in
Austria, Hungary and Slowakia; in charge of a sulfuric acid factory in Hermannstadt
1845; devoting himself especially to botany; high school teacher at Kronstadt (Brasov)
1853-1854; director and owner of a girl's school (1854-1864) and private scientist in
Wien 1854-1870; from 1870 in Brünn (Brno), ultimately in Bielitz (Silesia). (<em>Schur</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: LW (acquired 1861) and BRNU, P, PC; further material at B
(extant), BP, C, E, GOET, K, L, MW, PH, W, WU (in herb. Keck/Lang).
<em>Correspondence</em> with D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 1: 271, 12(1): 145; Backer p. 661; Barnhart 3: 247
(b. 18 Feb 1799, d. 28 Mai 1878); BM 4: 1874; Bossert p. 356; CSP 5: 580-581, 8: 899,
11: 359, 12: 667; DTS 1: 277, 6(4): 197; Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; Futak-Domin p. 534-535;
Herder p. 193; Hortus 3: 1203; IF p. 729; Jackson p. 269; Kanitz 213; Klásterský p. 169
(coll. BRNU); PR 8515; Rehder 5: 785; Tucker 1: 639; WU 32: 220-221; Zander ed. 10,
p. 715, ed. 11, p. 815.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Not. 1879: 31 (d.); Bull. Soc. bot. France 25 (bibl.): 46. 1878 (obit.
	not.); J. Bot. 16: 256. 1878 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 9: 141. 1859 (herb. sold to Th.
	Oppolzer, Wien), 28: 247. 1878 (d.).

Barth, H., Von Honterus zu Oberth. Bedeutende siebenbürgisch-deutsche Naturwissen-
	schaftler, Techniker und Mediziner. Bukarest, p. 134-138.

	P/PC).

	bibl.).

	herb. to Lwow (LW) in 1861).

<sm>NOTE</sm>: (1) Schur made a botanical survey of Siebenbürgen from 5 Jul-15 Aug 1853. A
manuscript "Bericht" was submitted to the Austrian "Statthalterei". Michael Fuss pre-
pared an abstract of the botanically significant part and published it in Verh. Mitth.
Siebenbürg. Ver. Naturw. Hermannstadt 10: 58-86. Mar-Apr, 96-134. Mai-Jun, 137-
182. Jul-Aug, 185-212. Sep-Oct 1859, reprinted 1859, p. [i-ii], [1]-143. <em>Copy</em>: NY.
"<em>Auszug aus dem Berichte über eine ... vom</em> 5. <em>Juli bis 15. August 1883 unternommene Botanische
Rundreise durch Siebenbürgen</em>", Hermannstadt (gedruckt in der Georg v. Closius'schen
Buchdruckerei) 1859. Oct.
(2) Papers on Transylvanian plants ("Siebenbürgische Pflanzen") were published in
Verh. Mitt. siebenb. Ver. Naturw. Hermannstadt 2: 9-13. Jan, 65-70. Apr, 165-167,
167-171. Oct, 176-177, 177-195. Nov, 198-214 Dec 1851, 3: 84-85, 95-96. Jun, 117-128.
Aug 1852, 4: 3-16. Jan, 24-32. Feb, 46-52. Mar, 57-68. Apr, 105-109. Jun 1853 (in
supplements: <em>Sert. fl. Transsilv.</em>, see below), 6: 78-83. Mai 1854.

Schussnig, Bruno (1892-?), Austrian botanist; Dr. phil. Graz 1917; assistant at the
Triest botanical Station 1914-1919, but stationed as assistant at the botanical institute of
the University of Vienna 1915-1916; id. at the Maltepe biological station,
Constantinople 1918; with the Josephinian Academy at Wien 1918-1920; from 1920
regular assistant with the botanical institute Vienna; habil. ib. 1923; later extraordinary
professor of botany ib.; ultimately at the "Laboratorium für Protophytenkunde". Jena.
(<em>Schussnig</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 247 (b. 8 Jan 1892); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8440-
8441; Bossert p. 356; GR p. 459-460; Hirsch p. 268; Roon p. 101.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Österr. bot. Z. 65: 240. 1915 (temp. asst. Wien), 69: 272. 1920 (asst.
	Wien).
Janchen, E., Richard Wettstein 181-182. 1933.
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 2: 78. 1936, 5: 120, 197. 1939, 6: 305. 1941.

Schuster, C. (1860-1935), German (East-Prussian) botanical bibliographer; educated
at Tilsit Gymnasium; with the pomological institute of Proskau 1878-1880; with a tree-
nursery at Trier 1880-1882; from 1882 with a commercial horticultural establishment in
Strassburg and various private and public parks in Militsch, Kiel and Potsdam; from ca.
1886 with the Berlin Botanical Garden, bookkeeper for the development of the new
garden at Dahlem; from 1907-1926 librarian in Engler's new Botanical Museum. (<em>C.
Schust</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Schuster in not known to have made a herbarium.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 247 (b. 24 Feb 1860, d. 24 Mar 1935); Biol.-
Dokum. 16: 8442; BJI 2: 16; Bossert p. 356; MW p. 441; TL-2/200; Tucker 3: 275.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Hedwigia 75: (166). 1936 (d.).
Schmidt, O.C., Hedwigia 75(4): 267-271. 1935 (obit., portr.).
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 2: 140, 142. 1936 (d.).

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Collaborator <em>Hedwigia</em> 1910-1935 ("Neue Literatur", indexes,
personalia, exsiccatae).
(2) Ascherson &amp; Graebner, <em>Syn. mittelem. Fl.</em>, indexes vols. 5(1), 5(2), 12(1).
(3) Indexes <em>Kryptogamenflora Brandenburg</em> 5a: 925-946. 1914, 5: 613-630. 30 Jun 1915.

11.403. <em>Katalog der Bibliothek des Botanischen Vereins der Provinz Brandenburg</em> ... Dahlem-
Steglitz (Selbstverlag des Botanischen Vereins der Provinz Brandenburg) 1911. Oct. (<em>Kat. Bibl. Bot. Ver. Prov. Brand.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1911, p. [i]-vii, [viii], [1]-191, [192, colo.]. <em>Copy</em>: HH. – Issued as Beilage 2 to
	Verh. Bot. Ver. Prov. Brandenburg 51, 1911. – Preface by Th. Loesener.

11.404. <em>Iconum botanicarum index</em>. Verzeichnis der seit dem Jahre 1866 veröffentlichten
Abbildungen von Blütenpflanzen und Farnen. Geordnet nach dem Engler'schen System
herausgegeben von C. Schuster ... Dresden-N. (Verlag von C. Heinrich) 1926. Oct. †. (<em>Icon. bot. index</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: Jul 1926 (t.p.), p. [i-vi], 1-12, p. 1-2, 1-2. <em>Copies</em>: B-S, G, MO. – Intended to
	continue G.A. Pritzel's <em>Iconum botanicarum index locupletissimus</em> which went up to 1865.
	Schuster could not master this task alone and had to abandon it. For the ultimate
	successor to Pritzel's index see O. Stapf, <em>Index Londinensis</em>, 1929-1931. Schuster's index
	was to be the publication of an extensive card-index in the library of Berlin-Dahlem.
<em>Ref</em>.: Engler, A., Bot. Jahrb. 61 (Lit.): 16. 1927.

11.405. <em>Orchidacearum iconum index</em>. Zusammenstellung der in der Literatur erchienenen
Tafeln und Textabbildungen von Orchideen. Von Garteninspektor Kurt Schuster ...
(Dahlem bei Berlin. [Friedrich Fedde] ... im Selbstverlage) 1931-1936. Oct. (<em>Orch. icon.
index</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 15 Nov 1931-31 Dec 1943, in 9 parts, p. [i-iii], [1]-611. <em>Copies</em>: BR, G, PH, U. –

HEADING: SCHUSTER, C.

	Final t.p. with imprint "In Kommission bei "Natura", ... Paul Budy, ..." Contains
	circa 50.000 references to illustrations of orchids.

	<em>2</em>: 81-160. 10 Jun 1932.

Schuster, Johann Constantin [Christian] (1777-1839), Hungarian botanist; Dr. med.
Pesth (Budapest) 1802; "Repetitor" (coach) for pharmacy at Univ. Pesth 1806-1808;
high school teacher at Klausenburg (Cluj) 1808; from 1809-1811 professor of general
natural history at Pesth, ordinary professor id. 1811-1817; dean of the medical faculty
1811-1813, from 1817 ordinary professor of botany, continuing in various other univers-
ity functions until 1839. (<em>J.C. Schust.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Kanitz p. 65-66 (no. 99); PR 8516, ed. 1: 9467; Rehder
1: 70; WU 32: 247-248.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Gager, C.S., Brooklyn Bot. Gard. Rec. 27(3): 257. 1938 (dir. bot. gard. Budap-
	est 1816-1817).
Kanitz, A., Bonplandia 10: 363. 1862 (brief biogr.).
Krücken, O. &amp; I. Parlagi, Das geistige Ungarn 482. 1918.

11.406a. <em>Terminologia botanica</em> curante I. Schuster M.D. ... Editio altera, correctior.
Budae [Budapest] (Typis Regiae Universitatis Hungaricae) 1815. (<em>Term. bot.</em>).

<em>Ed. 1</em>: 1808, 118 p. n.v.
<em>Ed. 2</em>: 1815, p. [1-2], [i-ii, tipped in], [3]-148. <em>Copy</em>: HU.

Schuster, Julius (1886-1949), German (Bavarian) botanist, morphologist,
palaeontologist and historian of biology; Dr. phil. München 1909; habil. ib. 1911;
scientific assistant Bot. Mus. Berlin-Dahlem 1912-1920; in charge of the archival collect-
ion for the history of sciences, Darmstadt 1920-1928; with the geol.-palaeont. Museum
Berlin 1928; habil. Berlin 1932; lecturer and extra-ordinary professor history of biology,
Univ. Berlin and employed at the Institute for the history of science and medicine 1932-
1945; relieved from his functions 1945; collaborator Volk und Wissen 1945. (<em>J. Schust.</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown. Some material at E and in Migula <em>Crypt. Germ. Austr.
Helv. exsicc.</em> – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Andrews p. 329; Barnhart 3: 247; Biol.-Dokum. 16:
8443; BJI 2: 161; BM 4: 1874; Futak-Domin p. 535; Hortus 3: 1203; KR p. 631;
Langman p. 688; LS 39076-39079; Moebius p. 40, 41; MW p. 441; NI see indexes;
Quenstedt p. 390; SO 3092, 3101; TL-2/1713; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 815.

HEADING: SCHUSTER, J.

Schwabe, Samuel Heinrich (1789-1875), German (Anhalt-Dessau) astronomer and
botanist; trained as pharmacist; practicing pharmacist at Dessau 1812-1829; from then
on active as botanical and astronomical "Privatgelehrter". (<em>Schwabe</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: W. – Bryoph. in BM-Hampe. – <em>Letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlech-
tendal in HAL.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 33: 159-161; AG 2(1): 166; Barnhart 3: 248 (b. 25
Oct 1799, d. 11 Apr 1875); BM 4: 1874; CSP 5: 582-585, 8: 901; DSB 12: 239-240 (M.
Farrell); Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; GR p. 136 (b. 25 Oct 1789, <em>not</em> 1799); Herder p. 189; LS
24461-24465; PR 8521, ed. 1: 9471; Rehder 1: 379; Stevenson p. 1257; TL-2/see F.E.L.
Fischer; Tucker 1: 639.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Encycl. brit. ed. 11. 24: 387-388. 1911.
Arendt, T., Schwabe, Leben und Wirken, Dessau 1925 (n.v.).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Ascherson, P.F.A., Fl. Prov. Brandenburg 1: 14. 1864.
Hein, W.H. &amp; H.D. Schwarz, Deut. Apoth. Biogr. 2: 613-614. 1978 (biogr. sketch).

	work).

Schwacke, [Carl August] Wilhelm (1848-1904), German (Hannover) botanist;
studied botany at Göttingen and Bonn; on active service in the Franco-Prussian war;
emigrated to Brazil 1872; "naturalista viajante" travelling scientist for the Rio de
Janeiro National Museum 1874-1891; professor of botany at and later director of the
School of Pharmacy in Ouro Preto 1891-1904; German vice-consul for Minas Geraes.
(<em>Schwacke</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: RB (14.000) and R; other material in B (mainly destr.), BHMG,
BR, C, DPU, EM, G, GOET, H (bryo.), IAC, NY, P, RB, SP, U, US, and W. –
Schwacke made several of his collections available to Glaziou who sometimes labelled

PAGE: 416
HEADING: SCHWACKE

them as having been collected by himself. Several Glaziou collections labelled to come
from the neighbourhood of Rio de Janeiro are actually Schwacke collections from
Amazonas.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Barnhart 3: 248 (b. 29 Jul 1848, d. 11 Dec 1904); Biol.-
Dokum. 16: 8464; Bossert p. 357; Herder p. 226; IH 1 (ed. 7): 342; Morren ed. 10, p.
151; Rehder 5: 785; Tucker 1: 639; Urban-Berl. p. 268, 290, 395.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 22: (131). 1904 (d. 12 Dec 1904); Bot. Jahrb. 14,
	Beibl. 31: 17. 1891 (app. Ouro Preto), 37: Beibl. 84: 3. 1906 (d.); Nat. Nov. 27: 507.
	1905 (d.); Österr. bot. Z. 55: 331. 1905 (d.).
Loesener, Th., Ber. deut. bot. Ges. 23: (12)-(15). 1905 (obit., bibl., d. 11 Dec 1904).
Prance, G., Acta amaz. 1(1): 58. 1971 (coll.).
Sampaio, A.J., Arch. Mus. nac. Rio de Janeiro 41, 45, 47. 1919 (naturalista viajante 17
	Mar 1874-17 Apr 1891).
Schwacke, W., Bot. Jahrb. 12 (Beibl. 28): 4-10. 1890 (report on an excursion to the
	Serra de Caparao, Minas Geraes, Brazil).
Stafleu, F.A., Rec. trav. bot. néerl. 41: 533. 1948 (S. specimens at RB and U); Acta bot.
	néerl. 2(2): 214. 1953 (id.).
Stieber, M.T., Huntia 3(2): 125. 1979 (mentioned in notes A. Chase).
Urban, I., Fl. bras. 1(1): 104-105. 1906 (biogr. sketch, itin.).
Wagenitz, G., Index coll. princ. herb. Gott. 153. 1982.

auct. R. Chodat, Bull. Herb. Boiss. ser. 2. 4: 910-913 [1-4]. 31 Aug 1904.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schwackaea</em> Cogniaux (1891).

Schwägrichen, Christian Friedrich (1775-1853), German (Saxonian) botanist; Dr.
med. Leipzig 1799; extra-ordinary professor of natural history at the University of
Leipzig 1802, id. of botany 1806, director of the botanical garden 1806-1837; regular
professor 1815-1852. (<em>Schwägr</em>.).

PAGE: 417
HEADING: SCHWÄGRICHEN

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: G (bryoph. in Hedwig-Schwägrichen herbarium, see under J.
Hedwig, other material in general herb.), M (general herb.). Further material in B
(mainly destr.), COI, E, FH, H, L, LG ("moussier"), MW, PH, S, UPS. – <em>Letters</em> at G,
HAL, HU, PH.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 33: 175 (E. Wunschmann); AG 3: 434; Barnhart 3:
248 (b. 16 Sep 1775, d. 2 Mai 1853); BM 4: 1874-1875, 8: 1167; CSP 5: 585 (5 nos.);
DTS 1: 277; Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; GR p. 137; Herder p. 477; Jackson p. 153; Lasègue p.
328; Maiwald p. 196; MD p. 216-223; Moebius p. 116; MW p. 441; PR 8522-8523,
3885, ed. 1: 4262, 4450, 6004, 9138, 9472-9473, 11296; Rehder 1: 375; Saccardo 1: 150-
151; SBC p. 132; SO 512, 529; SY p. 38, 41, 53; TL-1/491, 731, 1199, 1209, 1212a,
1422; TL-2/1456, 1968, 2532, 2736, 4769, see J. Hedwig; Tucker 1: 639; Urban p. 313.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bonplandia 1: 52, 109 (d.), 239 (bot. exam. by Schw.; unflattering
	acct.), 241. 1853, 2: 267. 1854 (cognomen Leopoldina: Dillenius); Bot. Not. 1855:
	160. 1856 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 10: 359 (retirement, decoration), 941 ("917") (sale her-
	barium). 1852; Flora 1: 306. 1818 (on Schw.'s collections), 29: 591. 1846 (member

PAGE: 418
HEADING: SCHWÄGRICHEN

<sm>MOUSSIER</sm>: Schwägrichen assembled four copies of a portable "<sm>MOUSSIER</sm>" that is a collect-
ion of moss specimens accompanied by drawings of taxonomically relevant details. One
copy was given to F. Boudon de Saint-Amans. This set was used in 1873 as the basis for
a re-issue by C. Roumeguère and the publisher Calmet for a facsimile edition of the
drawings, a letter by Schwägrichen to Saint-Amans, completed with 321 exsiccatae with
updated nomenclature after Schimper's Synopsis. The sets at BR and G consist of
Calmet's introduction on p. [i], a copy of Schwägrichen's letter of 2 Feb 1813 and 26
plates with illustrations and moss fragments. See also Herbarium 16: 132. 1910, Bull.
Soc. bot. France 20 (bibl.): 45-46. 1873 and G. Sayre, Mem. New York Bot. Gard.
19(2): 234. 1971.

<sm>HANDWRITING</sm>: Bartonia 28: <em>pl. 8.</em> 1957.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Schwaegrichenia</em> K.P.J. Sprengel (1815). <em>Note</em>: <em>Schwaegrichenia</em> H.G.L. Reich-
enbach (1828) probably was also named for this author, but no etymology was given.

11.426. <em>Topographiae botanicae et etymologicae lipsiensis specimen</em> primum. Quod amplissimi
philosophorum ordinis auctoritate die xiii. aprili anni mdccxcix defendet Christianus
Fridericus Schwaegrichen ... Lipsiae [Leipzig] (impressit Carolus Tauchnitz) [1799].
Qu. (<em>Topogr. bot. entom. lips.</em>).

<em>1</em>: 13 Apr 1799 (t.p.), p. [i-vi], [1]-36. – Dissertation Dr. phil.
<em>2</em>: 28 Jun 1799 (t.p.), p. [i-iv], [1]-48. – "... Specimen secundum. Dissertatio quam
	gratiosi medicorum ordinis auctoritate in litterarum universitate lipsiensi pro summis
	in arte medica honoribus die xxviii mensis junii mdccic publice defendet auctor
	Christianus Fredericus Schwaegrichen ..." Lipsiae [Leipzig] (ex officina Klaubar-
	thia) [1801]. Qu.- Dissertation Dr. med.
<em>3</em>: 14 Nov 1804 (t.p.), p. [1]-16. – "Specimen iii. Quo ad audiendam orationem qua
	munus professons historiae naturalis extraordinarii die xiv. novembris mdccciv.
	h.l.q.c. auspicabitur humanissime invitat Fridericus Schwaegrichen, ..." Lipsiae
	[Leipzig] (ex officina Solbrigiana) [1804]. Qu. – Oration accepting professorship nat.
	hist.
<em>4</em>: 24 Dec 1806 (t.p.), p. [i], [1]-20. – "... specimen quartum plantas nuper inventas
	indicans scripsit et ad audiendam orationem ob munus professons botanicae in se
	delatum die xxiv. decembris [1806] in auditorio medico habendam humanissime in-
	vitat D. Fridericus Schwaegrichen ..." Lipsiae [Leipzig] (ex officina Solbrigia)
	[1806]. Qu. – Oration accepting professorship of botany.

11.431. <em>Bemerkungen über einige Stellen in der Flora brasiliensis</em> von Endlicher und Martius,

<em>Note</em>: Here, as elsewhere in his publications in German, Schwägrichen spelled his name
	"Schwägrichen"; the form Schwaegrichen occurs only on the title-pages of his works
	in Latin.

Schwanecke, Carl (1821-1916), German (Prussian-Saxony) botanist and gardener;

PAGE: 421
HEADING: SCHWANN

travelled in the West Indies, St. Thomas, Puertorico and Sto. Domingo 1846-1850;
owner of a commercial nursery at Oschersleben 1852, growing pansies. (<em>Schwanecke</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (mainly destr.) and' HAL; further material in BM (mosses), E,
GOET, L, LZ (destr.), NY, W.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Urban-Berl. p. 282, 313, 395.

Schwann, Theodor (1810-1882), German (Rhineland-Prussian) microscopist; Dr.
med. Berlin 1834; assistant with Johannes Müller at Berlin 1834-1839; postulated the
biological nature of alcoholic fermentation (1837); co-operated with M.J. Schleiden in
developing the "cell-theory"; professor of anatomy at Louvain 1839; id. at Liège 1848;
also professor of physiology ib. from 1858. (<em>Schwann</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Ainsworth p. 121, 211, 212, 304, 314, 347; Barnhart 3:
248 (b. 7 Dec 1810, d. 11 Jan 1882); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8471; BM 4: 1875; CSP 5: 585, 8:
903, 11: 362; DSB 12: 240-245 (M. Florkin); Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; Herderp. 122; Jackson
p. 69; LS 24474-24475; Moebius p. 102, 168, 272; PR 8525, ed. 1: 9475.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Bot. Gaz. 7: 52. 1882 (d.); Bot. Not. 1883: 30 (d.); Bot. Zeit. 40: 61.
	1882 (d.); Encycl. brit. ed. 11. 24: 388. 1911; Flora 29: 143. 1846 (Copley medal Roy.
	Soc., London); New York Times 21 Jan 1882 (d.).

Schwantes, Gustav (1891-1960), German (Hannover) botanist and archeologist; Dr.
	phil. Univ. Hamburg 1923; professor of prehistory Univ. Kiel 1929-1946; specialist on
	Mesembryanthemaceae. (<em>Schwant</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Living collections of Mesembryanthemum at KIEL.

Schwappach, Adam F. (1851-1932), German (Bavarian) forester; Dr. oec. München
1872; Königlicher Bayerischer Forstgehilfe, Martiniamitz 1873-1875; id. Ebrach 1875-
1876; assistant for chemistry at the Forstliche Lehranstalt Aschaffenburg 1876-1878; at
the Kreisforstbüro Würzburg 1878-1881; extra-ordinary profssor of forestry Giessen
1881-1886; in charge of forestry research at the Forstliche Hochschule Eberswalde 1886-
1921. (<em>Schwappach</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: Unknown.

Schwartz, Oskar (1901-1945), German (Baltic German, Latvian-born) botanist; Dr.
phil. Göttingen 1925; assistant at the Botanical Institute Göttingen 1924-1927; assistant
at the Institut für Allgemeine Botanik 1927-1932; scientific assistant 1932-1943; curator
of the herbarium 1943-1945; habil. Hamburg 1938; "Privatdocent" 1939-1945; on
active service in World War ii 1941-1945. (<em>O. Schwartz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: HBG.

Schwarz, [Erich] Frank (1857-1928), German (Silesian) botanist; studied at the
University of Graz; student of H. Leitgeb; assistant with W.F.P. Pfeffer in Tübingen
1881-1883; Dr. phil. Graz 1880; "Privatdozent" Breslau, with F.J. Cohn 1883-1888;
professor of botany at the Forestry College Eberswalde and director of the plant physi-
ological laboratory of the experiment station for forestry in Prussia, also in Eberswalde.
(<em>F. Schwarz</em>).

Schwarz, Otto [Karl Anton] (1900-1983), German (Thuringian) botanist; Dr. phil.
Berlin 1929 (student of L. Diels); on active service 1918; studied in Jena 1919-1920;
employed in an art and antique shop at Jena 1920-1926; studied in Berlin 1926-1928;
visiting professor in Turkey 1931-1934; privately active 1934-1939; director of the
Haussknecht Herbarium; from 1946 professor of botany at Jena. (<em>O. Schwarz</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: JE; first set of pre-1939 coll. Abruzzi, Carpath. and Anatolia at B
(Flora Anatoliae occidentalis 1932/33 extant); other material at ANK, KIEL. – <em>Letters</em>
at G.

3: 1203; IF suppl. 4: 338; IH 1 (ed. 1): 46, (ed. 2): 64, (ed. 3): 79, (ed. 4): 85, (ed. 5): 85,

H.C. Haussknecht; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 815-816.

Schwarzer, Carl Ferdinand (1829-1870), German (Silesian) veterinarian and
botanist; studied veterinary science at the Royal Veterinary College at Berlin; active
service in the Prussian army 1851-1852; practicing veterinarian at Löwen (Upper
Silesia) 1852-1854, from 1854 idem at Kuhnern near Striegau (Silesia); active batolo-
gist. (<em>Schwarzer</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: <em>Rubus</em> herbarium incorporated in that of W.O. Focke, BREM;

Schwatka, Frederick (1849-1892), American soldier and explorer, especially of the
Arctic; studied at West Point, 1867-1871; cavalry lieutenant 1871-1885; Dr. med. New
York 1876; on the New York Herald expedition to King William's land 1878-1880; in
command of the New York Times Alaska expedition 1886. (<em>Schwatka</em>).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: GH (Alaska; some Rocky Mts.).

Schweickerdt, Herold Georg Wilhelm Johannes (1903-1977), South-African bota-
nist (especially agrostologist), (born in Germany, 1904 to S. Africa); B.Sc. Transvaal
Universiteitskollege 1924; Dr. phil. Bonn 1928 (student of H. Fitting); with C.E.B. Bre-
mekamp at the University of Pretoria 1928-1931; with the National Herbarium of South
Africa from 1932-1944; liaison officer for South African botany at Kew 1934-1938; in
protective custody 1940-1944; senior lecturer University of Pretoria 1944-1951; Louis
Botha chair for general botany ib. 1952-1963; Havenga prize of the S. African Academy
of Sciences and Arts 1962. (<em>Schweick</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: PREM, PRU; further material at BOL, BR, NH, PRE, PUC,

PAGE: 428
HEADING: SCHWEICKERDT

STE, US, WIND; material from the former Portuguese African territories and Zambesi

Bossert p. 357; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 1): 78, (ed. 2): 101, (ed. 3): 127, (ed. 4): 141;
(ed. 5): 149, (ed. 7): 342; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 816.

Schweigger, August Friedrich (1783-1821), German (Bavarian) botanist and zoo-
logist; Dr. med. chir. Erlangen 1804; with Willdenow in Berlin; from 1809-1821 director
of the botanical garden and professor of botany at Königsberg; travelled in Western,
Southern and Central Europe; murdered near Girgenti in Sicily. (<em>Schweigg</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: KBG (destr.). – Plants collected in Sicily in B (mainly destr.); in
Nice in P; further material in UPS (Thunberg herb.; name spelled Schweigger and
Schweiger on labels). – Letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: ADB 33: 332-333 (E. Wunschmann); AG 3: 556; Backer
p. 661; Barnhart 3: 249 (b. 8 Sep 1783, d. 28 Jun 1821);BM4: 1876-1877, 8: 1168; CSP
5: 589; Frank 3 (Anh.): 94; Herder p. 142, 158, 189; Hortus 3: 1203; Jackson p. 428;
Langman p. 689; MW p. 441; PR 8526-8530, ed. 1: 9479-9483; Rehder 5: 787; TL-
1/1210, 1211; Tucker 3: 275; Urban-Berl. p. 395; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 816.

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Ann. Kriminalrechtspflege, Hitzig, 35: 152-183. 1846 (account of pro-

11.450. <em>Specimen florae Erlangensis</em>. Dissertatio medica inauguralis quam consentiente ill-
ustri medicorum ordine pro gradu doctoris medicinae ac chirurgiae rite obtinendo d. xv.
nov. [1804]. Publice defendet Augustus Fridericus Schweigger erlangensis. Pars i. Class.
i-xiii. Erlangae (Typis Hilpertianis) [1804]. Oct. (<em>Spec. fl. Erlang.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 15 Nov 1804 (t.p.), p. [i-xii], [1]-136. <em>Copies</em>: BR, L, MICH, NY.
<em>Addenda</em>: 1811 (see H.P. Fuchs 1960), p. 137-160, written by Franz Koerte ((1782-1845).
<em>Pars ii</em>: class. xiv-xxiii, see below <em>Fl. erlang.</em> 1811.
<em>Ref</em>.: Fuchs, H.P., Ber. Schweiz, bot. Ges. 70: 449-450. 1960 (and Fl. males. Bull. 17: 910.
	1962).

11.451. <em>Flora erlangensis</em>. Continens plantas phaenogamas circa Erlangam crescentes auc-
toribus Augusto Friderico Schweigger ... et Francisco Koerte ... Erlangae [Erlangen]
(apud J.J. Palm) 1811. Oct. (<em>Fl. erlang.</em>).

<em>Publ</em>.: 1811 (p. iv: 25 Sep 1810), p. [i]-viii, [ix], [1]-160, pars ii (continens plantarum
	phaenogamarum class. xiv-xxiii), [1]-143. <em>Copies</em>: G, L, M, NY. – The first part, p.
	[1]-160 consists of the 1804 text p. [1]-136, mentioned above under <em>Spec. fl. erlang.</em>,
	with the addenda 137-160, first issued in this volume; the second part continues the
	treatment in the <em>Spec. fl. Erlang.</em> for class. 14-23. – The date of for class. 14-23. – The
	date of <em>Fl. erlang</em>, cannot be given by us with more precision; M. Lidén, Taxon 30:
	323. 1981 cites an instance in which the book competes with Clairville, <em>Man. herbor.
	Suisse</em> which was published 28 Apr 1811. The <em>Fl. erlang.</em> preface, however, is 25 Sep
	1810, that of the <em>Man. herbor. Suisse</em> 21 Feb 1811.

	6469.

emischen Buchhandlung) 1819. Oct. (<em>Nachr. bot. Gart. Königsberg</em>).

HEADING: SCHWEIGGER

<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Flora 5(1) Beil. 2: 97-103. Feb 1822 (rev.).
	Sprengel, K.P.J., Neue Entd. Pfl.-K. 2: 319-322. 1821.

Schweinfurth, Charles (1890-1970), American botanist (orchidologist); A.B. Harvard
1913; curator of O. Arnes herbarium 1914-1931, from 1931 idem with the Orchid
Herbarium of Oakes Ames at the Botanical Museum, Harvard University; honorary
professor of botany Univ. Mayor de San Marcos, Peru 1948; id. Cuzco 1962. (<em>C.
Schweinf</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: AMES (types); local collections in A, F, NEBC, NMW. – <em>Letters</em>
at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: Backer p. 521; Barnhart 3: 249 (b. 13 Apr 1890); Bossert
p. 357; Hortus 3: 1203; IH 1 (ed. 1): 21, (ed. 2): 37, (ed. 3): 42, (ed. 4): 45, (ed. 5): 38,
(ed. 6): 364 (err. G.A.S.); Langman p. 689; Lenley p. 362; MW p. 442; NI 1819n; Roon
p. 101; Tucker 3: 275; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 816 (d. 16 Nov 1970).

<sm>BIOFILE</sm>: Anon., Amer. men sci. ed. 8: 2210. 1949, ed. 9: 1402. 1955, ed. 10: 3625. 1961,
	ed. 11: 4773. 1967.
Arditti, J., ed., Orchid biol. 1: 22, 97, 114. 1977.
Garay, L.A., Orquideologia 6(1): 56-60. 1971 (obit., portr.)., Rhodora 74: 71-75. 1972
	(obit., portr.), see also Orquidea 1(8): 11-13. 1971 (abstract).
Schuhes, R.E., Bot. Mus. Leafl. Harvard Univ. 23(2): 93-99. 1971 (obit., portr., d. 16
	Nov 1970).
Stieber, M.L. et al., Huntia 9(1): 86. 1981.
Verdoorn, F., ed., Chron. bot. 3: 293. 1937, 4: 565. 1938, 5: 173, 370. 1939.

<sm>NOTE</sm>: Most major publications fall outside our period, such as e.g. his <em>Orchids of Peru</em>,
Fieldiana, Botany 30 (1-4), 1958-1961, 1005 p., see e.g. R.E. Schuhes, Taxon 10: 229.
1961.

<sm>EPONYMY</sm>: <em>Cischweinfia</em> Dressler et N.H. Williams (1970).

Schweinfurth, Georg [August] (1836-1925), German (Latvian-born of German par-
ents; naturalized Prussian 1879) botanist, geographer and explorer; studied in Heidel-
berg 1858-1859, München 1859-1860, Berlin 1860-1861; Dr. phil. Heidelberg 1862;
travelled in the Nile countries 1863-1866, in Equatorial Africa 1868-1871; to El Chargeh
1874; founded the Cairo Geographical Society 1875; private scientist in Cairo 1875-
1888; explored the areas between the Nile and the Red Sea 1876-1886; domiciled in
Berlin from 1888 in close association with the Botanical Museum, still making frequent
trips until 1914, e.g. to Yemen 1888-1889 and Eritrea 1891-1894. (<em>Schweinf</em>.).

<sm>HERBARIUM</sm> and <sm>TYPES</sm>: B (herb. small part extant; alcohol material extant, incl. types);
other material in AAR, BAS, BM, BO, BP, BPI, BR, C, CAIM, CORD, DBN, E, FT,
G, GE, GOET, GZA, H (bryo.), K, KIEL, L, LE, LY, M, MICH, MO, MPU, NA,
NH, NMW, OXF, NY, P, PC, PH, PR, S, SAM, US, W, WRSL, WU, Z. – <em>Diaries</em> at
B-S; <em>letters</em> to D.F.L. von Schlechtendal at HAL; other letters at G.

<sm>BIBLIOGRAPHY</sm> and <sm>BIOGRAPHY</sm>: AG 3: 576-577, 12(3): 477; Backer p. 661; Barnhart 3:
249 (b. 16/29 Dec 1836, d. 19 Sep 1925); Biol.-Dokum. 16: 8506-8507; BJI 1: 53-54, 2:
88, 161; BL 1: 21, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 58; Blunt p. 6; BM 4: 1877, 8: 1168; Bossert p.
357; CSP 5: 593, 8: 905-906, 11: 365, 12: 668, 18: 635-636; Frank 3 (Anh.): 95; GF p.
75, 76; GR p. 582; Herder p. 477 [index]; Hortus 3: 1203; IF p. 729; IH 1 (ed. 7): 342;
Jackson p. 350; LS 24484; LS suppl. 25057; Moebius p. 383, 423; Morren ed. 10, p. 112;
MW p. 44; NI 1820-1824; NW p. 57; PR 8531-8537; Quenstedt p. 391; Rehder 5: 787;
Saccardo 1: 151; TL-2/199, 2867, 3895, 4028, 6452, 6590, 6761, see indexes; Tucker 1:
640-641; Urban-Berl. 268, 272, 282, 313, 395; Zander ed. 10, p. 715, ed. 11, p. 816.

<sm>COMPOSITE WORKS</sm>: (1) Author of text, <em>Reliquiae Kotschyanae</em> 1868, see TL-2/3895. – <em>Copies</em>:
B, BR, G, HH, M, MO, NY, PH, USDA. – The plates are uncol. liths. of drawings by
Liepoldt, W.A. Meyn, Schweinfurth and Jos. Seboth. – The book is announced as "eben
erschienen" in Bot. Zeit. 18 Dec 1868, which would put its date approximately at 1
Nov-15 Dec 1868. – Extensive review: P. Ascherson, Bot. Zeit. 27: 177-180. 12 Mar
1869.
(2) <em>Phanerogamen, in</em> L. v. Höhnel, <em>Rudolph-Stephanie-See</em> 1891-1892, p. 852-868, see TL-
2/2867 and below.
(3) <em>Samm. Conserv. Phanerog., in</em> G.B. Neumayer, <em>Anl. wiss. Beobacht. Reisen</em> 1875, see TL-
2/6761 (ed. 2: 1888, ed. 3, 1906) and below <em>Récolte cons. pl.</em>
(4) Introduction to Ludwig Keimer, <em>Die Gartenpflanzen im alten Ägypten</em> ägyptologische
Studien, Berlin 1924, repr. Hildesheim (Georg Olms ...) 1967, p. [i]-xv, [1]-187.
(5) <em>Vegetationstypen aus der Kolonie Eritraea</em>. Der Text nach den Aufzeichnungen ...
Schweinfurth's bearbeitet von L. Diels, <em>in</em> Karsten &amp; Schenk, <em>Vegetationsbilder</em> 2, <em>6 pl</em>. and
vi, 11 p. text, 1905.
(6) Various identifications, <em>in</em> G. Rohlfs, <em>Quer d. Afrika</em> 1871-1875, see TL-2/9454.
(7) Identifications, P.T. Range, <em>Fl. Isthmus-Wüste</em> 1921, see TL-2/8628.

<em>Publ</em>.: Sep-Nov 1865 (mss. submitted 2 Aug 1865; BSbF rd 22 Dec 1865), p. [1]-24.
	<em>Copies</em>: G, MO. – Reprinted and to be cited from Verh. zool.-bot. Ges. Wien 15:
	[537]-560. 1865.
<em>Ref</em>.: Schlechtendal, D.F.L. von, Bot. Zeit. 23: 375-376. 8 Dec 1865 (rev.).

11.459. <em>Beitrag zur Flora Aethiopiens</em> von Dr. Georg Schweinfurth. Erste Abtheilung ...
Berlin (Druck und Verlag von Georg Reimer) 1867. Qu. †. (<em>Beitr. Fl. Aethiop.</em>).

<em>Editors</em>: Schweinfurth himself took care of the <em>Dicotylées éleuthéropétales et sympétales</em> before
	his departure for Egypt in December 1863; Paul Friedrich August Ascherson (1834-
	1913) took care of the rest and requested the help of various colleagues for special
	families (see preface p. viii).
<em>Collaborators</em>: P.F.A. Ascherson, Johann Otto Böckeier (1803-1899), Christian August
	Friedrich Garcke (1819-1904), Hermann Maximilian Carl Ludwig Friedrich zu
	Solms-Laubach (1842-1915) et al.
<em>Collectors</em>: Christian Gottfried Ehrenberg (1795-1876), Nubia 1822 ("Flora dongolana")
	and Massawa 1825 ("Flora habessinica"), coll. all in B; Leon Semenowich de Cien-
	kowski (1822-1827), Nubia, Kordofan, Sennaar, 1848-1849, orig. coll. LE, dupl. B,
	W; W. von Harnier, upper White Nile 1860-1861, coll. at B; Theodor von Heuglin,
	Khartum, coll. at B and K; Kretschmer, N.E. Ethiopia 1862, coll. B; Georg Heinrich
	Wilhelm Schimper (1804-1878), coll. Semen 1850, Agow 1854, both at B; H. Steud-
	ner (1832-1863) on the Heuglin exped., trop. N. Afr., coll. B; Friedrich Paul Wilhelm
	von Württemberg (1797-1860), coll. upper Nile, coll. B, W. – The results of the study
	of these collections is reported in part 1, p. 1-230, with errata and addenda by Ascher-
	son on p. 231-252.
<em>Publ</em>.: Mai 1867 (p. xii: 1 Jul 1866; p. 311: 25 Feb 1867; Flora 27 Aug; Bot. Zeit. 4 Oct
	1867, p. 311: "Abgeschlossen am 25 Februar 1867", "erschienen" ÖbZ 1 Jul 1867;
	"eben erschienen" Bot. Zeit. 24 Mai 1867), p. [i]-xii, [1]-311, <em>pl. 1-3</em> (uncol. liths.
	Schweinfurth), <em>4</em> (id. Caspary). <em>Copies</em>: B, BR, FI, G, HH, M, MO, PH, Teyler; IDC
	320. – A note on p. ix speaks about information contained in Proc. Linn. Soc. Bot. 7:
	13-54. Mar 1863 [sic] which was received only after printing. It is likely that p. 1-230
	were printed long before distribution which would also account for the long sections
	with errata. However, there is no indication that distribution of parts took place
	before the book was issued as a whole in Mai 1867. The book competes sometimes
	with Boissier, Fl. orient. 1, publ. Apr-Jun 1867; it is difficult to say which has priority;
	in the absence of further proof Boissier might be given priority.
<em>Ref</em>.: Anon., Bull. Soc. bot. France 14 (bibl.): 116-118. post 14 Aug 1867.
	Ascherson, P., Bot. Zeit. 25: 316-318. 4 Oct 1867 (rev.).
	Eichler, A.W., Flora 50: 393-397. 27 Aug 1867 (rev.).
	Tournay, R., mss. annotations in copy BR.
